options.description: This sounds dangerous. Use the 30 GP for something else.

title: Flush with Coin (100GP)
description: One hundred gold pieces! A small fortune for someone like you. Silas practically threw you out after paying. What's the first priority?

options.name: Buy Superior Gear
options.description: Invest in better armor (Studded Leather?), a Rapier, and Thieves' Tools.

options.name: Hire Help/Information
options.description: Pay for reliable information or maybe even a bodyguard/accomplice.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook in Style
options.description: Book passage on a fast ship, buy fine clothes, live well for a while.

title: Discreet Inquiries
description: You ask around carefully, inquiring about collectors of 'intricate mechanisms' or 'ancient symbols'. Most people shrug, but a shifty-eyed dockworker mutters about the Unbound cult always looking for 'old junk' and meeting near the Tidecaller Lighthouse. Separately, a street urchin mentions seeing someone matching your description being watched by Silas.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device. Linked to Unbound/Lighthouse. Silas is watching.

options.name: Investigate the Lighthouse
options.description: The Unbound meeting seems relevant.

options.name: Confront Silas
options.description: Why is he watching you?

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook Cautiously
options.description: Being watched isn't good. Time to go.

title: Silas Bluff
description:
'Someone else is looking for things like this,' you say, trying to sound knowledgeable. 'Mentioned... the Unbound? Said they pay well.'

[Perform a Deception check (DC 14)]

Success: Silas pales slightly. 'The Unbound?! Fine, fine! Sixty gold! Take it and *never* mention my name to those lunatics!'

Failure: Silas laughs nervously. 'Unbound? Don't be ridiculous. Twenty-five gold, final offer.'

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Take 60 Gold (If Success)
options.description: Your bluff paid off handsomely.

options.name: Take 25 Gold (If Failure)
options.description: He didn't buy it. Take the original offer.

options.name: Leave
options.description: Your bluff failed. Keep the Tumbler.

title: Basic Supplies (25GP)
description: With 25 gold, you purchase some rations, 50 feet of hempen rope, and a simple dagger (1d4 piercing). You have about 10 gold left. It's not much, but you're slightly better equipped.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A small pouch containing 10 gold.

items.name: Rations (3 days)
items.description: Dried meat, hardtack, nuts.

items.name: Hempen Rope (50ft)
items.description: Standard rope.

items.name: Dagger
items.description: A simple, sharp knife.

options.name: Look for Odd Jobs
options.description: Need more coin. Ask around for simple work.

options.name: Attempt Another Theft
options.description: Try your luck picking pockets again.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: Move on with your minimal supplies.

title: Forty Pieces
description: Forty gold pieces. Better than twenty-five, enough for some basic gear or a couple of weeks' modest living. Silas pockets the Tumbler without further comment.

options.name: Buy Basic Gear (Armor or Weapon)
options.description: Prioritize either defense (Leather Armor) or offense (Shortsword).

options.name: Save the Money, Seek Information
options.description: Hold onto the cash and try to learn more about recent events or opportunities.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: A decent stake to start fresh elsewhere.

title: Morning After
description: You wake in the inn room, feeling more rested than you have in days. The meager coin is gone, but the comfort was welcome. Outside, Nestlebrook begins its daily bustle. What now?

options.name: Seek Work (Odd Jobs/Notice Board)
options.description: Need coin again. Look for legitimate work.

options.name: Return to Thievery
options.description: Back to the familiar grind. Scan the streets or taverns.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: Time to move on, even if broke.

title: Inn Rumors
description: In the common room, nursing a cheap drink (or just lingering), you overhear: talk of Silas the fence suddenly looking nervous, praise for the guard captain's diligence against petty crime, and a debate about whether the noises from the Tidecaller Lighthouse are seagulls or something... else.

options.name: Visit Silas (He's Nervous?)
options.description: Maybe pressure him now? Or see if he knows more?

options.name: Avoid Thievery (Guards Diligent)
options.description: Hearing about the guards makes pickpocketing seem riskier now.

options.name: Focus on the Lighthouse
options.description: The rumors persist. Investigate the source of the noises.

title: Seller's Remorse?
description: You replay the transaction with Silas in your mind. The Tumbler felt... important. Selling it for a mere 20 gold feels foolish now. What was it really? And who else might want it?

options.name: Try to Buy it Back from Silas (Risky)
options.description: Approach Silas and offer to buy the Tumbler back (likely at a higher price).

options.name: Steal it Back from Silas (Very Risky)
options.description: Plan a burglary of the pawn shop.

options.name: Forget About It
options.description: It's gone. Focus on the future, not past mistakes.

title: Cautious Wager Outcome
description: Playing cautiously, you manage the ebb and flow of the game. After an hour, you end up slightly ahead.

options.name: Quit While Ahead
options.description: Take your modest winnings and leave the table.

options.name: Keep Playing Cautiously
options.description: Continue the slow grind.

options.name: Get Bolder
options.description: This is too slow. Make a bigger bet.

title: Bold Wager Outcome
description:
You push a significant stack of chips forward. The table goes quiet. Cards are dealt... [High-stakes Luck/Skill check,  (con) DC 15].

Success: A winning hand! You rake in a large pot (Gain 50 GP).

Failure: Your bluff is called, or the cards betray you. You lose most of your stake (Lose 15 GP, total 5).

Critical Failure: Someone accuses you of cheating (even if you weren't!), causing a commotion.

options.name: Leave with Winnings
options.description: Quit while you're way ahead.

options.name: Cut Losses (If Failure)
options.description: Leave the table with your remaining few coins.

options.name: Deal with Cheating Accusation (If Crit Fail)
options.description: Deny, bluff, or prepare for trouble.

collectedItems.name: Whooooooole lotta nothing
collectedItems.description: Why are you checking this,,, its stll nothing.

title: Cheat Attempt Outcome
description:
You try to subtly palm a card or influence the dice roll... [High-stakes Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check, DC 16].

Success: Nobody notices! You engineer a win (Gain 40 GP).

Failure: A sharp-eyed player spots your move! 'Cheat!' he shouts, pointing a finger. The table erupts.

options.name: Casually Collect Winnings (If Success)
options.description: Act natural and leave the table before anyone gets suspicious.

options.name: Deny Vehemently (If Failure)
options.description: Insist it was a mistake or they're seeing things.

options.name: Flee Immediately (If Failure)
options.description: Caught! Bolt before fists start flying.

title: Guarded Cargo
description:
You sneak closer to the 'Sea Serpent'. [Perform a Dexterity (Stealth) check (DC 13)].

Success: Hidden behind barrels, you overhear the guards talking about protecting 'the Reliquary' heading to a 'Master Valerius' at the Tidecaller Lighthouse. They seem professional and alert.

Failure: A guard spots you skulking. 'Oi! You! What are you doing there?'

options.name: Slip Away with Information (If Success)
options.description: Valerius again! Retreat quietly with this valuable clue.

options.name: Talk Your Way Out (If Failure)
options.description: Make up a plausible excuse ('Looking for work', 'Lost'). [Deception check].

options.name: Run
options.description: Don't wait to explain. Flee the docks.

title: Dockside Whispers (Cloaked Figures)
description:
Getting closer requires careful movement among the dock workers. [Perform a Perception check (DC 14)].

Success: You hear them pressuring a sailor: '...the half-elf who came ashore... had an artifact... a Key Fragment... find them! The Unbound *will* reclaim it!'

Failure: You get too close or make noise. They glare suspiciously in your direction, then move off quickly.

options.name: Retrieve Tumbler Immediately (If Success)
options.description: They're actively looking for you and the Tumbler! Get it back now.

options.name: Follow Them Discreetly
options.description: Try to shadow the Unbound agents.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook Urgently
options.description: They're hunting you. Time to vanish.

title: Mountain Stone Secrets
description:
You examine the standing stone. [Perform an Intelligence (Investigation) check (DC 13)].

Success: Below the main symbol, almost hidden by moss, is a smaller marking: a stylized serpent coiling around the rings. And the stone seems subtly shifted, pointing towards a faint game trail leading off the main road.

Failure: It's just the one symbol. No other obvious clues or directions.

options.name: Follow the Game Trail (If Success)
options.description: The serpent suggests Unbound. Follow their path.

options.name: Recognize Unbound Symbol (If Success)
options.description: (If Elara told you) Realize this is Unbound territory. Decide whether to follow or avoid.

options.name: Stay on the Main Road
options.description: Either you found nothing or the serpent symbol means trouble. Stick to the road.

title: Off the Beaten Path (Mountain)
description: The game trail is narrow and overgrown, winding deeper into the woods at the base of the mountains. After an hour, you find a recently disturbed campsite - tracks suggest two or three people. A scrap of dark cloth snagged on a branch confirms recent passage. Further on, the trail seems to head towards a cave mouth or a narrow pass.

options.name: Investigate the Campsite Closely
options.description: Search for dropped items or specific clues. [Perception check].

options.name: Proceed Towards the Cave/Pass Cautiously
options.description: Continue following the trail, expecting potential ambush or occupants. [Stealth approach].

options.name: Turn Back to the Main Road
options.description: This feels too much like walking into a trap.

title: Continuing Mountain Journey
description: You continue along the main mountain road. The air thins further. Ahead, you see smoke rising - perhaps a settlement, a traveler's fire, or something else?

options.name: Approach the Smoke Cautiously
options.description: Investigate the source of the smoke, ready for anything.

options.name: Skirt Around the Smoke Source
options.description: Avoid potential contact by leaving the road briefly.

options.name: Continue on the Road, Ignoring Smoke
options.description: Focus on your journey, hoping it's just a traveler.

title: Inside the Barnacle's Bite
description: The air inside 'The Barnacle's Bite' is thick with smoke, cheap booze, and desperation. Rough-looking sailors and dockhands eye you suspiciously. The barkeep is a one-eyed orc who looks like he wrestles sharks for fun. Opportunities here will be hard-won.

options.name: Order a Drink, Listen for Rumors
options.description: Try to blend in and gather information.

options.name: Look for the Easiest Mark (Risky)
options.description: Scan the room for someone drunk or distracted enough to rob.

options.name: Ask the Barkeep About Work
options.description: Maybe there's some dirty job no one else wants.

title: Seabrook Dock Opportunities
description: The Seabrook docks are chaotic and poorly guarded. Crates are piled haphazardly, nets hang drying, and small fishing vessels jostle against larger, shabbier merchant ships. You spot a ship captain arguing with customs officials, creating a distraction.

options.name: Attempt to Steal from Nearby Crates
options.description: Use the argument as cover to quickly check unsecured crates for valuables.

options.name: Try to Stow Away on a Ship
options.description: Look for a ship preparing to depart and sneak aboard.

options.name: Offer to Help Load/Unload Cargo
options.description: Look for simple manual labor jobs.

title: Shelter in Seabrook
description: Finding shelter in Seabrook involves choosing between a leaky, abandoned net hut smelling strongly of fish, the relative exposure of hiding behind fishing boats pulled ashore, or trying to sneak into the loft of a busy boat repair shop.

options.name: Sleep in the Net Hut
options.description: It offers walls but smells terrible.

options.name: Hide Behind the Boats
options.description: Exposed to weather and discovery, but easy to flee.

options.name: Attempt the Boat Repair Loft
options.description: Dry and potentially warm, but high risk of discovery. [Stealth check].

title: Wilderness Hunt Outcome
description:
[Perform a Wisdom (Survival) (DC 13) to hunt].

Success: You manage to catch a rabbit or couple of squirrels. Enough for a meal.

Failure: Your hunt is fruitless, leaving you hungry. You might attract unwanted attention with your efforts.

Critical Failure: You stumble into the territory of a hungry wolf or boar!

options.name: Cook and Eat (If Success)
options.description: Prepare your meal and rest.

options.name: Continue Hungry (If Failure)
options.description: Press on, hoping to find food later. [Risk exhaustion?]

options.name: Face the Beast (If Crit Fail)
options.description: Prepare for combat!

title: Tracking the Trackers
description:
Following the booted tracks requires care. [Perform a Dexterity (Stealth) check (DC 14)].

Success: You crest a ridge and spot them below: three figures in dark cloaks examining markings on a tree. They seem focused, possibly Unbound cultists.

Failure: A twig snaps underfoot! The figures whirl around, spotting you!

options.name: Observe Further (If Success)
options.description: Stay hidden and try to learn more about their purpose.

options.name: Attempt Ambush (If Success)
options.description: Try to get the drop on them.

options.name: Fight or Flee (If Failure)
options.description: You're discovered. Choose confrontation or escape.

title: Wilderness Survival Outcome
description:
[Perform a Wisdom (Survival) check (DC 12)].

Success: You find a small, clear stream and a dry overhang offering decent shelter for the night.

Failure: Your search yields nothing. You remain exposed, thirsty, and night is falling fast. [Gain level of exhaustion?].

options.name: Make Camp (If Success)
options.description: Rest by the stream under the overhang.

options.name: Keep Searching Desperately (If Failure)
options.description: Push on despite exhaustion, hoping for better luck.

options.name: Head Back Towards Civilization
options.description: The wilderness is too harsh. Turn back towards the road or coast.

title: The Haul (Halfling)
description: In a quiet corner, you open the heavy pouch lifted from the halfling. Inside, you find a substantial amount of gold (75 GP) and a small, smooth jade figurine of a frog.

options.name: Pocket the Loot
options.description: A very successful score.

options.name: Examine the Figurine
options.description: Is it valuable? Magical?

options.name: Leave the Tavern Immediately
options.description: Get out before the halfling realizes and raises hell.

title: Tavern Chase (Halfling)
description: You bolt as the cry of 'Thief!' or 'Cheat!' goes up. Angry shouts and the pounding footsteps of the halfling (and possibly others/guards) follow you out into the streets of Nestlebrook. It's chaos.

options.name: Duck into an Alley
options.description: Try to lose them in the maze.

options.name: Use the Crowd
options.description: Weave through people, cause obstructions.

options.name: Head for the Docks
options.description: Try to lose them among the ships.

title: Caught by the Halfling/Guards
description: Your attempt to bluff or push past fails. The surprisingly strong halfling grabs you, and nearby guards converge, alerted by the commotion. 'Gotcha!' the halfling snarls.

options.name: Surrender
options.description: Give up. Hope for leniency (unlikely).

options.name: Attempt to Fight Way Out
options.description: Try to break free and fight the halfling and guards.

options.name: Offer a Bribe (If You Have Coin)
options.description: Try to buy your freedom from the guards.

title: Smoothing Feathers
description: You quickly apologize to the person you jostled, maybe offer to buy them a drink (if you have coin). They grumble but accept the apology (or drink). The moment of potential theft passed, but you avoided further trouble.

options.name: Scan the Room Again
options.description: Look for a new opportunity.

options.name: Observe the Halfling Further
options.description: Maybe another chance will arise.

options.name: Leave the Tavern
options.description: Too many close calls. Time to go.

title: Cheater Exposed
description: You point out the player palming dice. Chaos erupts! The accused cheater lunges at you, the halfling demands his money back from the cheater, and other gamblers start shouting. The guards might be called soon.

options.name: Fight the Cheater
options.description: Defend yourself against the angry cheater.

options.name: Use Chaos to Rob the Halfling
options.description: While everyone's distracted, make a move for the halfling's purse.

options.name: Slip Away During the Uproar
options.description: Use the fight as cover to exit the tavern.

title: Cloaked Observer (Halfling)
description: You shift your focus to the cloaked figure watching the halfling. They seem less interested in the game and more in the bulge of the halfling's coin purse. Their hand rests inside their cloak, perhaps on a weapon or tool. They might be another thief... or something else (Unbound?).

options.name: Target the Halfling Before They Do
options.description: Make your move quickly before this potential rival acts.

options.name: Approach the Cloaked Figure
options.description: Try to subtly signal or speak to them ('Looking for the same score?').

options.name: Warn the Halfling (Unlikely?)
options.description: Tell the halfling he's being watched by the cloaked figure.

title: Poking the Mercenary
description: The mercenary gives you a look that could curdle milk. 'None of your damn business, sneak-thief. Another word, and I'll test the edge of my axe on you.' [Intimidation successful - no check needed]. He means it.

options.name: Back Off Immediately
options.description: Message received. Leave him alone.

options.name: Subtly Warn the Cloaked Figures?
options.description: If you saw the cloaked figures, maybe warn them about this dangerous merc?

options.name: Leave the Tavern
options.description: This place has too many sharp edges.

title: Avoiding the Guardian
description: Knowing the mercenary is likely a Guardian of the Lock gives you pause, especially if you possess or know about the Tumbler. You make a point of staying clear of him, melting back into the tavern's anonymity.

options.name: Target Someone Else (Carefully)
options.description: Find a different mark, being mindful of the Guardian's presence.

options.name: Leave the Tavern
options.description: A Guardian's presence makes this place too risky.

options.name: Warn the Unbound (Cloaked Figures)?
options.description: If you saw the Unbound, maybe tip them off about the Guardian?

title: Reporting the Guardian
description: You know the mercenary bears the Guardian's sigil. Who do you tell?

options.name: Tell the Cloaked Figures (Unbound?)
options.description: Approach the figures you eavesdropped on and warn them about the Guardian.

options.name: Tell Elara the Scholar
options.description: Seek out Elara and inform her a Guardian is in town.

options.name: Tell Silas the Fence
options.description: Maybe Silas would pay for this information, or it might scare him.

title: Unbound Acquiescence
description: Reluctantly (or perhaps readily), you hand the Whispering Tumbler to the Unbound agents. They snatch it greedily. 'Wise choice,' one sneers. 'Now disappear. Loc's liberation is not for the likes of you to witness.' They melt back into the shadows, leaving you empty-handed.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook Immediately
options.description: Get out of town before they change their minds or something worse happens.

options.name: Seek Out the Guardian Mercenary
options.description: Find the mercenary and tell him the Unbound have the Tumbler.

options.name: Try to Follow the Unbound
options.description: Shadow them to see where they take the Tumbler.

title: Unbound Confrontation

enemies.name: Unbound Agent (Leader)

weapons.name: Poisoned Dagger
weapons.description: A wicked blade coated in dark venom.

enemies.description: A fanatic in dark robes, moving with serpentine grace.

enemies.name: Unbound Agent

weapons.name: Curved Dagger
weapons.description: A simple but sharp curved knife.

enemies.description: Another cultist, eyes gleaming with fervor.

description: 'Fool! The Key Fragment belongs to the Unbound!' The cultists draw wicked-looking daggers, their movements quick and threatening. They clearly won't let you leave with the Tumbler.
limitation: Combat ends when Unbound are defeated or Darryn flees. Leader might use poison. Victory leads to Node 212. Defeat leads to Node 213.

title: Unbound Deception
description:
You try to talk your way out. 'The Tumbler? Oh, I sold that thing to Silas the fence already,' or 'I hid it somewhere safe, far from here.'

[Perform a Deception check (DC 14)]

Success: The Unbound hesitate, exchanging uncertain glances. 'Silas? Hmm. Very well. But if you lie, we *will* find you.' They reluctantly withdraw.

Failure: 'Liar!' one hisses, seeing through your bluff. 'Take it from them!' They attack.

options.name: Retreat Quickly (If Success)
options.description: Your bluff worked. Get away before they reconsider.

options.name: Fight (If Failure)
options.description: Bluff failed. Combat begins.

title: Warning Silas
description: You hurry to Silas's pawn shop. He looks up, annoyed, as you enter. You quickly tell him the Unbound cultists know he might have (or know about) the Tumbler and are meeting at the lighthouse.

options.name: Demand Information/Payment
options.description: Leverage the warning. 'What do you know? Maybe helping me will help you.'

options.name: Observe His Reaction
options.description: See how he responds to the news. Is he scared? Dismissive?

options.name: Leave After Warning Him
options.description: You delivered the warning. His problem now.

title: Guardian's Pawn
description: You take the coin and subtly watch the cloaked figures from across the tavern. They finish their drinks, exchange a few more hushed words, and then slip out the back entrance. The mercenary nods curtly as they leave, then turns his attention back to the main door, ignoring you.

items.name: Gold Piece
items.description: A single gold coin.

options.name: Report to the Mercenary
options.description: Tell him the figures left via the back exit.

options.name: Try to Follow the Figures
options.description: Disobey the merc and try to shadow the cloaked figures.

options.name: Keep the Coin and Mind Your Business
options.description: You did your part. Go back to scanning the room or leave.

title: Risky Warning
description:
You discreetly approach the cloaked figures (Unbound?) or slip them a note. 'You're being watched,' you whisper/write. 'Armored man at the door - Guardian sigil.'

[Perform a Persuasion (DC 14) to deliver warning without Guardian noticing].

Success: They receive the warning, give you a sharp, assessing look (maybe gratitude, maybe suspicion), and alter their behavior (become more cautious, prepare to leave).

Failure: The Guardian notices your interaction! OR The Unbound react suspiciously/hostilely towards you.

options.name: Observe Their Reaction (If Success)
options.description: See what they do with the information.

options.name: Face Guardian's Wrath (If Failure - Noticed)
options.description: The mercenary approaches you, looking furious.

options.name: Deal with Unbound Reaction (If Failure - Hostile)
options.description: They corner you, demanding to know why you interfered.

title: Guardian's Silence
description: You try to press the mercenary for information about the Tumbler. He glares. 'Certain doors should remain locked, kid. Certain powers contained. That's all you need to know. Now, stay out of it.' He refuses to say more.

options.name: Accept His Warning
options.description: He's clearly not talking. Leave him be.

options.name: Try to Offer Information (If You Have Any)
options.description: Maybe offer info on the Unbound's plans (if you know them) in exchange for answers.

options.name: Decide He's the Enemy
options.description: His secrecy suggests he's against whatever the Tumbler represents.

title: Rat Job Victory
description: PLACEHOLDER - Will be replaced by Node 201 in next generation.

title: Rat Job Defeat
description: PLACEHOLDER - Will be replaced by Node 202 in next generation.

title: Blocking Rat Holes
description:
You spend time finding stones and wedging them into the cracks where rats emerge. [Perform an Intelligence (Investigation) check (DC 12) to find and block effectively].

Success: You seem to have blocked the main entrances. The squeaking diminishes.

Failure: You block some holes, but others remain hidden, or your barriers are easily bypassed. Rats still infest the cellar.

options.name: Report Success to Barkeep (If Success)
options.description: Claim your reward.

options.name: Resort to Combat (If Failure)
options.description: Plan B didn't work. Time to fight.

options.name: Abandon the Job
options.description: This is too much effort. Give up.

title: Vinegar Assault
description:
You slosh the pungent vinegar near the rat holes and nests. The acrid smell burns your nostrils. The rats react with furious squeaking!

Outcome: The vinegar drives most rats out a back vent (Success!), OR it enrages them and they swarm to attack (Failure!).

options.name: Claim Reward (If Success)
options.description: Report the rats driven out.

options.name: Fight Enraged Rats (If Failure)
options.description: The vinegar backfired! Prepare for combat.

title: Rat Trap
description:
You scatter grain to lure the rats near a precariously balanced crate. Timing is crucial. [Perform a Dexterity check (DC 14) to trigger the trap effectively].

Success: Several rats are crushed under the falling crate! Others scatter, seemingly cowed.

Failure: You mistime it, the crate falls harmlessly, or you only trap one or two minor rats, angering the rest.

options.name: Claim Reward (If Success)
options.description: Report the job done.

options.name: Fight Remaining Rats (If Failure)
options.description: Your trap failed. Time for direct combat.

options.name: Abandon Job
options.description: This isn't working.

title: Rat Job Lie
description:
You try to convince the barkeep the cellar is clear. [Deception check DC 12 vs Barkeep's Insight].

Success: He shrugs, unconvinced but too busy to check. He grudgingly gives you 5 coppers.

Failure: He scoffs. 'Nice try. Heard 'em squeaking from here. Get out!'

options.name: Take the Coppers (If Success)
options.description: A meager reward for your lies.

options.name: Leave Angrily (If Failure)
options.description: Stalk out of the tavern.

options.name: Try Another Approach
options.description: Maybe scan the room for a theft target now?

title: Mocked by Barkeep
description: You endure the barkeep's laughter and return to the main tavern room, feeling slightly humiliated.

options.name: Scan the Room for a Mark
options.description: Need to make up for the failed job.

options.name: Leave the Tavern
options.description: Get away from the mocking barkeep.

options.name: Order a (Cheap) Drink
options.description: Try to salvage the situation, maybe gather info.

title: Lighthouse Knock
description: After a moment, the heavy oak door creaks open a crack. A pale, gaunt human servant in simple grey robes peers out. 'Yes? What business have you at Tidecaller Watch?' His eyes are unnervingly blank.

options.name: Mention the Notice ('Discreet Assistance')
options.description: State you're here about the job.

options.name: Ask for Master Valerius
options.description: Inquire directly after the scholar.

options.name: Try to Push Past (Risky)
options.description: Attempt to force your way inside.

title: Lighthouse Door Check
description: You discreetly try the heavy oak door handle. It's solid, unyielding. Locked tight. The lock looks complex, possibly requiring skill or a specific key.

options.name: Attempt to Pick the Lock
options.description: Use Thieves' Tools if you have them. [Dexterity (Thieves' Tools) check, likely high DC].

options.name: Knock on the Door
options.description: Try the direct approach.

options.name: Scout Around the Base for Another Way
options.description: Look for windows or other potential entrances.

title: Lighthouse Scouting
description: Circling the lighthouse base, you find the stone slick with sea spray. The narrow windows are high up and barred. However, on the cliff-facing side, partially hidden by eroded rock, you spot a small, rusted metal grate set into the foundation, possibly leading to a cellar or tunnel.

options.name: Examine the Rusted Grate
options.description: Check if it can be opened or forced.

options.name: Look for Handholds to Climb
options.description: Assess the possibility of climbing to a window. [Perception check].

options.name: Give Up, Knock on the Door
options.description: No obvious easy way in. Try knocking.

title: Ghost Stories
description: The barkeep lowers his voice. 'Said they heard whispers... saw shadows moving where no one stood... felt watched. One lad swore the tide itself spoke to him before he ran screaming. Valerius just said it was 'atmospheric disturbances'. Paid 'em well to keep quiet, but they left town quick.'

options.name: Head to the Lighthouse (Intrigued/Wary)
options.description: The stories only add to the mystery.

options.name: Ask if Valerius Studies Magic
options.description: 'Sounds like magic. Is he a wizard?'

options.name: Decide Against It
options.description: This sounds genuinely dangerous. Reconsider other options.

title: Performance Pickpocketing Outcome
description:
[Perform a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check (DC 13)].

Success: Your fingers deftly lift a purse from a distracted merchant watching the fire-eater. Feels moderately heavy.

Failure: The merchant feels the tug or a nearby guard spots your attempt. 'Thief! Stop them!'

options.name: Check the Loot (If Success)
options.description: Find a quiet spot to count the coin.

options.name: Flee the Market Square (If Failure)
options.description: Caught! Run before the guards or crowd grab you.

title: Using Performance Cover
description: You use the heat and motion of the fire-eater's act as cover. [Attempt Sleight of Hand check against a target, perhaps with Advantage or DC 12].

options.name: Make the Lift
options.description: Execute the theft attempt.

options.name: Abort the Attempt
options.description: Too much heat, literally or figuratively. Back off.

title: Market Interlude
description: The fire-eater finishes their act to scattered applause. The crowd begins to disperse. The moment for easy pickings might have passed.

options.name: Listen for Gossip Among Dispersing Crowd
options.description: See if you overhear anything useful now.

options.name: Case the Nearby Shops
options.description: Look for burglary opportunities as the market winds down.

options.name: Leave the Market Square
options.description: Head towards the docks or find a place to rest.

title: Whispering Shoals Lore
description: You ask a grizzled fisherman about the Whispering Shoals. He spits. 'Cursed place. Rocks like teeth, currents that'll drag ships down. And the fog... they say you hear voices in it, luring sailors to their doom. Stay clear.'

options.name: Note the Location (Potential Future Plot?)
options.description: File away the information about the dangerous shoals.

options.name: Ask if Anyone Survived Recently
options.description: 'Any ships make it *through* the shoals?'

options.name: Dismiss it as Superstition
options.description: Sailors are always spinning yarns. Ignore it.

title: Increased Caution
description: Knowing guards are specifically looking for elves (or half-elves) makes you instinctively pull your hood lower, avoid eye contact, and stick to the shadows more. [Future Stealth checks might gain Advantage, while social checks with authorities gain Disadvantage? System notes state].

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook ASAP
options.description: Too much heat. Time to go.

options.name: Lie Low, Find Shelter
options.description: Find a place to hide until things cool down.

options.name: Continue Cautiously
options.description: Proceed with your plans (theft, info gathering) but be extra careful.

title: Watched?
description: The rumor that someone matching your description was seen at Silas's shop puts you on edge. Was it just gossip, or is someone actively tracking your movements? Every glance from a stranger feels like scrutiny.

options.name: Take Countermeasures (Watch Your Back)
options.description: Spend time doubling back, checking rooftops, looking for tails. [Perception check].

options.name: Leave Town Immediately
options.description: Don't wait to find out who's watching. Disappear.

options.name: Confront Silas Directly
options.description: Go back to Silas and ask if he's been talking about you.

title: Apothecary Heist Prep
description: As night falls, you approach the back of the apothecary shop. The window is indeed unlatched. The alley is dark and deserted.

options.name: Climb Through the Window (Stealth)
options.description: Quietly open the window and slip inside.

options.name: Listen at the Window First
options.description: Check for sounds of movement inside before entering.

options.name: Abort the Burglary
options.description: Second thoughts. Maybe this isn't worth the risk.

title: Jeweler Heist Prep
description: The jeweler's shop is dark. The heavy grille looks formidable. Getting through will require force, finesse, or a major distraction.

options.name: Attempt to Force/Pry the Grille
options.description: Requires tools (like a crowbar?) and strength. Very noisy.

options.name: Attempt to Pick the Grille Lock
options.description: Requires Thieves' Tools. The lock looks complex.

options.name: Abort the Burglary
options.description: Too difficult/risky. Find an easier target.

title: Antiquities Heist Prep
description: The small 'Curios & Relics' shop is dark. The front door lock looks average. The elderly owner likely lives upstairs or nearby. Stealth is key.

options.name: Attempt to Pick the Front Door Lock
options.description: Use Thieves' Tools if you have them. [Dexterity (Thieves' Tools) check, moderate DC].

options.name: Check for a Back Entrance/Window
options.description: Scout around the building for alternative entry points.

options.name: Abort the Burglary
options.description: Maybe robbing an old man isn't your style, or it feels wrong.

title: Alley Victory
description: PLACEHOLDER - Node 206 Next

title: Alley Defeat
description: PLACEHOLDER - Node 207 Next

title: Alley Exit
description: Your bluff worked. The thugs let you pass, and you emerge from the other end of the alleyway, finding yourself near the bustling docks.

options.name: Explore the Docks
options.description: Look for opportunities (work, theft, passage).

options.name: Find Passage Out of Nestlebrook
options.description: Try to hire on or stow away on a ship leaving soon.

options.name: Head Back Towards the Town Center
options.description: Return to the market or taverns.

title: Street Escape (Alley)
description:
You burst onto the main street and immediately try to lose yourself in the flow of people. [Dexterity (Stealth) check (DC 13) to evade notice].

Success: You manage to slip away unnoticed. The thugs (presumably) don't follow you out or lose you quickly.

Failure: You stumble or draw attention. The thugs spot you on the street, or worse, a guard notices the commotion.

options.name: Continue Cautiously (If Success)
options.description: You escaped. Decide your next move.

options.name: Deal with Pursuers/Guard (If Failure)
options.description: Confrontation seems likely.

title: Seeking Guards (Alley)
description: You spot a pair of city guards patrolling nearby and wave them down, perhaps claiming you were just accosted in the alley. They approach, looking bored but official.

options.name: Report the Thugs
options.description: Give a description and point towards the alley.

options.name: Answer Their Questions (Suspicious?)
options.description: They might ask what *you* were doing in the alley. Try to answer plausibly. [Deception check?].

options.name: Change Mind, Slip Away
options.description: Maybe involving guards is a bad idea. Try to disappear while they're approaching.

title: New Hiding Spot (Alley Flee)
description: You dart off the main street again, ducking into a different alley or slipping through the door of a crowded shop, hoping to break line of sight.

options.name: Wait and Observe
options.description: Stay hidden and see if the thugs follow or give up. [Stealth check].

options.name: Continue Moving Through Back Ways
options.description: Navigate the alleys and side streets to get further away.

options.name: Emerge Elsewhere
options.description: Exit the shop/alley in a different location and reassess.

title: Stable Slumber
description: The hay is surprisingly comfortable. You drift off to the gentle sounds of horses shifting in their stalls. You wake near dawn, feeling rested. The stablehand is nowhere in sight.

options.name: Slip Out Before Stablehand Returns
options.description: Leave quietly and undetected.

options.name: Wait for Stablehand (Offer to Work?)
options.description: Maybe offer to help muck out stalls for some coin or food?

options.name: Search the Stable Quickly
options.description: Look for any useful items (rope, tools, loose change) before leaving. [Perception check].

title: Stable Confrontation
description:
The stablehand approaches, holding a pitchfork warily. 'What's your business here?' he demands. 'This ain't no inn.'

[Perform a Deception or Persuasion check (DC 12)].

Success: You convince him you meant no harm ('Just needed a moment out of the cold,' 'Thought this was the tavern stable') or offer a small bribe (if possible). He lets you leave.

Failure: He doesn't believe you. 'Get out! And stay out! I oughta call the Watch!' He gestures menacingly with the pitchfork.

options.name: Leave Peacefully (If Success)
options.description: You talked your way out. Go find another plan.

options.name: Run (If Failure)
options.description: Bolt before he calls the guards or jabs you.

options.name: Intimidate/Fight?
options.description: Try to scare him off or prepare to fight.

title: Ejected from Stable
description: You flee the stable, the stablehand's shouts echoing behind you. You're back out on the streets, needing a new plan for rest or for the day.

options.name: Try the Abandoned Shack
options.description: Look for the other potential shelter option.

options.name: Look for Work/Theft Opportunities
options.description: Give up on rest for now, focus on getting coin.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: This town isn't working out.

title: Shack Companion
description: You cautiously greet the huddled figure. They look up, revealing a face pale with sickness but intelligent eyes. 'Water...' they rasp, coughing again. 'Name's Finn... caught the Shakes... dockmaster threw me out.' Nearby is a small, discarded waterskin, seemingly empty.

options.name: Offer Water (If You Have Any)
options.description: Share your waterskin if you have one.

options.name: Promise to Find Water
options.description: Tell Finn you'll look for water nearby.

options.name: Ignore His Plight
options.description: Not your problem. Find your own corner to rest.

title: Silent Sharing
description: You find a relatively dry corner of the shack and settle down, ignoring (or ignored by) the sick figure (Finn). The night passes uneasily, punctuated by Finn's coughing. By morning, he is either still there, looking weaker, or gone.

options.name: Check on Finn (If Still There)
options.description: See if his condition has worsened.

options.name: Leave the Shack
options.description: Time to start the day.

options.name: Search Where Finn Was (If Gone)
options.description: Did he leave anything behind?

title: Cold Dawn
description: Morning arrives, finding you cold, stiff, and unrested from the night spent in the damp alcove. [Disadvantage on first skill check of the day?]. Time to move.

options.name: Seek Food/Warmth First
options.description: Find a tavern (if coin) or try to get a hot meal somewhere.

options.name: Look for Work Immediately
options.description: Ignore discomfort, focus on getting coin.

options.name: Look for Thievery Opportunity
options.description: Maybe being unrested sharpens desperation?

title: Vigilant Night
description: You spend the night alert, dozing lightly but never truly sleeping. You remain safe but greet the dawn feeling drained and weary. [Gain level of exhaustion?].

options.name: Find Somewhere to Rest Properly
options.description: Need real sleep. Prioritize finding safe shelter, even if it costs.

options.name: Push Through Fatigue (Seek Work/Theft)
options.description: Ignore exhaustion, focus on immediate needs.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: Too tired to deal with this town. Move on.

title: Escape Achieved
description: You slip out of hiding (or the crowd) after your pursuers have gone. The immediate threat is over. You still have the Whispering Tumbler.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Find Somewhere Safe to Examine Tumbler
options.description: Now that you're clear, figure out what this thing is.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook Immediately
options.description: Don't wait for them to regroup or alert guards.

options.name: Try to Sell the Tumbler
options.description: Get rid of the evidence and make some profit.

title: Deeper into Shadow (Alley)
description: Scrambling further back behind the crates or deeper into the alley reveals... a bricked-up wall OR a narrow sewage tunnel grate OR the back door to another building.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Face Pursuers (If Bricked Wall)
options.description: Dead end. Turn and fight.

options.name: Try Sewage Tunnel Grate
options.description: Attempt to pry open the grate and escape into the tunnels below. [Strength check].

options.name: Try the Back Door
options.description: Check if the door is locked. [Attempt lockpick if necessary/possible].

title: New Street, Same Problems?
description: You burst out of the alley onto a different street - perhaps quieter residential, maybe bustling market fringe. You pause, catching your breath, listening for pursuit.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Listen Carefully
options.description: Are they still following? [Perception check].

options.name: Keep Moving, Blend In
options.description: Don't wait. Try to act natural and move with the flow.

options.name: Duck into Nearest Building/Alley
options.description: Find immediate cover.

title: Alley Climb Outcome
description:
[Perform an Athletics check (DC 14) to scale the wall/fence].

Success: You scramble over the obstacle, dropping into another alley or onto a low roof, leaving your pursuers behind.

Failure: You slip, can't get a good grip, or the structure crumbles. You fall back to the ground as your pursuers catch up.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Escape via Rooftops/New Alley (If Success)
options.description: You made it over. Navigate the new environment.

options.name: Fight (If Failure)
options.description: Climbing failed. Time to face them.

title: Cornered Victory Loot
description: PLACEHOLDER - Node 208 Next

title: Cornered Defeat Outcome
description: PLACEHOLDER - Node 209 Next

title: Merchant Melee

enemies.name: Angry Merchant (Winded)
enemies.description: Panting heavily but still furious and trying to grab you.

description: The merchant, though winded from the chase, tries to grapple you, flailing wildly. 'Give... it... back!' he gasps.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

limitation: Combat ends when the merchant is defeated (likely knocked out or gives up). Victory leads to Node 214. Defeat (unlikely but possible) leads to Node 215.

title: Breaking Free (Merchant)
description:
You twist and pull against the merchant's grip. [Athletics check (DC 11) vs Merchant's Strength].

Success: You break free from his grasp and can continue running.

Failure: He holds fast, dragging you closer for a fight.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Keep Running (If Success)
options.description: You're free! Continue the escape.

options.name: Fight Merchant
options.description: Can't break free. Time to fight.

title: Stowaway Attempt
description:
You choose a likely ship (perhaps one loading common cargo) and wait for the crew's attention to be elsewhere. [Perform a Dexterity (Stealth) check (DC 14)].

Success: You slip aboard unseen, finding a hiding place among barrels or crates below deck.

Failure: A crew member spots you sneaking aboard. 'Oi! Stowaway! Get off this ship!'

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Await Departure (If Success)
options.description: You're hidden. Now wait for the ship to sail, hopefully away from Nestlebrook.

options.name: Try to Talk/Bribe Crew (If Failure)
options.description: Attempt to convince them to let you stay or look the other way.

options.name: Fight or Flee Ship
options.description: Try to fight past the crew member or jump back onto the docks.

title: Dockside Climb Outcome
description:
[Perform an Athletics check (DC 13) to climb rigging or stacked crates].

Success: You find a secure perch high above the docks, hidden from view. Your pursuers mill about below, confused, before giving up the chase.

Failure: You slip on wet ropes or unstable crates, falling back to the ground with a thud, possibly attracting attention or injuring yourself.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Wait, Then Descend (If Success)
options.description: Once the coast is clear, climb down carefully.

options.name: Deal with Fall Aftermath (If Failure)
options.description: Check for injuries, see if pursuers noticed.

title: Pier Pressure
description: You sprint along the wooden piers, dodging workers and obstacles. The merchant and dockhand still follow, though the dockhand seems faster. Ahead, the pier narrows near a moored ferry.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Jump onto the Ferry
options.description: Make a leap for the ferry deck. [Acrobatics check].

options.name: Jump into the Water
options.description: Dive into the cold harbor water to escape. [Athletics (Swim) check].

options.name: Turn and Face Pursuers
options.description: Nowhere else to run on the pier.

title: In Custody
description: The guards clap you in irons. They confiscate the Whispering Tumbler ('Evidence!') along with any obvious weapons or coin purses. You're marched towards the town's small jailhouse, the accusing merchant/halfling following closely.

options.name: Remain Silent
options.description: Don't say anything to incriminate yourself further.

options.name: Try to Talk/Bribe the Guards
options.description: Attempt to persuade or bribe them on the way to the jail.

options.name: Protest Innocence Loudly
options.description: Make a scene, claim mistaken identity or false accusation.

title: Dodging the Law
description:
You feint left, then dart right, trying to slip past the guard's reach. [Perform a high DC Dexterity (Acrobatics) check (DC 16)].

Success: In a surprising display of agility, you evade the guard's grasp and continue your desperate flight!

Failure: The guard anticipates your move or trips you. You sprawl on the cobblestones, quickly apprehended.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Keep Running (If Success)
options.description: Don't stop now! Find cover!

options.name: Captured
options.description: The guards have you.

title: Turning the Tables?
description:
You point wildly at the merchant/halfling. 'He attacked me! Tried to rob me!' you shout at the guard. [Perform a Deception check vs Guard's Insight (DC 14)].

Success: The guard hesitates, confused by the conflicting stories. This momentary pause might be your chance to escape.

Failure: The guard sighs, clearly siding with the more respectable-looking citizen. 'Likely story. Come along quietly.'

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Attempt Escape During Confusion (If Success)
options.description: Use the guard's hesitation to bolt.

options.name: Captured (If Failure)
options.description: Your bluff failed.

title: Overheard Bargain
description:
Hiding nearby, you strain to hear the conversation between the merchant (Borin) and the cloaked figure (Unbound). [Perception check DC 13].

Success: You hear fragments: '...price for the Key Fragment... Unbound pays well... deliver it to Valerius at the lighthouse... tonight...'

Failure: Their voices are too low, or the street noise interferes. You can't make out the details.

options.name: Follow the Merchant (If Success)
options.description: See if he heads towards Silas or the lighthouse.

options.name: Follow the Cloaked Figure (If Success)
options.description: See where the Unbound agent goes.

options.name: Intervene or Slip Away (If Success or Failure)
options.description: Decide whether to interfere based on info (or lack thereof) or just leave.

title: Three-Way Standoff?
description: You step out from hiding, confronting the merchant and the cloaked figure. Both turn, surprised and wary. The Tumbler lies on the ground nearby or in the merchant's hand.

options.name: Demand the Tumbler
options.description: 'That object is more trouble than it's worth. Hand it over.'

options.name: Offer Information/Services
options.description: Try to play them off each other or offer to help one side (for a price).

options.name: Attempt to Snatch the Tumbler and Run
options.description: Make a quick grab for the object while they're surprised. [High DC Sleight of Hand/Acrobatics].

title: Renewed Flight (Tumbler Reclaimed)
description: You incredibly manage to snatch the Tumbler back! The merchant and/or dockhand roar in fury, possibly joined by the Unbound agent if they were present. The chase is back on, potentially more dangerous now.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly. Reclaimed!

options.name: Duck into Alley
options.description: Try the alleys again.

options.name: Use Crowd
options.description: Weave through the streets.

options.name: Head for Docks
options.description: Lose them among the ships.

title: Resisting the Pull
description: You focus your will, trying to ignore the Tumbler's strange pull towards the lighthouse.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device. Resisted (or failed to resist) pull to Lighthouse.

options.name: Decide to Go to Lighthouse Anyway
options.description: Resisting doesn't change the mystery. Investigate.

options.name: Seek Help (Elara)
options.description: Maybe the scholar can explain or shield you from the pull.

options.name: Try to Sell/Discard the Tumbler
options.description: Get rid of the source of the compulsion.

title: Borin and Silas Feud
description: The barkeep elaborates: 'Borin imports rare woods, sometimes 'loses' bits of cargo insurance scam, maybe? Silas fences the 'lost' goods. They argue constantly about prices or who owes who. Wouldn't get between 'em.'

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Approach Silas with Leverage?
options.description: Hint you know about his dealings with Borin when negotiating?

options.name: Approach Borin?
options.description: Maybe the merchant would pay to get dirt on Silas?

options.name: File Information Away
options.description: Useful knowledge, but focus on the Tumbler/Lighthouse for now.

title: Sailor's Lighthouse Tale
description: The old sailor leans closer, smelling of brine and cheap spirits. 'Secrets sleepin' there, aye. Older than the stones. They say the light ain't just for ships... it holds somethin' back. Somethin' that whispers on the tide. Don't go pokin' around, lest ya wake it!'

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Ask What 'It' Is
options.description: 'What does the light hold back?'

options.name: Dismiss as Drunken Rambling
options.description: Thank him for the tale and move on.

options.name: Connect 'Whispers' to the Tumbler
options.description: Does the Tumbler whisper? This seems significant.

title: Connecting the Dots
description: Considering the Tumbler and the rumors about Valerius, the lighthouse, sleeping secrets, and whispering tides... it all seems interconnected. The lighthouse feels like the next logical step, potentially dangerous but necessary to understand the artifact.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly. Increasingly seems tied to the Lighthouse.

options.name: Go to the Lighthouse
options.description: Time to investigate the source of the rumors.

options.name: Seek Elara's Counsel
options.description: Maybe Elara can make sense of these connections.

options.name: Try Selling the Tumbler Before It Gets Complicated
options.description: Get rid of it now before you're drawn deeper.

title: Post-Dwarf Calm
description: The tension eases slightly now that the dwarf is placated (or unconscious). Patrons go back to their drinks, though some give you wary glances.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Leave the Tavern Quietly
options.description: Best to leave before more trouble starts.

options.name: Scan the Room for Opportunities
options.description: Maybe the commotion created new openings?

options.name: Order Another Drink (Act Normal)
options.description: Try to blend back in.

title: Dwarf Fight Victory
description: PLACEHOLDER - Node 210 Next

title: Dwarf Fight Defeat
description: PLACEHOLDER - Node 211 Next

title: Double Theft Getaway
description: You bolt from the tavern, clutching both the Whispering Tumbler and the merchant's coin purse! Behind you, shouts of anger and confusion erupt. You hit the streets running.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Find Hiding Place & Check Loot
options.description: Get somewhere safe first, then see what you got.

options.name: Keep Running, Head for Docks/Exit
options.description: Focus on escape, check loot later.

title: Tavern Brawl: Double Trouble

enemies.name: Angry Merchant
enemies.description: Furious at being targeted twice.

enemies.name: Grumpy Dwarf
enemies.description: Still angry about the spilled ale, now involved.

description: 'Thief!' the merchant yells, grabbing your wrist. The angry dwarf, seeing the commotion centered on you, also turns his ire your way. You're caught between two angry opponents in the middle of the tavern.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

limitation: Combat ends when opponents are defeated or Darryn flees. Victory leads to Node 216. Defeat leads to Node 217.

title: Dropping the Bait
description: Caught, you quickly release the coin purse. It falls to the floor. The merchant glances down at it. Does this appease him enough for you to escape?

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Attempt to Flee While Merchant is Distracted
options.description: Use his moment of hesitation to bolt.

options.name: Merchant Still Attacks
options.description: He wants payback, not just his purse.

options.name: Dwarf Still Attacks
options.description: The dwarf doesn't care about the purse, he's still mad at you.

title: Brawl Watcher
description: The dwarf and the merchant are now yelling furiously at each other, shoving ensues! It looks like a full brawl might break out, drawing the attention of everyone nearby.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Slip Away During the Brawl
options.description: Perfect cover to escape the tavern.

options.name: Attempt Theft on Merchant During Brawl
options.description: Try to grab the purse while he's fully engaged with the dwarf. [Sleight of Hand check, maybe DC 14?].

options.name: Loot the Loser?
options.description: Wait for one to knock the other out, then try to loot them.

title: Rat Reward
description: You report back to the barkeep. He eyes you skeptically but, seeing no immediate sign of rats (or having been successfully bluffed), tosses you 5 copper pieces. 'Barely worth the trouble,' he mutters.

items.name: Copper Pieces
items.description: A handful of 5 copper pieces.

options.name: Buy a Cheap Drink/Food
options.description: Spend the meager earnings.

options.name: Look for More Work/Opportunities
options.description: Need something better paying.

options.name: Leave the Tavern
options.description: Take your coppers and go.

title: Rat Bites
description: The rats overwhelm you with vicious bites before you manage to scramble back up the cellar stairs. You're injured [Lose HP, specific amount TBD by combat system], possibly suffering from Sewer Plague [CON save result from combat system determines effect]. The barkeep takes one look at your sorry state and throws you out. 'Useless!'

options.name: Seek Healing (If Coin Allows)
options.description: Find a temple or healer to tend your wounds/disease.

options.name: Try to Find Shelter and Rest
options.description: Find somewhere to recover naturally.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook Immediately (Injured)
options.description: Limp out of town before infection sets in worse.

title: Caught Lying
description: The barkeep sees right through your lie about the rats. 'Think I'm stupid? Get out of my tavern, liar!' He shoves you towards the door.

options.name: Leave Angrily
options.description: Stalk out.

options.name: Try to Apologize/Smooth Over
options.description: Attempt to placate him.

options.name: Shove Back/Start Trouble?
options.description: Escalate the situation.

title: Market Loot
description: You duck into an alley and check the purse lifted during the performance. Inside: 35 Gold Pieces.

options.name: Pocket the Coin
options.description: A decent score.

options.name: Return to Market (Look for More?)
options.description: Feeling lucky. Try again?

options.name: Leave the Area
options.description: Don't push your luck. Head to docks/inn/exit town.

title: Market Chase
description: Caught! The cry goes up, and guards converge while the angry merchant points you out. You have to run, dodging stalls and shoppers.

options.name: Head for the Alleys
options.description: Try to lose them in the narrow streets.

options.name: Head for the Docks
options.description: Use the ships and cargo for cover.

options.name: Try to Surrender
options.description: Give up before things get worse.

title: Alley Spoils
description: The thugs lie defeated (likely unconscious). You quickly check their pockets, finding a total of 12 gold pieces and the leader's rusty cutlass.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 12 gold.

items.name: Rusty Cutlass
items.description: A pitted, curved blade.

options.name: Continue Through the Alley
options.description: Proceed to your original destination (likely the docks).

options.name: Loot More Thoroughly?
options.description: Take more time searching them or the alley. [Perception check].

options.name: Retreat Back to Main Street
options.description: Maybe the alley isn't safe after all.

title: Alley Beating Aftermath
description: Pain explodes in your head as the thugs beat you into unconsciousness (or near it). You wake up bruised and aching in the filthy alley. Your pockets are empty [Lose all unsecured coin/items]. The thugs are gone.

options.name: Crawl Out and Seek Help
options.description: Try to reach the main street and find someone sympathetic (or a guard).

options.name: Rest in the Alley (Risky)
options.description: Try to recover strength before moving.

options.name: Stagger Towards the Docks (Escape?)
options.description: Try to get out of town despite injuries.

title: Cornered Victory Spoils
description: The merchant and dockhand are defeated (unconscious or fled). You retrieve the Whispering Tumbler. A quick search yields a small coin purse from the merchant containing 15 GP.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device. Retrieved after combat.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 15 gold.

options.name: Leave the Alley Quickly
options.description: Get out before guards arrive.

options.name: Examine the Tumbler Here
options.description: Take a moment to study it now that the fight is over.

options.name: Take the Dockhand's Hook?
options.description: Consider taking the cargo hook as a weapon.

title: Cornered Defeat Aftermath
description: You are overpowered. The merchant snatches back the Whispering Tumbler. They might tie you up for the guards, knock you out and leave you, or worse.

options.name: Wake Up Later (If Knocked Out)
options.description: They left you beaten in the alley.

options.name: Struggle Against Bonds (If Tied Up)
options.description: Attempt to escape before guards arrive. [Dexterity check].

options.name: Face the Guards (If They Arrive)
options.description: Captured.

title: Dwarf Victory Spoils
description: The grumpy dwarf lies unconscious on the tavern floor. Patrons stare. The barkeep looks furious. You could quickly loot the dwarf before leaving...

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Loot the Dwarf (Quickly)
options.description: Check his pockets before fleeing. [Sleight of Hand check?].

options.name: Flee the Tavern Immediately
options.description: Get out before the guards are called or the barkeep attacks.

options.name: Try to Calm the Barkeep?
options.description: Attempt to explain or apologize for the mess.

title: Dwarf Beating Aftermath
description: The dwarf's heavy mug connects soundly with your head. You wake up outside the tavern, bruised, aching, and possibly missing some coin filched by onlookers. The world spins slightly.

options.name: Seek Healing/Rest
options.description: Find somewhere to recover.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: This town is bad luck.

options.name: Try a Different Tavern/Approach
options.description: Maybe sneak into another place?

title: Unbound Victory Spoils
description: The Unbound agents lie defeated. You retrieve the Whispering Tumbler (if they had taken it). A quick search reveals their poisoned daggers, perhaps a cryptic note mentioning 'Valerius' and 'High Tide', and 20 GP.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: Key Fragment, secured from Unbound.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 20 gold.

items.name: Poisoned Dagger
items.description: A wicked blade coated in dark venom.

items.name: Cryptic Note (Unbound)
items.description: Mentions 'Valerius', 'High Tide'.

options.name: Head to the Lighthouse
options.description: The note confirms the connection.

options.name: Report to the Guardian Mercenary
options.description: Tell the Guardian you dealt with the Unbound agents.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook with Loot
options.description: Take your winnings and get out of town.

title: Unbound Defeat Aftermath
description: The Unbound overwhelm you, perhaps using poison or sheer fanaticism. They take the Whispering Tumbler. Your fate depends on their whims...

options.name: Left for Dead
options.description: They knock you out and leave you, taking the Tumbler.

options.name: Taken Captive
options.description: They bind you, intending to take you with them (perhaps to the Lighthouse?).

options.name: Ritual Sacrifice Component?
options.description: They mention needing a sacrifice... [Leads to darker path/escape attempt].

title: Merchant Defeated (Chase)
description: The winded merchant is no match for you. You easily knock him aside or unconscious. The chase is over.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Check Merchant's Pockets
options.description: See if he has any coin.

options.name: Continue Escape
options.description: Leave him and get away before guards arrive.

title: Merchant Capture (Chase)
description: Somehow, the flailing merchant manages to trip you or hold you long enough for the dockhand or guards to arrive. You are captured.

options.name: Face the Consequences
options.description: Taken into custody.

title: Double Trouble Victory
description: Against the odds, you defeat both the furious merchant and the grumpy dwarf! The tavern is a wreck, patrons are hiding. You possess the Tumbler.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Loot Both Quickly
options.description: Check the pockets of both opponents before fleeing.

options.name: Flee the Tavern Immediately
options.description: Get out before guards arrive.

title: Double Trouble Defeat
description: Facing two opponents proves too much. You are beaten into submission. The merchant likely takes the Tumbler (if you had it), and you're thrown out or handed over to the guards, likely injured.

options.name: Wake Up Outside (If Thrown Out)
options.description: Beaten and robbed.

options.name: Face the Guards (If Handed Over)
options.description: Captured.

title: Journey to Whispering Falls
description: You follow Elara's directions, heading into the increasingly dense woods surrounding Nestlebrook. The path is faint, sometimes disappearing altogether. Night falls quickly under the thick canopy, and the woods become filled with unsettling rustles and snaps. The full moon provides some eerie light.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: Identified as a Key Fragment for Loc's prison. On a quest for Elara.

options.name: Press On Through the Night
options.description: Rely on the moonlight and your senses to find the Falls quickly. [Survival check?]

options.name: Make a Cold Camp
options.description: Find a defensible spot to rest until dawn. Safer, but delays the quest.

options.name: Follow Animal Trails (Risky)
options.description: Look for clearer paths used by animals, hoping they lead towards water.

title: Guardian Clarification
description: Elara frowns. 'The woods themselves may resist intrusion near the Falls, especially under the full moon. Fey creatures, awakened spirits... perhaps even natural predators drawn by the lunar energies. Keep your wits sharp and tread softly.' She offers no more specifics.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: Identified as a Key Fragment. Warned about fey/spirits near Falls.

options.name: Head Towards Whispering Falls
options.description: Proceed with the quest, now slightly more informed (or worried).

options.name: Try to Buy Protective Charms/Supplies
options.description: If you have coin, maybe the market or Elara herself sells something useful.

options.name: Reconsider the Quest
options.description: Fey creatures and spirits sound dangerous. Maybe refuse after all?

title: Quest Preparations
description: You decide to prepare before heading into the woods. Depending on your coin, you might visit the general store for rations and rope, the smithy for basic weapons/armor, or perhaps ask Elara if she sells any protective wards (5 GP for a simple anti-fey charm?).

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: Identified as a Key Fragment. Preparing for Elara's quest.

options.name: Buy Rations and Rope (5 GP)
options.description: Basic survival gear.

options.name: Buy Simple Weapon/Armor (10+ GP)
options.description: Prioritize combat readiness.

options.name: Buy Anti-Fey Charm from Elara (5 GP)
options.description: If you have the coin, purchase her ward.

options.name: Proceed Without Supplies
options.description: No time or coin to waste. Head out now.

title: Local Faction Activity
description: Elara peers thoughtfully into her teacup. 'Shadows gather. I sense the Unbound's chaotic energy stirring, particularly near the Tidecaller Lighthouse. As for the Keepers... one arrived recently. Stern fellow, watches the tavern door like a hawk. His presence suggests the Fragment was noticed quickly. Now, the blossom?'

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: Key Fragment. Confirmed Unbound near Lighthouse, Keeper at tavern.

options.name: Agree to Retrieve the Blossom
options.description: Accept the quest, armed with this new knowledge.

options.name: Warn the Keeper about the Unbound?
options.description: Find the mercenary and tell him about the Unbound activity.

options.name: Refuse the Quest, Focus on Factions
options.description: This is too dangerous. Decline the quest and decide how to handle the factions.

title: Docks at Night
description: Following Elara's 'shadow and tide' clue literally, you head to the Nestlebrook docks as night deepens and the tide comes in. It's quieter now, mostly deserted except for a few lone watchmen and the sounds of creaking wood and lapping water. Shadows are deep between crates and under piers.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Sneak Aboard a Ship
options.description: Look for a ship that might be leaving soon or seems unguarded.

options.name: Listen for Unusual Sounds/Activity
options.description: Find a hidden spot and just observe. [Perception check].

options.name: Investigate Under the Piers
options.description: Explore the dark, damp spaces beneath the docks.

options.name: Decide This Was a Bad Idea
options.description: It's just dark docks. Elara must have meant the Lighthouse.

title: Seeking Former Assistant
description: Asking around the seedier parts of town, you eventually find someone who admits to working for Valerius briefly. It's Finn, the sick man from the abandoned shack (if encountered previously) or another nervous-looking local. 'Don't go there,' he rasps/whispers. 'Place ain't right. Books that whisper... instruments that hum... felt like the walls were watchin' me. Valerius? Obsessed. Barely sleeps. Talks about 'alignments' and 'unlocking the Gate'.'

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device. Linked to Tidecaller Lighthouse & Valerius.

options.name: Ask More About 'The Gate'
options.description: Press him for details about this 'Gate'.

options.name: Ask About Security/Layout
options.description: 'Any secret ways in? Guards?'

options.name: Heed the Warning, Avoid Lighthouse
options.description: This sounds too dangerous. Reconsider.

options.name: Go to the Lighthouse Anyway
options.description: The warning only makes it more intriguing.

title: Armored Up
description: You purchase a suit of sturdy Leather Armor. It feels reassuringly solid. You have 40 Gold Pieces remaining.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 40 gold.

items.name: Leather Armor
items.description: Standard leather armor.

options.name: Buy a Weapon Now?
options.description: Use remaining coin for a Shortsword (10 GP)?

options.name: Save Remaining Coin
options.description: Keep the 40 GP for now.

options.name: Seek Information/Rumors
options.description: Now better protected, time to gather intel.

title: Armed and Ready
description: You purchase a well-balanced Shortsword. Its hilt feels good in your hand. You have 40 Gold Pieces remaining (or 30 if you also bought armor).

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 30-40 gold.

items.name: Shortsword
items.description: A well-balanced shortsword.

options.name: Buy Armor Now? (If Didn't Already)
options.description: Use remaining coin for Leather Armor (10 GP)?

options.name: Save Remaining Coin
options.description: Keep the 30-40 GP for now.

options.name: Seek Adventure/Trouble
options.description: Now armed, look for opportunities (Lighthouse? Factions?).

title: Tools of the Trade
description: You acquire a set of Thieves' Tools. The lockpicks and small tools feel familiar and useful. You have 25 Gold Pieces remaining.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 25 gold.

items.name: Thieves' Tools
items.description: A set of lockpicks and tools.

options.name: Buy Weapon or Armor?
options.description: Use remaining coin for Leather Armor (10 GP) or Shortsword (10 GP)?

options.name: Look for Burglary Opportunities
options.description: Time to put the tools to use. Case shops or houses.

options.name: Save Remaining Coin
options.description: Keep the 25 GP for now.

title: Finding the Guardian
description: Following Ratty Finnigan's tip, you return to 'The Drunken Sailor'. Sure enough, the armored mercenary (likely the Guardian) is still there, watching the door intently. He looks alert and dangerous.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 30 gold.

options.name: Approach and Offer Information
options.description: Tell him about the Unbound meeting at the lighthouse.

options.name: Observe Him Further
options.description: Watch his interactions, look for more clues about his purpose.

options.name: Avoid Him, Head to Lighthouse
options.description: Maybe it's better if he doesn't know you're involved. Go investigate the meeting yourself.

title: Gearing Up (30GP)
description: With the information about the Unbound meeting bought, you still have 30 Gold Pieces. You could buy some basic gear before heading towards the lighthouse.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 30 gold.

options.name: Buy Leather Armor (10 GP)
options.description: Leaves 20 GP.

options.name: Buy Shortsword (10 GP)
options.description: Leaves 20 GP.

options.name: Buy Thieves' Tools (25 GP)
options.description: Leaves 5 GP.

collectedItems.name: Thieves' Tools
collectedItems.description: A set of lockpicks and tools.

options.name: Save the Coin
options.description: Keep the 30 GP and proceed.

title: Splurging on Gear (100GP)
description:
You visit the best smith and leatherworker in town. With 100 GP, you can afford quality. Choose your kit:
- Studded Leather (45 GP) & Rapier (25 GP) & Thieves' Tools (25 GP) = 95 GP total (Leaves 5 GP)
- Chain Shirt (50 GP) & Shortsword (10 GP) & Shield (10 GP) = 70 GP total (Leaves 30 GP)

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 100 gold.

options.name: Buy Rogue's Set (Studded Leather, Rapier, Tools)
options.description: AC 12+Dex, 1d8 Finesse weapon, tools. Costs 95 GP.

collectedItems.name: Thieves' Tools
collectedItems.description: A set of lockpicks and tools.

options.name: Buy Fighter's Set (Chain Shirt, Sword, Shield)
options.description: AC 13+Dex (max 2), 1d6 weapon, +2 AC shield. Costs 70 GP.

collectedItems.name: Chain Shirt
collectedItems.description: A shirt of interlocking metal rings.

options.name: Save the Money
options.description: Decide against buying gear right now.

title: Investing in Allies (100GP)
description: With 100 GP, you could potentially hire some muscle or buy significant information. Ratty Finnigan might know more for a higher price, or perhaps one of the mercenaries in the tavern could be hired as a temporary bodyguard or accomplice?

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 100 gold.

options.name: Seek Out Ratty Finnigan Again
options.description: Offer more coin (50GP?) for everything he knows about the Tumbler/Factions/Lighthouse.

options.name: Approach a Mercenary (Not the Guardian)
options.description: Find a tough-looking sellsword in the tavern and offer good pay (e.g., 40GP for a day's dangerous work).

options.name: Try to Bribe a Guard?
options.description: Risky, but maybe a guard captain could be bought for information or protection?

options.name: Keep the Coin For Now
options.description: Decide against hiring help yet.

title: Stylish Departure (100GP)
description: You decide to use your newfound wealth to leave Nestlebrook comfortably. You book passage on the 'Swift Tern', a fast merchant vessel heading south (cost 15 GP). You also buy new clothes, quality rations, and enjoy a fine meal and comfortable inn stay before departure (cost 20 GP). You have 65 GP left as you prepare to board.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 65 gold.

items.name: Fine Clothes
items.description: Well-made traveler's clothes.

items.name: Quality Rations (5 days)
items.description: Good quality travel food.

options.name: Board the 'Swift Tern'
options.description: Begin your journey south.

options.name: One Last Stop (Risky)
options.description: Before boarding, quickly visit Elara or try to learn one last thing about the Tumbler?

options.name: Gamble Some Coin?
options.description: Try your luck at the tavern one last time before leaving.

title: Confronting Silas (Watched)
description: You return to Silas's shop. He looks up, and a flicker of recognition (or annoyance) crosses his face. 'Back again?' he asks warily. You confront him about being watched or about him talking.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device. Retained after refusing Silas's offer.

options.name: Accuse Him Directly
options.description: 'Why are your people following me?' or 'Why are you telling people I visited?'

options.name: Try a Subtle Approach
options.description: 'Seems word gets around fast in this town. Heard someone was asking about me...'

options.name: Offer Him the Tumbler Again
options.description: 'Maybe we can make a deal after all? If you tell me who's interested.'

title: Sixty Pieces of Silver (Tongue)
description: Silas practically shoves 60 gold pieces into your hand, snatching the Tumbler away. 'Take it! And stay away from the Unbound, understand? Bad business.' He looks genuinely frightened. This artifact is clearly more dangerous than you realized.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 60 gold.

options.name: Buy Gear (60GP Budget)
