options.description: Invest in armor, weapons, or tools.

options.name: Seek Information (Leverage Unbound Fear?)
options.description: Use the coin or the Unbound connection to gather more intel.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook Immediately
options.description: Take the money and the warning seriously. Get out.

title: Basic Investment (40GP)
description: With 40 gold, you can afford one decent piece of basic gear. What's the priority?

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 40 gold.

options.name: Leather Armor (10 GP)
options.description: Basic protection. Leaves 30 GP.

options.name: Shortsword (10 GP)
options.description: Reliable weapon. Leaves 30 GP.

options.name: Thieves' Tools (25 GP)
options.description: For infiltration. Leaves 15 GP.

collectedItems.name: Thieves' Tools
collectedItems.description: A set of lockpicks and tools.

options.name: Save the Coin
options.description: Keep the 40 GP.

title: Nervous Silas
description: You visit Silas's shop. He seems jumpy, constantly glancing towards the door. He polishes items nervously. The rumors were right.

options.name: Ask About the Tumbler (If Sold)
options.description: 'That strange device I sold you... causing trouble?'

options.name: Mention the Unbound/Guardians
options.description: 'Heard some dangerous folks are in town... looking for artifacts?' Try to gauge his knowledge.

options.name: Offer Protection (For a Price/Info)
options.description: Bluff that you can help him deal with the Unbound... if he makes it worth your while.

options.name: Leave Him Be
options.description: His nervousness might attract unwanted attention to you. Best to leave.

title: Heightened Security
description: The rumors about the diligent guard captain make you reconsider pickpocketing or burglary for now. It seems riskier than usual in Nestlebrook.

options.name: Seek Legitimate Work
options.description: Look for odd jobs or check the notice board again.

options.name: Focus on Information Gathering
options.description: Spend time listening for rumors, perhaps investigate the Lighthouse whispers.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: If theft is too risky and work is scarce, time to move on.

title: Buyback Attempt
description: You return to Silas. 'About that intricate metal thing I sold you... I've reconsidered. Name your price to buy it back.' Silas eyes you calculatingly.

options.name: Offer Double What He Paid (e.g., 40 GP)
options.description: Start with a reasonable (for him) offer.

options.name: Claim Sentimental Value
options.description: Try to appeal to his (non-existent?) good nature. [Persuasion check?]

options.name: He Refuses to Sell
options.description: 'Sorry, already sold it.' Or 'Not for sale.'

title: Pawn Shop Heist Prep
description: Stealing back the Tumbler from Silas requires infiltrating his shop at night. It's likely locked, possibly trapped, and Silas might live nearby or have guards.

options.name: Case the Shop (Doors, Windows, Locks)
options.description: Spend time scouting the exterior for weaknesses. [Investigation check].

options.name: Attempt Front Door Lock
options.description: Requires Thieves' Tools. Likely a good lock. [High DC check].

options.name: Attempt Back Entrance/Window
options.description: Look for a less obvious way in. [Perception check].

options.name: Abort the Heist
options.description: Too risky. Forget the Tumbler.

title: Leaving the Game (Cautious)
description: You cash out your chips, ending up with roughly 10-30 GP depending on luck. Not a huge gain or loss, but you spent time and avoided disaster.

options.name: Spend the Coin (Food/Lodging/Supplies)
options.description: Use your remaining cash for necessities.

options.name: Look for Work
options.description: Need a more reliable source of income.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: Move on.

title: Big Winner
description: You leave the gambling table significantly richer, with 70 gold pieces. The other players watch you go with envy or suspicion.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 70 gold.

options.name: Invest in Good Gear
options.description: Buy better armor, weapon, and tools.

options.name: Seek Quality Information
options.description: Pay well for reliable intel (Ratty Finnigan?).

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook Comfortably
options.description: Get out while you're ahead.

title: Gambling Loss
description: Your bold move failed. You leave the table with only 5 gold pieces left. A harsh lesson in luck.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 5 gold.

options.name: Seek Basic Work (Rat Catching?)
options.description: Need any coin you can get.

options.name: Attempt Desperate Theft
options.description: Try to pickpocket someone for immediate cash.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook Broke
options.description: Nothing left here for you.

title: Cheating Accusation
description: The accusation hangs in the air. Angry gamblers surround you. The barkeep approaches menacingly.

options.name: Bluff/Persuade Innocence
options.description: Try to talk your way out, convince them it was a mistake. [Deception/Persuasion check].

options.name: Offer to Return Winnings/Pay Off
options.description: Try to buy peace by returning the disputed money.

options.name: Fight Your Way Out
options.description: Prepare for a tavern brawl.

options.name: Attempt to Flee
options.description: Make a break for the door.

title: Successful Cheat Getaway
description: You pocket your ill-gotten gains (60 GP total) and casually leave the gambling table before anyone notices or questions your luck. A clean, if dishonest, win.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 60 gold.

options.name: Buy Gear (60GP Budget)
options.description: Invest your winnings.

options.name: Seek Information
options.description: Use the coin to learn more.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook Quickly
options.description: Get out before your cheating is discovered.

title: Reliquary Clue
description: You retreat from the docks, the words 'Reliquary' and 'Master Valerius' echoing. It seems the scholar at the lighthouse is expecting a valuable, guarded shipment. This could be related to the Tumbler, or a separate opportunity.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Head to the Lighthouse
options.description: Investigate Valerius and his expected cargo.

options.name: Try to Intercept the Reliquary?
options.description: Plan a heist to steal the Reliquary before it reaches Valerius (Risky).

options.name: Retrieve Your Hidden Tumbler
options.description: This new info makes your artifact seem even more significant. Go get it.

options.name: Inform Elara
options.description: Tell the other scholar about Valerius's expected delivery.

title: Dock Guard Bluff
description:
You quickly make up a story for the guard who spotted you near the 'Sea Serpent'. [Deception check DC 13].

Success: 'Lost me way, lookin' for the harbormaster.' He buys it, or doesn't care enough, and tells you to move along.

Failure: He doesn't believe you. 'Skulking around guarded cargo? Likely story. Come with me.' He moves to apprehend you.

options.name: Move Along Quickly (If Success)
options.description: Retreat from the docks.

options.name: Run (If Failure)
options.description: Bolt before he grabs you.

options.name: Fight the Guard
options.description: Resist arrest.

title: Shadowing the Unbound
description:
Following the cloaked figures requires stealth and caution as they move through the alleys and backstreets of Nestlebrook. [Dexterity (Stealth) check DC 14].

Success: You track them to a dilapidated warehouse near the docks OR back towards the Drunken Sailor tavern OR towards the path leading to the Lighthouse.

Failure: They notice you following, either confronting you directly or splitting up and losing you in the streets.

options.name: Observe Their Destination (If Success)
options.description: Watch the warehouse/tavern/path from a safe distance.

options.name: Confront Them (If Failure - Confronted)
options.description: They've spotted you. Deal with the confrontation.

options.name: Lose the Trail (If Failure - Lost)
options.description: They evaded you. Return to previous activities.

title: Unbound Trail Choice
description: You recognize the serpent coiled around the rings as an Unbound symbol, based on Elara's description or other encounters. The game trail likely leads to their activity. Do you follow, knowing the danger?

options.name: Follow the Trail (Knowingly)
options.description: Proceed cautiously down the Unbound path.

options.name: Avoid the Trail
options.description: Unbound are trouble. Stick to the main road.

options.name: Set an Ambush?
options.description: Wait near the trail entrance and see who comes or goes. [Risky strategy].

title: Campsite Clues (Mountain)
description: Searching the recently abandoned campsite yields: discarded ration wrappers (confirming recent use), faint drag marks leading towards the cave/pass, and a small pouch dropped near the fire pit containing three polished obsidian shards.

options.name: Take the Obsidian Shards
options.description: They might be valuable or significant.

collectedItems.name: Obsidian Shards (x3)
collectedItems.description: Polished, sharp shards of black volcanic glass.

options.name: Follow the Drag Marks Towards Cave/Pass
options.description: Someone or something was dragged. Investigate cautiously.

options.name: Leave the Clues, Turn Back
options.description: This looks ominous. Return to the main road.

title: Approaching the Cave/Pass
description: You move stealthily towards the dark opening in the mountainside. It could be a natural cave or a narrow mountain pass. You hear faint chanting or rhythmic pounding from within. The air smells stale and metallic.

options.name: Enter the Cave/Pass Stealthily
options.description: Proceed inside, trying to remain undetected. [Stealth check].

options.name: Listen at the Entrance
options.description: Try to discern more about the sounds before entering. [Perception check].

options.name: Create a Diversion Outside
options.description: Try to draw occupants out by making noise away from the entrance.

options.name: Turn Back
options.description: This feels like walking into a lair. Retreat.

title: Investigating Mountain Smoke
description: Approaching cautiously, you find the smoke comes from a small, rough camp built around a smoky fire. Two grizzled prospectors are arguing loudly over a small bag, occasionally glancing nervously into the surrounding peaks.

options.name: Approach Them Openly
options.description: Hail them, ask for directions or news.

options.name: Eavesdrop on Their Argument
options.description: Try to learn what they found or why they're nervous. [Perception check].

options.name: Attempt to Steal the Bag
options.description: Try to snatch the bag they're arguing over while they're distracted. [Sleight of Hand check].

options.name: Avoid Them and Continue
options.description: Leave them to their argument.

title: Bypassing the Camp
description: You leave the road, moving through the rocky terrain to circle around the source of the smoke. It takes extra time and effort, but you avoid potential confrontation. You rejoin the road further up.

options.name: Continue Along the Mountain Road
options.description: Press onwards towards potential settlements or ruins.

options.name: Look for Shelter
options.description: Find a place to rest after the detour.

options.name: Hunt for Food
options.description: Try to find game in the surrounding wilderness.

title: Further Up the Mountain Road
description: The road continues its ascent. The air is cold and thin. Ahead, you see a fork in the road: one path seems better maintained, leading towards a distant watchtower; the other is rougher, heading towards what look like ancient ruins on a nearby peak.

options.name: Take Path Towards Watchtower
options.description: Follow the maintained road towards potential civilization or guards.

options.name: Take Path Towards Ruins
options.description: Investigate the ancient ruins, seeking shelter, treasure, or trouble.

options.name: Make Camp Near the Fork
options.description: Rest before choosing a path.

title: Barnacle's Bite Rumors
description: Nursing the cheapest, vilest ale imaginable, you listen in. Talk revolves around brutal dockside turf wars between gangs ('The Salty Dogs' vs 'The Kraken's Crew'), a recent shipwreck nearby with rumors of lost treasure, and the one-eyed orc barkeep ('Grognak') being owed money by half the patrons.

options.name: Ask About the Shipwreck/Treasure
options.description: Inquire carefully about the wreck location and rumors.

options.name: Try to Play Gangs Off Each Other?
options.description: Risky, but maybe offer info to one gang about the other?

options.name: Offer to Collect Debts for Grognak?
options.description: Approach the orc barkeep and offer your services.

options.name: Look for an Easy Pickpocket Target
options.description: Scan the room again for drunks or fools.

title: Seabrook Pickpocketing
description: The pickings look slim and dangerous. The patrons are rough and watchful. Your best bet seems to be a sailor passed out face-down on a table, or perhaps trying to lift something from the barkeep's unattended coin box while he deals with a brawl.

options.name: Target the Passed-Out Sailor
options.description: Easy target, but might have friends nearby. [Sleight of Hand DC 12].

options.name: Target the Barkeep's Coin Box (High Risk)
options.description: Requires perfect timing during a distraction. [Sleight of Hand DC 16].

options.name: Abort Attempt, Seek Work Instead
options.description: Too risky. Try asking Grognak for a job.

title: Work for Grognak
description: You ask the one-eyed orc barkeep, Grognak, about work. He grunts, wiping down the bar with a filthy rag. 'Work? Yeah. Need someone to... discourage... the Kraken's Crew from hangin' 'round my docks. Or... clean the kraken tank out back. Stinks somethin' fierce.'

options.name: Take the Discouragement Job (Intimidation/Combat)
options.description: Go deal with the Kraken's Crew members.

options.name: Take the Kraken Tank Job (Disgusting Labor)
options.description: Agree to clean the tank. It sounds awful.

options.name: Decline Both Jobs
options.description: Neither option sounds appealing.

title: Seabrook Crate Loot
description:
Using the argument as cover, you quickly pry open a nearby crate. [Perception DC 12].

Success: Inside, you find a bolt of fine silk (worth 10-15 GP to a fence) OR several bottles of decent brandy (usable/sellable).

Failure: The crate contains only salted fish or rough wool. Nothing valuable.

options.name: Take the Silk/Brandy (If Success)
options.description: Secure your loot.

options.name: Leave Empty-Handed (If Failure)
options.description: Bad luck. Try something else.

options.name: Try Another Crate (Risky)
options.description: Press your luck while the distraction lasts.

title: Seabrook Stowaway Attempt
description: You eye the ships. The 'Salty Dog' looks rough but ready to sail. The 'Windswept Wanderer' seems cleaner but quieter. You attempt to sneak aboard one while the crew is occupied or distracted. [Dexterity (Stealth) check DC 13].

options.name: Attempt 'Salty Dog'
options.description: Try to board the rougher, potentially less observant ship.

options.name: Attempt 'Windswept Wanderer'
options.description: Try to board the quieter, possibly more secure ship.

options.name: Abort Attempt
options.description: Too risky. Look for work instead.

title: Dock Labor (Seabrook)
description: You find a dock foreman overseeing the loading of pungent fish barrels onto a grimy trawler. He eyes you up and down. 'Need hands, yeah. Back-breaking work. Few coppers an hour. You in?'

options.name: Accept the Work
options.description: Agree to load the barrels. It's honest, if unpleasant, pay.

options.name: Try to Negotiate Higher Pay
options.description: Attempt to haggle for more copper. [Persuasion check?].

options.name: Decline the Work
options.description: Not worth the effort or the smell.

title: Net Hut Respite
description: You spend the night in the abandoned net hut. The smell of old fish is overpowering, and something rustles in the walls, but it keeps the worst of the wind and rain off. You wake feeling slightly nauseous but relatively rested.

options.name: Head to the Docks
options.description: Look for work or opportunities.

options.name: Brave 'The Barnacle's Bite'
options.description: Enter the tavern.

options.name: Try to Wash Off the Smell
options.description: Find the sea or a public pump to clean up.

title: Boat Shelter
description: Hiding behind upturned fishing boats offers minimal shelter. The night is cold, the ground hard. You sleep fitfully, waking at every sound. [Possible disadvantage or exhaustion?].

options.name: Head to the Docks (Stiffly)
options.description: Look for work, feeling unrested.

options.name: Seek Warmth/Food at Tavern
options.description: Go to 'The Barnacle's Bite'.

options.name: Try to Find Better Shelter Next Time
options.description: Note this spot is bad for future reference.

title: Loft Infiltration Attempt
description:
You try to sneak into the boat repair shop's loft. [Dexterity (Stealth) check DC 14].

Success: You find a relatively clean, dry spot hidden among sails and ropes. You rest well.

Failure: A worker spots you climbing or hears you in the loft. 'Hey! Get down from there!'

options.name: Rest Well, Leave Stealthily (If Success)
options.description: Enjoy the good rest and slip out unnoticed in the morning.

options.name: Try to Talk/Bluff Way Out
options.description: Make excuses to the worker.

options.name: Run For It
options.description: Jump down and flee the shop.

title: Wilderness Meal
description: You manage to prepare and cook your catch over a small, carefully concealed fire. The simple meal restores some energy and lifts your spirits.

options.name: Continue Journey (Refreshed)
options.description: Press on through the wilderness.

options.name: Rest Longer After Eating
options.description: Take extra time to recover at your campsite.

options.name: Follow the Booted Tracks Now
options.description: With food in your belly, investigate the other tracks.

title: Continuing Wilderness Journey
description: You press on through the wilderness, either hungry or having eaten. The terrain becomes rockier, harder going. You spot distant ruins on a hilltop OR signs of a narrow path leading down towards the coast.

options.name: Head Towards the Ruins
options.description: Investigate the distant structures.

options.name: Take the Path Towards the Coast
options.description: Return towards potential settlements or the sea.

options.name: Continue Deeper into Wilderness
options.description: Keep moving inland, avoiding ruins and coast.

title: Wilderness Ambush!

enemies.name: Hungry Wolf / Boar
enemies.description: A large, aggressive wild animal protecting its territory or looking for a meal.

description: Your clumsy hunting attempt attracts the wrong kind of attention! A large, snarling wolf (or boar) bursts from the undergrowth, charging straight at you!
limitation: Combat ends when the animal is defeated or driven off, or Darryn flees. Victory leads to Node 442. Defeat leads to Node 443.

title: Observing the Trackers
description: From your hidden vantage point, you watch the three cloaked figures (Unbound?). They seem to be following markings only they can see, speaking in low whispers. One points towards the distant ruins you spotted earlier. They seem purposeful, possibly heading there.

options.name: Continue Shadowing Them Towards Ruins
options.description: Follow them discreetly. [Stealth check?].

options.name: Head to Ruins via Different Route
options.description: Try to get to the ruins ahead of them or from another direction.

options.name: Leave Them Be, Go Elsewhere
options.description: Avoid the Unbound and the ruins. Head back towards coast or deeper inland.

options.name: Attempt Ambush Now
options.description: Try to attack them while they are focused.

title: Wilderness Ambush Attempt
description: You prepare to ambush the three cloaked figures from your hidden position.

options.name: Initiate Combat (Surprise Round?)
options.description: Launch your attack.

options.name: Create Diversion First
options.description: Throw a rock or make noise elsewhere to distract them before attacking.

options.name: Reconsider, Observe Instead
options.description: Maybe attacking three opponents is unwise. Go back to watching them.

title: Trackers Confrontation
description: Spotted! The three cloaked figures turn towards you, hands reaching inside their robes. 'Who's there? Show yourself!' one calls out, voice sharp.

options.name: Reveal Yourself (Attempt Diplomacy/Bluff)
options.description: Step out, try to talk your way out ('Lost traveler', 'Just hunting').

options.name: Attack Immediately
options.description: Don't wait for them to act.

options.name: Attempt to Flee
options.description: Turn and run back the way you came.

title: Wilderness Camp
description: You settle down by the clear stream under the rock overhang. It's a relatively safe and comfortable spot to rest for the night. The sound of the water is soothing.

options.name: Rest Until Morning
options.description: Get a good night's sleep.

options.name: Keep Watch (Despite Safety)
options.description: Remain alert, just in case.

options.name: Explore Around the Camp Briefly
options.description: Check the immediate surroundings before settling down completely. [Perception check].

title: Retreat from Wilderness
description: The wilderness proves too harsh or unyielding. You decide to turn back towards more civilized areas, following your tracks back towards the coast or the mountain road, feeling weary and unsuccessful.

options.name: Return to Coastal Path
options.description: Head back towards Seabrook or other coastal settlements.

options.name: Return to Mountain Road
options.description: Head back towards the main road near Nestlebrook or further into the mountains.

options.name: Rest Briefly Before Continuing
options.description: Find the best spot possible for a short, uneasy rest.

title: Rich Pickings
description: 75 Gold Pieces and a jade frog. An excellent haul! This significantly improves your financial situation.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 75 gold.

items.name: Jade Frog Figurine
items.description: A smooth, well-carved jade frog.

options.name: Leave Tavern Immediately
options.description: Get out before the halfling notices.

options.name: Stay, Try to Act Natural
options.description: Order a drink, try to blend in.

options.name: Examine the Jade Frog More Closely
options.description: Find a quiet corner to study the figurine.

title: Jade Frog Examination
description:
You study the jade frog figurine. It's cool to the touch and expertly carved. [Perform an Intelligence (Arcana) or (History) check (DC 15)].

Success: You recognize the style or feel a faint magical aura. It might be a minor good luck charm or have some connection to nature spirits/fey.

Failure: It just seems like a well-made, likely valuable, non-magical trinket.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 75 gold.

items.name: Jade Frog Figurine
items.description: A smooth, well-carved jade frog. Potentially minor magic?

options.name: Keep It (If Success - Magical?)
options.description: Hold onto the potentially magical item.

options.name: Plan to Sell It (If Failure - Mundane?)
options.description: Look for a fence or collector to sell the valuable trinket.

options.name: Leave Tavern Now
options.description: Decide later. Get out before the halfling notices the theft.

title: Discreet Exit (Halfling Loot)
description: Clutching your loot, you slip out of the Drunken Sailor tavern before the wealthy halfling realizes his loss. You're back on the streets of Nestlebrook with a heavy purse.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 75 gold.

items.name: Jade Frog Figurine
items.description: A smooth, well-carved jade frog.

options.name: Find a Place to Lie Low/Rest
options.description: Secure your winnings and plan your next move.

options.name: Invest in Gear
options.description: Use the money to buy better equipment.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook Immediately
options.description: Get out of town before the halfling raises the alarm.

title: Fighting the Law

enemies.name: Angry Halfling
enemies.description: Surprisingly furious and nimble.

enemies.name: City Guard (x2)
enemies.description: Doing their duty, trying to subdue you.

description: Resisting arrest! You try to fight your way past the angry halfling and the city guards. This is unlikely to end well.
limitation: Combat ends when Darryn is defeated or somehow manages to incapacitate/evade all opponents. Victory (highly unlikely) leads to Node 458. Defeat leads to Node 459.

title: Guard Bribery Attempt
description:
You try to discreetly offer a bribe to the guards while the halfling fumes. 'Let me go, maybe 20 gold helps you look the other way?' [Persuasion/Deception check (DC 15), depends on guard's integrity].

Success: One guard hesitates, glances at his partner, and subtly nods, pocketing the coin (if offered) and letting you slip away during the 'confusion'.

Failure: The guards react angrily. 'Trying to bribe an officer?! That'll add to your charges!'

options.name: Slip Away (If Success)
options.description: The bribe worked. Disappear quickly.

options.name: Face Increased Charges (If Failure)
options.description: Bribery failed. You're definitely going to jail.

title: Overpowered by Guards
description: Fighting multiple trained guards and an angry halfling was foolish. You are quickly subdued, possibly taking a few knocks in the process. You are securely bound.

options.name: Dragged to Jail
options.description: Your fight is over.

title: Approaching a Rival?
description: You subtly approach the cloaked figure watching the halfling. 'Good target,' you murmur, nodding towards the gambler. The figure turns slightly, eyes hidden in shadow. 'Mind your own business, street rat. Or share the score?' Their voice is a low hiss.

options.name: Suggest Cooperation
options.description: 'Maybe we help each other? Create a diversion?'

options.name: Back Off
options.description: 'Just observing.' Retreat and let them be.

options.name: Intimidate/Warn Off
options.description: 'He's mine. Find your own mark.' Try to scare them away.

title: Warning the Mark
description: You discreetly try to warn the halfling gambler. 'Watch your back,' you mutter as you pass, 'cloaked figure in the corner has eyes on your purse.' The halfling glances at you, then at the figure, frowning.

options.name: See Halfling's Reaction
options.description: Does he seem grateful? Suspicious of you? Does he confront the figure?

options.name: See Cloaked Figure's Reaction
options.description: Does the figure notice you warned the halfling?

options.name: Move Away Quickly
options.description: You delivered the warning. Don't get involved in the fallout.

title: Reporting to Elara (Guardian/Reliquary)
description: You seek out Elara and tell her about the Guardian mercenary in town, OR about the guarded 'Reliquary' shipment heading for Valerius at the lighthouse. She listens intently, her brow furrowed.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Ask Her Interpretation
options.description: 'What does this mean? Are they connected?'

options.name: Offer to Investigate Further (For Her)
options.description: 'Should I watch the Guardian? Investigate the Reliquary?'

options.name: Ask About the Tumbler's Connection
options.description: (If you showed her) 'How does the Key Fragment fit into this?'

title: Reporting to Silas (Guardian)
description: You tell Silas that a Guardian of the Lock (armored merc with keyhole sigil) is in town, likely hunting artifacts. Silas pales considerably.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Demand Payment for Information
options.description: 'This info is valuable. What's it worth to you?'

options.name: Ask if He Knows Why Guardian is Here
options.description: 'Did you fence something that would attract them?'

options.name: Offer Alliance Against Guardian?
options.description: Suggest working together to mislead or avoid the Guardian.

title: Reporting to the Guardian (Unbound)
description: You find the Guardian mercenary and report the Unbound activity - either that they took the Tumbler, that you defeated them, or that they are meeting at the lighthouse. He listens impassively, his hand resting on his axe.

options.name: Ask for Reward/Payment
options.description: 'That information should be worth something.'

options.name: Offer to Help Him Further
options.description: 'I can help you deal with them or investigate the lighthouse.'

options.name: Leave After Reporting
options.description: You delivered the information. Let him handle it.

title: Unbound Bluff Success
description: Your lie about selling or hiding the Tumbler worked. The Unbound agents withdrew, though likely still suspicious. You need to be careful.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly. Kept safe via bluff.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook Immediately
options.description: Get out before they realize you lied or find the Tumbler.

options.name: Find a Better Hiding Place for Tumbler
options.description: Secure the artifact more effectively.

options.name: Seek Out the Guardian Mercenary
options.description: Maybe the Guardian can protect you or deal with the Unbound.

title: Leveraging Silas
description: You pressure Silas, using the threat of the Unbound. 'Tell me what you know about this Tumbler, or why they're meeting at the lighthouse. Maybe I can help... for a price.' Silas sweats.

options.name: Demand Information
options.description: Press him for lore about the Tumbler, Loc, Unbound, Valerius.

options.name: Demand Gold for Protection/Silence
options.description: Extort money from him in exchange for not telling the Unbound he warned you (or for 'protecting' him).

options.name: He Panics and Refuses to Talk
options.description: Silas becomes too scared or stubborn to cooperate.

title: Silas Warned
description: You leave Silas to his worry. You warned him about the Unbound and the lighthouse meeting; what he does with that information is his problem.

options.name: Head to the Lighthouse
options.description: Investigate the Unbound meeting yourself.

options.name: Look for Other Leads
options.description: Explore other rumors or opportunities in Nestlebrook.

options.name: Leave Town
options.description: Let Silas and the cultists deal with each other.

title: Reporting Back (Guardian)
description: You tell the Guardian mercenary that the cloaked figures left via the back. He grunts. 'Predictable. Doesn't matter.' He seems unconcerned, his focus remaining on the main door.

items.name: Gold Piece
items.description: A single gold coin.

options.name: Ask Why He Doesn't Care
options.description: 'Aren't you trying to stop them?'

options.name: Return to Observing the Room
options.description: Go back to looking for other targets or information.

options.name: Leave the Tavern
options.description: Nothing more to learn here.

title: Warning Received
description: The cloaked figures react to your warning about the Guardian. They exchange tense whispers, perhaps change their departure plans, or subtly ready weapons. They seem to take the threat seriously.

options.name: Offer Further Help (Risky)
options.description: 'I can create a diversion for your escape.'

options.name: Watch Them Leave/Act
options.description: See what they do now.

options.name: Discreetly Withdraw
options.description: You warned them. Move away before the Guardian notices you.

title: Guardian's Ire
description: The Guardian mercenary saw you interact with the cloaked figures. He strides over, his face grim. 'Whispering secrets to the enemy, half-elf? Explain yourself. Quickly.' His hand rests pointedly on his axe pommel.

options.name: Lie (Claim Misunderstanding)
options.description: 'No, I was just asking directions/warning *them* about *you*?' [Deception check DC 14].

options.name: Confess (Claim You Were Gathering Info)
options.description: 'Trying to learn their plans for you. They mentioned the Lighthouse.'

options.name: Stay Silent / Defiant
options.description: Refuse to explain or challenge him.

options.name: Attempt to Flee
options.description: Try to bolt past him.

title: Unbound Suspicion
description: The cloaked figures (Unbound) corner you, their eyes glinting suspiciously. 'Why interfere, outsider? Whose side are you on? Are you working for the Keeper?' They seem ready for violence.

options.name: Claim Neutrality/Ignorance
options.description: 'Just saw trouble, tried to help. Don't know anything about Keepers.' [Deception check DC 13].

options.name: Offer Allegiance/Information
options.description: 'The Keeper *is* here. I can help you avoid him... or deal with him.'

options.name: Fight
options.description: Prepare for combat.

options.name: Attempt to Flee
options.description: Try to push past them and run.

title: Trading Information (Guardian)
description: You offer the Guardian information about the Unbound's plans (e.g., meeting at the lighthouse) in exchange for answers about the Tumbler. He considers this. 'The artifact is a Key Fragment, part of a mechanism binding an entity called Loc. The Unbound seek to release Him, the Keepers prevent it. Knowing their meeting place is useful.' [He might offer a small reward (10 GP) or simply accept the info].

options.name: Accept Reward/Acknowledgement
options.description: Take any offered coin or simply nod.

options.name: Offer to Help Him at the Lighthouse
options.description: Volunteer to assist him against the Unbound.

options.name: Press for More Details About Loc/Keepers
options.description: Ask for more specifics about the entity or the factions.

title: Guardian as Obstacle
description: The Guardian's secrecy and focus on 'containment' make him seem like an obstacle, especially if you're curious about the Tumbler's power or sympathetic to the idea of 'unbinding'. You decide he's likely an enemy to your goals (whatever they may be).

options.name: Avoid Him Carefully
options.description: Keep your distance and work around him.

options.name: Warn the Unbound About Him
options.description: Actively aid the Unbound by warning them.

options.name: Plan to Deal With Him Later?
options.description: Consider ways to incapacitate or mislead him.

title: Meager Coppers
description: You leave the Drunken Sailor with only 5 copper pieces, earned through a lie. It's barely enough for a piece of bread.

items.name: Copper Pieces
items.description: A handful of 5 copper pieces.

options.name: Buy Stale Bread
options.description: Spend the coppers on minimal sustenance.

options.name: Look for Another Tavern/Opportunity
options.description: Try your luck elsewhere in Nestlebrook.

options.name: Try Begging?
options.description: Resort to asking for charity.

title: Answering the Call
description: You mention the notice seeking 'discreet assistance'. The gaunt servant nods slowly. 'Ah, yes. The Master awaits. Please enter.' He opens the door wider, revealing a dimly lit, circular stone chamber. The air smells of salt, ozone, and old paper.

options.name: Enter the Lighthouse
options.description: Step inside.

options.name: Ask About the Job First
options.description: 'Before I enter, what exactly does the 'assistance' entail?'

options.name: Hesitate, Look Around Outside Again
options.description: Feeling uneasy. Take one last look for escape routes or other details.

title: Asking for the Master
description: You ask for Master Valerius. The servant's blank eyes seem to look through you. 'Master Valerius sees few visitors. State your purpose.' He doesn't open the door further.

options.name: Mention the Notice for 'Discreet Assistance'
options.description: Explain you're here for the job.

options.name: Claim You Have Information for Him
options.description: Bluff that you have news about artifacts or recent events. [Deception check?]

options.name: Say Elara Sent You (If True)
options.description: Mention the other scholar.

options.name: Give Up, Leave
options.description: He's stonewalling. Find another way.

title: Forcing Entry (Lighthouse)
description: You try to shove past the gaunt servant into the lighthouse. He's surprisingly strong, or perhaps bolstered by something unseen. [Strength check (DC 14) or Combat].

options.name: Overpower the Servant (If Success)
options.description: You force your way inside.

options.name: Fight the Servant
options.description: Engage the surprisingly resilient servant.

options.name: Retreat (If Failure)
options.description: He repels you. Back away.

title: Picking the Lighthouse Lock
description:
You set to work on the complex lock on the lighthouse door with your Thieves' Tools. [Dexterity (Thieves' Tools) check (DC 17)].

Success: Click! The heavy lock mechanism yields. The door is unlocked.

Failure: The lock resists your efforts, or worse, a hidden needle jabs your finger! [Take 1 piercing damage, possible poison effect?].

options.name: Enter Stealthily (If Success)
options.description: Open the door quietly and slip inside.

options.name: Deal with Trap/Injury (If Failure)
options.description: Tend to your wound, possibly needing an antidote.

options.name: Give Up, Knock or Scout (If Failure)
options.description: Lockpicking failed. Try knocking or looking for another way.

title: The Rusted Grate
description: The metal grate is heavily rusted and set firmly into the stone foundation. It looks like it hasn't been opened in years. Opening it will require force or leverage.

options.name: Attempt to Force Grate (Strength)
options.description: Try to pry it open with brute strength or a tool (like a crowbar). [Strength check DC 16].

options.name: Look for a Hidden Latch/Mechanism
options.description: Examine the grate and surrounding stones closely. [Investigation check DC 15].

options.name: Leave Grate, Try Main Door/Climbing
options.description: This seems too difficult. Try another approach.

title: Lighthouse Climb Assessment
description: You scan the lighthouse walls. The stone is weathered but offers some potential handholds, especially near the base. Climbing to the first barred window looks difficult but perhaps possible. [Perception check DC 14 reveals a slightly loose bar on one window].

options.name: Attempt the Climb
options.description: Start scaling the lighthouse wall. [Athletics check DC 15].

options.name: Focus on the Loose Bar (If Seen)
options.description: Climb specifically towards the window with the loose bar.

options.name: Too Dangerous, Try Grate/Door
options.description: The climb looks too risky. Try the grate or main door.

title: Is Valerius a Wizard?
description: The barkeep shrugs. 'Wizard? Scholar? Madman? Hard to say. Deals in strange books, weird instruments... smells like ozone sometimes drift from the cliffs. Magic? Probably. The dangerous kind? Definitely.'

options.name: Head to the Lighthouse (Prepared for Magic?)
options.description: Go investigate, expecting arcane weirdness.

options.name: Seek Elara's Opinion on Valerius
options.description: Maybe the other scholar knows Valerius.

options.name: Decide Against It (Too Magical/Dangerous)
options.description: Avoid the potentially powerful mage.

title: Leaving the Market
description: You leave the bustle of the market square behind. Where to next in Nestlebrook?

options.name: Head Towards the Docks
options.description: Look for ships, work, or other opportunities.

options.name: Find an Inn/Tavern
options.description: Look for rest, food, or information.

options.name: Seek Shelter (Cheap/Free)
options.description: Look for a place to lie low (stables, abandoned shack, etc.).

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: Decide to move on from the town.

title: Nestlebrook Next Steps
description: Having gathered some information or dealt with immediate threats, you consider your next move within Nestlebrook.

options.name: Investigate the Lighthouse
options.description: Rumors consistently point there.

options.name: Seek Out Elara
options.description: The scholar might have answers.

options.name: Visit Silas the Fence
options.description: Try to sell items or get information.

options.name: Look for Work/Theft
options.description: Focus on acquiring coin.

title: Shoals Survivors?
description: The fisherman shakes his head grimly. 'Survived? Nah. Once the Shoals got yer scent, they don't let go. Ships vanish, crews vanish. Maybe washed ashore miles away, pieces missing... maybe just gone.'

options.name: Mark Shoals as Dangerous Area
options.description: Avoid that location if possible.

options.name: Ask About Wreckage/Cargo
options.description: 'Any valuable cargo wash ashore?'

options.name: Thank Him, Move On
options.description: End the conversation.

title: Counter-Surveillance
description:
You spend some time being deliberately unpredictable, doubling back, watching reflections, lingering near corners. [Perception check DC 14].

Success: You spot him - a nondescript man in plain clothes, trying too hard to look casual, keeping distance but always seeming to reappear. Definitely a tail.

Failure: You don't spot anyone specific, but the feeling of being watched persists. Maybe they're very good, or maybe you're paranoid.

options.name: Confront the Tail (If Success)
options.description: Turn the tables, approach the man directly.

options.name: Attempt to Lose the Tail (If Success)
options.description: Knowing you're followed, use alleys and crowds to actively shake him.

options.name: Act Normally (If Failure/Paranoid)
options.description: Proceed with caution, but assume you might be imagining it.

options.name: Leave Town (Assume Watched)
options.description: Whether real or paranoia, get out.

title: Inside the Apothecary
description: You slip through the unlatched window into the apothecary shop. It smells strongly of dried herbs and chemicals. Moonlight illuminates shelves lined with jars, bottles, and pouches. A curtained doorway likely leads to the front shop or living quarters.

options.name: Search for Valuables (Potions, Ingredients)
options.description: Quickly scan the shelves for expensive or useful items. [Perception/Investigation check].

options.name: Check the Till/Counter First
options.description: Look for easily accessible coin in the main shop area beyond the curtain.

options.name: Listen for Occupants
options.description: Pause and listen carefully for anyone sleeping or moving nearby.

title: Listening Quietly
description: You press your ear to the window/curtain, listening intently. You hear... faint snoring from upstairs OR the shuffling sounds of someone moving about nearby OR complete silence.

options.name: Proceed Quietly (If Snoring/Silence)
options.description: Seems safe enough to proceed with the burglary.

options.name: Wait for Movement to Subside (If Shuffling)
options.description: Stay hidden and wait for the person to settle down.

options.name: Abort Burglary (If Shuffling/Nervous)
options.description: Too risky with someone awake.

title: Heist Aborted
description: You decide against the burglary. Too risky, too difficult, or perhaps a pang of conscience. You melt back into the shadows of Nestlebrook, needing another plan.

options.name: Look for an Easier Target
options.description: Case other buildings or look for pickpocketing opportunities.

options.name: Seek Legitimate Work
options.description: Maybe honesty is the best policy tonight.

options.name: Find a Place to Rest
options.description: Give up for the night and find shelter.

title: Forcing the Jeweler's Grille
description:
You attempt to pry or smash the heavy grille. [Strength check DC 17, requires tools like crowbar, causes loud noise - definite Stealth failure].

Success: With a loud screech/bang, the grille gives way! But the noise certainly alerted someone.

Failure: The grille holds firm. You only succeed in making noise.

options.name: Dash Inside Quickly (If Success)
options.description: Get in, grab what you can, and get out before guards arrive.

options.name: Flee Immediately (If Success or Failure)
options.description: The noise is too much. Run before guards arrive.

title: Picking the Jeweler's Lock
description:
The lock on the jeweler's grille is intricate. You apply your Thieves' Tools carefully. [Dexterity (Thieves' Tools) check DC 18].

Success: A satisfying click! The grille lock opens silently.

Failure: The complex tumblers refuse to yield, or you break a pick in the lock.

options.name: Enter Stealthily (If Success)
options.description: Open the grille quietly and slip inside the jeweler's shop.

options.name: Abort Attempt (If Failure)
options.description: The lock is too good. Give up.

title: Picking the Antiquities Lock
description:
The lock on the 'Curios & Relics' shop door seems average. [Dexterity (Thieves' Tools) check DC 14].

Success: Click. The lock opens easily.

Failure: The lock holds, or you make too much noise fumbling with it.

options.name: Enter Stealthily (If Success)
options.description: Open the door quietly and step inside.

options.name: Try Back Entrance (If Failure)
options.description: Maybe there's another way in.

options.name: Abort Attempt
options.description: Give up on this shop.

title: Antiquities Back Entrance
description: You check the back of the antiquities shop. There's a small, grimy window slightly ajar OR a sturdy back door with a simple lock.

options.name: Try the Ajar Window
options.description: Attempt to slip through the window. [Dexterity (Stealth) check?].

options.name: Pick the Back Door Lock
options.description: Use Thieves' Tools on the simpler lock. [DC 13?].

options.name: Give Up
options.description: No easy way in.

title: Seeking Passage (Docks)
description: You approach captains or first mates on the docks, looking for passage out of Nestlebrook. Some ships are heading coastally, others further afield. You could offer coin or offer to work your passage.

options.name: Pay for Passage (If Coin)
options.description: Negotiate a price for passage on a departing ship.

options.name: Offer to Work Passage
options.description: Try to convince a captain you're worth taking on as temporary crew.

options.name: Attempt to Stow Away
options.description: If refused or too expensive, try sneaking aboard.

title: Street Confrontation (Alley Escape Fail)
description: Your escape from the alley fails. Either the thugs catch up, or a guard confronts you about the disturbance.

options.name: Fight the Thugs
options.description: Face the alley thugs who pursued you.

options.name: Talk to the Guard
options.description: Try to explain the situation to the guard.

options.name: Attempt to Flee Again
options.description: Try to run from the thugs/guard.

title: Reporting Alley Thugs
description: You tell the guards about the thugs who accosted you in the alley. They sigh wearily. 'Another one... alright, describe 'em. We'll take a look.' They seem unlikely to catch anyone.

options.name: Provide Description
options.description: Give the guards the details.

options.name: Offer to Lead Them (Risky)
options.description: Offer to show them exactly where it happened.

options.name: Thank Them and Leave
options.description: Let them handle it (or not).

title: Guard Questioning (Alley)
description: The guard eyes you up and down. 'Alright, so thugs jumped you. What were *you* doing cutting through Black Retch Alley in the first place? Not exactly the scenic route.'

options.name: Lie (Shortcut/Lost)
options.description: 'Just looking for a shortcut to the docks,' or 'Got turned around.' [Deception check DC 12].

options.name: Tell Partial Truth (Avoiding Trouble)
options.description: 'Trying to avoid someone from the tavern.'

options.name: Become Defensive/Suspicious
options.description: 'Does it matter? I was attacked!'

title: Hiding and Waiting (Alley Flee)
description:
You wait in your new hiding spot (another alley, inside a shop). [Stealth check DC 12 vs Pursuers' Perception].

Success: You hear/see the alley thugs run past or give up the search.

Failure: They spot your hiding place or barge into the shop after you!

options.name: Emerge When Clear (If Success)
options.description: Coast is clear. Proceed.

options.name: Confront Pursuers
options.description: They found you. Fight or talk?

title: Navigating Back Ways
description: You weave through a network of narrow alleys, refuse heaps, and backyards, putting distance between yourself and the main street (and hopefully your pursuers). Where do you try to emerge?

options.name: Near the Docks
options.description: Aim for the waterfront.

options.name: Near the Town Outskirts
options.description: Try to get closer to leaving Nestlebrook.

options.name: Near a Different Tavern/Inn
options.description: Look for another potential source of information or shelter.

options.name: Get Lost
options.description: Focus solely on evasion, worry about location later. [Might end up somewhere unexpected].

title: Morning Departure (Shelter)
description: You slip out of your temporary shelter (stable/shack) as dawn breaks over Nestlebrook. You managed some rest, undetected.

options.name: Seek Food/Drink
options.description: Find a tavern or market stall.

options.name: Look for Work
options.description: Check the notice board or ask around.

options.name: Look for Thievery Opportunities
options.description: Scan the waking town for marks.

title: Offering Stable Work
description: The stablehand returns. Seeing you awake in the hay, he frowns. Before he can yell, you quickly offer to help muck out stalls or groom horses in exchange for breakfast or a few coppers.

options.name: He Accepts (Reluctantly)
options.description: He agrees. Prepare for some smelly work. [Leads to minor reward].

options.name: He Refuses
options.description: 'Nah, owner wouldn't like it. Just get out.'

options.name: He Demands Payment for Lodging
options.description: 'Slept here, you owe coin!'

title: Stable Scrounging
description:
Before leaving the stable, you quickly look around. [Perception check DC 13].

Success: Tucked under some hay, you find a discarded coil of rope OR a few loose copper pieces (1d6 CP).

Failure: You find nothing but hay, horse dung, and worn tools.

options.name: Take Findings (If Success)
options.description: Pocket the rope/coppers.

options.name: Leave Empty-Handed (If Failure)
options.description: Nothing useful.

title: Threatening the Stablehand
description: The stablehand is barring your way, pitchfork raised. You could try to intimidate him or resort to violence.

options.name: Attempt Intimidation
options.description: 'Lower the fork before you get hurt.' [Intimidation check DC 13].

options.name: Attack the Stablehand
options.description: Engage him in combat.

options.name: Back Down, Try to Leave
options.description: Decide against confrontation.

title: Sharing Water (Shack)
description: You offer Finn water from your waterskin. He drinks greedily, coughing less afterwards. 'Bless you,' he whispers hoarsely. 'Owe you one. Name's Finn... used to work for... Valerius... at the lighthouse... saw things...'

options.name: Ask About Valerius/Lighthouse
options.description: Press him for details about his former employer and the 'things' he saw.

options.name: Ask How He Got Sick
options.description: 'What are the Shakes?'

options.name: Let Him Rest
options.description: He seems weak. Don't push him further now.

title: Fetching Water (Shack)
description: You promise Finn you'll find water. Searching nearby, you locate a rainwater barrel behind a neighboring building OR a public well near the market square.

options.name: Collect Water from Barrel
options.description: Fill his waterskin (or yours) with potentially stagnant rainwater.

options.name: Go to the Public Well
options.description: Requires venturing further back into town.

options.name: Forget About Finn
options.description: Decide it's too much trouble. Find your own corner.

title: Morning Check (Finn)
description: You check on Finn in the morning light. He looks feverish and weaker than before. He barely seems conscious.

options.name: Try to Help Further (Medicine? Food?)
options.description: Attempt to provide more aid if possible.

options.name: Leave Him Be
options.description: Nothing more you can do. Leave the shack.

options.name: Search His Belongings (Pitiful)
options.description: Check his pockets or bundle for anything useful while he's incapacitated.

title: Finn Gone
description: Finn is gone from the corner where he huddled. Did he recover and leave? Or wander off in delirium? You search the spot where he lay.

options.name: Find a Small Clue
options.description: Perhaps he dropped a small token, a note fragment, or left tracks. [Perception check DC 13].

options.name: Find Nothing
options.description: The spot is empty.

title: Seeking Relief (Fatigued)
description: Feeling cold, tired, and possibly hungry, you focus on finding immediate relief.

options.name: Find a Tavern (If Coin)
options.description: Seek out the warmth, food, and drink of a tavern.

options.name: Look for Market Food Stall
options.description: Try to buy cheap, hot food.

options.name: Seek Work for Food/Warmth
options.description: Offer labor specifically for immediate sustenance or shelter.

title: Prioritizing Rest
description: Exhaustion weighs heavily. You decide your top priority is finding a safe, comfortable place to sleep properly, even if it costs coin or requires finding better free shelter.

options.name: Seek an Inn (If Coin)
options.description: Find the cheapest inn and pay for a room.

options.name: Try Stable/Shack Again
options.description: Revisit the free shelter options, hoping for better luck.

options.name: Acquire Coin First (Theft/Work)
options.description: Need money for an inn. Look for a quick score or job.

title: Sewage Tunnel Escape
description:
You struggle with the heavy, rusted sewage grate. [Strength check DC 15].

Success: With a groan, the grate gives way! You slip into the stinking darkness below just as your pursuers arrive above.

Failure: The grate won't budge. You hear your pursuers closing in behind you.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Navigate the Sewers (If Success)
options.description: Explore the dark, foul-smelling tunnels. [Leads to new sewer section].

options.name: Face Pursuers (If Failure)
options.description: Trapped. Turn and fight.

title: Alley Back Door
description:
You try the back door of the adjacent building. It's locked / unlocked. .

If Unlocked: You slip inside, finding yourself in the storage room of a shop/tavern.

If Locked: Attempt to pick lock? [DC 14 Thieves' Tools check].

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Explore Storage Room (If Unlocked/Picked)
options.description: Look for loot or another exit.

options.name: Fail Lockpick, Face Pursuers (If Locked/Failed)
options.description: Can't get the door open. Turn and fight.

options.name: Give Up on Door (If Locked)
options.description: Try the sewage grate or face pursuers.

title: Listening for Pursuit
description:
You pause, straining your ears. [Perception check DC 13].

Success: You hear faint shouts fading back towards the main street. You seem to have lost them.

Failure: You hear heavy footsteps approaching from the alley exit! They're still coming!

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Proceed Cautiously (If Success)
options.description: You escaped the immediate chase.

options.name: Keep Running/Find Cover (If Failure)
options.description: They're still after you! Don't stop!

title: Rooftop Escape
description: You find yourself on a rooftop or in a different alley network after successfully climbing the wall. The sounds of pursuit are gone. You have a moment to catch your breath.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Navigate Rooftops/Alleys
options.description: Carefully make your way across roofs or through alleys to safety.

options.name: Find Hiding Spot to Rest/Observe
options.description: Find cover and wait a while.

options.name: Descend to Street Level Cautiously
options.description: Find a safe way back down.

title: Hidden Voyage
description: Hidden among cargo, you wait anxiously. Hours pass. Finally, you feel the rumble of the ship's departure and the gentle sway of the sea. You've escaped Nestlebrook, but where are you heading, and can you remain undiscovered?

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Remain Hidden
options.description: Stay concealed as long as possible.

options.name: Explore the Cargo Hold (Stealthily)
options.description: Look for food, water, or useful items while staying hidden.

options.name: Attempt to Emerge and Blend In?
options.description: Try to appear like regular crew (very risky).

title: Stowaway Diplomacy
description: Caught sneaking aboard, you try to reason with the crew member. 'Just need passage, willing to work hard!' or 'Maybe a few gold pieces could help you forget you saw me?' [Persuasion/Deception check DC 14].

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Success! Allowed to Stay (Working/Hidden)
options.description: They agree (maybe reluctantly) to let you stay, likely putting you to hard labor or telling you to stay hidden.

options.name: Failure! Thrown Off Ship
options.description: They refuse and toss you back onto the pier.

title: Resisting Ejection
description: The crew member tries to grab you to throw you off the ship.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Fight the Crew Member
options.description: Try to overpower them. [Combat].

options.name: Jump Overboard
options.description: Dive into the harbor water to escape.

options.name: Try to Run Deeper into Ship
options.description: Attempt to evade them within the ship's confines.

title: Dock Fall Aftermath
description: You hit the dock hard after falling from the rigging/crates. [Take 1d4 bludgeoning damage? Possible CON save vs stun/prone?]. Your pursuers might have seen you fall.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Scramble Up and Keep Running
options.description: Ignore the pain and try to flee.

options.name: Face Pursuers (Injured)
options.description: They catch up while you're down. Fight.

options.name: Try to Hide Under Pier/Nearby
options.description: Crawl quickly into the nearest cover.

title: Ferry Leap
description:
You take a running leap towards the deck of the nearby ferry. [Acrobatics check DC 13].

Success: You land relatively smoothly on the ferry deck among startled passengers just as it begins to pull away!

Failure: You mistime the jump, slamming into the side of the ferry or missing entirely and plunging into the water.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Escape on Ferry (If Success)
options.description: You're leaving the pier (and your pursuers) behind.

options.name: Splashdown (If Failure)
options.description: You fall into the cold harbor water.

title: Harbor Swim
description: The cold water of Nestlebrook harbor shocks you. It's murky and smells of fish and refuse. You need to swim for shore or another pier quickly. [Athletics (Swim) check DC 12].

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Swim to Nearby Pier/Shore (If Success)
options.description: You make it out of the water, cold and dripping, hopefully unseen.

options.name: Struggle in Water (If Failure)
options.description: The cold saps your strength, or currents pull you. Risk drowning or being spotted. [CON save?]

options.name: Try to Hide Under Pier
options.description: Cling to the pilings in the shadows.

title: Silent Prisoner
description: You remain silent as the guards march you towards the jail. They search you thoroughly, confiscating anything of value or potential use. The merchant/halfling provides their angry testimony.

options.name: Thrown into a Cell
options.description: You are locked up in a small, damp cell.

options.name: Interrogation Attempt
options.description: The guard captain tries to question you before locking you up.

title: Jailhouse Bribery
description: On the way to, or inside, the jailhouse, you try to bribe the guards holding you. 'Let me go... worth 50 gold?' [Persuasion check DC 16 - harder now].

options.name: Bribe Succeeds (Miraculously)
options.description: A corrupt guard pockets the coin and arranges for you to 'slip away' during processing.

options.name: Bribe Fails
options.description: They laugh or get angry. 'Not happening, thief.' You're definitely getting locked up.

title: Prisoner's Protest
description: You loudly protest your innocence, claiming mistaken identity or framing. This attracts attention from passersby but doesn't sway the guards or the accuser.

options.name: Thrown into a Cell
options.description: Your protests are ignored. You are locked up.

options.name: Attract Unwanted Attention?
options.description: Perhaps someone else (Unbound? Keeper? Elara's associate?) notices your arrest and the mention of the Tumbler.

title: Following the Merchant (Post-Drop)
description: You discreetly follow the merchant (Borin) after his meeting with the Unbound agent. He clutches the Tumbler and heads... towards Silas's pawn shop OR directly towards the path leading to the Lighthouse.

options.name: Follow to Silas's Shop
options.description: See if he tries to sell/fence the Tumbler.

options.name: Follow Towards Lighthouse
options.description: He intends to deliver it to Valerius himself.

options.name: Ambush the Merchant
options.description: Try to jump him in a quiet spot and take the Tumbler back.

title: Standoff Demand
description: You demand the Tumbler from the merchant and the Unbound agent. They both look at you, then at each other, assessing the situation. The merchant looks nervous, the Unbound looks dangerous.

options.name: Merchant Relents?
options.description: Maybe the scared merchant throws it to you to avoid trouble? [Low chance].

options.name: Unbound Attacks You
options.description: The cultist sees you as interference.

options.name: They Both Attack You?
options.description: Unlikely alliance against the interloper.

options.name: Try Intimidation
options.description: Attempt to scare them into handing it over.

title: Standoff Negotiation
description: You try to negotiate in the tense standoff. 'I know what that is,' you might say to the Unbound, 'I can help you get it past the Keeper.' Or to the merchant, 'They'll betray you. Let me handle it for a cut.'

options.name: Side with Unbound
options.description: Offer to help the cultist secure the Tumbler from the merchant.

options.name: Side with Merchant
options.description: Offer to help the merchant escape or deal with the Unbound.

options.name: Negotiation Fails, Combat Ensues
options.description: Neither side trusts you, or they decide to fight over it.

title: Leveraging Silas (Borin Feud)
description: You approach Silas, hinting you know about his shady dealings with the merchant Borin. 'Heard you two have... disagreements. Maybe information is worth more than coin sometimes?' Silas looks uncomfortable.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Trade Info for Info
options.description: Offer dirt on Borin in exchange for info on the Tumbler.

options.name: Try to Extort Silas
options.description: Demand coin or the Tumbler (if he has it) for your silence about Borin.

options.name: Silas Calls Your Bluff/Refuses
options.description: He denies everything or tells you to get lost.

title: Approaching Borin (Merchant)
description: You find the merchant Borin later, perhaps at the docks overseeing cargo. You subtly mention Silas the fence. 'Seems like Silas drives a hard bargain... maybe sometimes too hard? Perhaps information about his other dealings could be... useful?' Borin looks intrigued.

options.name: Offer Information on Silas (For Coin)
options.description: Sell what you know (or pretend to know) about Silas's dealings.

options.name: Ask About the Tumbler (If He Had It)
options.description: 'That strange device you had... Silas interested in those?'

options.name: Borin is Suspicious/Dismissive
options.description: He doesn't trust you or isn't interested.

title: What the Light Holds Back
description: The old sailor lowers his voice further, eyes wide. 'Somethin' old. Somethin' vast. Name of Loc, some say. Locked away by the lighthouse, or maybe *in* it. They say the light... it keeps 'im sleepin'. Dim the light, wake the tide... wake *him*.' He shudders.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Connect Loc to Tumbler/Factions
options.description: This confirms Elara/Guardian's words. Loc is the entity.

options.name: Ask How to Dim the Light (Carefully)
options.description: Feigning academic curiosity, ask about the lighthouse mechanism.

options.name: Dismiss as Drunken Fearmongering
options.description: Too fantastical. Thank him and leave.

title: Double Loot Check
description: You find a safe hiding spot and check the merchant's coin purse. Inside: 25 Gold Pieces. Added to the Tumbler, it's a decent haul for a risky move.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 25 gold.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook with Loot
options.description: Get out of town before the merchant raises the alarm.

options.name: Find Somewhere to Spend/Invest Coin
options.description: Buy supplies, gear, or information.

options.name: Examine the Tumbler
options.description: Now that you're safe, study the main prize.

title: Looting the Brawl
description: The brawl between the merchant and the dwarf ends with one of them (likely the merchant) knocked unconscious. While others are distracted by the aftermath, you could quickly check their pockets.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Loot the Merchant (Quickly)
options.description: Check the unconscious merchant's pockets. [Sleight of Hand DC 13].

options.name: Loot the Dwarf (Quickly, If He Lost)
options.description: Check the unconscious dwarf's pockets. [Sleight of Hand DC 14].

options.name: Slip Away During Commotion
options.description: Use the chance to escape the tavern.

title: Spending Coppers
description: Your 5 copper pieces buy you a small cup of watery ale or a stale piece of bread at the Drunken Sailor. It does little to satisfy hunger or thirst.

options.name: Look for More Work
options.description: Need a real job.

options.name: Scan Room for Theft Target
options.description: Need real coin.

options.name: Leave the Tavern
options.description: Seek opportunities elsewhere.

title: Seeking Healing
description: You need healing for your injuries (and possibly disease). You could seek out a temple acolyte (if Nestlebrook has one) or perhaps Elara the scholar knows some remedies.

options.name: Look for a Temple/Acolyte
options.description: Requires finding one and likely paying for healing.

options.name: Seek Out Elara
options.description: Ask the scholar for medicinal help.

options.name: Rest and Hope for the Best
options.description: Find shelter and try to recover naturally.

title: Appeasing the Barkeep
description: You try to apologize to the furious barkeep for lying about the rats. 'Alright, alright, they were too much for me! Sorry.' [Persuasion check DC 13].

options.name: He Calms Down (Slightly)
options.description: He grumbles but lets you stay. 'Fine. Now buy something or get out.'

options.name: He Doesn't Care, Still Angry
options.description: 'Get out! Still lied to me!'

title: Tavern Ejection (Escalation)
description: Shoving back at the barkeep is a bad idea. He's large and likely has a club under the counter. He easily overpowers you and physically throws you out into the street.

options.name: Pick Yourself Up
options.description: Dust yourself off and decide what to do next.

title: Moderate Gain (Market)
description: 35 Gold Pieces. A solid amount, enough for decent supplies or a comfortable few days.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 35 gold.

options.name: Buy Basic Gear
options.description: Purchase armor, weapon, or tools.

options.name: Find Lodging and Food
options.description: Get a room at an inn.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: Move on with your earnings.

title: Thorough Alley Looting
description: Taking more time to search the defeated thugs and the alley reveals: 10 GP hidden in a boot, and a crumpled note mentioning a meeting at 'The Salty Dog' tavern in Seabrook. Being thorough for an extra 20 min you find nothing else of value.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 12 (+1d6?) gold.

items.name: Rusty Cutlass
items.description: A pitted, curved blade.

options.name: Note the Seabrook Meeting (If Found)
options.description: A potential lead in the next town.

options.name: Proceed to Docks
options.description: Continue your original plan.

title: Retreating After Alley Fight
description: Deciding the alley is trouble, you head back towards the main street where you entered, leaving the defeated thugs behind.

options.name: Head Towards Market Square
options.description: Rejoin the town center.

options.name: Find a Tavern
options.description: Seek rest or information.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook via Main Road
options.description: Head out of town.

title: Crawling for Help
description: Bruised and robbed, you manage to drag yourself out of the alley onto a side street. You look pathetic. Will anyone help?

options.name: Encounter a Guard Patrol
options.description: A guard finds you. Report the mugging?

options.name: Encounter a Kind Stranger?
options.description: A passing citizen takes pity? [Low chance].

options.name: Ignored by Passersby
options.description: People avoid eye contact and hurry past.

title: Risky Alley Rest
description: You curl up in the filthiest part of the alley, hoping no one finds you while you try to recover some strength. Time passes slowly, painfully. [Make CON save vs disease? Recover 1 HP?]

options.name: Feel Slightly Better, Try to Move
options.description: Attempt to get up and leave the alley.

options.name: Attract More Trouble
options.description: Someone else finds you (rats, another thug, guards).

title: Staggering Escape (Injured)
description: Despite your injuries, you force yourself to move, staggering towards the docks with the desperate hope of escaping Nestlebrook.

options.name: Attempt to Stow Away (Injured)
options.description: Find a ship and try to sneak aboard, hindered by pain. [Stealth check w/ Disadvantage?].

options.name: Collapse on the Docks
options.description: Your injuries overwhelm you. You fall unconscious near the piers.

options.name: Beg for Passage/Help
options.description: Appeal to sailors for help or passage.

title: Taking the Hook
description: You decide to take the burly dockhand's cargo hook. It's heavy and crude, but potentially effective.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device. Retrieved after combat.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 15 gold.

items.name: Cargo Hook
items.description: A large, sharp hook used for moving crates.

options.name: Leave the Alley Quickly
options.description: Get out before guards arrive.

options.name: Examine the Tumbler Here
options.description: Take a moment to study it now that the fight is over.

title: Struggling Against Bonds
description:
The merchant/dockhand tied you up poorly (or you have tools hidden). You work at the ropes. [Dexterity check or Sleight of Hand with Thieves' Tools, DC 14].

Success: You free yourself just as you hear guards approaching!

Failure: The knots hold firm. The guards arrive and find you bound.

options.name: Attempt Escape (If Success)
options.description: Quickly try to flee the alley before the guards grab you.

options.name: Captured by Guards (If Failure)
options.description: The guards apprehend you.

title: Looting the Dwarf
description:
You quickly check the unconscious dwarf's pockets. [Sleight of Hand DC 14?].

Success: You find a hefty pouch containing 40 GP and a smooth stone with a dwarven rune.

Failure: You find only lint, or the barkeep/patrons shout at you to stop.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Flee with Loot (If Success)
options.description: Take the gold and rune stone, then escape the tavern.

collectedItems.name: Dwarven Rune Stone
collectedItems.description: A smooth stone etched with a dwarven rune (Protection? Luck?).

options.name: Flee Empty-Handed (If Failure)
options.description: Didn't get anything, or got caught trying. Escape now.

title: Facing the Barkeep (Post-Brawl)
description: You try to talk to the furious barkeep after knocking out his patron. 'Sorry about the mess... dwarf started it?' [Persuasion check DC 15].

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Offer to Pay Damages (If Coin)
options.description: Try to buy his forgiveness.

options.name: He Doesn't Care, Calls Guards
options.description: He wants you out or arrested.

options.name: Intimidate Him?
options.description: Try to scare him into letting you go.

title: Finding New Haunts
description: Bruised and ejected from the Drunken Sailor, you look for another establishment in Nestlebrook. Perhaps a quieter inn or a different shady tavern?

options.name: Try 'The Salty Siren' (Quieter Inn)
options.description: Look for a calmer atmosphere, maybe less scrutiny.

options.name: Try 'The Leaky Barrel' (Shadier Tavern)
options.description: Another dive, potentially more dangerous.

options.name: Give Up on Taverns, Seek Shelter
options.description: Look for a place to rest instead.

title: Unbound Captive
description: Bound and gagged, you are dragged by the Unbound cultists. They speak in hushed tones about taking you to 'the Master' at the Tidecaller Lighthouse. They seem eager to present both you and the recovered Tumbler.

options.name: Struggle Against Bonds
options.description: Try to loosen your bindings while they march. [Dex check DC 15?].

options.name: Try to Observe Surroundings
options.description: Look for landmarks or opportunities for escape later. [Perception check].

options.name: Remain Quiet and Wait
options.description: Conserve energy, wait for a better chance.

title: Intended Sacrifice
description: The Unbound cultists drag you along, discussing the upcoming ritual. 'The alignment nears... Loc requires blood to awaken fully... this one will serve...' Your fear intensifies.

options.name: Plead for Your Life
options.description: Beg them to reconsider, offer service.

options.name: Look Desperately for Escape Opportunity
options.description: Scan constantly for any chance to break free.

options.name: Try to Stall (Ask About Loc/Ritual)
options.description: Engage them in conversation, hoping to delay or learn something useful.

title: Looting the Merchant (Chase)
description: You quickly check the defeated merchant's pockets. You find 15 GP.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 15 gold.

options.name: Continue Escape
options.description: Leave him and get away before guards arrive.

title: Double Brawl Loot
description: Quickly looting both the merchant and the dwarf yields: The merchant's purse (25 GP) and the dwarf's pouch (40 GP + Rune Stone). A total of 65 GP and the stone. Time to flee!

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 65 gold.

items.name: Dwarven Rune Stone
items.description: A smooth stone etched with a dwarven rune.

options.name: Flee the Tavern Immediately
options.description: Get out before the guards arrive!

title: Night March to the Falls
description:
Pushing through the dark woods under the eerie moonlight requires focus. [Wisdom (Survival) check DC 14].

Success: You navigate by moonlight and instinct, hearing the sound of falling water ahead - the Whispering Falls.

Failure: You become disoriented in the darkness, perhaps stumbling into difficult terrain or attracting unwanted attention (rustling leaves nearby, glowing eyes watching).

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: Identified as a Key Fragment for Loc's prison. On a quest for Elara.

options.name: Approach the Falls (If Success)
options.description: Move towards the sound of water.

options.name: Investigate Disturbance (If Failure)
options.description: Cautiously check out the rustling or glowing eyes.

options.name: Make Camp Now
options.description: Stop and wait for daylight.

title: Cold Camp in Woods
description: You find a relatively sheltered spot (under a large tree, in a small hollow) and make a cold camp, huddling for warmth. The sounds of the forest seem amplified in the darkness. You rest fitfully until dawn.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: Identified as a Key Fragment for Loc's prison. On a quest for Elara.

options.name: Continue Quest at Dawn
options.description: Resume the search for Whispering Falls in daylight.

options.name: Disturbed Night?
options.description: Perhaps something approached your camp during the night? [Roll for random encounter?].

title: Following Animal Trails
description: You find a deer trail that seems to lead downhill, possibly towards water. Following it, the path becomes clearer, but you also see signs of predators (wolf tracks?). The sound of running water grows louder.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: Identified as a Key Fragment for Loc's prison. On a quest for Elara.

options.name: Proceed Cautiously Towards Water Sound
options.description: Continue, but stay alert for predators.

options.name: Set a Snare?
options.description: Try to catch small game while heading towards the falls.

options.name: Leave the Trail, Move Cross-Country
options.description: Predator signs are worrying. Veer off the trail.

title: Buying Survival Gear
description: You purchase 3 days' rations and 50ft of hempen rope (Total 5 GP used). Basic survival needs covered.
