items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: Identified as a Key Fragment. Preparing for Elara's quest.

items.name: Rations (3 days)
items.description: Dried meat, hardtack, nuts.

items.name: Hempen Rope (50ft)
items.description: Standard rope.

options.name: Head Towards Whispering Falls
options.description: Now supplied, begin the journey.

options.name: Buy Weapon/Armor As Well?
options.description: If you have enough remaining coin.

options.name: Buy Anti-Fey Charm?
options.description: Purchase Elara's ward (5 GP).

title: Buying Combat Gear (Quest Prep)
description: You purchase basic combat gear (e.g., Leather Armor for 10 GP or a Shortsword for 10 GP) before heading out on Elara's quest.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: Identified as a Key Fragment. Preparing for Elara's quest.

options.name: Head Towards Whispering Falls
options.description: Now better equipped, begin the journey.

options.name: Buy Rations/Rope As Well?
options.description: If you have enough remaining coin.

options.name: Buy Anti-Fey Charm?
options.description: Purchase Elara's ward (5 GP).

title: Buying Fey Ward
description: You purchase a small, fragrant bundle of herbs and carved wood from Elara (5 GP). She claims it will ward off mischievous fey and minor spirits.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: Identified as a Key Fragment. Preparing for Elara's quest.

items.name: Anti-Fey Charm
items.description: A fragrant charm said to ward off fey.

options.name: Head Towards Whispering Falls
options.description: Now prepared, begin the journey.

options.name: Buy Rations/Rope As Well?
options.description: If you have enough remaining coin.

options.name: Buy Weapon/Armor As Well?
options.description: If you have enough remaining coin.

title: Night Dock Vigil
description:
Hidden in the shadows, you watch and listen. The tide laps against the pilings. [Perception check DC 14].

Success: You hear muffled voices from under a specific pier OR see cloaked figures moving stealthily near a warehouse OR spot faint lights moving out near the Whispering Shoals.

Failure: The docks remain quiet and uneventful, aside from the usual creaks and water sounds.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Investigate Voices/Figures/Lights (If Success)
options.description: Move cautiously towards the source of the activity.

options.name: Give Up, Go to Lighthouse (If Failure)
options.description: Nothing happening here. Elara must have meant the lighthouse.

options.name: Continue Waiting
options.description: Remain hidden and keep watching.

title: Under the Piers
description:
You slip into the damp, dark space beneath the main pier. The water laps near your feet. It smells terrible. You move carefully. [Perception check DC 13].

Success: You find a small hidden cache containing smuggled goods (brandy bottles?) OR signs of recent passage (footprints, discarded cloak pin) OR a loose stone hiding a small waterproof pouch.

Failure: You find only rotting wood, barnacles, and refuse.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Investigate Findings (If Success)
options.description: Examine the cache, footprints, or pouch.

options.name: Emerge from Under Pier (If Failure)
options.description: Nothing here. Return to the docks.

title: The Gate
description: Finn (or the other worker) lowers their voice further. ''The Gate'... that's what he called the big machine in the lantern room. All gears and lenses, pointed at the sea. Said it... focused the tide's power. Needed 'alignment' for the 'Great Unlocking'. Scared me right out of there.'

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device. Linked to Valerius/Lighthouse.

options.name: Assume 'Gate' Relates to Loc
options.description: Connect this to the lore about Loc being locked away.

options.name: Ask About Valerius's Allies/Visitors
options.description: 'Did he mention anyone else? Cultists? Guardians?'

options.name: Head to the Lighthouse
options.description: More determined than ever to investigate.

title: Lighthouse Layout/Security
description: Finn/worker shakes his head. 'Guards? Nah, just that creepy servant fella. As for ways in... main door, yeah? And maybe... maybe a grate down low, near the cliffs? Used to chuck rubbish out there. Don't know if it opens from outside.'

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device. Linked to Valerius/Lighthouse.

options.name: Focus on the Grate Entrance
options.description: This confirms a potential alternate entry point.

options.name: Focus on the Servant
options.description: Only one 'guard'? Seems manageable.

options.name: Head to the Lighthouse
options.description: Time to check out these entry points.

title: Heeding the Worker's Warning
description: The former worker's fear is palpable. Whispering books, humming instruments, talk of 'Unlocking'... it sounds like dangerous magic far beyond petty theft. You decide to steer clear of the Tidecaller Lighthouse.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device. Linked to Valerius/Lighthouse.

options.name: Try to Sell the Tumbler
options.description: Get rid of the artifact that seems connected to this madness.

options.name: Warn Elara About Valerius
options.description: Tell the other scholar what you learned.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: This town and its lighthouse are too strange.

title: Holding Onto Coin
description: You decide to hold onto your remaining gold for now. It's good to have resources available for unexpected needs or opportunities.

options.name: Seek Information/Rumors
options.description: Use your time, not coin, to learn more.

options.name: Investigate Leads (Lighthouse, Factions)
options.description: Follow up on existing clues.

options.name: Look for Work/Theft
options.description: Try to increase your funds.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: Move on.

title: Seeking Adventure (Armed)
description: Newly armed (and possibly armored), you feel more confident tackling the mysteries or dangers of Nestlebrook.

options.name: Investigate the Lighthouse
options.description: Head towards the Tidecaller Lighthouse.

options.name: Confront a Faction (Unbound/Guardian)
options.description: Seek out the cultists or the mercenary.

options.name: Take on a Dangerous Job
options.description: Look for mercenary work or high-risk tasks.

title: Post-Purchase Decision
description: Having purchased some gear (Armor, Weapon, or Tools), you have some gold remaining (5-30 GP depending on choices).

options.name: Buy Another Basic Item?
options.description: If affordable, get another piece of basic gear (Sword/Armor/Tools).

options.name: Save Remaining Coin
options.description: Keep the rest of the gold.

options.name: Proceed with Plans
options.description: Continue with investigating the Lighthouse, factions, or seeking work.

title: Rogue Set Acquired
description: You are now well-equipped with Studded Leather armor, a deadly Rapier, and Thieves' Tools. You feel much more prepared for infiltration and combat. You have 5 GP remaining.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 5 gold.

items.name: Studded Leather
items.description: Leather armor reinforced with studs.

items.name: Rapier
items.description: A thin, sharp finesse blade.

items.name: Thieves' Tools
items.description: A set of lockpicks and tools.

options.name: Seek High-Risk/High-Reward Opportunity
options.description: Look for burglary targets or dangerous quests suited to your skills.

options.name: Investigate Lighthouse (Stealth Approach)
options.description: Use your tools and armor for a stealthy infiltration.

options.name: Confront Factions
options.description: Feel ready to face the Unbound or the Keeper.

title: Fighter Set Acquired
description: You are now equipped with a Chain Shirt, Shortsword, and Shield. You feel ready for direct combat. You have 30 GP remaining.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 30 gold.

items.name: Chain Shirt
items.description: A shirt of interlocking metal rings.

items.name: Shortsword
items.description: A well-balanced shortsword.

items.name: Shield
items.description: A standard wooden shield.

options.name: Seek Combat Opportunities
options.description: Look for mercenary work, gang fights, or confront factions directly.

options.name: Investigate Lighthouse (Direct Approach)
options.description: Knock on the door or prepare to force entry.

options.name: Spend Remaining Coin?
options.description: Buy Thieves' Tools (25 GP) or other supplies.

title: Buying Finnigan's Secrets
description: You find Ratty Finnigan and offer him 50 GP for everything he knows. His eyes widen. 'Fifty?! Alright, alright! The Tumbler... Key Fragment, yeah? Opens Loc's prison. Unbound want it bad, leader's some fanatic named Kaelen. Meeting tonight, high tide, lighthouse, to prep a ritual. Keeper? Name's Marius, ex-temple guard, reports to someone higher up. Valerius at the lighthouse? He's collectin' artifacts, maybe workin' *with* the Unbound, maybe not. Dangerous game. That's all I got! Worth fifty?' (Leaves 50 GP).

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 50 gold.

options.name: Go to Lighthouse (Armed with Info)
options.description: Head to the Unbound meeting/ritual site.

options.name: Warn/Confront Keeper Marius
options.description: Find the Guardian and tell him about Kaelen and the ritual.

options.name: Buy Gear with Remaining Coin
options.description: Use the 50 GP to get well-equipped before acting.

title: Hiring Muscle
description: You find a capable-looking mercenary (human woman named Brynn) nursing an ale. You offer 40 GP for a day's dangerous work, possibly involving cultists or a weird scholar. She considers, then nods. 'Forty gold upfront, I watch your back for 24 hours. No funny business.' (Leaves 60 GP).

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 60 gold.

options.name: Head to Lighthouse with Brynn
options.description: Investigate the Unbound meeting with backup.

options.name: Confront Guardian Marius with Brynn
options.description: Face the Keeper with muscle.

options.name: Use Brynn for a Heist?
options.description: Attempt to steal the Reliquary or rob Silas with help.

title: Guard Bribery (Major)
description: You discreetly approach a guard captain. Offering a substantial bribe (e.g., 50 GP) for information or 'looking the other way' is extremely risky. [High DC Persuasion/Intimidation check + risk of immediate arrest].

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 100 gold.

options.name: Attempt the Bribe
options.description: Make your offer. [High risk check determines outcome].

options.name: Abort, Too Risky
options.description: Think better of it. Walk away.

title: Setting Sail (South)
description: You board the 'Swift Tern'. The crew is professional, the ship well-maintained. As Nestlebrook shrinks behind you, you feel a sense of relief, leaving the strange artifact and its troubles behind. The journey south begins. [This is a potential ending point for this branch - leaving the main story].

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 65 gold.

items.name: Fine Clothes
items.description: Well-made traveler's clothes.

items.name: Quality Rations (5 days)
items.description: Good quality travel food.

options.name: Enjoy the Journey (End Branch?)
options.description: Focus on the voyage and whatever awaits in the south.

options.name: Have Second Thoughts Mid-Voyage?
options.description: Maybe leaving the Tumbler mystery was a mistake? Consider trying to return? [Complicates things].

title: Last Minute Inquiry
description: Before boarding the 'Swift Tern', you make a quick detour. Who do you seek out for one last piece of information?

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing (potentially less than 100) gold.

options.name: Visit Elara
options.description: Ask her one final question about the Tumbler's fate or purpose.

options.name: Visit Silas
options.description: Ask him who he sold the Tumbler to (if applicable) or who else was asking.

options.name: Visit Ratty Finnigan
options.description: Ask for any last rumors about the factions or lighthouse.

options.name: Forget It, Board the Ship
options.description: No time. Head to the docks.

title: Silas's Denial
description: Silas scoffs, though his eyes dart nervously. 'Following you? Don't be ridiculous! I run a business, I don't have time for spy games. And I certainly don't gossip about my... clients.' He denies everything, but his nervousness is apparent.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device. Retained after refusing Silas's offer.

options.name: Press Him (Intimidate)
options.description: 'I know you're lying, Silas. Who put them up to it? The Unbound?'

options.name: Change Tact (Offer Deal)
options.description: 'Alright, fine. But maybe we can still make a deal for this...' (Show Tumbler).

options.name: Leave the Shop
options.description: He's not cracking. Leave him to his nerves.

title: Silas's Evasion
description: Silas forces a laugh. 'Word travels? Aye, Nestlebrook's a small town. Can't help what people gossip about. Doesn't mean *I* said anything.' He tries to deflect, polishing a trinket vigorously.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device. Retained after refusing Silas's offer.

options.name: Mention Specifics (Unbound/Guardian)
options.description: 'Heard talk about... cultists? Or maybe a stern fellow looking for artifacts?'

options.name: Offer the Tumbler Again
options.description: 'Maybe discussing this artifact would be more productive?'

options.name: Leave
options.description: Not getting anywhere. Depart.

title: Re-offering the Tumbler
description: You show Silas the Whispering Tumbler again. 'Maybe we can reconsider a deal,' you suggest. 'Perhaps its value has become... clearer? Especially if others are interested.'

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device. Retained after refusing Silas's offer.

options.name: Demand High Price (Leveraging Interest)
options.description: Name a high price (100+ GP?), citing the known interest from Unbound/Guardians.

options.name: Trade for Information
options.description: 'Tell me everything you know about who wants this, and it's yours.'

options.name: Silas Refuses (Too Scared/Greedy)
options.description: He either wants too much or is too afraid to be involved now.

title: Shopping Spree (60GP)
description:
With 60 GP, you can afford a solid combination of gear. Choose wisely:
- Leather Armor (10) + Shortsword (10) + Thieves' Tools (25) = 45 GP (Leaves 15 GP)
- Studded Leather (45) = Leaves 15 GP
- Chain Shirt (50) = Leaves 10 GP

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 60 gold.

options.name: Buy Basics Set (Armor, Sword, Tools)
options.description: Get all three core items.

options.name: Buy Studded Leather
options.description: Prioritize better stealthy armor.

options.name: Buy Chain Shirt
options.description: Prioritize better direct combat armor.

options.name: Save the Coin
options.description: Hold onto the 60 GP.

title: Seeking Info (60GP / Unbound Fear)
description: You have 60 GP and the knowledge that Silas fears the Unbound. How do you leverage this?

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 60 gold.

options.name: Pay Ratty Finnigan for Information
options.description: Offer good coin (30-40GP?) for info on Unbound/Lighthouse.

options.name: Pressure Silas for More Info
options.description: Go back to Silas, mention the Unbound again, demand details.

options.name: Inquire About Guardians
options.description: Ask around about the armored mercenary (Keeper Marius).

options.name: Use Coin for Gear Instead
options.description: Forget info, buy equipment.

title: Asking Silas (Nervous) About Tumbler
description: You ask the nervous Silas about the Tumbler you sold him. He flinches. 'That thing? Sold it. Good riddance! Caused nothing but trouble. Some cloaked fanatics came asking... then that armored brute... not worth the hassle!'

options.name: Ask Who He Sold It To
options.description: 'Who bought it? The cultists? The armored man?'

options.name: Ask What They Offered Him
options.description: 'Must have paid well if both sides wanted it?'

options.name: Leave Him Be
options.description: He seems genuinely glad it's gone.

title: Probing Silas (Factions)
description: You mention the Unbound or the Guardian mercenary to Silas. He visibly pales. 'Keep your voice down!' he hisses. 'Meddling with them is suicide! The Unbound are fanatics seeking chaos, the Keeper serves some rigid ancient order. Both play for keeps. Stay out of it!'

options.name: Ask Which Faction He Fears More
options.description: 'Who worries you more, Silas?'

options.name: Ask if He Deals With Either
options.description: 'Ever fenced items for them before?'

options.name: Heed His Warning
options.description: Take his fear seriously and leave.

title: Offering Protection (Silas)
description: You offer to 'protect' Silas from the factions... for a price or information. He looks at you incredulously. 'Protect *me*? From *them*? You're either brave or stupid, maybe both. What makes you think you could?' [Persuasion/Intimidation check DC 14 needed].

options.name: Convince Him (If Success)
options.description: He agrees to pay (e.g., 30 GP) or offer valuable info in exchange for you dealing with any threats.

options.name: He Laughs/Refuses (If Failure)
options.description: 'Get out of here before you attract them!'

title: Buyback Offer
description: You offer Silas double what he paid (e.g., 40 GP) for the Tumbler. He strokes his chin. 'Hmm, tempted... but things have... changed. Interest has increased. Make it 80 GP, and it's yours.'

options.name: Pay 80 GP (If You Have It)
options.description: Agree to his inflated price.

options.name: Try to Haggle Down
options.description: 'Eighty? That's robbery! How about 60?' [Persuasion check DC 15].

options.name: Refuse, Give Up on Buyback
options.description: Too expensive. Forget it.

title: Sentimental Ploy (Buyback)
description: You try claiming the Tumbler has unexpected sentimental value. Silas raises an eyebrow. 'Sentimental? Looked like dangerous clockwork to me. Sentiment doesn't pay my bills. 80 Gold Pieces.' He seems unmoved by your ploy.

options.name: Pay 80 GP
options.description: Resort to paying his price.

options.name: Try Haggling
options.description: Attempt to negotiate based on price, not sentiment.

options.name: Give Up
options.description: He's not buying it, literally or figuratively.

title: Buyback Refused / Aborted
description: Silas either refuses to sell the Tumbler back or his price is too high. It seems getting it back legitimately isn't an option.

options.name: Consider Stealing It Back
options.description: Plan a heist of the pawn shop.

options.name: Forget About the Tumbler
options.description: Let it go. Focus on other things.

options.name: Try to Find Out Who Has It Now
options.description: If Silas claimed he sold it, try to learn the buyer's identity.

title: Casing Silas's Shop
description:
You observe Silas's pawn shop discreetly. [Investigation check DC 14].

Success: You note the sturdy front lock, barred back window, but also a potentially weak cellar grate accessible from the alley. You also notice Silas seems to leave promptly at sundown.

Failure: The shop seems well-secured. Front door lock looks tough, back window is barred, no obvious weaknesses.

options.name: Target Cellar Grate (If Success)
options.description: Plan to force or pick the cellar grate after sundown.

options.name: Target Front Lock (If Failure/Prefer)
options.description: Prepare for a difficult lockpicking attempt on the front door.

options.name: Target Back Window (If Failure/Prefer)
options.description: Attempt to deal with the barred window (prying bars?).

options.name: Abort Heist
options.description: Seems too well-defended.

title: Picking Silas's Front Lock
description:
Under cover of darkness, you work on Silas's sturdy front door lock. [Dexterity (Thieves' Tools) check DC 16].

Success: Click! The lock springs open.

Failure: The lock defeats you, or you make noise and hear movement inside / nearby.

options.name: Enter Shop Stealthily (If Success)
options.description: Slip inside the dark pawn shop.

options.name: Flee (If Failure - Noise)
options.description: You alerted someone! Retreat immediately.

options.name: Try Another Entrance (If Failure - Lock Stuck)
options.description: Attempt the back window or cellar grate.

title: Silas's Back Entrance
description: You check the back of Silas's shop. There's a barred window OR a cellar grate.

options.name: Attempt Barred Window
options.description: Try to pry the bars loose. [Strength check DC 15, noisy].

options.name: Attempt Cellar Grate
options.description: Try to force or pick the grate lock. [Thieves' Tools DC 15?].

options.name: Abort Heist
options.description: No easy way in.

title: Modest Funds
description: With your modest gambling outcome (10-30 GP), you have enough for basic necessities or maybe one piece of cheap gear.

options.name: Buy Food and Lodging
options.description: Get a meal and a cheap room for the night.

options.name: Buy Supplies (Rope, Rations)
options.description: Purchase basic survival gear.

options.name: Buy Dagger/Leather Armor (If 10+ GP)
options.description: Get one cheap piece of equipment.

options.name: Save the Coin
options.description: Hold onto what little you have.

title: Gearing Up (70GP)
description:
With 70-75 GP from your successful gamble or theft, you can afford a good selection of gear.
- Studded Leather (45) + Shortsword (10) = 55 GP (Leaves 15-20 GP)
- Chain Shirt (50) + Shield (10) = 60 GP (Leaves 10-15 GP)
- Leather Armor (10) + Rapier (25) + Thieves' Tools (25) = 60 GP (Leaves 10-15 GP)

options.name: Buy Studded Leather & Shortsword
options.description: Good balance of stealthy armor and weapon.

options.name: Buy Chain Shirt & Shield
options.description: Focus on AC for direct combat.

options.name: Buy Leather Armor, Rapier & Tools
options.description: Versatile rogue set.

options.name: Save the Coin
options.description: Hold onto the gold.

title: Buying Quality Info (70GP)
description: With a decent amount of gold (60-70 GP), you seek out Ratty Finnigan, offering him a significant sum (e.g., 40 GP) for reliable information.

options.name: Ask About Tumbler/Factions/Lighthouse
options.description: Get the full story he knows.

options.name: Ask About High-Value Heist Targets
options.description: Use the money to find a lucrative burglary opportunity.

options.name: Ask About Safe Passage Out
options.description: Find a discreet way to leave Nestlebrook.

title: Bluffing Out of Trouble
description:
You try to talk your way out of the cheating accusation. 'A mistake!', 'Bad shuffle!', 'You misread the dice!' [Deception/Persuasion check DC 15].

Success: The accuser backs down, uncertain, or the barkeep decides it's not worth the trouble. You're told to cash out and leave.

Failure: They don't buy it. The hostility remains or escalates.

options.name: Leave Quickly (If Success)
options.description: Get out before they change their minds.

options.name: Face Consequences (If Failure)
options.description: Prepare for a fight or being thrown out.

title: Paying Off Accusers
description: To avoid a fight, you offer to return the disputed winnings or pay off the accuser/barkeep (perhaps 10-20 GP).

options.name: They Accept, You Leave Poorer
options.description: You buy peace at a cost. Leave the tavern.

options.name: They Refuse, Still Want Trouble
options.description: Money isn't enough. They want satisfaction.

title: Tavern Brawl (Cheating)

enemies.name: Angry Gambler
enemies.description: The person who accused you of cheating.

enemies.name: Tavern Bouncer/Barkeep

weapons.name: Club
weapons.description: A heavy piece of wood kept under the bar.

enemies.description: Trying to restore order, forcefully.

description: Talk fails. Fists (and possibly bottles or clubs) start flying as the angry gambler and the tavern staff move to subdue you.
limitation: Combat ends when opponents are defeated/driven off, or Darryn flees the tavern. Victory leads to Node 637. Defeat leads to Node 638.

title: Reliquary Heist Plan
description: You decide to try and steal the 'Reliquary' heading to Valerius. It's on the heavily guarded 'Sea Serpent' ship. Intercepting it would require bypassing the guards, likely involving stealth, diversion, or force.

options.name: Attempt Stealth Infiltration of Ship
options.description: Try to sneak aboard again, aiming specifically for the Reliquary's location (if known).

options.name: Create Diversion on Docks
options.description: Cause a fire, start a brawl, or fake an emergency to draw guards away.

options.name: Ambush Guards During Transfer?
options.description: Try to attack the guards when they move the Reliquary off the ship.

options.name: Reconsider, Too Dangerous
options.description: Attacking multiple guards is risky. Pursue other leads.

title: Leaving the Docks
description: You leave the dock area, putting the ships and their activities behind you for now. You're back in the main part of Nestlebrook.

options.name: Head to a Tavern/Inn
options.description: Seek rest, food, or information.

options.name: Investigate Lighthouse Rumors
options.description: Focus on the Tidecaller Lighthouse.

options.name: Seek Work/Theft Opportunities
options.description: Try to acquire coin.

title: Fighting Dock Guard

enemies.name: Dock Guard
enemies.description: A watchful guard doing his job.

description: The dock guard moves to apprehend you after your failed bluff near the 'Sea Serpent'. 'You're coming with me!'
limitation: Combat ends when guard is defeated or Darryn flees/is subdued. Victory leads to Node 642. Defeat leads to Node 643.

title: Observing Unbound Destination
description: You successfully tracked the Unbound agents or dealt with the dock guard. You observe their destination: a seemingly abandoned warehouse OR the back entrance of the Drunken Sailor OR the path leading up to the Tidecaller Lighthouse.

options.name: Investigate Warehouse
options.description: Try to sneak into or observe the warehouse.

options.name: Re-enter Drunken Sailor (Back)
options.description: Go back into the tavern via the rear entrance, cautiously.

options.name: Head Towards Lighthouse
options.description: Follow the path towards the lighthouse.

title: Ambushing the Trail
description: You find a good hiding spot near the entrance to the game trail marked by the Unbound symbol, waiting to see who uses it.

options.name: Wait Patiently
options.description: Stay hidden and observe. [Time passes, possible Perception check later].

options.name: Set a Simple Trap?
options.description: Try to rig a snare or tripwire. [Survival/Dex check?].

options.name: Give Up Waiting, Follow Trail
options.description: Decide to proactively follow the trail instead.

title: Obsidian Clues
description: You pocket the three polished obsidian shards found at the campsite. They feel strangely cold.

items.name: Obsidian Shards (x3)
items.description: Polished, sharp shards of black volcanic glass.

options.name: Follow Drag Marks Towards Cave/Pass
options.description: Continue tracking.

options.name: Examine Shards More Closely
options.description: Look for markings or magical properties. [Arcana/Investigation check?]

options.name: Turn Back
options.description: Leave the trail.

title: Entering the Darkness (Cave/Pass)
description: You slip into the cave or pass entrance. [Stealth check DC 13]. The chanting/pounding is louder here. The passage narrows, lit sporadically by phosphorescent moss or crude torches ahead.

options.name: Proceed Deeper (If Success)
options.description: Continue further into the passage towards the sound/light.

options.name: Spotted! (If Failure)
options.description: A figure steps out from the shadows ahead! 'Intruder!'

options.name: Retreat Quietly
options.description: Back out before going further.

title: Listening at the Threshold
description: You listen carefully at the entrance. [Perception check DC 13]. You can better discern the sounds: rhythmic chanting in a harsh tongue ('...Loc Vobiscum...?') mixed with the clang of hammer on metal OR guttural commands and the shuffling of feet.

options.name: Enter (Hearing Chanting/Hammering)
options.description: Sounds like a ritual or forge. Proceed cautiously.

options.name: Enter (Hearing Commands/Shuffling)
options.description: Sounds like guards or prisoners. Proceed cautiously.

options.name: Try Diversion
options.description: Make noise outside to see who responds.

options.name: Turn Back
options.description: Sounds dangerous.

title: Cave Diversion
description: You throw a rock or shout down the mountainside away from the cave entrance. A moment later, you hear the chanting/pounding inside falter, followed by questioning shouts. Maybe someone will come out to investigate.

options.name: Wait in Ambush
options.description: Hide near the entrance and prepare to attack anyone who emerges.

options.name: Sneak Inside While They're Distracted
options.description: Use the confusion to slip into the entrance. [Stealth check, maybe with advantage?].

options.name: Retreat After Causing Diversion
options.description: Use the chance to get away.

title: Meeting the Prospectors
description: You approach the prospectors' camp openly. They eye you warily, stopping their argument. 'Lost, stranger?' one asks gruffly, hand near a pickaxe. 'Not much up here 'cept rocks and trouble.'

options.name: Ask for Directions/News
options.description: Politely inquire about the way to the nearest settlement or any recent happenings.

options.name: Ask About What They Found
options.description: 'Seemed like you found something interesting?' Inquire about the bag.

options.name: Offer to Trade (If You Have Goods)
options.description: See if they need supplies you might have.

title: Prospectors' Argument
description: Hidden nearby, you listen to the prospectors argue. You overhear snippets: '...just a pouch of dust, I tell ya!' 'Shiny dust! Worth more than you think!' '...but They might be watchin' the peaks... the ones from the cave... 'fraid they saw us...' 'Should hide it...'

options.name: Approach Them Now
options.description: Step out, maybe ask about the 'shiny dust' or 'the cave'.

options.name: Attempt to Steal the Pouch
options.description: Try to grab it while they're distracted by arguing.

options.name: Investigate 'The Cave' Mentioned
options.description: Try to find the cave they're afraid of.

title: Stealing from Prospectors
description:
While the prospectors are distracted, you make a move for the small bag they were arguing over. [Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check DC 14].

Success: You snatch the pouch and dart away before they notice!

Failure: One of them sees you! 'Hey! Thief! Get back here!' They give chase.

options.name: Check the Loot (If Success)
options.description: Find a safe spot and examine the contents of the pouch.

options.name: Flee into the Mountains (If Failure)
options.description: Run from the angry prospectors.

options.name: Fight the Prospectors
options.description: Face the two angry miners.

title: Mountain Camp (Fork)
description: You find a relatively sheltered spot near the fork in the mountain road to make camp for the night. The air is thin and cold. The stars are incredibly bright.

options.name: Rest Until Morning
options.description: Get some sleep before choosing a path.

options.name: Study the Stars?
options.description: Do the constellations look unusual? [Nature/Arcana check?].

options.name: Keep Watch
options.description: Stay alert through the cold night.

title: Path to the Watchtower
description: You follow the better-maintained path. It winds upwards towards a stone watchtower perched on a high ridge. It looks old but possibly still garrisoned. Smoke curls from a chimney.

options.name: Approach the Watchtower Openly
options.description: Walk up to the gate or entrance.

options.name: Scout the Watchtower from Distance
options.description: Observe for guards, activity, flags, etc. [Perception check].

options.name: Attempt Stealthy Approach
options.description: Try to get closer without being seen.

options.name: Turn Back, Take Path to Ruins
options.description: Change your mind and head for the ruins instead.

title: Path to the Ruins
description: The rough path leads towards crumbling stone structures silhouetted against the sky on a nearby peak. The ruins look ancient, possibly predating the nearby watchtower. It seems isolated and potentially dangerous.

options.name: Explore the Ruins Cautiously
options.description: Enter the ruins, alert for hazards or occupants.

options.name: Scout Ruins Exterior First
options.description: Circle the ruins, looking for obvious dangers or points of interest.

options.name: Look for Signs of Recent Activity
options.description: Check for tracks, campfires, etc. near the ruins. [Survival check].

options.name: Turn Back, Take Path to Watchtower
options.description: Ruins seem too dangerous. Head for the watchtower.

title: Shipwreck Lore (Seabrook)
description: Asking about the shipwreck gets knowing looks. 'The 'Seafoam's Kiss',' a sailor slurs. 'Went down on the Serpent's Teeth rocks, just south o' here. Word is she carried silver from the northern mines. Salvage crews went out, found wreckage... but no silver. And some came back... changed.'

options.name: Ask About 'Serpent's Teeth'
options.description: Inquire about the location and dangers of these rocks.

options.name: Ask How Salvage Crews 'Changed'
options.description: 'Changed how?'

options.name: Plan a Salvage Trip?
options.description: Consider trying to find the wreck yourself.

title: Playing Seabrook Gangs
description: Trying to play the Salty Dogs and Kraken's Crew against each other is dangerous. You'd need to find a member of one gang and offer information about the other, hoping for a reward without getting caught in the crossfire.

options.name: Seek Out Salty Dogs
options.description: Try to find where the Salty Dogs hang out.

options.name: Seek Out Kraken's Crew
options.description: Try to find where the Kraken's Crew hang out.

options.name: Abort Plan, Too Risky
options.description: Decide against meddling in gang warfare.

title: Grognak's Debt Collector
description: You offer to collect debts for Grognak the orc barkeep. He grins, showing tusks. 'Heh. Got guts. Alright. Start with 'One-Eyed' Mick over there. Owes me ten silver. Get it back - keep two for yourself.' He points to a particularly surly-looking sailor.

options.name: Approach 'One-Eyed' Mick
options.description: Go demand the ten silver.

options.name: Ask Grognak for Backup/Advice
options.description: 'Mick looks tough. Any tips?'

options.name: Decline the Job
options.description: Decide against starting with Mick.

title: Pickpocketing the Drunk
description:
You approach the passed-out sailor. [Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check DC 12].

Success: You lift a small, worn pouch containing 1d10 silver pieces.

Failure: As you reach, the sailor suddenly snorts awake OR a nearby patron notices and shouts, 'Oi! Leave 'im alone!'

options.name: Take the Silver (If Success)
options.description: Pocket the meager earnings.

options.name: Deal with Shouter/Woken Sailor (If Failure)
options.description: Try to bluff, flee, or fight.

title: Targeting the Till
description:
A brawl conveniently breaks out near the bar, drawing Grognak's attention. You dart towards the unattended coin box. [Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check DC 16].

Success: You quickly scoop up a handful of coins (2d6 GP)!

Failure: Grognak spots your movement out of the corner of his one eye and roars, turning towards you!

options.name: Flee with Gold (If Success)
options.description: Escape the tavern immediately with your score.

options.name: Face Grognak's Wrath (If Failure)
options.description: Caught red-handed by the formidable orc.

title: Discouraging the Kraken's Crew
description: Grognak points you towards the docks outside his tavern. 'See them three? Kraken badges. Tell 'em Grognak says this is Salty Dog territory now. Make 'em understand.' Three tough-looking sailors wearing kraken symbols are loitering nearby.

options.name: Approach and Intimidate
options.description: Try to scare them off with threats. [Intimidation check].

options.name: Attempt Subtle Sabotage?
options.description: Try to frame them for something or cause trouble that makes them leave?

options.name: Attack Them
options.description: Resort to violence.

options.name: Report Back to Grognak (Give Up)
options.description: Tell him you can't handle it.

title: Cleaning the Kraken Tank
description: Grognak leads you out back to a large, slimy tank filled with murky water and smelling indescribably foul. 'Scrub it clean. Bucket and brush.' It looks like hours of disgusting work. But... at the bottom, half-buried in sludge, something metallic glints.

options.name: Start Cleaning (Endure the Stench)
options.description: Get to work, keeping an eye on the glinting object.

options.name: Investigate Glinting Object First
options.description: Try to reach the object at the bottom immediately.

options.name: Refuse the Job Now
options.description: This is too vile. Tell Grognak you changed your mind.

title: Declining Grognak's Jobs
description: You decline Grognak's charming job offers. He shrugs. 'Suit yourself. Don't cause trouble.' You're back in the main room of the Barnacle's Bite.

options.name: Order a Drink, Listen for Rumors
options.description: Try to gather info.

options.name: Look for Pickpocket Target
options.description: Scan the room again.

options.name: Leave the Tavern
options.description: Try the docks or leave Seabrook.

title: Securing Crate Loot
description: You quickly secure the bolt of silk / bottles of brandy found in the crate, hiding it on your person or in your gear.

options.name: Look for a Fence in Seabrook
options.description: Try to sell the stolen goods quickly.

options.name: Keep the Loot for Now
options.description: Hold onto it, perhaps use the brandy or save silk for later.

options.name: Try to Steal More?
options.description: Look for other opportunities on the docks.

title: Seabrook Dock Next Move
description: Having either failed to find valuable loot in the crates or decided against dock labor/poor shelter, you reassess your options on the Seabrook docks.

options.name: Try 'The Barnacle's Bite' Tavern
options.description: Head into the local dive.

options.name: Attempt to Stow Away
options.description: Look for a ship leaving soon.

options.name: Look for Odd Jobs Again
options.description: Ask different foremen or captains.

options.name: Leave Seabrook
options.description: This town seems unpromising.

title: Stowing Away (Salty Dog)
description:
You try to sneak aboard the rough-looking 'Salty Dog'. [Dexterity (Stealth) check DC 13].

Success: You slip into the messy cargo hold undetected amid coils of rope and fish barrels.

Failure: A burly, tattooed sailor spots you. 'Oi! Get off our ship, rat!'

options.name: Await Departure (If Success)
options.description: Hide and wait for the ship to sail.

options.name: Try to Talk/Bribe Sailor (If Failure)
options.description: Attempt diplomacy with the rough sailor.

options.name: Run/Jump Off Ship (If Failure)
options.description: Flee back onto the docks.

title: Stowing Away (Windswept Wanderer)
description:
You try to sneak aboard the quieter 'Windswept Wanderer'. The decks are cleaner, potentially fewer hiding spots. [Dexterity (Stealth) check DC 15].

Success: You find a small, empty crate or bundle of sails to hide in.

Failure: The watchful first mate notices you creeping aboard. 'Hold there! Identify yourself!'

options.name: Await Departure (If Success)
options.description: Hide and wait for the ship to sail.

options.name: Try to Talk/Bluff First Mate (If Failure)
options.description: Attempt diplomacy with the more professional officer.

options.name: Run/Jump Off Ship (If Failure)
options.description: Flee back onto the docks.

title: Barrel Loading
description: You spend several grueling hours hauling heavy, stinking fish barrels onto the trawler. Your muscles ache, and you smell awful, but the foreman eventually pays you 15 copper pieces.

items.name: Copper Pieces
items.description: A handful of 15 copper pieces.

options.name: Spend Coppers on Food/Drink
options.description: Go to the Barnacle's Bite for cheap sustenance.

options.name: Look for More Work
options.description: Try to find another job on the docks.

options.name: Try to Wash Up
options.description: Find water to clean off the fish stench.

options.name: Leave Seabrook
options.description: Take your meager earnings and move on.

title: Haggling for Labor
description:
You try to negotiate for better pay from the dock foreman. 'This looks like more than a few coppers' worth of work.' [Persuasion check DC 13].

Success: He grunts. 'Alright, smart mouth. Twenty coppers for the whole load. Take it or leave it.'

Failure: He scoffs. 'Few coppers is the rate. Don't like it, move along.'

options.name: Accept 20 Coppers (If Success)
options.description: Agree to the slightly better rate and start working.

options.name: Accept Original Rate (If Failure)
options.description: Agree to the initial offer.

options.name: Decline the Work
options.description: Not worth it.

title: Washing Off the Stench
description: You find a public water pump or brave the cold sea water near the beach to wash off the accumulated grime or fish smell. You feel marginally cleaner, though still rough.

options.name: Head to Docks
options.description: Look for work/opportunities.

options.name: Go to Tavern
options.description: Seek food/drink/info.

options.name: Leave Seabrook
options.description: Move on.

title: Loft Departure
description: After a good night's rest in the boat repair shop loft, you slip out unnoticed as the workers begin their day. You feel refreshed and ready for Seabrook.

options.name: Head to Docks
options.description: Look for work/opportunities.

options.name: Go to Tavern
options.description: Seek food/drink/info.

options.name: Explore Seabrook Town
options.description: See what the rest of the town offers.

title: Caught in the Loft Bluff
description:
Caught by the worker, you try to make an excuse. 'Thought this was the sailmaker's?', 'Just looking for shelter from the rain!' [Deception check DC 12].

Success: The worker grumbles but accepts your story. 'Well, it ain't. Now clear off.'

Failure: He doesn't believe you. 'Trespassin', eh? Or tryin' to steal somethin'? Wait 'til the boss hears!'

options.name: Leave Quickly (If Success)
options.description: Get out before he changes his mind.

options.name: Run For It (If Failure)
options.description: Don't wait for the boss. Flee.

options.name: Try to Bribe Worker (If Failure)
options.description: Offer coin to keep him quiet.

title: Fleeing the Loft
description: You quickly scramble down from the loft or out of the boat repair shop, escaping the angry worker(s). You're back on the streets of Seabrook.

options.name: Head to Docks
options.description: Look for work/opportunities away from the shop.

options.name: Go to Tavern
options.description: Seek refuge or info elsewhere.

options.name: Leave Seabrook
options.description: Too much trouble already.

title: Extended Wilderness Rest
description: You take extra time resting at your campsite after your successful hunt. The quiet and solitude help clear your head, and you feel fully recovered.

options.name: Continue Journey
options.description: Proceed through the wilderness, fully rested.

options.name: Follow Booted Tracks
options.description: Investigate the other tracks now.

title: Path to the Coast
description: You follow the narrow path leading downwards out of the rocky terrain. You soon smell salt on the air and hear distant gulls. The path seems likely to lead back to the coast, perhaps near Seabrook or another small settlement.

options.name: Continue Towards Coast
options.description: Follow the path to civilization.

options.name: Look for Shelter Near Coast
options.description: Find a place to rest before reaching a settlement.

options.name: Turn Back Towards Ruins/Wilderness
options.description: Change your mind, head back inland.

title: Deeper into Wilderness
description: You push further inland, leaving the coast and ruins behind. The wilderness becomes denser, older. Resources might be scarce here. What are you hoping to find?

options.name: Seek Seclusion/Avoidance
options.description: Try to truly disappear off the map.

options.name: Look for Signs of Ancient Magic/Ruins
options.description: Search for hidden places away from common paths.

options.name: Focus on Survival (Hunt/Shelter)
options.description: Prioritize staying alive in the deep wilds.

title: Wild Animal Victory
description: You manage to defeat or drive off the aggressive wolf/boar. You stand panting, possibly slightly injured from the fight. The carcass could provide food.

options.name: Butcher Animal for Food/Pelt
options.description: Harvest resources from the kill. [Survival check?]

options.name: Continue Journey (Shaken)
options.description: Leave the carcass and press on.

options.name: Rest and Recover from Fight
options.description: Find a safe place to camp and tend any wounds.

title: Wild Animal Defeat
description: The wild animal overpowers you, inflicting painful wounds before you manage to scramble away or it loses interest. You are injured [Lose HP, possibly gain Bleeding condition?] and alone in the wilderness.

options.name: Try to Find Shelter and Bind Wounds
options.description: Focus on immediate survival and first aid. [Survival/Medicine check?]

options.name: Stagger Towards Civilization (Injured)
options.description: Attempt to reach the coast or mountain road despite injuries.

options.name: Look for the Booted Tracks (Distraction?)
options.description: Maybe the trackers can help, or are the source of the trouble?

title: Shadowing Towards Ruins
description: You follow the cloaked figures at a distance as they make their way towards the hilltop ruins. They move purposefully, seemingly familiar with the terrain. [Stealth check DC 13 to remain undetected].

options.name: Maintain Shadow (If Success)
options.description: Continue following them into the ruins.

options.name: Spotted! (If Failure)
options.description: They notice you! Prepare for confrontation.

options.name: Break Off, Approach Ruins Separately
options.description: Let them go ahead, find your own way into the ruins.

title: Alternate Route to Ruins
description: You break off from shadowing the cloaked figures and circle around, looking for another way into the ruins on the hilltop. You find a collapsed section of wall offering potential entry away from the main path.

options.name: Enter via Collapsed Wall (Stealth)
options.description: Climb through the rubble quietly.

options.name: Scout the Perimeter Further
options.description: Keep looking for other entrances or vantage points.

options.name: Wait and Observe
options.description: Find a hidden spot outside the ruins and watch.

title: Wilderness Cultist Fight

enemies.name: Unbound Agent (Leader?)

weapons.name: Poisoned Dagger
weapons.description: A wicked blade coated in dark venom.

enemies.description: A fanatic in dark robes, surprised but dangerous.

enemies.name: Unbound Agent (x2)

weapons.name: Curved Dagger
weapons.description: A simple but sharp curved knife.

enemies.description: Cultists reacting quickly to the attack/confrontation.

description: You attack the three cloaked Unbound agents in the wilderness! They react quickly, drawing daggers and spreading out.
limitation: Combat ends when all agents are defeated or Darryn flees. Victory leads to Node 703. Defeat leads to Node 704.

title: Wilderness Ambush Diversion
description: You create a diversion (thrown rock, animal call) before attacking the Unbound agents. [They might be momentarily distracted - potential advantage on first attack?].

options.name: Launch Attack Now
options.description: Attack while they are potentially looking the wrong way.

options.name: Diversion Fails/Ignored
options.description: They aren't fooled or ignore the noise. Attack proceeds normally.

title: Trackers Bluff Attempt
description:
You step out, trying to appear harmless. 'Just a lost traveler/hunter,' you claim. [Deception check DC 13 vs their Insight].

Success: They seem to relax slightly, though still wary. 'This is not safe territory for travelers. Be on your way.'

Failure: They don't believe you. 'Liar! You were following us! What do you want?' They ready their weapons.

options.name: Leave Quickly (If Success)
options.description: Take their warning and retreat.

options.name: Attack
options.description: Bluff failed. Fight.

options.name: Attempt Further Diplomacy
options.description: Try another angle - offer help? Plead ignorance?

title: Fleeing the Trackers
description: You turn and bolt, crashing through the undergrowth, hoping to lose the Unbound agents in the wilderness.

options.name: Attempt to Hide
options.description: Find thick bushes or cover and try to conceal yourself. [Stealth check].

options.name: Keep Running (Endurance)
options.description: Try to outdistance them. [Athletics/CON check?].

options.name: They Catch Up / Corner You
options.description: Unable to escape, they force a confrontation.

title: Rested by the Stream
description: You wake with the sun, feeling refreshed by the peaceful night spent near the stream. The wilderness seems less threatening in the daylight.

options.name: Continue Journey
options.description: Press on through the wilderness.

options.name: Follow Booted Tracks?
options.description: Decide whether to investigate the tracks you saw earlier.

options.name: Hunt for Breakfast
options.description: Try to catch some food before moving on.

title: Wilderness Vigil
description: You spend the night keeping watch, dozing lightly. The night passes without incident, but you feel tired and slightly on edge by morning. [Possible exhaustion?].

options.name: Press On Despite Fatigue
options.description: Continue your journey.

options.name: Try to Rest More During Day
options.description: Find a safe spot for a proper rest now.

title: Exploring Near Camp
description:
You scout the area around your stream-side camp. [Perception check DC 12].

Success: You find edible berries OR signs of a hidden path nearby OR tracks indicating someone else passed through recently.

Failure: You find nothing unusual, just typical wilderness.

options.name: Gather Berries (If Found)
options.description: Collect some food.

options.name: Investigate Path/Tracks (If Found)
options.description: Follow the hidden path or tracks.

options.name: Settle Down to Rest (If Nothing Found)
options.description: Return to camp and rest.

title: Uneasy Wilderness Rest
description: Exhausted from your failed search for good shelter, you find a marginally protected spot (thicket, shallow overhang) and collapse for a few hours of uncomfortable, wary sleep.

options.name: Continue Retreat (Slightly Recovered)
options.description: Wake feeling marginally better, continue back towards civilization.

options.name: Something Disturbs Your Rest
options.description: A noise wakes you - animal? person?

title: Lingering Dangerously
description: Despite the successful theft, you linger in the tavern, trying to act casual. It's a risky move. The halfling might notice his loss at any moment.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 75 gold.

items.name: Jade Frog Figurine
items.description: A smooth, well-carved jade frog.

options.name: Order a Drink, Observe
options.description: See if he notices, gather more info.

options.name: Attempt Another Theft?
options.description: Feeling extremely bold/foolish. Look for another mark.

options.name: Leave Before Trouble Starts
options.description: Decide this is too risky. Exit.

title: Keeping the Frog Charm
description: You decide to keep the Jade Frog Figurine, suspecting it might possess minor magical properties (perhaps luck or protection related to nature/fey).

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 75 gold.

items.name: Jade Frog Figurine
items.description: A potentially magical jade frog.

options.name: Leave Tavern Now
options.description: Get out before the halfling misses his charm.

options.name: Try to Attune/Use It?
options.description: Focus on the charm, see if you can activate its power.

options.name: Seek Expert Opinion (Elara?)
options.description: Ask someone knowledgeable about its magic.

title: Selling the Jade Frog
description: The Jade Frog seems like just a valuable trinket. You decide your best bet is to sell it to a fence or collector.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 75 gold.

items.name: Jade Frog Figurine
items.description: A well-carved, valuable jade frog.

options.name: Seek Out Silas
options.description: Try selling it to the local pawnbroker.

options.name: Look for Other Collectors/Merchants
options.description: Ask around for someone who deals in art or antiquities.

options.name: Leave Tavern Now
options.description: Decide on a buyer later. Exit safely.

title: Securing the Haul
description: With a good amount of coin (from theft or gambling), you find a room at a modest inn, 'The Weary Traveler'. It's clean enough and feels secure. You can finally relax properly.

options.name: Rest and Recover
options.description: Get a full night's sleep.

options.name: Plan Next Move (Gear/Info/Travel)
options.description: Consider how best to use your resources.

options.name: Gather Rumors in Inn Common Room
options.description: Listen for local gossip.

title: Impossible Victory (Guards)
description: Against all odds, you manage to defeat or drive off two city guards and the furious halfling! The street is in chaos, witnesses stare in disbelief. You need to disappear, NOW.

options.name: Flee Nestlebrook Immediately
options.description: Get out of town by any means possible before reinforcements arrive.

options.name: Find Deep Hiding Place
options.description: Go to ground somewhere within the town and wait for things to cool down (very risky).

title: Subdued by Guards
description: You are quickly and efficiently subdued by the guards after your foolish attempt to fight them. You're disarmed, bound tightly, and likely facing serious charges.

options.name: Dragged to Jail
options.description: Your current journey likely ends in a cell.

title: Bribery Success!
description: The guard discreetly accepts your bribe (or perhaps lets you 'escape' during processing). You slip away from custody, lighter in the purse but free. You need to be careful, as other guards might still be looking for you.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook Immediately
options.description: Get out of town before your luck runs out.

options.name: Find a New Hiding Place
options.description: Lie low somewhere different.

options.name: Seek Out Contacts (Elara/Silas?)
options.description: Maybe someone can help you disappear or understand the situation.

title: Cooperative Theft?
description: You suggest working together with the cloaked figure to rob the halfling. They pause. 'Two ways... double the risk, double the reward. Or one cuts the purse, the other creates noise. Your choice?'

options.name: You Cut the Purse, They Create Noise
options.description: You attempt the Sleight of Hand, relying on their diversion.

options.name: They Cut the Purse, You Create Noise
options.description: You cause a distraction, trusting them to succeed and share.

options.name: Abort Plan, Too Complicated
options.description: Decide against teaming up.

title: Avoiding the Rival
description: You decide not to engage with the cloaked figure further, leaving them to their own devices regarding the halfling.

options.name: Attempt to Rob Halfling Yourself (Quickly)
options.description: Try to beat the rival to the punch.

options.name: Observe Both Halfling and Rival
options.description: See who makes the first move or if anything happens.

options.name: Leave the Tavern
options.description: Avoid the potential conflict.

title: Warning Off Rival
description:
You try to intimidate the cloaked figure, claiming the halfling as your mark. [Intimidation check DC 13].

Success: They seem to hesitate, perhaps deciding you're not worth the trouble, and subtly withdraw.

Failure: They scoff or meet your gaze defiantly. 'We'll see who's faster.'

options.name: Attempt the Theft Now (If Success)
options.description: Your rival backed off. Make your move.

options.name: Prepare for Competition/Conflict (If Failure)
options.description: They didn't back down. Race them to the target or prepare for interference.

options.name: Back Down Yourself
options.description: Decide confrontation isn't worth it.

title: Halfling's Reaction (Warned)
description: The halfling, warned by you, becomes visibly more alert. He subtly shifts his position, securing his coin purse more firmly. He keeps glancing between you and the cloaked figure with suspicion.

options.name: Target is Now Too Alert
options.description: The opportunity to steal from him is likely gone.

options.name: Halfling Confronts Cloaked Figure?
options.description: See if he calls out the figure, potentially causing a scene.

options.name: Halfling Confronts You?
options.description: Does he suspect you were planning something too?

title: Rival's Reaction (Warned)
description: The cloaked figure seems to notice you warning the halfling. They give you a sharp, dangerous look before melting back into the shadows or turning their attention elsewhere, thwarted for now.

options.name: Feel Safer, Opportunity Gone
options.description: The rival is gone, but the mark is alert.

options.name: Worry About Retaliation
options.description: Did you just make an enemy?

options.name: Ignore Them, Find New Target
options.description: Move on to other possibilities.

title: Elara's Interpretation
description: Elara considers your report. 'A Keeper active, and Valerius receiving guarded shipments... The pattern tightens. The Keepers likely sense the Unbound's nearing success, or perhaps Valerius's own research nears fruition. The Reliquary... perhaps it contains another Key Fragment, or something needed for the ritual, or even a tool to *counter* Loc.'

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Ask About the Ritual/Unlocking
options.description: Inquire about the specifics of Loc's release.

options.name: Offer to Investigate Lighthouse/Reliquary
options.description: Volunteer to find out more for her.

options.name: Ask How to Stop It
options.description: 'What can be done to prevent this?'

title: Working for Elara?
description: You offer to investigate the Guardian or the Reliquary for Elara. She looks thoughtful. 'Information is valuable. If you can discover the nature of the Reliquary, or the Keeper's specific orders, without drawing undue attention... I could offer payment (50 GP?) or perhaps share deeper knowledge about the Key Fragments.'

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Accept Task (Investigate Reliquary)
options.description: Agree to find out about the guarded shipment.

options.name: Accept Task (Investigate Keeper)
options.description: Agree to learn more about the Guardian Marius's plans.

options.name: Decline Task
options.description: Decide against working for her.

title: Tumbler's Role (Elara)
description: You ask Elara how your Key Fragment fits into the arrival of the Keeper and the Reliquary. 'Your Fragment,' she says, 'is likely what drew the Keeper here. Its presence resonates, alerting those sensitive to Loc's prison. The Reliquary... could be bait, could be reinforcement, could be unrelated... but unlikely. Everything involving Loc tends to intertwine.'

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: Key Fragment, source of attention.

options.name: Ask How to Hide It
options.description: 'Can I shield its resonance?'

options.name: Ask About Other Fragments
options.description: 'How many are there? Where might others be?'

options.name: Decide to Get Rid of It
options.description: Maybe selling or hiding it is safer.

title: Selling Info (Guardian)
description: You demand payment from the frightened Silas for the information about the Guardian. He throws a small pouch at you. 'Take it! 20 gold! Now get out and don't tell anyone I deal in... sensitive items!'

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 20 gold.

options.name: Take the 20 Gold and Leave
options.description: Accept the payment.

options.name: Demand More?
options.description: Try to push the scared fence for more coin.

options.name: Ask About the Tumbler Now
options.description: Press him for info while he's off balance.

title: Alliance with Silas?
description: You suggest an uneasy alliance with Silas against the Guardian. He looks terrified but considers it. 'Help me? How? He's a Keeper! You think a street rat and a jumpy fence can stop him?'

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Suggest Misdirection/Lies
options.description: 'We feed him false information. Send him on a wild goose chase.'

options.name: Suggest Ambush/Trap (Very Risky)
options.description: 'Lure him somewhere, deal with him permanently.'

options.name: He Refuses, Too Scared
options.description: 'No, no, too dangerous. Just leave me alone!'

title: Guardian's Reward?
description: You ask the Guardian (Marius) for a reward for your information about the Unbound. He gives you a cold look. 'The prevention of chaos is its own reward. Now, unless you have further *useful* intelligence, be on your way.' He offers no coin.

options.name: Accept His Stance
options.description: Leave without payment.

options.name: Offer to Help Further (For Payment This Time?)
options.description: Try again to offer assistance, maybe hinting at payment.

options.name: Become Annoyed/Hostile
options.description: Argue about the lack of reward.

title: Assisting the Guardian
description: You offer to help the Guardian (Marius) against the Unbound or investigate the lighthouse. He assesses you. 'You have some... useful skills, perhaps. Very well. Meet me near the path to the Tidecaller Lighthouse at moonrise. We will observe the Unbound's activities.'

options.name: Agree to Meet Him
options.description: Accept the task. Prepare to go to the lighthouse path.

options.name: Ask About the Plan
options.description: 'Just observe? Or intervene?'

options.name: Decline, Too Dangerous
options.description: Working directly with a Keeper seems risky.

title: Leaving the Guardian
description: You leave the Guardian mercenary to his business. You've shared what you know (or haven't); his fight is not necessarily yours.

options.name: Head to Lighthouse Independently
options.description: Investigate the Unbound meeting yourself.

options.name: Seek Out Elara
options.description: Report your findings or seek guidance.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: Avoid the faction conflict altogether.

title: Silas Spills Secrets
description: Under pressure (threat of Unbound/Guardians, or offered the Tumbler), Silas starts talking nervously. 'Alright, alright! The Tumbler... one of the Keys of Loc, they call it. Fragments scattered. Unbound want 'em to free their mad god. Keepers want 'em locked up. Valerius at the lighthouse... he's collecting 'em too, but for himself? Or the Unbound? Don't know! Heard the Unbound meet there 'cause the place resonates with Loc's power, 'specially at high tide!'

options.name: Ask About Valerius's Motives
options.description: 'Why would Valerius want the Keys?'

options.name: Ask About Other Key Fragments
options.description: 'Know where any other Fragments might be?'

options.name: Take the Info (and Tumbler/Payment?)
options.description: Absorb the information, conclude the deal/threat.

title: Extorting Silas
description: You press Silas for money, threatening to expose his dealings or attract the factions' attention. He panics and shoves gold at you. 'Take it! 50 Gold! Just leave me out of this!'

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 50 gold.

options.name: Take the Money and Leave
options.description: Extortion successful.

options.name: Demand Information As Well
options.description: 'Not enough, Silas. Tell me what you know *first*.'

options.name: Push for More Money?
options.description: Risk pushing him too far?

title: Silas Clams Up
description: Silas refuses your offer or demand, too scared or stubborn to cooperate further. 'Get out! I know nothing! Leave me alone!' He might even reach for a weapon under the counter.

options.name: Leave the Shop
options.description: Respect his fear/refusal.

options.name: Attempt Intimidation/Force
options.description: Try to physically threaten him for info/items.

options.name: Try Pickpocketing?
options.description: Attempt to lift something while leaving.

title: Aiding Unbound Escape
description: You offer to help the warned Unbound agents escape the Guardian's notice. One nods sharply. 'Quickly! Cause a scene near the front door. We'll slip out the back.'

options.name: Create a Diversion (Knock over table, start argument)
options.description: Cause a commotion to draw the Guardian's eye.

options.name: Directly Confront the Guardian (Risky)
options.description: Distract Marius by talking to or challenging him.

options.name: Change Mind, Let Them Handle It
options.description: Decide against actively helping.

title: Unbound Reaction (Warned)
description: Having been warned about the Guardian, the Unbound agents become more cautious. They might: finish their drinks and leave quickly via the back OR subtly prepare weapons OR try to blend into the crowd.

options.name: Watch Them Leave
options.description: Observe their departure.

options.name: Alert the Guardian?
options.description: Tell Marius they are preparing something or leaving.

options.name: Mind Your Own Business
options.description: Let events unfold.

title: Lying to the Guardian
description:
You try to lie your way out of the Guardian's suspicion. [Deception check DC 14 vs his Insight].

Success: He seems unconvinced but lets it go for now. 'See that you cause no further trouble.'

Failure: He narrows his eyes. 'I don't believe you. You're interfering. Explain your true purpose, or face the consequences.'

options.name: Back Away Carefully (If Success)
options.description: Retreat, having barely avoided trouble.

options.name: Confess Now (If Failure)
options.description: Tell him you were gathering info.

options.name: Remain Defiant (If Failure)
options.description: Refuse to cooperate.

options.name: Attempt to Flee
options.description: Try to run.

title: Partial Confession (Guardian)
description: You admit to the Guardian you were trying to learn the Unbound's plans. 'They mentioned meeting at the Lighthouse,' you add. He listens, considering your words.

options.name: Offer to Help Him
options.description: Volunteer your services against the Unbound.

options.name: Ask for Leniency
options.description: 'Just trying to understand what's going on. Meant no harm.'

options.name: He Remains Suspicious
options.description: He doesn't fully trust you. 'Stay out of my way.'

title: Defying the Guardian
description: You refuse to explain yourself to the Guardian or challenge his authority. His hand tightens on his axe. 'Interfering with Keeper business carries a heavy price. Last chance: stand down, or be removed.'

options.name: Fight the Guardian
options.description: Engage the Keeper in combat.

options.name: Attempt to Flee
options.description: Try to run now.

options.name: Back Down Now
options.description: Relent and try to explain/confess.

title: Fleeing the Guardian
description: You decide to run from the imposing Guardian mercenary. He might pursue.

options.name: Escape into the Crowd/Street
options.description: Try to lose him in the tavern or outside. [Dex check?]

options.name: He Catches You / Blocks Exit
options.description: He's faster or anticipates your move.

title: Unbound Bluff Success (Suspicion)
description: Your claim of neutrality seems to placate the Unbound agents, though they still watch you with suspicion. 'See that you stay neutral,' one warns, before they turn back to their business or prepare to leave.

options.name: Withdraw Carefully
options.description: Back away and leave them be.

options.name: Try to Offer Information Now
options.description: 'Actually... I overheard the Keeper's plans...' Try to gain their trust.

options.name: Continue Observing Them
options.description: Subtly watch what they do next.

title: Siding with Unbound
description: You offer allegiance or information to the Unbound, perhaps about the Keeper. They seem intrigued. 'You wish to aid the Unbinding? Or just profit from the Keeper's downfall? Prove your use. Tell us what you know. Or help us retrieve the Fragment.'

options.name: Share Information about Keeper
options.description: Tell them the Guardian's location, appearance, or suspected goals.

options.name: Offer to Help Get the Fragment (If you know location)
options.description: Agree to assist them in stealing or retrieving the Tumbler.

options.name: Ask What They Offer in Return
options.description: Inquire about payment or membership.

title: Fleeing Unbound Suspicion
description: Not liking the Unbound's hostile attention, you push past them and make a break for it, running out of the tavern or deeper into the crowd.

options.name: Escape Successfully
options.description: You manage to get away. [Leads back to general tavern/street state].

options.name: They Pursue / Catch You
options.description: They give chase or manage to grab you.

title: Guardian's Knowledge
description: You press the Guardian (Marius) for more details about Loc or the Keepers. He hesitates, then speaks curtly. 'Loc is the Forgotten Locksmith, a primordial entity of chaos and creation, bound for millennia. The Keepers are an ancient order sworn to maintain that binding. Tampering with the Fragments risks cosmic unraveling. That is sufficient for you.' He clearly won't elaborate further.

options.name: Accept His Explanation
options.description: Thank him (or not) and leave.

options.name: Offer to Help Him Again
options.description: Reiterate your offer to assist against the Unbound.

options.name: Seek Elara's Version
options.description: Compare the Keeper's story with the scholar's.

title: Planning Against the Guardian
description: Seeing the Guardian (Marius) as an obstacle, you consider ways to neutralize him. You could try to lure him into a trap, frame him for a crime, steal his weapon or sigil, or perhaps find leverage against him.

options.name: Try to Frame Him (Very Risky)
options.description: Plant stolen goods on him? Accuse him of collaborating with Unbound?

options.name: Plan an Ambush
options.description: Requires finding a suitable location and possibly allies.

options.name: Seek Leverage (Information)
options.description: Try to learn secrets about him from Elara, Silas, or others.

options.name: Focus on Avoidance Instead
options.description: Decide direct confrontation is too risky. Work around him.

title: Stale Sustenance
description: Your few coppers buy a small, hard loaf of stale bread from a market vendor. It's better than nothing, but barely fills the pit in your stomach.

options.name: Look for More Work
options.description: Need a proper job.

options.name: Look for Theft Opportunity
options.description: Need proper coin.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: Nothing left here.

title: Begging for Scraps
description:
Swallowing your pride, you find a busy corner and try begging for coin or food. Most people ignore you, some sneer. [Charisma check DC 13 determines outcome].

Success: A kind soul tosses you a few copper pieces (1d4 CP) or a piece of fruit.

Failure: You receive nothing but scorn, or perhaps a guard tells you to move along.

options.name: Take Meager Alms (If Success)
options.description: Pocket the small charity.

options.name: Move Along (If Failure)
options.description: Begging failed. Try something else.

options.name: Guard Interaction (If Told to Move)
options.description: Deal with the guard's order.

title: Lighthouse Entry Chamber
description: You step inside the base of the Tidecaller Lighthouse. The circular room is stark stone. A winding staircase spirals upwards into darkness. Strange symbols, similar to those on the Tumbler but more complex, are faintly etched into the walls. The gaunt servant closes the heavy door behind you.

options.name: Examine the Symbols
options.description: Study the etchings on the wall. [Investigation/Arcana check?].

options.name: Ascend the Staircase
options.description: Head up towards the main levels.

options.name: Question the Servant
options.description: Ask about the symbols, Valerius, or the job.

title: Inquiring About the Job
description: You ask the servant about the nature of the 'discreet assistance'. His face remains blank. 'The Master requires aid in... calibration. Aligning resonant frequencies. Tasks requiring agility and tolerance for heights. He will explain further.'

options.name: Enter the Lighthouse
options.description: Accept the vague explanation and go inside.

options.name: Press for More Details
options.description: 'Calibration of what? What frequencies?'

options.name: Decline Job, Leave
options.description: Sounds too weird or dangerous.

title: Bluffing Valerius's Servant
description:
You claim to have important information for Valerius. [Deception check DC 14 vs Servant's Insight].

Success: The servant hesitates, then nods slightly. 'The Master values knowledge. Wait here.' He disappears inside for a moment, then returns. 'He will see you. Enter.'

Failure: The servant's eyes narrow fractionally. 'The Master is not expecting information. State your *true* purpose or leave.'

options.name: Enter Lighthouse (If Success)
options.description: Your bluff worked. Now you need to back it up.

options.name: Admit True Purpose (Job/Curiosity) (If Failure)
options.description: Try confessing you saw the notice or are just curious.

options.name: Leave (If Failure)
options.description: Bluff failed. Retreat.

title: Name-Dropping Elara
description: You mention that Elara sent you. The servant pauses. 'Elara? Hmm. The Master respects her... knowledge, if not her methods. Very well. You may enter.' He opens the door.

options.name: Enter the Lighthouse
options.description: Step inside, using Elara's name as your pass.

options.name: Ask Servant About Elara/Valerius Relationship
options.description: 'Do they correspond often?'

title: Turned Away (Lighthouse)
description: You are turned away from the lighthouse door, either by the unhelpful servant or your own caution. The heavy oak door remains closed.

options.name: Try Picking the Lock
options.description: Attempt to bypass the door with Thieves' Tools.

options.name: Scout for Another Entrance (Grate/Climb)
options.description: Look for the cellar grate or try climbing.

options.name: Wait and Observe
options.description: Hide nearby and watch the lighthouse for activity.

options.name: Give Up on Lighthouse
options.description: Decide it's not worth the trouble.

title: Fighting the Servant

enemies.name: Gaunt Servant
enemies.description: Pale, blank-eyed servant defending the lighthouse entrance. Might have unnatural resilience?

description: The gaunt servant blocks your forced entry attempt, moving with surprising speed or strength. He raises his fists or grabs a nearby object to defend the doorway.
limitation: Servant might fight until defeated or until Valerius intervenes. Victory leads to Node 766. Defeat leads to Node 767.

title: Stealthy Lighthouse Entry
description: You successfully bypass the main door lock (or the servant) and slip inside the lighthouse's entry chamber. It's quiet for now. The circular room is stark stone, with a spiral staircase leading up.

options.name: Examine Symbols
options.description: Look closely at the wall etchings.

options.name: Ascend Staircase Stealthily
options.description: Move quietly up the stairs.

options.name: Listen for Movement Above
options.description: Pause and listen before ascending.

title: Lockpick Trap / Defeat Aftermath
description: Your attempt to enter the lighthouse fails, either due to a trapped lock or being defeated by the servant. You are outside, possibly injured or suffering from poison.

options.name: Tend Wounds/Seek Healing
options.description: Address any injuries or poison effects.

options.name: Scout for Another Entrance Again
options.description: Check the grate or look for climbing routes.

options.name: Wait and Observe
options.description: Watch the lighthouse from a distance.

options.name: Give Up on Lighthouse
options.description: Too difficult or dangerous.

title: Forcing the Cellar Grate
description:
You put your shoulder (or crowbar) to the rusted cellar grate. [Strength check DC 16].

Success: With a loud groan and shower of rust, the grate breaks or pops open, revealing a dark opening leading down.

Failure: The grate holds firm, stubbornly resisting your efforts. You might have made some noise.

options.name: Enter Cellar (If Success)
options.description: Descend into the opening.

options.name: Try Picking Lock (If Failed Force)
options.description: Check if there's a lock mechanism to pick.

options.name: Give Up on Grate
options.description: Try the main door or climbing.

options.name: Listen for Reaction (If Failed/Noisy)
options.description: Did the noise alert anyone inside?

title: Grate Mechanism Search
description:
You carefully examine the cellar grate and surrounding stones. [Investigation check DC 15].

Success: You find a cleverly hidden lever camouflaged as rock OR a small keyhole almost filled with dirt.

Failure: No obvious latch or lock mechanism is visible. It seems purely rusted shut or requires brute force.

options.name: Try Lever (If Success - Lever)
options.description: Attempt to pull the hidden lever.

options.name: Try Picking Keyhole (If Success - Keyhole)
options.description: Clean the keyhole and use Thieves' Tools. [DC 14?].

options.name: Resort to Force (If Failure)
options.description: Attempt to break the grate open.

options.name: Give Up on Grate
options.description: Try another entrance.

title: Lighthouse Climb
description:
You begin scaling the weathered stone wall of the lighthouse. The wind whips around you, and the sea crashes below. [Athletics check DC 15].

Success: You make steady progress upwards towards the first set of barred windows.

Failure: You lose your grip on the slippery stone and fall! [Take 1d6 bludgeoning damage, land near base].
