options.name: Reach Window Level (If Success)
options.description: You arrive at the height of the barred windows.

options.name: Try Again After Fall (If Failure)
options.description: If able, attempt the climb again.

options.name: Give Up Climbing
options.description: Too difficult/dangerous. Try another way.

title: Climbing to Loose Bar
description:
Focusing on the window with the potentially loose bar, you make the climb. [Athletics check DC 14 - slightly easier target].

Success: You reach the window. The bar is indeed loose in its socket.

Failure: You slip and fall. [Take 1d6 bludgeoning damage].

options.name: Attempt to Remove Bar (If Success)
options.description: Try to pry the loose bar out. [Strength check?].

options.name: Try Again After Fall (If Failure)
options.description: If able, attempt the climb again.

options.name: Give Up Climbing
options.description: Try another way.

title: Finding an Inn/Tavern (Generic)
description: You find another tavern or inn in Nestlebrook, perhaps 'The Salty Siren' (quieter) or 'The Leaky Barrel' (rowdier).

options.name: Enter 'The Salty Siren'
options.description: Seek a calmer atmosphere.

options.name: Enter 'The Leaky Barrel'
options.description: Brave another dive.

options.name: Keep Looking
options.description: Search for other options.

title: Wreckage Cargo?
description: You ask the fisherman if any valuable cargo washed ashore from the 'Seafoam's Kiss'. He snorts. 'Silver? Nah. Just splintered wood, torn sails... and one odd crate, sealed tight. Dockmaster took it, locked it up. Said it felt... wrong.'

options.name: Ask About the Dockmaster/Crate Location
options.description: 'Where does the dockmaster keep seized goods?'

options.name: Consider Stealing the Crate
options.description: Plan a potential heist targeting the dockmaster's storage.

options.name: Dismiss It
options.description: Probably nothing important.

title: Confronting the Tail
description: You abruptly turn and confront the nondescript man who was tailing you. He looks startled. 'Can I... help you?' he asks, trying to appear innocent.

options.name: Demand to Know Who He Is/Works For
options.description: 'Stop following me. Who sent you? Silas? Someone else?'

options.name: Intimidate Him
options.description: 'Following people can be hazardous to your health. Leave.'

options.name: Attack Him
options.description: Assume hostility and attack.

title: Losing the Tail
description: Knowing you were being followed, you use your knowledge of alleys, crowds, and timing to successfully shake the tail. You feel reasonably sure you're no longer being watched, for now.

options.name: Proceed with Caution
options.description: Continue your plans, but remain wary.

options.name: Leave Town Now
options.description: Get out while you're sure you're not followed.

options.name: Try to Find Out Who Sent Him
options.description: Go ask Silas or others who might hire spies.

title: Apothecary Search
description:
You quickly scan the shelves in the back room. [Perception check DC 13].

Success: You spot several vials of Healing Potion OR a pouch of valuable herbs (Nightshade? Moonpetal?) OR a locked strongbox under the counter.

Failure: Mostly common herbs, empty bottles, and mundane supplies.

options.name: Take Potions/Herbs (If Success)
options.description: Grab the easily accessible valuables.

options.name: Attempt Strongbox Lock (If Success)
options.description: Try to pick the strongbox lock. [Thieves' Tools DC 15?].

options.name: Check Front Shop (If Failure)
options.description: Move past the curtain to check the till.

options.name: Leave Quietly
options.description: Nothing worth the risk here. Exit the way you came.

title: Checking the Apothecary Till
description: You slip past the curtain into the front shop area. The till drawer is closed. [Try opening quietly - Sleight of Hand DC 12? OR Force it - Strength DC 10, noisy?].

options.name: Open Quietly (Sleight of Hand)
options.description: Attempt to open the till without noise.

options.name: Force Drawer Open (Noisy)
options.description: Pry or smash the till open.

options.name: Leave It, Search Elsewhere
options.description: Don't risk the till. Go back to the shelves or leave.

title: Waiting Out Movement (Apothecary)
description: You wait patiently in the shadows outside or just inside the window. After a few tense minutes, the shuffling sounds cease. It seems quiet again.

options.name: Proceed with Burglary Now
options.description: Enter or continue searching the shop.

options.name: Still Too Risky, Abort
options.description: Decide against it even now.

title: Jeweler Smash and Grab
description: The grille is down! You rush into the jeweler's shop. Display cases glitter with jewelry. You hear shouts from outside - the Watch is coming! You have seconds.

options.name: Grab Nearest/Easiest Items
options.description: Snatch whatever is closest and run. [Quick Perception/Sleight of Hand?].

options.name: Target Specific Valuable?
options.description: Try to quickly identify and grab the most valuable piece. [Slower, riskier Perception?].

options.name: Flee Immediately Empty-Handed
options.description: Panic! Get out now before the guards arrive.

title: Fleeing Noisy Burglary
description: The loud noise from attempting to force the jeweler's grille (or smashing it) attracts immediate attention. You hear guards shouting and running towards the shop. You have to flee into the night.

options.name: Escape into Alleys
options.description: Try to lose the guards in the maze.

options.name: Head for Docks
options.description: Try to escape via the waterfront.

options.name: Attempt to Hide Nearby
options.description: Find immediate cover and hope they run past. [Stealth check].

title: Inside the Jeweler's Shop
description: You slip silently through the picked grille lock into the jeweler's shop. Moonlight glints off necklaces, rings, and gems in glass display cases. It's eerily quiet. There might be pressure plates or magical wards.

options.name: Check for Traps First
options.description: Carefully examine the floor and display cases. [Investigation check].

options.name: Target Display Cases
options.description: Attempt to quietly open or break the glass cases.

options.name: Look for a Safe/Strongbox
options.description: Search for where the most valuable items might be secured.

title: Inside the Antiquities Shop
description: You enter the 'Curios & Relics' shop. It smells of dust and old parchment. Shelves are crammed with oddities: pottery shards, faded maps, strange figurines, tarnished jewelry. Stairs likely lead up to the owner's quarters.

options.name: Search for Obvious Valuables
options.description: Quickly scan for anything that looks like gold, silver, or gems.

options.name: Look for Unique/Interesting Artifacts
options.description: Examine the oddities more closely. Maybe find something unusual? [Investigation/Arcana check?].

options.name: Check the Till/Counter
options.description: Look for any cash left behind.

options.name: Listen for Owner Upstairs
options.description: Check if the owner is moving around.

title: Antiquities Window Entry
description: You carefully slide open the grimy, slightly ajar back window and slip inside the antiquities shop, likely into a dusty storeroom.

options.name: Search the Storeroom
options.description: Look for valuables or interesting items here first.

options.name: Enter the Main Shop Area
options.description: Move into the front of the store.

options.name: Listen for Occupants
options.description: Pause and check for sounds from upstairs.

title: Antiquities Back Door Pick
description: The simple lock on the back door yields easily to your Thieves' Tools. You open the door into a small storeroom.

options.name: Search the Storeroom
options.description: Look for valuables here.

options.name: Enter the Main Shop Area
options.description: Move into the front.

options.name: Listen for Occupants
options.description: Check for sounds from upstairs.

title: Paying for Passage
description: You find a captain willing to take you on as a passenger. After haggling, you agree on a price (e.g., 15 GP for coastal, 30 GP for longer voyage). You pay the coin.

options.name: Board the Ship
options.description: Prepare for departure.

options.name: Gather Rumors Before Boarding
options.description: Ask other passengers or crew about the destination.

title: Working for Passage
description: A grizzled captain eyes you up and down. 'Work yer passage? Fine. Need hands swabbing decks and hauling ropes. Don't expect pay, just food and a bunk. Don't cause trouble.' You agree to the terms.

options.name: Board the Ship as Crew
options.description: Join the crew and prepare for hard work.

options.name: Ask About the Ship/Destination
options.description: Inquire where the ship is heading.

title: Describing the Thugs
description: You give the guards the best description you can of the two thugs who attacked you in the alley. They make a note. 'We'll keep an eye out,' one says noncommittally.

options.name: Thank Them and Leave
options.description: Nothing more to do here.

options.name: Ask About Known Troublemakers
options.description: 'Do these descriptions match any local gangs?'

title: Leading the Guards
description: You offer to lead the guards back to the alley where the attack happened. They agree, and you guide them back into the dark, narrow passage.

options.name: Thugs Are Gone
options.description: The alley is empty. The guards shrug.

options.name: Find Evidence?
options.description: Maybe the thugs dropped something? [Perception check].

options.name: Thugs Are Still There! (Unlikely Ambush?)
options.description: The thugs haven't left and might fight the guards (and you?).

title: Guard Believes Lie
description: The guard seems to accept your explanation (shortcut/lost). 'Alright,' he says, 'Just be more careful. These alleys ain't safe.' He might offer directions or just move on.

options.name: Ask for Directions
options.description: Get pointed towards docks/market/etc.

options.name: Thank Him and Leave
options.description: Continue on your way.

title: Guard Accepts Partial Truth
description: Telling the guard you were avoiding trouble from the tavern seems plausible. 'Happens,' he sighs. 'Still, find a better route next time. Move along.'

options.name: Ask About Tavern Trouble
options.description: 'Any specific trouble I should know about?'

options.name: Thank Him and Leave
options.description: Continue on your way.

title: Guard Suspicion
description: Getting defensive makes the guard narrow his eyes. 'Just asking routine questions. No need to get touchy... unless you've got something to hide?' He seems more suspicious of you now.

options.name: Try to Backpedal/Apologize
options.description: 'Sorry, just shaken up from the attack.'

options.name: Maintain Defiance
options.description: Stick to your guns.

options.name: Walk Away Abruptly
options.description: End the conversation and leave.

title: Reaching Town Outskirts
description: Your navigation through the back ways leads you to the edge of Nestlebrook. Fields or woods stretch out before you, offering escape or a place to hide.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: Continue out of town.

options.name: Find Shelter on Outskirts (Shack?)
options.description: Look for the abandoned shack or other cover outside town.

options.name: Return to Town Center via Different Route
options.description: Head back towards the market/taverns.

title: Lost in Back Alleys
description: Focusing only on evasion, you twist and turn through the alleys until you're thoroughly lost. You emerge onto an unfamiliar street. Where are you?

options.name: Try to Get Bearings (Look for Landmarks)
options.description: Scan for the lighthouse, docks, market square, etc.

options.name: Ask Someone for Directions
options.description: Approach a local.

options.name: Explore the Current Area
options.description: See what opportunities this unfamiliar street offers.

title: Mucking Out Stalls
description: You spend a smelly hour mucking out horse stalls. The stablehand watches you work, then grudgingly gives you a chunk of bread and cheese OR 3 copper pieces.

options.name: Eat Reward/Take Coppers
options.description: Accept the payment.

options.name: Ask Stablehand for Information
options.description: While working or after, try to get local rumors.

title: Paying for Stable Stay
description: The stablehand demands payment for your unauthorized stay in the stable. 'Five coppers, or I call the Watch for trespassin'!'

options.name: Pay 5 Coppers (If Able)
options.description: Reluctantly hand over the coin.

options.name: Offer to Work Instead
options.description: Reiterate offer to muck out stalls.

options.name: Refuse/Unable to Pay
options.description: Argue or admit you're broke.

title: Stable Findings Acquired
description: You pocket the coil of rope OR the few copper pieces found hidden in the stable.

options.name: Leave the Stable
options.description: Exit quietly.

title: Intimidating the Stablehand
description:
You try to stare down the stablehand, projecting menace. [Intimidation check DC 13].

Success: He falters, lowering the pitchfork slightly. 'Alright, alright! Just... just get out!'

Failure: He grips the pitchfork tighter. 'Think yer tough? Get out before I call the lads!'

options.name: Leave Peacefully (If Success)
options.description: Your threat worked. Exit.

options.name: Fight Him (If Failure)
options.description: Intimidation failed. Combat.

options.name: Back Down (If Failure)
options.description: Give up the intimidation attempt.

title: Fighting the Stablehand

enemies.name: Stablehand

weapons.name: Pitchfork
weapons.description: A long farm tool with sharp tines.

enemies.description: A simple worker defending his workplace.

description: The stablehand jabs at you with his pitchfork! Combat begins in the confines of the stable.
limitation: Stablehand might try to flee or call for help if injured. Victory leads to Node 814. Defeat leads to Node 815.

title: Finn's Illness
description: You ask Finn about 'the Shakes'. He coughs. 'Got it down the docks... bad water, maybe? Or somethin' crawled outta that crate the Dockmaster seized from the wreck... Felt wrong, that crate did. Gave me the chills first, then the fever... then the shakes... Dockmaster quarantined the crate, threw me out...' His voice trails off.

options.name: Ask More About the Crate
options.description: 'What did the crate look like? Where is it now?'

options.name: Ask About Valerius/Lighthouse Again
options.description: Return to questioning him about his former employer.

options.name: Offer Help (Medicine?)
options.description: See if you have any herbs or skills to ease his symptoms.

title: Fetching Barrel Water
description: You collect murky water from the rainwater barrel. It smells stagnant. Returning to the shack, you offer it to Finn.

options.name: He Drinks It (Gratefully)
options.description: He drinks, seems slightly better, and might offer info.

options.name: He Refuses It (Too Murky)
options.description: He weakly shakes his head at the smelly water.

options.name: Try the Public Well Instead
options.description: Decide the barrel water isn't good enough.

title: Fetching Well Water
description: You make your way to the public well near the market square. You draw fresh, clean water and return to the abandoned shack to give it to Finn.

options.name: He Drinks It (Gratefully)
options.description: He drinks, seems slightly better, and might offer info.

options.name: He's Worse/Unconscious Upon Return
options.description: You took too long? His condition deteriorated.

title: Helping Finn (Further Aid)
description:
You try to help the ailing Finn further. [Requires Medicine check DC 14 or specific item like Healer's Kit/Antitoxin?].

Success: You manage to ease his fever or stop the tremors slightly. He seems more lucid.

Failure: Your efforts have no effect, or you lack the necessary supplies/skills.

options.name: Ask Questions While Lucid (If Success)
options.description: Use the chance to ask about Valerius/Lighthouse/Crate.

options.name: Leave Him Be (If Failure)
options.description: Can't help further. Leave the shack.

title: Searching Finn's Belongings
description: While Finn is delirious or unconscious, you quickly check his meager belongings. You find: a few copper pieces (1d4 CP) OR a crudely drawn map fragment showing coastal rocks OR nothing of value.

options.name: Take Findings
options.description: Pocket the coppers or map fragment.

options.name: Leave Him Be
options.description: Find nothing or feel guilty. Leave.

title: Clue Left by Finn
description: Searching where Finn lay, you find: a small wooden token carved with a wave symbol OR a torn piece of parchment with the name 'Valerius' scribbled OR faint tracks leading towards the docks.

options.name: Investigate Wave Token
options.description: Examine the token. Recognize it? [History/Investigation?]

options.name: Keep Note Fragment
options.description: Another link to Valerius.

options.name: Follow Tracks to Docks
options.description: See where Finn went.

options.name: Ignore Clue, Leave Shack
options.description: Leave.

title: Market Food
description: You find a stall in the market selling hot meat pies or fish stew for a few copper pieces. It smells wonderful compared to the alley.

options.name: Buy Food
options.description: Spend some coppers on a warm meal.

options.name: Attempt to Steal Food?
options.description: Try to snatch a pie when the vendor is distracted. [Sleight of Hand DC 13].

options.name: Move On Hungry
options.description: Can't afford it or won't risk theft.

title: Navigating the Sewers
description: You splash through the foul tunnels beneath Nestlebrook. It's a maze of dripping pipes and narrow walkways. You hear rats skittering nearby. Which way do you go?

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Follow Flow Towards Sea Outlet
options.description: Try to find an exit near the harbor.

options.name: Look for Manhole/Grate Upwards
options.description: Try to find an exit back to the streets.

options.name: Explore Deeper Tunnels
options.description: See what secrets the sewers hold. [Risk encounters?]

title: Storage Room Search
description:
You quickly search the storage room you entered via the back door. It contains crates, barrels, mundane supplies... [Perception check DC 13].

Success: You find a small hidden compartment with a few GP OR a useful item (rope, crowbar?) OR hear voices from the main room.

Failure: Just storage.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Take Item/Coin (If Success)
options.description: Grab the loot.

options.name: Eavesdrop on Voices (If Success)
options.description: Listen to the conversation in the main room.

options.name: Exit Back the Way You Came
options.description: Decide to leave.

options.name: Enter Main Room
options.description: Proceed further into the building.

title: Rooftop Navigation
description: Moving across the rooftops of Nestlebrook requires balance and nerve. You leap small gaps, scramble over chimneys, trying to find a safe way down or a good vantage point.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Find Safe Descent Route
options.description: Look for sturdy drainpipes, low roofs, or quiet alleys to climb down into. [Perception check].

options.name: Spot Something Interesting Below
options.description: Notice unusual activity, a meeting, or an opportunity in the streets/alleys below. [Perception check].

options.name: Keep Moving Across Rooftops
options.description: Continue navigating the roofscape.

options.name: Risk a Difficult Jump/Climb Down
options.description: Attempt a more dangerous descent. [Acrobatics/Athletics check].

title: Rooftop Hideout
description: You find a hidden spot on the rooftops - perhaps behind a large chimney stack or in the shadow of a water tower. You can rest here briefly and observe the streets below.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Rest and Wait
options.description: Catch your breath, wait for things to cool down.

options.name: Observe Streets Below
options.description: Scan for pursuers, guards, or opportunities. [Perception check].

options.name: Plan Descent
options.description: Look for a safe way down.

title: Stowaway's Vigil
description: You remain hidden in the ship's hold as it sails. Days pass. Your rations dwindle (if you had any). You hear the crew moving about above. Staying hidden indefinitely is impossible.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Risk Emerging for Food/Water
options.description: Try to sneak out at night to find supplies.

options.name: Await Landfall
options.description: Hope the ship reaches port before you starve or are discovered.

options.name: Try to Determine Destination
options.description: Listen to crew talk, look for clues about where the ship is heading.

title: Cargo Hold Foraging
description:
Under cover of darkness or when the hold seems empty, you creep out of your hiding place to search for supplies. [Stealth check DC 13].

Success: You find a cask of fresh water and some hardtack biscuits OR maybe unsecured cargo you could examine.

Failure: A crew member doing rounds discovers you!

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Take Supplies, Return to Hiding (If Success)
options.description: Replenish your water/food and retreat.

options.name: Examine Cargo (If Success)
options.description: Check any interesting crates or containers.

options.name: Face Discovery (If Failure)
options.description: Try to talk, bribe, fight, or flee.

title: Stowaway Reveal Attempt
description: You decide to risk emerging from hiding, hoping to blend in or plead your case to the crew now that you're far from land. You step out onto the deck or into a main passageway.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Crew Reacts with Hostility
options.description: They immediately treat you as a prisoner or threat.

options.name: Crew Reacts with Weary Acceptance
options.description: They grumble but put you to work.

options.name: Crew Reacts with Curiosity/Suspicion
options.description: They question you intensely about who you are and why you stowed away.

title: Working Passage (Mid-Voyage)
description: The crew allows you to stay, but you're put to the hardest, dirtiest jobs: swabbing decks, cleaning bilges, assisting the cook. You earn basic food and a rough place to sleep.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Endure the Work Until Landfall
options.description: Keep your head down and do the work.

options.name: Try to Befriend Crew Members
options.description: Gather information about the ship, destination, or crew.

options.name: Look for Opportunities (Theft?)
options.description: Even as crew, maybe lift something valuable?

title: Thrown Off Ship
description: You're unceremoniously thrown back onto the docks of Nestlebrook/Seabrook. The ship departs without you. Your attempt to escape via sea has failed.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Try Another Ship?
options.description: Look for another vessel to stow away on.

options.name: Seek Work on Docks
options.description: Try to earn coin.

options.name: Head Back into Town
options.description: Return to the taverns/streets.

options.name: Leave Town Overland
options.description: Give up on sea travel.

title: Fighting Crew Member

enemies.name: Tough Sailor

weapons.name: Belaying Pin
weapons.description: A short, heavy wooden or metal pin.

enemies.description: An experienced sailor defending his ship.

description: The crew member who caught you tries to subdue you, grabbing a heavy belaying pin!

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

limitation: Sailor will likely call for help. Combat might attract other crew. Victory leads to Node 841. Defeat leads to Node 842.

title: Deeper into the Ship
description: You manage to evade or defeat the crew member and dash deeper into the ship's interior - perhaps down a hatch into the hold, or along a narrow passageway.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Find New Hiding Place
options.description: Quickly find somewhere else to conceal yourself. [Stealth check].

options.name: Barricade Yourself?
options.description: Try to block a door or hatch.

options.name: Keep Moving, Explore Ship
options.description: Continue exploring while trying to avoid crew.

title: Hiding Under Pier
description: You manage to scramble or swim under the pier, clinging to the slimy pilings in the cold, dark water. Above, you hear footsteps and shouts (pursuers? crew?).

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Wait for Them to Leave
options.description: Stay hidden until the sounds fade. [Stealth check].

options.name: Move Along Under Pier
options.description: Try to sneak further along under the docks.

options.name: Spotted!
options.description: Someone spots you clinging to the pilings!

title: Ferry Escape
description: You successfully land on the ferry deck as it pulls away from the pier. Your pursuers shout impotently from the dock. You've escaped them, but now you're on a ferry with other passengers, heading... where?

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Blend In with Passengers
options.description: Try to act casual, observe others.

options.name: Ask Destination
options.description: Inquire from a crew member or passenger where the ferry is going.

options.name: Find Place to Hide on Ferry
options.description: Look for a quiet corner or storage area.

title: Emerging from Harbor
description: You haul yourself out of the cold harbor water onto a deserted stretch of beach or a low pier, shivering and dripping. You seem to have escaped pursuit for the moment.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Find Shelter to Warm Up/Dry Off
options.description: Look for the abandoned shack or other cover.

options.name: Head Back Towards Town (Cautiously)
options.description: Return to the main part of Nestlebrook.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook via Coastline
options.description: Start walking along the coast away from town.

title: Struggling in the Water
description:
The cold water saps your strength rapidly. You struggle to stay afloat, gasping for air. [CON save DC 13 to avoid exhaustion/drowning].

Success: You manage to keep your head above water, but you're weakening.

Failure: You start to sink, water filling your lungs...

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Keep Struggling Towards Shore (If Success)
options.description: Make one last desperate attempt to swim. [Another check?].

options.name: Get Rescued? (If Failure)
options.description: Perhaps a boat notices or someone throws a rope?.

options.name: Drown
options.description: The cold water claims you. [Game Over?]

title: Jail Cell
description: You are thrown into a small, damp stone cell. A straw pallet serves as a bed. The heavy barred door clangs shut. You are imprisoned. Your confiscated items (including the Tumbler, if you had it) are likely in the guard captain's office.

options.name: Examine the Cell
options.description: Look for weaknesses, loose stones, potential tools.

options.name: Wait for Guard / Interrogation
options.description: See who comes to talk to you.

options.name: Try to Talk to Other Prisoners (If Any)
options.description: Gather information or potential allies.

options.name: Attempt to Sleep
options.description: Rest despite the grim surroundings.

title: Guard Interrogation
description: The guard captain, a stern woman with a no-nonsense air, enters the cell block. 'Alright, let's have it,' she says. 'Why were you stealing from Master Borin / the halfling? And what's this strange device we confiscated?' (Referring to the Tumbler, if applicable).

options.name: Confess to Theft, Plead Need
options.description: Admit guilt but try to gain sympathy.

options.name: Deny Everything / Claim Mistake
options.description: Maintain innocence.

options.name: Offer Information (Factions/Lighthouse?)
options.description: Try to bargain for release by offering intel.

options.name: Remain Silent
options.description: Refuse to answer.

title: Noticed Arrest
description: Your loud protests during the arrest, possibly mentioning the strange device, attract attention. Later, in your cell, you might hear whispers outside, or a guard might mention that 'someone' was asking about the noisy half-elf prisoner.

options.name: Try to Identify Observer/Inquirer
options.description: Listen carefully, try to see who might be interested.

options.name: Assume It's Trouble (Unbound/Keeper)
options.description: Prepare for potential hostile interest.

options.name: Hope It's Help (Elara?)
options.description: Could someone be trying to assist you?

title: Merchant Heads to Silas
description: You follow Borin the merchant as he hurries to Silas's pawn shop, clutching the Tumbler. He disappears inside.

options.name: Wait Outside and Watch
options.description: See if Borin comes out with coin or if someone else arrives.

options.name: Try to Eavesdrop at Door/Window
options.description: Listen to their conversation. [Perception check].

options.name: Enter the Shop After Borin
options.description: Confront them both.

title: Merchant Heads to Lighthouse
description: You follow Borin the merchant (or the Unbound agents) as they take the path leading out of Nestlebrook towards the Tidecaller Lighthouse on the cliffs.

options.name: Continue Following Discreetly
options.description: Maintain pursuit towards the lighthouse. [Stealth check?]

options.name: Try to Get Ahead of Them
options.description: Find a shortcut or run ahead to reach the lighthouse first.

options.name: Ambush Them on the Path
options.description: Find a suitable spot to attack and retrieve the Tumbler (if Borin has it).

title: Ambushing the Merchant

enemies.name: Merchant Borin

weapons.name: Fists / Heavy Pouch
weapons.description: Surprised and panicked, maybe swings his pouch.

enemies.description: Not a fighter, likely tries to flee or surrender if hurt.

description: You jump out from hiding, confronting the startled merchant Borin as he travels with the Tumbler. 'Hand it over!' you demand.
limitation: Merchant is likely to surrender or flee rather than fight to the end. Victory leads to Node 867. Defeat (unlikely) leads to Node 868.

title: Reclaiming Tumbler (Standoff/Ambush)
description: You successfully recover the Whispering Tumbler from the merchant Borin, either through intimidation or combat.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device. Reclaimed.

options.name: Check Merchant's Pockets (If Combat)
options.description: Loot him quickly.

options.name: Leave the Area
options.description: Disappear before guards or others arrive.

options.name: Head to Lighthouse?
options.description: Continue towards the likely destination.

title: Two-on-One Standoff Fight

enemies.name: Merchant Borin
enemies.description: Likely tries to stay behind the Unbound.

enemies.name: Unbound Agent

weapons.name: Curved Dagger
weapons.description: A simple but sharp curved knife.

enemies.description: Sees you as an obstacle to the Tumbler.

description: Seeing you as a common threat or obstacle, both the merchant and the Unbound agent turn on you!
limitation: Merchant might flee if Unbound is defeated. Victory leads to Node 869. Defeat leads to Node 870.

title: Standoff Intimidation
description:
You attempt to intimidate both the merchant and the Unbound agent into handing over the Tumbler. [Intimidation check DC 15].

Success: The merchant is terrified, the Unbound perhaps wary. One might toss the Tumbler towards you to avoid conflict.

Failure: They are unimpressed or see weakness. Prepare for a fight.

options.name: Grab Tumbler, Flee (If Success)
options.description: Snatch the artifact and run.

options.name: Fight (If Failure)
options.description: Intimidation failed.

title: Siding with Unbound (Standoff)
description: You offer to help the Unbound agent secure the Tumbler from the merchant. The agent nods curtly. 'Deal with him. The Fragment is the prize.'

options.name: Attack the Merchant
options.description: Turn on Borin.

options.name: Intimidate the Merchant
options.description: Try to scare Borin into handing it over.

title: Siding with Merchant (Standoff)
description: You offer to help the merchant (Borin) deal with the dangerous Unbound agent. Borin looks relieved but scared. 'Help me get away from this lunatic!'

options.name: Attack the Unbound Agent
options.description: Fight the cultist.

options.name: Create Diversion for Merchant's Escape
options.description: Cause a commotion so Borin can flee (potentially with the Tumbler).

title: Trading Dirt (Silas)
description: You offer Silas information damaging to Borin in exchange for secrets about the Tumbler. Silas considers, then leans closer. 'Alright... Borin's last 'lost' shipment wasn't wood, it was smuggled weapons... Now, tell me, what do *you* know about this Tumbler that makes it worth risking Borin's wrath?'

options.name: Share Tumbler Info (Key Fragment, Factions)
options.description: Tell him what you learned from Elara/Guardian.

options.name: Bluff/Exaggerate Tumbler Knowledge
options.description: Make it sound more important than you know.

options.name: Keep Info, End Negotiation
options.description: Decide not to share.

title: Selling Info (Borin)
description: You offer Borin damaging information about Silas (e.g., fencing stolen goods, dealing with dangerous types). He listens intently. 'Interesting... very interesting. This information could be... valuable. How valuable? Say, 30 gold pieces?'

options.name: Accept 30 GP
options.description: Take the payment.

options.name: Haggle for More
options.description: 'This could ruin him. Worth at least 50.' [Persuasion check].

options.name: Trade Info for Info (About Tumbler?)
options.description: Ask about the strange device he had instead of coin.

title: Asking Borin About Tumbler
description: You ask Borin about the strange metal device he possessed. He frowns. 'That thing? Found it in a crate from the northern salvage... felt wrong. Cold. Hummed sometimes. Silas offered me practically nothing for it... until those cloaked thugs showed up asking about it. Then he got interested.'

options.name: Ask About Northern Salvage
options.description: 'Where exactly did the crate come from?'

options.name: Ask About Cloaked Thugs
options.description: 'What did the thugs want? Unbound?'

options.name: Thank Him, Leave
options.description: Useful information.

title: Borin Uninterested
description: Borin seems suspicious of you or simply uninterested in dealing with a street rat. He dismisses you curtly. 'I have business to attend to.'

options.name: Leave Him Be
options.description: Find other leads.

options.name: Try Pickpocketing Him?
options.description: If he won't deal, maybe steal? [Risky].

options.name: Follow Him?
options.description: See where he goes next.

title: Dimming the Light?
description: You ask the old sailor how one might (hypothetically) dim the lighthouse light. He looks horrified. 'Dim it?! Are ye mad? That'd be invitin' doom! Only the Keeper... Valerius... knows the workings. Complex clockwork and lenses, tied to the tides themselves. Tamperin' would be suicide!'

options.name: File Info (Mechanism is Complex)
options.description: Note that Valerius controls it and it's intricate.

options.name: Ask if Anyone Else Tried
options.description: 'Has anyone ever *tried* to tamper with it?'

options.name: Thank Him, Change Subject
options.description: Avoid sounding too interested.

title: Looting the Merchant (Brawl)
description: While the merchant Borin is unconscious from the brawl, you quickly check his pockets. You find his coin purse containing 25 GP.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 25 gold.

options.name: Slip Away with Loot
options.description: Exit the tavern during the continued commotion.

title: Seeking Temple Healing
description: You find a small shrine dedicated to a sea or luck deity. An acolyte offers healing prayers for a donation (5-10 GP) or tending to wounds/disease for a slightly larger fee (15 GP).

options.name: Pay for Healing (If Coin)
options.description: Spend the gold for magical healing.

options.name: Offer Services Instead?
options.description: Ask if you can work for healing (cleaning shrine?).

options.name: Cannot Afford, Leave
options.description: Unable to pay. Seek other options.

title: Seeking Elara's Aid (Healing)
description: You go to Elara's cottage, showing her your injuries or describing your illness. She examines you with sharp eyes. 'Crude wounds... or perhaps something worse from the cellar filth. I can brew a poultice or tonic, but my ingredients are not free. 10 Gold Pieces, or perform a small task for me.'

options.name: Pay 10 GP
options.description: Buy the remedy.

options.name: Ask About the Task
options.description: 'What task do you need done?'

options.name: Cannot Afford/Refuse Task, Leave
options.description: Unable or unwilling to meet her price.

title: Barkeep Mollified
description: The barkeep grunts, somewhat appeased by your apology. 'Fine. Just don't lie to me again. Now, you buyin' somethin' or just takin' up space?'

options.name: Order Cheap Drink/Food
options.description: Spend a few coppers to stay.

options.name: Ask About Work (Again?)
options.description: See if he has any *other* jobs.

options.name: Leave the Tavern
options.description: Decide to leave anyway.

title: Ejected Forcefully
description: You pick yourself up from the dusty street outside the Drunken Sailor, having been forcefully ejected by the barkeep. Your pride is bruised, maybe your body too.

options.name: Seek Different Tavern
options.description: Try your luck elsewhere.

options.name: Look for Work/Theft on Street
options.description: Focus on opportunities outside the tavern.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: This town is hostile.

title: Seabrook Gang Lead
description: You pocket the note mentioning a meeting at 'The Salty Dog' tavern in Seabrook. This seems like a solid lead if you head to the next coastal town.

items.name: Note (Salty Dog Meeting)
items.description: Mentions a meeting at 'The Salty Dog' in Seabrook.

options.name: Proceed to Nestlebrook Docks
options.description: Continue your original plan.

options.name: Plan to Head to Seabrook
options.description: Decide to investigate this lead.

title: Guard Finds Injured Darryn
description: A guard patrol finds you injured on the street. 'What happened here?' the guard asks, looking you over. 'Looks like you lost a fight.'

options.name: Report the Mugging
options.description: Tell them about the thugs in the alley.

options.name: Ask for Help/Healer
options.description: Request assistance for your injuries.

options.name: Lie/Be Evasive
options.description: Claim you fell or don't remember.

title: Kind Stranger Encounter
description: A kind-faced local (perhaps a priestess, merchant, or simple villager) stops, concerned by your injured state. 'Gods! Are you alright? Here, let me help you.' They offer an arm or perhaps basic first aid.

options.name: Accept Help Gratefully
options.description: Allow them to assist you.

options.name: Refuse Help Suspiciously
options.description: Wave them away, distrustful.

options.name: Ask for Specific Aid (Healer/Shelter)
options.description: Request they guide you somewhere safe.

title: Ignored on the Street
description: Passersby pointedly ignore your plight, hurrying past or pretending not to see you lying injured. You're on your own.

options.name: Try to Reach Shelter
options.description: Attempt to find the stables or abandoned shack.

options.name: Try to Find Guards
options.description: Look specifically for the Watch.

options.name: Rest Where You Are
options.description: Give up for now, rest on the street.

title: Trouble Finds You (Alley Rest)
description: While resting weakly in the alley, you attract unwanted attention. Choose or roll: 1-2: Giant Rats investigate, 3-4: Another opportunistic Thug approaches, 5-6: A Guard Patrol discovers you.

options.name: Fight Giant Rats (Injured)
options.description: Face the hungry rodents.

options.name: Face New Thug (Injured)
options.description: Another predator smells weakness.

options.name: Deal with Guard Patrol (Injured)
options.description: Explain your situation to the guards.

title: Collapse on Docks
description: Your injuries and exhaustion finally catch up. You collapse onto the hard planks of the docks, the world fading to black...

options.name: Wake Up Later (Found by Someone?)
options.description: Regain consciousness later, possibly moved or aided.

options.name: Wake Up Robbed Again
options.description: Someone took advantage while you were out.

title: Begging for Passage (Injured)
description: Leaning heavily against a post, you appeal to passing sailors or captains, showing your injuries and begging for passage or help.

options.name: Someone Takes Pity (Offers Work/Passage)
options.description: A captain agrees to take you on, perhaps out of pity. [Leads to 516 or 543].

options.name: Rejected / Told to See Healer
options.description: They refuse or suggest you find aid elsewhere.

options.name: Offered Medical Aid?
options.description: Maybe a ship's surgeon offers basic help.

title: Escaping the Guards (Bound)
description: You manage to free yourself from the bonds just as guards arrive in the alley! You have a split second to act.

options.name: Bolt Past Them
options.description: Try to run out of the alley before they can react. [Acrobatics/Stealth?].

options.name: Try to Hide Again
options.description: Duck back behind crates or into shadows.

options.name: Surrender Now
options.description: Give up.

title: Paying for Damages
description: You offer to pay for the damages caused by the brawl with the dwarf. The barkeep eyes the broken furniture, then you. 'Gonna cost ya... 30 gold.'

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Pay 30 GP (If Able)
options.description: Settle the debt.

options.name: Try to Haggle/Offer Less
options.description: 'Thirty?! How about fifteen?' [Persuasion check].

options.name: Refuse/Unable to Pay
options.description: Can't or won't pay.

title: Barkeep Calls Guards
description: The barkeep ignores your excuses or refusal to pay. 'That's it! Guards!' he bellows, reaching for a signal horn or shouting out the door. The Watch will be here soon.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Flee the Tavern Now!
options.description: Get out before the guards arrive.

options.name: Try to Stop Him?
options.description: Attempt to physically prevent him from calling guards.

options.name: Wait for Guards / Surrender
options.description: Give up and face arrest.

title: Intimidating the Barkeep
description:
You try to intimidate the furious barkeep. [Intimidation check DC 14 vs his Will/Temper].

Success: He hesitates, perhaps wary after seeing you defeat the dwarf. 'Fine. Get out. And don't come back.'

Failure: He laughs humorlessly. 'Think you scare me? Guards!'

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Leave Quickly (If Success)
options.description: He backed down. Exit.

options.name: Guards Called (If Failure)
options.description: He calls the Watch.

title: The Salty Siren Inn
description: You enter 'The Salty Siren'. It's cleaner and quieter than the Drunken Sailor, with fewer patrons - mostly traveling merchants or locals having a quiet meal. The innkeeper is a plump, matronly woman.

options.name: Rent a Room (If Coin)
options.description: Inquire about lodging.

options.name: Order Food/Drink, Listen for Rumors
options.description: Gather information in the calmer atmosphere.

options.name: Look for Subtle Opportunities (Theft?)
options.description: Scan for unattended bags or rooms left ajar.

title: The Leaky Barrel Tavern
description: You push into 'The Leaky Barrel'. It's even grimier and more crowded than the Drunken Sailor. The air is thick with cheap smoke and desperation. Fights seem likely to break out at any moment.

options.name: Find a Corner, Observe
options.description: Try to blend in and watch for opportunities or threats.

options.name: Look for Gambling
options.description: See if there's a backroom game.

options.name: Look for Easy Mark (High Risk)
options.description: Scan for someone drunk and alone.

options.name: Leave, Too Dangerous
options.description: Decide this place is worse than the last one.

title: Struggling as Captive
description:
As the Unbound march you along, you secretly work at your bonds. [Dexterity or Sleight of Hand check DC 15].

Success: You manage to loosen the ropes significantly! You could try to break free at the right moment.

Failure: The ropes hold fast, possibly even tightening.

options.name: Wait for Opportunity to Escape (If Success)
options.description: Bide your time, look for a distraction.

options.name: Continue as Captive (If Failure)
options.description: Remain bound.

title: Guardian's Knowledge
description: You press the Guardian (Marius) for more details about Loc or the Keepers. He hesitates, then speaks curtly. 'Loc is the Forgotten Locksmith, a primordial entity of chaos and creation, bound for millennia. The Keepers are an ancient order sworn to maintain that binding. Tampering with the Fragments risks cosmic unraveling. That is sufficient for you.' He clearly won't elaborate further.

options.name: Accept His Explanation
options.description: Thank him (or not) and leave.

options.name: Offer to Help Him Again
options.description: Reiterate your offer to assist against the Unbound.

options.name: Seek Elara's Version
options.description: Compare the Keeper's story with the scholar's.

title: Planning Against the Guardian
description: Seeing the Guardian (Marius) as an obstacle, you consider ways to neutralize him. You could try to lure him into a trap, frame him for a crime, steal his weapon or sigil, or perhaps find leverage against him.

options.name: Try to Frame Him (Very Risky)
options.description: Plant stolen goods on him? Accuse him of collaborating with Unbound?

options.name: Plan an Ambush
options.description: Requires finding a suitable location and possibly allies.

options.name: Seek Leverage (Information)
options.description: Try to learn secrets about him from Elara, Silas, or others.

options.name: Focus on Avoidance Instead
options.description: Decide direct confrontation is too risky. Work around him.

title: Stale Sustenance
description: Your few coppers buy a small, hard loaf of stale bread from a market vendor. It's better than nothing, but barely fills the pit in your stomach.

options.name: Look for More Work
options.description: Need a proper job.

options.name: Look for Theft Opportunity
options.description: Need proper coin.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: Nothing left here.

title: Begging for Scraps
description:
Swallowing your pride, you find a busy corner and try begging for coin or food. Most people ignore you, some sneer. [Charisma check DC 13 determines outcome].

Success: A kind soul tosses you a few copper pieces (1d4 CP) or a piece of fruit.

Failure: You receive nothing but scorn, or perhaps a guard tells you to move along.

options.name: Take Meager Alms (If Success)
options.description: Pocket the small charity.

options.name: Move Along (If Failure)
options.description: Begging failed. Try something else.

options.name: Guard Interaction (If Told to Move)
options.description: Deal with the guard's order.

title: Lighthouse Entry Chamber
description: You step inside the base of the Tidecaller Lighthouse. The circular room is stark stone. A winding staircase spirals upwards into darkness. Strange symbols, similar to those on the Tumbler but more complex, are faintly etched into the walls. The gaunt servant closes the heavy door behind you.

options.name: Examine the Symbols
options.description: Study the etchings on the wall. [Investigation/Arcana check?].

options.name: Ascend the Staircase
options.description: Head up towards the main levels.

options.name: Question the Servant
options.description: Ask about the symbols, Valerius, or the job.

title: Inquiring About the Job
description: You ask the servant about the nature of the 'discreet assistance'. His face remains blank. 'The Master requires aid in... calibration. Aligning resonant frequencies. Tasks requiring agility and tolerance for heights. He will explain further.'

options.name: Enter the Lighthouse
options.description: Accept the vague explanation and go inside.

options.name: Press for More Details
options.description: 'Calibration of what? What frequencies?'

options.name: Decline Job, Leave
options.description: Sounds too weird or dangerous.

title: Bluffing Valerius's Servant
description:
You claim to have important information for Valerius. [Deception check DC 14 vs Servant's Insight].

Success: The servant hesitates, then nods slightly. 'The Master values knowledge. Wait here.' He disappears inside for a moment, then returns. 'He will see you. Enter.'

Failure: The servant's eyes narrow fractionally. 'The Master is not expecting information. State your *true* purpose or leave.'

options.name: Enter Lighthouse (If Success)
options.description: Your bluff worked. Now you need to back it up.

options.name: Admit True Purpose (Job/Curiosity) (If Failure)
options.description: Try confessing you saw the notice or are just curious.

options.name: Leave (If Failure)
options.description: Bluff failed. Retreat.

title: Name-Dropping Elara
description: You mention that Elara sent you. The servant pauses. 'Elara? Hmm. The Master respects her... knowledge, if not her methods. Very well. You may enter.' He opens the door.

options.name: Enter the Lighthouse
options.description: Step inside, using Elara's name as your pass.

options.name: Ask Servant About Elara/Valerius Relationship
options.description: 'Do they correspond often?'

title: Turned Away (Lighthouse)
description: You are turned away from the lighthouse door, either by the unhelpful servant or your own caution. The heavy oak door remains closed.

options.name: Try Picking the Lock
options.description: Attempt to bypass the door with Thieves' Tools.

options.name: Scout for Another Entrance (Grate/Climb)
options.description: Look for the cellar grate or try climbing.

options.name: Wait and Observe
options.description: Hide nearby and watch the lighthouse for activity.

options.name: Give Up on Lighthouse
options.description: Decide it's not worth the trouble.

title: Fighting the Servant

enemies.name: Gaunt Servant
enemies.description: Pale, blank-eyed servant defending the lighthouse entrance. Might have unnatural resilience?

description: The gaunt servant blocks your forced entry attempt, moving with surprising speed or strength. He raises his fists or grabs a nearby object to defend the doorway.
limitation: Servant might fight until defeated or until Valerius intervenes. Victory leads to Node 766. Defeat leads to Node 767.

title: Stealthy Lighthouse Entry
description: You successfully bypass the main door lock (or the servant) and slip inside the lighthouse's entry chamber. It's quiet for now. The circular room is stark stone, with a spiral staircase leading up.

options.name: Examine Symbols
options.description: Look closely at the wall etchings.

options.name: Ascend Staircase Stealthily
options.description: Move quietly up the stairs.

options.name: Listen for Movement Above
options.description: Pause and listen before ascending.

title: Lockpick Trap / Defeat Aftermath
description: Your attempt to enter the lighthouse fails, either due to a trapped lock or being defeated by the servant. You are outside, possibly injured or suffering from poison.

options.name: Tend Wounds/Seek Healing
options.description: Address any injuries or poison effects.

options.name: Scout for Another Entrance Again
options.description: Check the grate or look for climbing routes.

options.name: Wait and Observe
options.description: Watch the lighthouse from a distance.

options.name: Give Up on Lighthouse
options.description: Too difficult or dangerous.

title: Forcing the Cellar Grate
description:
You put your shoulder (or crowbar) to the rusted cellar grate. [Strength check DC 16].

Success: With a loud groan and shower of rust, the grate breaks or pops open, revealing a dark opening leading down.

Failure: The grate holds firm, stubbornly resisting your efforts. You might have made some noise.

options.name: Enter Cellar (If Success)
options.description: Descend into the opening.

options.name: Try Picking Lock (If Failed Force)
options.description: Check if there's a lock mechanism to pick.

options.name: Give Up on Grate (If Failed)
options.description: Try the main door or climbing.

options.name: Listen for Reaction (If Failed/Noisy)
options.description: Did the noise alert anyone inside?

title: Grate Mechanism Search
description:
You carefully examine the cellar grate and surrounding stones. [Investigation check DC 15].

Success: You find a cleverly hidden lever camouflaged as rock OR a small keyhole almost filled with dirt.

Failure: No obvious latch or lock mechanism is visible. It seems purely rusted shut or requires brute force.

options.name: Try Lever (If Success - Lever)
options.description: Attempt to pull the hidden lever.

options.name: Try Picking Keyhole
options.description: Clean the keyhole and use Thieves' Tools. [DC 14?].

options.name: Resort to Force (If Failure)
options.description: Attempt to break the grate open.

options.name: Give Up on Grate
options.description: Try another entrance.

title: Lighthouse Climb
description:
You begin scaling the weathered stone wall of the lighthouse. The wind whips around you, and the sea crashes below. [Athletics check DC 15].

Success: You make steady progress upwards towards the first set of barred windows.

Failure: You lose your grip on the slippery stone and fall! [Take 1d6 bludgeoning damage, land near base].

options.name: Reach Window Level (If Success)
options.description: You arrive at the height of the barred windows.

options.name: Try Again After Fall (If Failure)
options.description: If able, attempt the climb again.

options.name: Give Up Climbing (If Failure)
options.description: Too difficult/dangerous. Try another way.

title: Climbing to Loose Bar
description:
Focusing on the window with the potentially loose bar, you make the climb. [Athletics check DC 14 - slightly easier target].

Success: You reach the window. The bar is indeed loose in its socket.

Failure: You slip and fall. [Take 1d6 bludgeoning damage].

options.name: Attempt to Remove Bar (If Success)
options.description: Try to pry the loose bar out. [Strength check?].

options.name: Try Again After Fall (If Failure)
options.description: If able, attempt the climb again.

options.name: Give Up Climbing (If Failure)
options.description: Try another way.

title: Finding an Inn/Tavern (Generic)
description: You find another tavern or inn in Nestlebrook, perhaps 'The Salty Siren' (quieter) or 'The Leaky Barrel' (rowdier).

options.name: Enter 'The Salty Siren'
options.description: Seek a calmer atmosphere.

options.name: Enter 'The Leaky Barrel'
options.description: Brave another dive.

options.name: Keep Looking
options.description: Search for other options.

title: Wreckage Cargo?
description: You ask the fisherman if any valuable cargo washed ashore from the 'Seafoam's Kiss'. He snorts. 'Silver? Nah. Just splintered wood, torn sails... and one odd crate, sealed tight. Dockmaster took it, locked it up. Said it felt... wrong.'

options.name: Ask About the Dockmaster/Crate Location
options.description: 'Where does the dockmaster keep seized goods?'

options.name: Consider Stealing the Crate
options.description: Plan a potential heist targeting the dockmaster's storage.

options.name: Dismiss It
options.description: Probably nothing important.

title: Confronting the Tail
description: You abruptly turn and confront the nondescript man who was tailing you. He looks startled. 'Can I... help you?' he asks, trying to appear innocent.

options.name: Demand to Know Who He Is/Works For
options.description: 'Stop following me. Who sent you? Silas? Someone else?'

options.name: Intimidate Him
options.description: 'Following people can be hazardous to your health. Leave.'

options.name: Attack Him
options.description: Assume hostility and attack.

title: Losing the Tail
description: Knowing you were being followed, you use your knowledge of alleys, crowds, and timing to successfully shake the tail. You feel reasonably sure you're no longer being watched, for now.

options.name: Proceed with Caution
options.description: Continue your plans, but remain wary.

options.name: Leave Town Now
options.description: Get out while you're sure you're not followed.

options.name: Try to Find Out Who Sent Him
options.description: Go ask Silas or others who might hire spies.

title: Apothecary Search
description:
You quickly scan the shelves in the back room. [Perception check DC 13].

Success: You spot several vials of Healing Potion OR a pouch of valuable herbs (Nightshade? Moonpetal?) OR a locked strongbox under the counter.

Failure: Mostly common herbs, empty bottles, and mundane supplies.

options.name: Take Potions/Herbs (If Success)
options.description: Grab the easily accessible valuables.

options.name: Attempt Strongbox Lock (If Success)
options.description: Try to pick the strongbox lock. [Thieves' Tools DC 15?].

options.name: Check Front Shop (If Failure)
options.description: Move past the curtain to check the till.

options.name: Leave Quietly
options.description: Nothing worth the risk here. Exit the way you came.

title: Checking the Apothecary Till
description: You slip past the curtain into the front shop area. The till drawer is closed. [Try opening quietly - Sleight of Hand DC 12? OR Force it - Strength DC 10, noisy?].

options.name: Open Quietly (Sleight of Hand)
options.description: Attempt to open the till without noise.

options.name: Force Drawer Open (Noisy)
options.description: Pry or smash the till open.

options.name: Leave It, Search Elsewhere
options.description: Don't risk the till. Go back to the shelves or leave.

title: Waiting Out Movement (Apothecary)
description: You wait patiently in the shadows outside or just inside the window. After a few tense minutes, the shuffling sounds cease. It seems quiet again.

options.name: Proceed with Burglary Now
options.description: Enter or continue searching the shop.

options.name: Still Too Risky, Abort
options.description: Decide against it even now.

title: Jeweler Smash and Grab
description: The grille is down! You rush into the jeweler's shop. Display cases glitter with jewelry. You hear shouts from outside - the Watch is coming! You have seconds.

options.name: Grab Nearest/Easiest Items
options.description: Snatch whatever is closest and run. [Quick Perception/Sleight of Hand?].

options.name: Target Specific Valuable?
options.description: Try to quickly identify and grab the most valuable piece. [Slower, riskier Perception?].

options.name: Flee Immediately Empty-Handed
options.description: Panic! Get out now before the guards arrive.

title: Fleeing Noisy Burglary
description: The loud noise from attempting to force the jeweler's grille (or smashing it) attracts immediate attention. You hear guards shouting and running towards the shop. You have to flee into the night.

options.name: Escape into Alleys
options.description: Try to lose the guards in the maze.

options.name: Head for Docks
options.description: Try to escape via the waterfront.

options.name: Attempt to Hide Nearby
options.description: Find immediate cover and hope they run past. [Stealth check].

title: Inside the Jeweler's Shop
description: You slip silently through the picked grille lock into the jeweler's shop. Moonlight glints off necklaces, rings, and gems in glass display cases. It's eerily quiet. There might be pressure plates or magical wards.

options.name: Check for Traps First
options.description: Carefully examine the floor and display cases. [Investigation check].

options.name: Target Display Cases
options.description: Attempt to quietly open or break the glass cases.

options.name: Look for a Safe/Strongbox
options.description: Search for where the most valuable items might be secured.

title: Inside the Antiquities Shop
description: You enter the 'Curios & Relics' shop. It smells of dust and old parchment. Shelves are crammed with oddities: pottery shards, faded maps, strange figurines, tarnished jewelry. Stairs likely lead up to the owner's quarters.

options.name: Search for Obvious Valuables
options.description: Quickly scan for anything that looks like gold, silver, or gems.

options.name: Look for Unique/Interesting Artifacts
options.description: Examine the oddities more closely. Maybe find something unusual? [Investigation/Arcana check?].

options.name: Check the Till/Counter
options.description: Look for any cash left behind.

options.name: Listen for Owner Upstairs
options.description: Check if the owner is moving around.

title: Antiquities Window Entry
description: You carefully slide open the grimy, slightly ajar back window and slip inside the antiquities shop, likely into a dusty storeroom.

options.name: Search the Storeroom
options.description: Look for valuables or interesting items here first.

options.name: Enter the Main Shop Area
options.description: Move into the front of the store.

options.name: Listen for Occupants
options.description: Pause and check for sounds from upstairs.

title: Antiquities Back Door Pick
description: The simple lock on the back door yields easily to your Thieves' Tools. You open the door into a small storeroom.

options.name: Search the Storeroom
options.description: Look for valuables here.

options.name: Enter the Main Shop Area
options.description: Move into the front.

options.name: Listen for Occupants
options.description: Check for sounds from upstairs.

title: Paying for Passage
description: You find a captain willing to take you on as a passenger. After haggling, you agree on a price (e.g., 15 GP for coastal, 30 GP for longer voyage). You pay the coin.

options.name: Board the Ship
options.description: Prepare for departure.

options.name: Gather Rumors Before Boarding
options.description: Ask other passengers or crew about the destination.

title: Working for Passage
description: A grizzled captain eyes you up and down. 'Work yer passage? Fine. Need hands swabbing decks and hauling ropes. Don't expect pay, just food and a bunk. Don't cause trouble.' You agree to the terms.

options.name: Board the Ship as Crew
options.description: Join the crew and prepare for hard work.

options.name: Ask About the Ship/Destination
options.description: Inquire where the ship is heading.

title: Describing the Thugs
description: You give the guards the best description you can of the two thugs who attacked you in the alley. They make a note. 'We'll keep an eye out,' one says noncommittally.

options.name: Thank Them and Leave
options.description: Nothing more to do here.

options.name: Ask About Known Troublemakers
options.description: 'Do these descriptions match any local gangs?'

title: Leading the Guards
description: You offer to lead the guards back to the alley where the attack happened. They agree, and you guide them back into the dark, narrow passage.

options.name: Thugs Are Gone
options.description: The alley is empty. The guards shrug.

options.name: Find Evidence?
options.description: Maybe the thugs dropped something? [Perception check].

options.name: Thugs Are Still There! (Unlikely Ambush?)
options.description: The thugs haven't left and might fight the guards (and you?).

title: Guard Believes Lie
description: The guard seems to accept your explanation (shortcut/lost). 'Alright,' he says, 'Just be more careful. These alleys ain't safe.' He might offer directions or just move on.

options.name: Ask for Directions
options.description: Get pointed towards docks/market/etc.

options.name: Thank Him and Leave
options.description: Continue on your way.

title: Guard Accepts Partial Truth
description: Telling the guard you were avoiding trouble from the tavern seems plausible. 'Happens,' he sighs. 'Still, find a better route next time. Move along.'

options.name: Ask About Tavern Trouble
options.description: 'Any specific trouble I should know about?'

options.name: Thank Him and Leave
options.description: Continue on your way.

title: Guard Suspicion
description: Getting defensive makes the guard narrow his eyes. 'Just asking routine questions. No need to get touchy... unless you've got something to hide?' He seems more suspicious of you now.

options.name: Try to Backpedal/Apologize
options.description: 'Sorry, just shaken up from the attack.'

options.name: Maintain Defiance
options.description: Stick to your guns.

options.name: Walk Away Abruptly
options.description: End the conversation and leave.

title: Reaching Town Outskirts
description: Your navigation through the back ways leads you to the edge of Nestlebrook. Fields or woods stretch out before you, offering escape or a place to hide.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: Continue out of town.

options.name: Find Shelter on Outskirts (Shack?)
options.description: Look for the abandoned shack or other cover outside town.

options.name: Return to Town Center via Different Route
options.description: Head back towards the market/taverns.

title: Lost in Back Alleys
description: Focusing only on evasion, you twist and turn through the alleys until you're thoroughly lost. You emerge onto an unfamiliar street. Where are you?

options.name: Try to Get Bearings (Look for Landmarks)
options.description: Scan for the lighthouse, docks, market square, etc.

options.name: Ask Someone for Directions
options.description: Approach a local.

options.name: Explore the Current Area
options.description: See what opportunities this unfamiliar street offers.

title: Mucking Out Stalls
description: You spend a smelly hour mucking out horse stalls. The stablehand watches you work, then grudgingly gives you a chunk of bread and cheese OR 3 copper pieces.

options.name: Eat Reward/Take Coppers
options.description: Accept the payment.

options.name: Ask Stablehand for Information
options.description: While working or after, try to get local rumors.

title: Paying for Stable Stay
description: The stablehand demands payment for your unauthorized stay in the stable. 'Five coppers, or I call the Watch for trespassin'!'

options.name: Pay 5 Coppers (If Able)
options.description: Reluctantly hand over the coin.

options.name: Offer to Work Instead
options.description: Reiterate offer to muck out stalls.

options.name: Refuse/Unable to Pay
options.description: Argue or admit you're broke.

title: Stable Findings Acquired
description: You pocket the coil of rope OR the few copper pieces found hidden in the stable.

options.name: Leave the Stable
options.description: Exit quietly.

title: Intimidating the Stablehand
description:
You try to stare down the stablehand, projecting menace. [Intimidation check DC 13].

Success: He falters, lowering the pitchfork slightly. 'Alright, alright! Just... just get out!'

Failure: He grips the pitchfork tighter. 'Think yer tough? Get out before I call the lads!'

options.name: Leave Peacefully (If Success)
options.description: Your threat worked. Exit.

options.name: Fight Him (If Failure)
options.description: Intimidation failed. Combat.

options.name: Back Down (If Failure)
options.description: Give up the intimidation attempt.

title: Fighting the Stablehand

enemies.name: Stablehand

weapons.name: Pitchfork
weapons.description: A long farm tool with sharp tines.

enemies.description: A simple worker defending his workplace.

description: The stablehand jabs at you with his pitchfork! Combat begins in the confines of the stable.
limitation: Stablehand might try to flee or call for help if injured. Victory leads to Node 814. Defeat leads to Node 815.

title: Finn's Illness
description: You ask Finn about 'the Shakes'. He coughs. 'Got it down the docks... bad water, maybe? Or somethin' crawled outta that crate the Dockmaster seized from the wreck... Felt wrong, that crate did. Gave me the chills first, then the fever... then the shakes... Dockmaster quarantined the crate, threw me out...' His voice trails off.

options.name: Ask More About the Crate
options.description: 'What did the crate look like? Where is it now?'

options.name: Ask About Valerius/Lighthouse Again
options.description: Return to questioning him about his former employer.

options.name: Offer Help (Medicine?)
options.description: See if you have any herbs or skills to ease his symptoms.

title: Fetching Barrel Water
description: You collect murky water from the rainwater barrel. It smells stagnant. Returning to the shack, you offer it to Finn.

options.name: He Drinks It (Gratefully)
options.description: He drinks, seems slightly better, and might offer info.

options.name: He Refuses It (Too Murky)
options.description: He weakly shakes his head at the smelly water.

options.name: Try the Public Well Instead
options.description: Decide the barrel water isn't good enough.

title: Fetching Well Water
description: You make your way to the public well near the market square. You draw fresh, clean water and return to the abandoned shack to give it to Finn.

options.name: He Drinks It (Gratefully)
options.description: He drinks, seems slightly better, and might offer info.

options.name: He's Worse/Unconscious Upon Return
options.description: You took too long? His condition deteriorated.

title: Helping Finn (Further Aid)
description:
You try to help the ailing Finn further. [Requires Medicine check DC 14].

Success: You manage to ease his fever or stop the tremors slightly. He seems more lucid.

Failure: Your efforts have no effect, or you lack the necessary supplies/skills.

options.name: Ask Questions While Lucid (If Success)
options.description: Use the chance to ask about Valerius/Lighthouse/Crate.

options.name: Leave Him Be (If Failure)
options.description: Can't help further. Leave the shack.

title: Searching Finn's Belongings
description: While Finn is delirious or unconscious, you quickly check his meager belongings. You find: a few copper pieces (1d4 CP) OR a crudely drawn map fragment showing coastal rocks OR nothing of value.

options.name: Take Findings
options.description: Pocket the coppers or map fragment.

options.name: Leave Him Be
options.description: Find nothing or feel guilty. Leave.

title: Clue Left by Finn
description: Searching where Finn lay, you find: a small wooden token carved with a wave symbol OR a torn piece of parchment with the name 'Valerius' scribbled OR faint tracks leading towards the docks.

options.name: Investigate Wave Token
options.description: Examine the token. Recognize it? [History/Investigation?]

options.name: Keep Note Fragment
options.description: Another link to Valerius.

options.name: Follow Tracks to Docks
options.description: See where Finn went.

options.name: Ignore Clue, Leave Shack
options.description: Leave.

title: Market Food
description: You find a stall in the market selling hot meat pies or fish stew for a few copper pieces. It smells wonderful compared to the alley.

options.name: Buy Food (If Coin)
options.description: Spend some coppers on a warm meal.

options.name: Attempt to Steal Food?
options.description: Try to snatch a pie when the vendor is distracted. [Sleight of Hand DC 13].

options.name: Move On Hungry
options.description: Can't afford it or won't risk theft.

title: Navigating the Sewers
description: You splash through the foul tunnels beneath Nestlebrook. It's a maze of dripping pipes and narrow walkways. You hear rats skittering nearby. Which way do you go?

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Follow Flow Towards Sea Outlet
options.description: Try to find an exit near the harbor.

options.name: Look for Manhole/Grate Upwards
options.description: Try to find an exit back to the streets.

options.name: Explore Deeper Tunnels
options.description: See what secrets the sewers hold. [Risk encounters?]

title: Storage Room Search
description:
You quickly search the storage room you entered via the back door. It contains crates, barrels, mundane supplies... [Perception check DC 13].

Success: You find a small hidden compartment with a few GP OR a useful item (rope, crowbar?) OR hear voices from the main room.

Failure: Just storage.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Take Item/Coin (If Success)
options.description: Grab the loot.

options.name: Eavesdrop on Voices (If Success)
options.description: Listen to the conversation in the main room.

options.name: Exit Back the Way You Came
options.description: Decide to leave.

options.name: Enter Main Room
options.description: Proceed further into the building.

title: Rooftop Navigation
description: Moving across the rooftops of Nestlebrook requires balance and nerve. You leap small gaps, scramble over chimneys, trying to find a safe way down or a good vantage point.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Find Safe Descent Route
options.description: Look for sturdy drainpipes, low roofs, or quiet alleys to climb down into. [Perception check].

options.name: Spot Something Interesting Below
options.description: Notice unusual activity, a meeting, or an opportunity in the streets/alleys below. [Perception check].

options.name: Keep Moving Across Rooftops
options.description: Continue navigating the roofscape.

options.name: Risk a Difficult Jump/Climb Down
options.description: Attempt a more dangerous descent. [Acrobatics/Athletics check].

title: Rooftop Hideout
description: You find a hidden spot on the rooftops - perhaps behind a large chimney stack or in the shadow of a water tower. You can rest here briefly and observe the streets below.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Rest and Wait
options.description: Catch your breath, wait for things to cool down.

options.name: Observe Streets Below
options.description: Scan for pursuers, guards, or opportunities. [Perception check].

options.name: Plan Descent
options.description: Look for a safe way down.

title: Stowaway's Vigil
description: You remain hidden in the ship's hold as it sails. Days pass. Your rations dwindle (if you had any). You hear the crew moving about above. Staying hidden indefinitely is impossible.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Risk Emerging for Food/Water
options.description: Try to sneak out at night to find supplies.

options.name: Await Landfall
options.description: Hope the ship reaches port before you starve or are discovered.

options.name: Try to Determine Destination
options.description: Listen to crew talk, look for clues about where the ship is heading.

title: Cargo Hold Foraging
description:
Under cover of darkness or when the hold seems empty, you creep out of your hiding place to search for supplies. [Stealth check DC 13].

Success: You find a cask of fresh water and some hardtack biscuits OR maybe unsecured cargo you could examine.

Failure: A crew member doing rounds discovers you!

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Take Supplies, Return to Hiding (If Success)
options.description: Replenish your water/food and retreat.

options.name: Examine Cargo (If Success)
options.description: Check any interesting crates or containers.

options.name: Face Discovery (If Failure)
options.description: Try to talk, bribe, fight, or flee.

title: Stowaway Reveal Attempt
description: You decide to risk emerging from hiding, hoping to blend in or plead your case to the crew now that you're far from land. You step out onto the deck or into a main passageway.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Crew Reacts with Hostility
options.description: They immediately treat you as a prisoner or threat.

options.name: Crew Reacts with Weary Acceptance
options.description: They grumble but put you to work.

options.name: Crew Reacts with Curiosity/Suspicion
options.description: They question you intensely about who you are and why you stowed away.

title: Working Passage (Mid-Voyage)
description: The crew allows you to stay, but you're put to the hardest, dirtiest jobs: swabbing decks, cleaning bilges, assisting the cook. You earn basic food and a rough place to sleep.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Endure the Work Until Landfall
options.description: Keep your head down and do the work.

options.name: Try to Befriend Crew Members
options.description: Gather information about the ship, destination, or crew.

options.name: Look for Opportunities (Theft?)
options.description: Even as crew, maybe lift something valuable?

title: Thrown Off Ship
description: You're unceremoniously thrown back onto the docks of Nestlebrook/Seabrook. The ship departs without you. Your attempt to escape via sea has failed.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Try Another Ship?
options.description: Look for another vessel to stow away on.

options.name: Seek Work on Docks
options.description: Try to earn coin.

options.name: Head Back into Town
options.description: Return to the taverns/streets.

options.name: Leave Town Overland
options.description: Give up on sea travel.

title: Fighting Crew Member

enemies.name: Tough Sailor

weapons.name: Belaying Pin
weapons.description: A short, heavy wooden or metal pin.

enemies.description: An experienced sailor defending his ship.

description: The crew member who caught you tries to subdue you, grabbing a heavy belaying pin!
