items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

limitation: Sailor will likely call for help. Combat might attract other crew. Victory leads to Node 841. Defeat leads to Node 842.

title: Deeper into the Ship
description: You manage to evade or defeat the crew member and dash deeper into the ship's interior - perhaps down a hatch into the hold, or along a narrow passageway.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Find New Hiding Place
options.description: Quickly find somewhere else to conceal yourself. [Stealth check].

options.name: Barricade Yourself?
options.description: Try to block a door or hatch.

options.name: Keep Moving, Explore Ship
options.description: Continue exploring while trying to avoid crew.

title: Hiding Under Pier
description: You manage to scramble or swim under the pier, clinging to the slimy pilings in the cold, dark water. Above, you hear footsteps and shouts (pursuers? crew?).

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Wait for Them to Leave
options.description: Stay hidden until the sounds fade. [Stealth check].

options.name: Move Along Under Pier
options.description: Try to sneak further along under the docks.

options.name: Spotted!
options.description: Someone spots you clinging to the pilings!

title: Ferry Escape
description: You successfully land on the ferry deck as it pulls away from the pier. Your pursuers shout impotently from the dock. You've escaped them, but now you're on a ferry with other passengers, heading... where?

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Blend In with Passengers
options.description: Try to act casual, observe others.

options.name: Ask Destination
options.description: Inquire from a crew member or passenger where the ferry is going.

options.name: Find Place to Hide on Ferry
options.description: Look for a quiet corner or storage area.

title: Emerging from Harbor
description: You haul yourself out of the cold harbor water onto a deserted stretch of beach or a low pier, shivering and dripping. You seem to have escaped pursuit for the moment.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Find Shelter to Warm Up/Dry Off
options.description: Look for the abandoned shack or other cover.

options.name: Head Back Towards Town (Cautiously)
options.description: Return to the main part of Nestlebrook.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook via Coastline
options.description: Start walking along the coast away from town.

title: Struggling in the Water
description:
The cold water saps your strength rapidly. You struggle to stay afloat, gasping for air. [CON save DC 13 to avoid exhaustion/drowning].

Success: You manage to keep your head above water, but you're weakening.

Failure: You start to sink, water filling your lungs...

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Keep Struggling Towards Shore (If Success)
options.description: Make one last desperate attempt to swim. [Another check?].

options.name: Get Rescued? (If Failure)
options.description: Perhaps a boat notices or someone throws a rope?.

options.name: Drown (If Failure, No Rescue)
options.description: The cold water claims you. [Game Over?]

title: Jail Cell
description: You are thrown into a small, damp stone cell. A straw pallet serves as a bed. The heavy barred door clangs shut. You are imprisoned. Your confiscated items (including the Tumbler, if you had it) are likely in the guard captain's office.

options.name: Examine the Cell
options.description: Look for weaknesses, loose stones, potential tools.

options.name: Wait for Guard / Interrogation
options.description: See who comes to talk to you.

options.name: Try to Talk to Other Prisoners (If Any)
options.description: Gather information or potential allies.

options.name: Attempt to Sleep
options.description: Rest despite the grim surroundings.

title: Guard Interrogation
description: The guard captain, a stern woman with a no-nonsense air, enters the cell block. 'Alright, let's have it,' she says. 'Why were you stealing from Master Borin / the halfling? And what's this strange device we confiscated?' (Referring to the Tumbler, if applicable).

options.name: Confess to Theft, Plead Need
options.description: Admit guilt but try to gain sympathy.

options.name: Deny Everything / Claim Mistake
options.description: Maintain innocence.

options.name: Offer Information (Factions/Lighthouse?)
options.description: Try to bargain for release by offering intel.

options.name: Remain Silent
options.description: Refuse to answer.

title: Noticed Arrest
description: Your loud protests during the arrest, possibly mentioning the strange device, attract attention. Later, in your cell, you might hear whispers outside, or a guard might mention that 'someone' was asking about the noisy half-elf prisoner.

options.name: Try to Identify Observer/Inquirer
options.description: Listen carefully, try to see who might be interested.

options.name: Assume It's Trouble (Unbound/Keeper)
options.description: Prepare for potential hostile interest.

options.name: Hope It's Help (Elara?)
options.description: Could someone be trying to assist you?

title: Merchant Heads to Silas
description: You follow Borin the merchant as he hurries to Silas's pawn shop, clutching the Tumbler. He disappears inside.

options.name: Wait Outside and Watch
options.description: See if Borin comes out with coin or if someone else arrives.

options.name: Try to Eavesdrop at Door/Window
options.description: Listen to their conversation. [Perception check].

options.name: Enter the Shop After Borin
options.description: Confront them both.

title: Merchant Heads to Lighthouse
description: You follow Borin the merchant (or the Unbound agents) as they take the path leading out of Nestlebrook towards the Tidecaller Lighthouse on the cliffs.

options.name: Continue Following Discreetly
options.description: Maintain pursuit towards the lighthouse. [Stealth check?]

options.name: Try to Get Ahead of Them
options.description: Find a shortcut or run ahead to reach the lighthouse first.

options.name: Ambush Them on the Path
options.description: Find a suitable spot to attack and retrieve the Tumbler (if Borin has it).

title: Ambushing the Merchant

enemies.name: Merchant Borin

weapons.name: Fists / Heavy Pouch
weapons.description: Surprised and panicked, maybe swings his pouch.

enemies.description: Not a fighter, likely tries to flee or surrender if hurt.

description: You jump out from hiding, confronting the startled merchant Borin as he travels with the Tumbler. 'Hand it over!' you demand.
limitation: Merchant is likely to surrender or flee rather than fight to the end. Victory leads to Node 867. Defeat (unlikely) leads to Node 868.

title: Reclaiming Tumbler (Standoff/Ambush)
description: You successfully recover the Whispering Tumbler from the merchant Borin, either through intimidation or combat.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device. Reclaimed.

options.name: Check Merchant's Pockets (If Combat)
options.description: Loot him quickly.

options.name: Leave the Area
options.description: Disappear before guards or others arrive.

options.name: Head to Lighthouse?
options.description: Continue towards the likely destination.

title: Two-on-One Standoff Fight

enemies.name: Merchant Borin
enemies.description: Likely tries to stay behind the Unbound.

enemies.name: Unbound Agent

weapons.name: Curved Dagger
weapons.description: A simple but sharp curved knife.

enemies.description: Sees you as an obstacle to the Tumbler.

description: Seeing you as a common threat or obstacle, both the merchant and the Unbound agent turn on you!
limitation: Merchant might flee if Unbound is defeated. Victory leads to Node 869. Defeat leads to Node 870.

title: Standoff Intimidation
description:
You attempt to intimidate both the merchant and the Unbound agent into handing over the Tumbler. [Intimidation check DC 15].

Success: The merchant is terrified, the Unbound perhaps wary. One might toss the Tumbler towards you to avoid conflict.

Failure: They are unimpressed or see weakness. Prepare for a fight.

options.name: Grab Tumbler, Flee (If Success)
options.description: Snatch the artifact and run.

options.name: Fight (If Failure)
options.description: Intimidation failed.

title: Siding with Unbound (Standoff)
description: You offer to help the Unbound agent secure the Tumbler from the merchant. The agent nods curtly. 'Deal with him. The Fragment is the prize.'

options.name: Attack the Merchant
options.description: Turn on Borin.

options.name: Intimidate the Merchant
options.description: Try to scare Borin into handing it over.

title: Siding with Merchant (Standoff)
description: You offer to help the merchant (Borin) deal with the dangerous Unbound agent. Borin looks relieved but scared. 'Help me get away from this lunatic!'

options.name: Attack the Unbound Agent
options.description: Fight the cultist.

options.name: Create Diversion for Merchant's Escape
options.description: Cause a commotion so Borin can flee (potentially with the Tumbler).

title: Trading Dirt (Silas)
description: You offer Silas information damaging to Borin in exchange for secrets about the Tumbler. Silas considers, then leans closer. 'Alright... Borin's last 'lost' shipment wasn't wood, it was smuggled weapons... Now, tell me, what do *you* know about this Tumbler that makes it worth risking Borin's wrath?'

options.name: Share Tumbler Info (Key Fragment, Factions)
options.description: Tell him what you learned from Elara/Guardian.

options.name: Bluff/Exaggerate Tumbler Knowledge
options.description: Make it sound more important than you know.

options.name: Keep Info, End Negotiation
options.description: Decide not to share.

title: Selling Info (Borin)
description: You offer Borin damaging information about Silas (e.g., fencing stolen goods, dealing with dangerous types). He listens intently. 'Interesting... very interesting. This information could be... valuable. How valuable? Say, 30 gold pieces?'

options.name: Accept 30 GP
options.description: Take the payment.

options.name: Haggle for More
options.description: 'This could ruin him. Worth at least 50.' [Persuasion check].

options.name: Trade Info for Info (About Tumbler?)
options.description: Ask about the strange device he had instead of coin.

title: Asking Borin About Tumbler
description: You ask Borin about the strange metal device he possessed. He frowns. 'That thing? Found it in a crate from the northern salvage... felt wrong. Cold. Hummed sometimes. Silas offered me practically nothing for it... until those cloaked thugs showed up asking about it. Then he got interested.'

options.name: Ask About Northern Salvage
options.description: 'Where exactly did the crate come from?'

options.name: Ask About Cloaked Thugs
options.description: 'What did the thugs want? Unbound?'

options.name: Thank Him, Leave
options.description: Useful information.

title: Borin Uninterested
description: Borin seems suspicious of you or simply uninterested in dealing with a street rat. He dismisses you curtly. 'I have business to attend to.'

options.name: Leave Him Be
options.description: Find other leads.

options.name: Try Pickpocketing Him?
options.description: If he won't deal, maybe steal? [Risky].

options.name: Follow Him?
options.description: See where he goes next.

title: Dimming the Light?
description: You ask the old sailor how one might (hypothetically) dim the lighthouse light. He looks horrified. 'Dim it?! Are ye mad? That'd be invitin' doom! Only the Keeper... Valerius... knows the workings. Complex clockwork and lenses, tied to the tides themselves. Tamperin' would be suicide!'

options.name: File Info (Mechanism is Complex)
options.description: Note that Valerius controls it and it's intricate.

options.name: Ask if Anyone Else Tried
options.description: 'Has anyone ever *tried* to tamper with it?'

options.name: Thank Him, Change Subject
options.description: Avoid sounding too interested.

title: Looting the Merchant (Brawl)
description: While the merchant Borin is unconscious from the brawl, you quickly check his pockets. You find his coin purse containing 25 GP.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 25 gold.

options.name: Slip Away with Loot
options.description: Exit the tavern during the continued commotion.

title: Seeking Temple Healing
description: You find a small shrine dedicated to a sea or luck deity. An acolyte offers healing prayers for a donation (5-10 GP) or tending to wounds/disease for a slightly larger fee (15 GP).

options.name: Pay for Healing (If Coin)
options.description: Spend the gold for magical healing.

options.name: Offer Services Instead?
options.description: Ask if you can work for healing (cleaning shrine?).

options.name: Cannot Afford, Leave
options.description: Unable to pay. Seek other options.

title: Seeking Elara's Aid (Healing)
description: You go to Elara's cottage, showing her your injuries or describing your illness. She examines you with sharp eyes. 'Crude wounds... or perhaps something worse from the cellar filth. I can brew a poultice or tonic, but my ingredients are not free. 10 Gold Pieces, or perform a small task for me.'

options.name: Pay 10 GP
options.description: Buy the remedy.

options.name: Ask About the Task
options.description: 'What task do you need done?'

options.name: Cannot Afford/Refuse Task, Leave
options.description: Unable or unwilling to meet her price.

title: Barkeep Mollified
description: The barkeep grunts, somewhat appeased by your apology. 'Fine. Just don't lie to me again. Now, you buyin' somethin' or just takin' up space?'

options.name: Order Cheap Drink/Food
options.description: Spend a few coppers to stay.

options.name: Ask About Work (Again?)
options.description: See if he has any *other* jobs.

options.name: Leave the Tavern
options.description: Decide to leave anyway.

title: Ejected Forcefully
description: You pick yourself up from the dusty street outside the Drunken Sailor, having been forcefully ejected by the barkeep. Your pride is bruised, maybe your body too.

options.name: Seek Different Tavern
options.description: Try your luck elsewhere.

options.name: Look for Work/Theft on Street
options.description: Focus on opportunities outside the tavern.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: This town is hostile.

title: Seabrook Gang Lead
description: You pocket the note mentioning a meeting at 'The Salty Dog' tavern in Seabrook. This seems like a solid lead if you head to the next coastal town.

items.name: Note (Salty Dog Meeting)
items.description: Mentions a meeting at 'The Salty Dog' in Seabrook.

options.name: Proceed to Nestlebrook Docks
options.description: Continue your original plan.

options.name: Plan to Head to Seabrook
options.description: Decide to investigate this lead.

title: Guard Finds Injured Darryn
description: A guard patrol finds you injured on the street. 'What happened here?' the guard asks, looking you over. 'Looks like you lost a fight.'

options.name: Report the Mugging
options.description: Tell them about the thugs in the alley.

options.name: Ask for Help/Healer
options.description: Request assistance for your injuries.

options.name: Lie/Be Evasive
options.description: Claim you fell or don't remember.

title: Kind Stranger Encounter
description: A kind-faced local (perhaps a priestess, merchant, or simple villager) stops, concerned by your injured state. 'Gods! Are you alright? Here, let me help you.' They offer an arm or perhaps basic first aid.

options.name: Accept Help Gratefully
options.description: Allow them to assist you.

options.name: Refuse Help Suspiciously
options.description: Wave them away, distrustful.

options.name: Ask for Specific Aid (Healer/Shelter)
options.description: Request they guide you somewhere safe.

title: Ignored on the Street
description: Passersby pointedly ignore your plight, hurrying past or pretending not to see you lying injured. You're on your own.

options.name: Try to Reach Shelter
options.description: Attempt to find the stables or abandoned shack.

options.name: Try to Find Guards
options.description: Look specifically for the Watch.

options.name: Rest Where You Are
options.description: Give up for now, rest on the street.

title: Trouble Finds You (Alley Rest)
description: While resting weakly in the alley, you attract unwanted attention. Choose or roll: 1-2: Giant Rats investigate, 3-4: Another opportunistic Thug approaches, 5-6: A Guard Patrol discovers you.

options.name: Fight Giant Rats (Injured)
options.description: Face the hungry rodents.

options.name: Face New Thug (Injured)
options.description: Another predator smells weakness.

options.name: Deal with Guard Patrol (Injured)
options.description: Explain your situation to the guards.

title: Collapse on Docks
description: Your injuries and exhaustion finally catch up. You collapse onto the hard planks of the docks, the world fading to black...

options.name: Wake Up Later (Found by Someone?)
options.description: Regain consciousness later, possibly moved or aided.

options.name: Wake Up Robbed Again
options.description: Someone took advantage while you were out.

title: Begging for Passage (Injured)
description: Leaning heavily against a post, you appeal to passing sailors or captains, showing your injuries and begging for passage or help.

options.name: Someone Takes Pity (Offers Work/Passage)
options.description: A captain agrees to take you on, perhaps out of pity. [Leads to 516 or 543].

options.name: Rejected / Told to See Healer
options.description: They refuse or suggest you find aid elsewhere.

options.name: Offered Medical Aid?
options.description: Maybe a ship's surgeon offers basic help.

title: Escaping the Guards (Bound)
description: You manage to free yourself from the bonds just as guards arrive in the alley! You have a split second to act.

options.name: Bolt Past Them
options.description: Try to run out of the alley before they can react. [Acrobatics/Stealth?].

options.name: Try to Hide Again
options.description: Duck back behind crates or into shadows.

options.name: Surrender Now
options.description: Give up.

title: Paying for Damages
description: You offer to pay for the damages caused by the brawl with the dwarf. The barkeep eyes the broken furniture, then you. 'Gonna cost ya... 30 gold.'

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Pay 30 GP (If Able)
options.description: Settle the debt.

options.name: Try to Haggle/Offer Less
options.description: 'Thirty?! How about fifteen?' [Persuasion check].

options.name: Refuse/Unable to Pay
options.description: Can't or won't pay.

title: Barkeep Calls Guards
description: The barkeep ignores your excuses or refusal to pay. 'That's it! Guards!' he bellows, reaching for a signal horn or shouting out the door. The Watch will be here soon.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Flee the Tavern Now!
options.description: Get out before the guards arrive.

options.name: Try to Stop Him?
options.description: Attempt to physically prevent him from calling guards.

options.name: Wait for Guards / Surrender
options.description: Give up and face arrest.

title: Intimidating the Barkeep
description:
You try to intimidate the furious barkeep. [Intimidation check DC 14 vs his Will/Temper].

Success: He hesitates, perhaps wary after seeing you defeat the dwarf. 'Fine. Get out. And don't come back.'

Failure: He laughs humorlessly. 'Think you scare me? Guards!'

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Leave Quickly (If Success)
options.description: He backed down. Exit.

options.name: Guards Called (If Failure)
options.description: He calls the Watch.

title: The Salty Siren Inn
description: You enter 'The Salty Siren'. It's cleaner and quieter than the Drunken Sailor, with fewer patrons - mostly traveling merchants or locals having a quiet meal. The innkeeper is a plump, matronly woman.

options.name: Rent a Room (If Coin)
options.description: Inquire about lodging.

options.name: Order Food/Drink, Listen for Rumors
options.description: Gather information in the calmer atmosphere.

options.name: Look for Subtle Opportunities (Theft?)
options.description: Scan for unattended bags or rooms left ajar.

title: The Leaky Barrel Tavern
description: You push into 'The Leaky Barrel'. It's even grimier and more crowded than the Drunken Sailor. The air is thick with cheap smoke and desperation. Fights seem likely to break out at any moment.

options.name: Find a Corner, Observe
options.description: Try to blend in and watch for opportunities or threats.

options.name: Look for Gambling
options.description: See if there's a backroom game.

options.name: Look for Easy Mark (High Risk)
options.description: Scan for someone drunk and alone.

options.name: Leave, Too Dangerous
options.description: Decide this place is worse than the last one.

title: Struggling as Captive
description:
As the Unbound march you along, you secretly work at your bonds. [Dexterity or Sleight of Hand check DC 15].

Success: You manage to loosen the ropes significantly! You could try to break free at the right moment.

Failure: The ropes hold fast, possibly even tightening.

options.name: Wait for Opportunity to Escape (If Success)
options.description: Bide your time, look for a distraction.

options.name: Continue as Captive (If Failure)
options.description: Remain bound.

title: Stowaway (Salty Dog)
description: Hidden amongst the fish barrels and ropes in the hold of the 'Salty Dog', you feel the ship pull away from Seabrook. The crew seems rough and noisy above deck. This journey could be unpleasant if discovered.

options.name: Remain Hidden
options.description: Stay concealed, hope for a quick voyage.

options.name: Search Hold (Cautiously)
options.description: Look for supplies or information while trying to avoid notice.

title: Dealing with Salty Dog Crew
description: You try to talk or bribe the burly sailor who caught you sneaking onto the 'Salty Dog'. He spits. 'Think coin'll save ya? Cap'n hates stowaways. Work yer passage, maybe he won't keelhaul ya.'

options.name: Agree to Work Passage
options.description: Accept the hard labor.

options.name: Attempt to Fight/Flee
options.description: Try to overpower him or jump ship.

title: Stowaway (Windswept Wanderer)
description: Concealed within the hold of the 'Windswept Wanderer', you feel the ship depart Seabrook. The crew seems quieter, more professional than the 'Salty Dog's. Discovery might lead to being handed over to authorities rather than just being thrown overboard.

options.name: Remain Hidden
options.description: Stay concealed, hope for the best.

options.name: Search Hold (Carefully)
options.description: Look for supplies or intel, being extra quiet.

title: Dealing with First Mate
description: You try to talk your way past the watchful First Mate of the 'Windswept Wanderer'. He listens impassively. 'Stowaways are reported to the port authorities at our destination. You can work for your keep until then, or be confined below.'

options.name: Agree to Work
options.description: Accept the labor to stay out of the brig.

options.name: Accept Confinement
options.description: Be locked below deck until arrival.

options.name: Attempt to Flee/Fight?
options.description: Try to escape or overpower the First Mate (likely unwise).

title: Spending Coppers (Seabrook)
description: Your 15 copper pieces buy you a mug of truly awful ale and a greasy meat pie at The Barnacle's Bite. It's barely edible, but fills a hole.

options.name: Look for More Work
options.description: Need better pay.

options.name: Look for Theft Opportunity
options.description: Scan the tavern.

options.name: Leave Seabrook
options.description: This town isn't great.

title: Better Pay, Same Stink
description: You agree to the slightly better rate of 20 coppers and spend hours hauling the stinking fish barrels. The foreman pays you the agreed amount.

items.name: Copper Pieces
items.description: A handful of 20 copper pieces.

options.name: Spend Coppers on Food/Drink
options.description: Head to the tavern.

options.name: Look for More Work
options.description: Seek another job.

options.name: Try to Wash Up
options.description: Clean off the fish stench.

title: Exploring Seabrook
description: Feeling rested, you explore the main streets of Seabrook beyond the docks and tavern. It's a small, poor town. You see a struggling general store, a couple of closed warehouses (gang turf?), and a path leading inland.

options.name: Visit General Store
options.description: See if you can buy/sell/learn anything.

options.name: Investigate Warehouses (Risky)
options.description: Check out the potential gang hideouts.

options.name: Take Path Inland
options.description: Leave Seabrook via the inland route.

options.name: Return to Docks/Tavern
options.description: Go back to the more familiar areas.

title: Bribing the Loft Worker
description:
Caught in the loft, you offer the worker coin (e.g., 5 GP) to forget he saw you. [Persuasion check DC 12, + requires coin].

Success: He eyes the coin, then nods. 'Alright. Didn't see nuthin'. Now git!'

Failure: He refuses. 'Think I'm cheap? Boss needs to know!'

options.name: Leave Quickly (If Success)
options.description: Bribe worked. Exit.

options.name: Run For It (If Failure)
options.description: Flee before he gets the boss.

title: Reaching the Coast
description: The path emerges from the wilderness onto a windswept beach or cliff path. You see a small fishing village (Seabrook? Or another?) nestled in a cove ahead.

options.name: Enter the Village
options.description: Head into the settlement.

options.name: Scout Village from Distance
options.description: Observe before entering.

options.name: Avoid Village, Continue Along Coast
options.description: Bypass the settlement.

title: Coastal Shelter
description: Nearing the coast, you look for shelter before reaching any settlements. You find a small sea cave (tide dependent?) OR a cluster of dense dunes OR an overturned fishing boat.

options.name: Use Sea Cave
options.description: Check tide levels, rest inside.

options.name: Use Dunes
options.description: Hunker down amongst the sandy hills.

options.name: Use Overturned Boat
options.description: Shelter beneath the hull.

title: Deep Wilderness Seclusion
description: You travel for days deeper into the untamed wilderness, leaving all signs of civilization far behind. Survival is a constant challenge. You feel truly alone, for better or worse. [Potential branch end? Or requires specific Survival checks to continue?]

options.name: Continue Surviving (Ongoing)
options.description: Focus on day-to-day survival.

options.name: Encounter Hermit/Monster?
options.description: Chance encounter in the deep wilds.

options.name: Decide to Return to Civilization
options.description: Attempt the long journey back.

title: Searching for Ancient Secrets
description: Pushing into the deep wilderness, you actively search for signs of ancient ruins or hidden magic, perhaps following ley lines or strange natural formations.

options.name: Discover Hidden Grove/Standing Stones
options.description: Find a place pulsating with natural or arcane energy. [Perception/Arcana check].

options.name: Find Overgrown, Forgotten Ruin
options.description: Stumble upon a structure not marked on any map.

options.name: Attract Unwanted Attention (Guardian Spirit?)
options.description: Your search disturbs something ancient.

options.name: Find Nothing, Continue Surviving
options.description: The wilds remain mundane for now.

title: Harvesting the Kill
description:
You butcher the wolf/boar carcass. [Survival check DC 12].

Success: You gain several days' worth of rations (meat) and a usable pelt (wolf/boar).

Failure: You make a mess of it, salvaging only minimal meat (1 day ration) and ruining the pelt.

options.name: Take Resources (If Success)
options.description: Collect the meat and pelt.

options.name: Take Minimal Meat (If Failure)
options.description: Get what little food you could salvage.

options.name: Continue Journey
options.description: Move on.

title: Wilderness First Aid
description:
Injured by the wild animal, you find a somewhat sheltered spot and attempt first aid. [Wisdom (Medicine) check DC 13, maybe using rags/leaves].

Success: You manage to clean and bind the wounds effectively, stopping bleeding and reducing risk of infection. You feel slightly better.

Failure: Your attempts are clumsy. The wounds continue to ache, possibly becoming infected.

options.name: Rest and Recover Further
options.description: Stay put and try to heal.

options.name: Press On (Injured)
options.description: Continue moving despite injuries.

title: Following Trackers into Ruins
description: You successfully shadow the cloaked figures (Unbound?) into the mountain ruins. They head towards a crumbling central tower or a partially collapsed underground structure.

options.name: Follow into Tower/Underground
options.description: Continue tailing them into the structure. [Stealth check?].

options.name: Wait Outside, Observe
options.description: Find a hidden spot and watch the entrance.

options.name: Explore Other Parts of Ruins
options.description: Search elsewhere while they are occupied.

title: Ruins Entry (Collapsed Wall)
description: You carefully climb through the rubble of the collapsed wall into the ruins. This area seems less traveled than the main paths. You are in what might have been an outer courtyard or guardhouse.

options.name: Explore This Section
options.description: Search the immediate area for clues or items.

options.name: Move Towards Central Structure (Stealthily)
options.description: Head towards where you saw movement, trying to remain unseen.

options.name: Listen for Activity
options.description: Pause and try to hear where the figures you saw went.

title: Observing the Ruins
description: From a hidden vantage point outside (or just inside) the ruins, you watch the central structure where you saw movement or where the trackers entered. What do you see/hear?

options.name: See Figures Emerge/Move
options.description: Observe their actions.

options.name: Hear Chanting/Sounds Within
options.description: Try to discern the nature of the activity.

options.name: See Lights Flare Up
options.description: Torches or magical light appears within.

options.name: Nothing Happens
options.description: All remains quiet for now.

title: Wilderness Cultist Victory
description: You defeat the Unbound agents in the wilderness. Searching their bodies yields their daggers, perhaps a few coins (2d6 GP), and maybe a crude map or note hinting at their destination (the ruins? the cave?).

options.name: Loot Bodies
options.description: Take their belongings.

options.name: Examine Map/Note (If Found)
options.description: See if it provides clear directions.

options.name: Continue Towards Ruins/Cave (If Known)
options.description: Proceed to their likely destination.

options.name: Leave the Area
options.description: Head back towards civilization or deeper into wilds.

title: Wilderness Cultist Defeat
description: The Unbound agents overpower you in the wilderness. They take anything valuable you have, including the Tumbler if you possessed it. They might leave you injured, take you captive, or worse...

options.name: Left Injured and Robbed
options.description: They leave you for dead.

options.name: Taken Captive
options.description: They bind you and drag you towards their destination.

title: Escaping the Trackers
description: Your bluff worked, or they simply decided not to bother. The Unbound agents let you leave their path. You retreat back into the wilderness.

options.name: Head Back Towards Road/Coast
options.description: Return to more civilized areas.

options.name: Circle Around, Try to Find Ruins/Cave
options.description: Attempt to find their destination via a different route.

options.name: Continue Deeper into Wilderness
options.description: Avoid them entirely.

title: Failed Bluff (Trackers)
description: Your further attempts at diplomacy fail. The Unbound trackers are convinced you're an enemy or know too much. 'Enough talk!' one snarls.

options.name: Fight
options.description: Combat is inevitable.

options.name: Attempt to Flee
options.description: Make a last-ditch effort to run.

title: Hiding from Trackers
description:
You dive into thick undergrowth or behind large rocks, trying to hide from the pursuing Unbound. [Stealth check DC 14 vs their Perception].

Success: You hold your breath as they pass by your hiding spot, their angry voices fading.

Failure: They spot you! 'There!'

options.name: Emerge When Safe (If Success)
options.description: Wait until they are gone, then proceed.

options.name: Fight When Found (If Failure)
options.description: They found your hiding spot.

title: Outrunning Trackers
description:
You rely on speed and endurance, crashing through the wilderness. [CON check DC 14 vs their Pursuit].

Success: You manage to outdistance them, collapsing somewhere further in the wilds, exhausted but free.

Failure: They are relentless or know the terrain better. They catch up to you.

options.name: Escaped (Exhausted) (If Success)
options.description: Find a place to recover.

options.name: Fight When Caught (If Failure)
options.description: Can't run anymore.

title: Fatigued Journey
description: Setting out after a vigilant night, you feel the lack of proper sleep. Every shadow seems deeper, every hill steeper. [Perform future checks with Disadvantage until rested?].

options.name: Continue Towards Destination
options.description: Push through the fatigue.

options.name: Find Place to Rest Properly
options.description: Prioritize sleep now.

title: Seeking Daytime Rest
description: You find a secluded, sunny spot and try to catch up on sleep during the day. [Low chance of disturbance, potential recovery from exhaustion].

options.name: Rest Successfully
options.description: Wake feeling recovered. [Remove exhaustion/disadvantage].

options.name: Disturbed While Resting
options.description: Something interrupts your daytime nap.

title: Gathering Berries
description: You gather a handful of edible berries found near your camp. A small but welcome supplement to your rations.

items.name: Edible Berries
items.description: A handful of wild berries.

options.name: Return to Camp, Rest
options.description: Go back to your campsite.

options.name: Continue Journey
options.description: Eat berries on the move.

title: Following Found Path/Tracks
description: You decide to follow the hidden path or the recent tracks you discovered near your camp. Where do they lead?

options.name: Path Leads to Overlook/Cave
options.description: Discover a scenic view or another cave entrance.

options.name: Tracks Lead to Another Campsite/Signs of Struggle
options.description: Find where the previous travelers stopped or encountered trouble.

options.name: Path/Tracks Fade Out
options.description: Lose the trail.

title: Observing After Theft
description: Nursing a drink, you watch the halfling gambler. Eventually, he reaches for his pouch... and finds it missing! He leaps up, shouting, 'Thief! My purse is gone! Guards!' Chaos erupts.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 75 gold.

items.name: Jade Frog Figurine
items.description: A smooth, well-carved jade frog.

options.name: Slip Away During Commotion
options.description: Use the uproar as cover to exit.

options.name: Try to Look Innocent/Help Search?
options.description: Maintain your cover, perhaps pretend to help look for the 'thief'.

options.name: Accuse Someone Else?
options.description: Try to divert suspicion onto another patron.

title: Attuning to the Frog
description:
You focus on the Jade Frog figurine, trying to feel its magic or purpose. [Wisdom save DC 14?].

Success: You feel a faint warmth. Perhaps it grants a minor bonus (e.g., +1 to next Stealth check, advantage on saves vs poison?).

Failure: Nothing happens. It remains just a well-carved frog.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 75 gold.

items.name: Jade Frog Figurine
items.description: Jade frog. Might grant minor temporary bonus.

options.name: Note Potential Bonus (If Success)
options.description: Keep the potentially useful charm.

options.name: Decide It's Mundane (If Failure)
options.description: Plan to sell it.

options.name: Leave Tavern
options.description: Exit.

title: Seeking Expert on Frog
description: You decide to seek someone knowledgeable about the Jade Frog figurine. Elara the scholar or perhaps Silas the fence (if he deals in curiosities) might know more.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 75 gold.

items.name: Jade Frog Figurine
items.description: Jade frog. Seeking appraisal.

options.name: Visit Elara
options.description: Show the figurine to the scholar.

options.name: Visit Silas
options.description: Ask the pawnbroker about it.

options.name: Keep It For Now
options.description: Decide later.

title: Selling Frog to Silas
description: You show the Jade Frog figurine to Silas. He examines it closely. 'Nice carving. Good quality jade. Sentimental value?' He offers you 20 GP for it.

items.name: Jade Frog Figurine
items.description: A well-carved jade frog.

options.name: Accept 20 GP
options.description: Take the money.

options.name: Haggle for More (Persuasion)
options.description: 'It's worth at least 30!'

options.name: Ask if it's Magical
options.description: 'Any... special properties?'

options.name: Decline Offer
options.description: Keep the figurine.

title: Finding a Collector
description: Asking around discreetly for collectors of fine carvings leads you to the 'Curios & Relics' shop run by the elderly owner (if you haven't burgled it already).

items.name: Jade Frog Figurine
items.description: A well-carved jade frog.

options.name: Enter Curios & Relics
options.description: Approach the elderly owner to sell the frog.

options.name: Try Silas Instead
options.description: Go to the pawnbroker.

options.name: Keep the Figurine
options.description: Decide not to sell yet.

title: Inn Planning
description: Secure in your inn room with a decent amount of gold, you consider your next steps. Buy gear? Seek information? Pursue leads about the Lighthouse or factions? Leave town?

options.name: Plan Gear Purchase
options.description: Decide what equipment to buy.

options.name: Plan Information Gathering
options.description: Decide who to talk to (Finnigan, Elara, Silas?).

options.name: Plan Next Destination (Leave Nestlebrook)
options.description: Decide where to go next.

options.name: Plan Local Investigation (Lighthouse/Factions)
options.description: Focus on the Nestlebrook mysteries.

title: Deep Hiding (Post-Guard Fight)
description: After incredibly defeating guards, you know reinforcements are coming. You need to disappear *deeply*. You could try the sewers, find an abandoned cellar, or risk hiding in a loaded outgoing cargo ship.

options.name: Enter the Sewers
options.description: Find a grate and descend.

options.name: Find Abandoned Cellar
options.description: Search for unsecured underground access.

options.name: Hide on Cargo Ship
options.description: Attempt to stow away immediately.

title: Seeking Help (Post-Bribery)
description: Having bribed your way free, you need to be careful. Seeking out Elara or perhaps even Silas might offer guidance or a way to mitigate the danger.

options.name: Visit Elara
options.description: Explain your situation, seek advice.

options.name: Visit Silas (Risky)
options.description: See if the fence has heard anything or can help.

options.name: Lie Low
options.description: Find a hiding place.

title: Co-op Theft (Cut Purse)
description:
The cloaked figure nods. 'Make noise... now!' they hiss. As they cause a minor commotion (dropping a mug?), you make your move on the halfling's purse. [Sleight of Hand check DC 13, potentially with Advantage?].

Success: You get the purse! Heavy!

Failure: You fumble, the halfling notices!

options.name: Signal Success, Share Loot?
options.description: Quietly show your partner the success. Escape and split?

options.name: Caught! Deal with Fallout.
options.description: Halfling raises alarm. Does your partner help or flee?

options.name: Betray Partner? (Keep All Loot)
options.description: Try to slip away with the whole purse yourself.

title: Co-op Theft (Create Noise)
description: You create a diversion (jostle someone, shout). The cloaked figure moves towards the distracted halfling. Do they succeed? [Partner makes hidden Sleight of Hand check].

options.name: Partner Succeeds, Signals You
options.description: They got the purse. Time to retreat and meet.

options.name: Partner Fails, Gets Caught!
options.description: The halfling catches your partner! Do you help them or flee?

options.name: Partner Succeeds, Betrays You?
options.description: They get the purse but slip away without signaling.

title: Watching the Competition
description: You watch both the oblivious halfling and the potentially rival cloaked thief. The tension hangs in the air. Who will act first?

options.name: Rival Makes Move!
options.description: The cloaked figure attempts the theft.

options.name: Halfling Notices Rival?
options.description: The gambler seems to spot the watcher.

options.name: Opportunity Passes
options.description: Neither acts, the halfling moves or secures his purse.

options.name: Make Your Move Now
options.description: Don't wait any longer.

title: Race Against Rival
description: Your intimidation failed. Now it's a race or a potential conflict with the cloaked rival to get the halfling's purse.

options.name: Attempt Theft Immediately
options.description: Try to beat them to it. [Sleight of Hand check, possibly contested?].

options.name: Interfere with Rival's Attempt
options.description: Try to subtly trip or distract the rival as they make their move.

options.name: Back Off, Let Them Try
options.description: Avoid conflict, see if they succeed or fail.

title: Opportunity Lost (Halfling)
description: Either due to the halfling becoming alert or the rival thief backing off (or succeeding unseen), the prime opportunity to steal the purse seems to have passed.

options.name: Scan Room for New Target
options.description: Look elsewhere.

options.name: Leave the Tavern
options.description: Move on.

title: Halfling Confronts Rival
description: Alerted by you (or his own senses), the halfling turns to the cloaked figure. 'You eyein' my purse, friend?' he asks, voice dangerously pleasant. A confrontation seems imminent.

options.name: Watch the Confrontation
options.description: See if a fight breaks out.

options.name: Slip Away During Distraction
options.description: Use the confrontation as cover to leave.

options.name: Intervene? (Help Halfling/Rival?)
options.description: Get involved in the argument.

title: Halfling Confronts You
description: The halfling, now alert, turns his suspicious gaze on *you*. 'And why were *you* so concerned about my purse, eh? Thinking of trying yer own luck?' He looks ready for trouble.

options.name: Bluff Innocence
options.description: 'Just looking out for fellow gamblers!' [Deception check].

options.name: Intimidate Him?
options.description: 'Watch your tone, halfling.'

options.name: Apologize and Leave
options.description: 'Sorry, misunderstood. Leaving now.'

title: Potential Enemy Made
description: The dangerous look the cloaked figure gave you suggests you might have made an enemy by interfering. Best be watchful.

options.name: Increase Caution
options.description: Be more alert for ambushes or observation.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: Avoid potential retaliation.

options.name: Try to Identify/Find Them
options.description: Maybe confront them proactively?

title: Elara on Loc's Freedom
description: You ask Elara what happens if Loc is freed. Her face grows grim. 'Freedom? Unraveling. Loc is bound outside the normal flow of time and reality. His release wouldn't just be destruction, but... paradox. The rewriting of what *is*. Some Unbound crave this chaos, others foolishly believe they can control it.'

options.name: Ask How to Prevent It
options.description: 'What can stop the ritual?'

options.name: Ask About Your Role
options.description: 'Why is the Fragment I hold important?'

options.name: Express Skepticism
options.description: 'Sounds like exaggeration.'

title: Elara on Prevention
description: 'Stopping it?' Elara sighs. 'Difficult. The Unbound ritual at the lighthouse is likely just one step. Gathering all Key Fragments is paramount. Disrupting their ritual tonight might delay them. Informing the Keeper might help, if he can be trusted. Destroying a Fragment... perhaps possible, but dangerous and might have unforeseen consequences.'

options.name: Focus on Disrupting Ritual
options.description: Plan to interfere at the lighthouse.

options.name: Focus on Informing Keeper
options.description: Find Marius and tell him.

options.name: Ask About Destroying Fragment
options.description: 'How could *my* Fragment be destroyed?'

title: Task: Investigate Reliquary
description: You agree to Elara's task: find out what the Reliquary being shipped to Valerius contains. Your best bet is likely observing the 'Sea Serpent' at the docks, possibly attempting infiltration or eavesdropping.

options.name: Head to Docks (Observe 'Sea Serpent')
options.description: Begin your investigation.

options.name: Ask Elara for Tools/Advice
options.description: 'Any suggestions on how to get close?'

title: Task: Investigate Keeper
description: You accept Elara's task: learn the Guardian Marius's specific orders or intentions in Nestlebrook. He seems to frequent the Drunken Sailor.

options.name: Go to Drunken Sailor, Observe Marius
options.description: Watch the Keeper discreetly.

options.name: Try to Engage Marius in Conversation
options.description: Attempt to subtly probe him for information.

options.name: Ask Elara for Advice
options.description: 'How can I learn his orders without direct confrontation?'

title: Declining Elara's Task
description: You decide against taking on Elara's task (investigating the Reliquary/Keeper) or give up on entering the lighthouse. It seems too dangerous or complicated.

options.name: Try to Sell/Hide Tumbler
options.description: Focus on getting rid of the artifact.

options.name: Look for Other Work/Opportunities
options.description: Find a different path.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: Abandon the town and its mysteries.

title: Shielding the Fragment
description: 'Shield its resonance?' Elara considers. 'Difficult. Lead lining might dampen it somewhat. Certain warding spells could conceal it, but require rare components or arcane skill. Or... distance. The further it is from those sensitive, the fainter the signal.'

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: Key Fragment, source of attention.

options.name: Ask About Lead Lining/Wards
options.description: 'Where can I find lead? What components for wards?'

options.name: Consider Hiding It Far Away
options.description: Think about burying it or finding a remote spot.

options.name: Consider Leaving Town (Distance)
options.description: Putting physical distance seems easiest.

title: Other Key Fragments
description: You ask about other Key Fragments. Elara (or Silas, nervously) explains: 'Legend speaks of seven Fragments total, scattered by time or design. Some might lie dormant in ancient ruins, others could be held by collectors unaware of their true nature... or perhaps other agents of the Unbound or Keepers already possess them. Finding them all... that's the Great Game.'

options.name: Ask About Known Locations/Rumors
options.description: 'Any legends hint at specific ruins or collectors?'

options.name: Consider the Reliquary Again
options.description: Maybe the shipment contains another Fragment?

options.name: Focus on Protecting/Using Your Fragment
options.description: Worry about the others later.

title: Misdirecting the Guardian (w/ Silas)
description: You suggest feeding the Guardian false information. Silas looks terrified but intrigued. 'False info? Like... tell him the Unbound are meeting in the wrong place? Or that the Fragment was shipped out already? Risky... but maybe...' How do you proceed?

options.name: Plant False Rumors
options.description: You and Silas try to spread misinformation in town.

options.name: Directly Lie to the Guardian
options.description: You approach Marius and feed him a false lead (Silas backs you up?).

options.name: Abort Plan, Too Complex/Risky
options.description: Decide against the deception.

title: Ambushing the Guardian (w/ Silas)
description: You suggest ambushing the Guardian, perhaps luring him into Silas's trapped cellar or a dark alley. Silas looks horrified. 'Ambush a Keeper?! Are you insane? He'd tear us apart!'

options.name: Insist on the Plan
options.description: Try to convince Silas it's the only way. [High DC Persuasion?].

options.name: Suggest Non-Lethal Trap
options.description: 'Just trap him, slow him down.'

options.name: Silas Refuses Point Blank
options.description: He won't agree to violence.

title: Arguing with the Guardian
description: You argue with Marius about the lack of reward for your help/info. He remains stone-faced. 'Your assistance was noted. Your attitude is unwelcome. Do not test the patience of the Keepers.' He seems unimpressed by your complaints.

options.name: Back Down
options.description: Realize arguing is pointless. Leave.

options.name: Escalate (Threaten/Insult)?
options.description: Foolishly continue the argument.

title: Agreeing to Meet Guardian
description: You agree to meet Keeper Marius near the path to the lighthouse at moonrise to observe the Unbound.

options.name: Prepare (Rest, Gear Check)
options.description: Use the time before moonrise to prepare.

options.name: Scout the Meeting Point Early
options.description: Go to the location ahead of time to check it out.

options.name: Warn the Unbound Instead?
options.description: Second thoughts? Betray the Keeper?

title: Clarifying Guardian's Plan
description: You ask Marius about the plan. 'Observation first,' he states. 'Identify their numbers, leader, and the nature of their ritual. We intervene only if necessary to prevent the Unbinding, or if a Key Fragment is directly threatened.'

options.name: Agree to Meet Him
options.description: Accept the plan.

options.name: Question 'If Necessary'
options.description: 'What constitutes necessary intervention?'

options.name: Decline Mission
options.description: Sounds too reactive or dangerous.

title: Silas on Valerius
description: You ask Silas why Valerius would want the Key Fragments. 'Power, what else?' Silas whispers nervously. 'Some say he wants to *control* Loc, not free 'im. Use that chaos for himself. Mad ambition. Or maybe he *is* Unbound, just plays his own game. Wouldn't trust him either way!'

options.name: Note Valerius as Third Party?
options.description: He might be against both Unbound and Keepers.

options.name: Ask About Valerius's Defenses
options.description: 'How does he protect himself?'

options.name: Conclude Business with Silas
options.description: Finish your transaction/threat.

title: Silas on Other Fragments
description: Silas shakes his head frantically when asked about other Key Fragments. 'No idea! Wouldn't touch 'em! This town's enough trouble with just *one* surfacing. Look, just take yer info (or coin/Tumbler) and go!'

options.name: Conclude Business with Silas
options.description: Finish your transaction/threat.

title: Concluding Silas Deal
description: Having gotten information, coin, or the Tumbler from Silas (or failed to), you conclude your business with the nervous pawnbroker.

options.name: Leave the Shop
options.description: Exit back onto the streets.

title: Pushing Silas Too Far
description: You push Silas for even more money after his initial terrified offer. He snaps. 'Enough! Get out! Guards! Help! Robbery!' He starts shouting, possibly grabbing a weapon.

options.name: Flee Immediately
options.description: Run before guards arrive.

options.name: Fight Silas?
options.description: Try to silence him.

title: Fighting Silas

enemies.name: Silas the Fence

weapons.name: Dagger / Club
weapons.description: A concealed weapon kept for trouble.

enemies.description: A nervous but desperate pawnbroker.

description: Your threats push Silas too far! He grabs a weapon from under the counter. 'Get out of my shop!' he yells, attacking.
limitation: Silas likely tries to subdue or drive off, might yell for guards. Victory leads to Node 1119. Defeat leads to Node 1120.

title: Pickpocketing Silas
description:
As you turn to leave (or after defeating him), you attempt to pick Silas's pocket or grab something from the counter. [Sleight of Hand check DC 14].

Success: You snag his keys OR a small pouch (1d10 GP?) OR the Tumbler (if visible/known location).

Failure: He notices! 'Thief!' (Or if defeated, you find nothing extra).

options.name: Flee with Loot (If Success)
options.description: Escape with your stolen item.

options.name: Caught! Fight/Flee (If Failure & Silas Conscious)
options.description: He caught you.

options.name: Leave Empty-Handed (If Failure)
options.description: Didn't get anything.

title: Diversion for Unbound
description: You create a diversion near the tavern's front door (spill drinks, start shouting). The Guardian, Marius, glances towards the commotion.

options.name: Observe Unbound Escape
options.description: See if they use the chance to slip out the back.

options.name: Diversion Draws Too Much Attention to You
options.description: The Guardian or barkeep focuses on *you* now.

title: Distracting the Guardian Directly
description: You approach Marius directly, trying to engage him in conversation or challenge him to distract him while the Unbound escape.

options.name: Successfully Distract Him
options.description: You keep his attention long enough. [Persuasion/Deception check?].

options.name: He Sees Through It / Ignores You
options.description: He remains focused or dismisses you, possibly noticing the Unbound anyway.

title: Unbound Depart (Warned)
description: Having been warned, the Unbound agents leave the tavern, likely via a discreet exit. They cast a final glance towards you or the Guardian.

options.name: Try to Follow Them?
options.description: Attempt to shadow them again.

options.name: Report Departure to Guardian
options.description: Inform Marius they left.

options.name: Let Them Go
options.description: Mind your own business.

title: Guardian's Leniency?
description: You plead ignorance or good intentions to the Guardian. He considers you for a long moment. 'Ignorance is no excuse for interference. But perhaps... you were merely misguided. Stay out of matters that don't concern you.' He seems to let you off with a warning.

options.name: Thank Him (Wisely), Leave
options.description: Accept the warning and depart.

options.name: Offer Help Now?
options.description: Press your luck, offer assistance.

title: Fighting the Guardian

enemies.name: Keeper Marius
enemies.description: An experienced, disciplined Keeper of the Lock.

description: You choose to fight the Guardian, Marius! He draws his heavy axe, its edge gleaming. 'Foolish choice,' he states calmly.
limitation: Marius is a skilled opponent. He likely fights to subdue unless Darryn poses a lethal threat. Victory leads to Node 1126. Defeat leads to Node 1127.

title: Guardian Escape Success
description: You manage to escape the confrontation with the Guardian (or Unbound agents), using the tavern crowd or street chaos to your advantage. You find a moment to catch your breath, heart pounding.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook Immediately
options.description: Too dangerous here.

options.name: Find Hiding Place
options.description: Lie low.

options.name: Seek Opposite Faction?
options.description: If you fled the Guardian, find the Unbound? Or vice versa?

title: Guardian Defeat
description: Keeper Marius easily overpowers you. His axe blow likely knocks you unconscious, or he simply pins you down. 'Interference ends here,' he says grimly.

options.name: Wake Up Imprisoned?
options.description: Perhaps in the town jail, or somewhere else?

options.name: Wake Up Left Behind?
options.description: He defeats you but leaves you, perhaps taking the Tumbler.

title: Aiding Unbound (Fragment)
description: You offer to help the Unbound agents retrieve the Key Fragment (Tumbler). This likely involves planning a heist against Silas (if he has it), Valerius (if he received it), or confronting the Keeper (if he confiscated it).

options.name: Plan Heist on Silas (w/ Unbound)
options.description: Work with the cultists to rob the pawn shop.

options.name: Plan Attack on Keeper (w/ Unbound)
options.description: Coordinate an ambush against Marius.

options.name: Plan Infiltration of Lighthouse (w/ Unbound)
options.description: Work together to get inside Valerius's tower.

title: Unbound Rewards?
description: You ask the Unbound what they offer for your help. 'Serve the Opener of Ways, and you shall share in the glorious chaos of His return!' one declares fervently. The other adds, 'And perhaps... find power unimaginable. Coin is irrelevant when reality bends.' They offer fanaticism and vague promises, not gold.

options.name: Accept (Join the Cult?)
options.description: Embrace their cause (or pretend to).

options.name: Refuse, Back Away
options.description: Decide their payment isn't worth the risk/insanity.

options.name: Demand Tangible Reward
options.description: 'Need something more concrete than 'chaos'.'

title: Framing the Guardian
description: You decide to try and frame Keeper Marius. This requires careful planning: planting incriminating evidence (stolen goods, Unbound paraphernalia?), spreading false rumors to the guards or townsfolk, or engineering a situation where he looks guilty.

options.name: Attempt Planting Evidence
options.description: Requires acquiring evidence and planting it on him or his belongings. [High risk Stealth/Sleight of Hand].

options.name: Spread False Rumors
options.description: Try to convince guards or influential locals he's corrupt or dangerous. [Deception checks].

options.name: Abort Framing Plan
options.description: Too complicated or likely to backfire.

title: Planning Guardian Ambush
description: Planning an ambush on Marius requires choosing a location (dark alley? outside tavern?) and method (direct assault? trap?). Doing it alone is incredibly risky. Do you seek allies?

options.name: Recruit Allies (Unbound? Silas? Mercs?)
options.description: Try to get help from other factions or hired hands.

options.name: Set a Physical Trap
options.description: Rig a deadfall, tripwire, etc. [Requires resources/Survival check].

options.name: Attempt Solo Ambush (Very High Risk)
options.description: Try to get the drop on him alone.

options.name: Abort Ambush Plan
options.description: Too dangerous.

title: Seeking Leverage (Guardian)
description: You decide to find leverage against Marius. You could try asking Elara about Keeper weaknesses, pressing Silas for any dirt he knows, or observing Marius closely for exploitable habits or secrets.

options.name: Ask Elara About Keepers
options.description: Inquire about their code, vulnerabilities, or history.

options.name: Press Silas for Dirt
options.description: See if the fence knows any Keeper secrets or scandals.

options.name: Observe Marius Closely
options.description: Shadow him, watch his routines, look for weaknesses. [Perception/Investigation checks].

title: Meager Charity
description: Your begging yields a tiny amount: 1d4 copper pieces or a bruised apple. It's barely enough to keep starvation at bay.

options.name: Continue Begging?
options.description: Try another spot or approach.

options.name: Look for Work
options.description: Seek any kind of paying job.

options.name: Attempt Petty Theft
options.description: Try to steal something small.

title: Guard Interaction (Begging)
description: A guard approaches you while you're begging. 'Alright, move along,' he says gruffly. 'No loitering or harassing folks.'

options.name: Comply and Move On
options.description: Do as he says.

options.name: Argue / Plead?
options.description: Try to reason with the guard.

options.name: Try to Slip Away
options.description: Attempt to disappear while he's talking.

title: Lighthouse Symbol Examination
description: You examine the symbols etched into the lighthouse walls. [Investigation/Arcana check DC 15]. They depict complex celestial charts intertwined with geometric patterns resembling locks and keys. Some symbols pulse with a faint, cold light that seems to react to your presence (especially if carrying the Tumbler).

options.name: Try Touching a Symbol
options.description: Reach out to one of the glowing etchings.

options.name: Compare to Tumbler (If Possessed)
options.description: See if the Tumbler's markings match specific symbols.

options.name: Ignore Symbols, Ascend Stairs
options.description: Proceed upwards.

title: Ascending the Lighthouse
description: You begin climbing the winding stone staircase. It spirals upwards into oppressive darkness, the only sound your footsteps and the distant crash of waves. The air grows colder.

options.name: Proceed Cautiously (Listening)
options.description: Move slowly, listening for sounds from above.

options.name: Check for Traps on Stairs
options.description: Look for pressure plates or magical wards. [Perception check].

options.name: Use Light Source (If Available)
options.description: Light a torch or lantern.

options.name: Descend Back Down
options.description: Second thoughts. Return to the entry chamber.

title: Questioning the Servant
description: You question the gaunt servant in the entry chamber. He answers in a monotone, emotionless voice. 'The Master conducts his research. The symbols regulate energies. My purpose is to serve.' He offers little useful information willingly.

options.name: Ask About Valerius's Research
options.description: 'What energies? What research?'

options.name: Ask About the Lighthouse Itself
options.description: 'How old is this place? Who built it?'

options.name: Attempt Persuasion/Intimidation
options.description: Try to get more out of him through charisma or threats.

options.name: Give Up, Ascend Stairs
options.description: He's useless. Head up.

title: Pressing the Servant
description: You press the servant for more details about the calibration. He repeats robotically, 'Celestial alignments. Tidal resonances. The Master requires precise adjustments to the Focusing Array in the lantern room. Your agility is required.' He refuses to elaborate further.

options.name: Enter Lighthouse
options.description: Go inside despite the vague answers.

options.name: Ask About Dangers
options.description: 'What are the risks involved?'

options.name: Decline Job, Leave
options.description: Still sounds too suspicious.

title: Servant on Elara/Valerius
description: You ask the servant about Elara and Valerius. 'They correspond... rarely,' the servant intones. 'Disagreements on methodology. The Master finds her reliance on... naturalistic sympathies... limiting. She finds his precision... cold.'

options.name: Note Scholarly Rivalry
options.description: File away the information about their differing approaches.

options.name: Proceed Inside
options.description: Continue into the lighthouse.

title: Servant Defeated
description: You defeat the surprisingly resilient gaunt servant. He collapses, inert. The way into the lighthouse is clear.

options.name: Loot the Servant
options.description: Check his robes for keys or items.

options.name: Enter the Lighthouse
options.description: Step into the entry chamber.

title: Defeated by Servant
description: The gaunt servant, stronger or tougher than he looked, overpowers you. You are knocked unconscious or subdued at the lighthouse entrance.

options.name: Wake Up Inside (Prisoner?)
options.description: Regain consciousness inside the lighthouse, possibly imprisoned.

options.name: Wake Up Outside (Thrown Out)
options.description: Regain consciousness outside the lighthouse, injured.

title: Listening on the Stairs
description: You pause on the dark staircase, listening intently. [Perception check DC 13]. You hear... faint humming or clicking sounds from far above OR distant, mumbled chanting OR shuffling footsteps on the level directly above OR silence.

options.name: Proceed Towards Sound (Humming/Chanting)
options.description: Continue upwards towards the source.

options.name: Prepare for Encounter (Footsteps)
options.description: Ready yourself, someone is on the next level.

options.name: Proceed Cautiously (Silence)
options.description: Continue upwards quietly.

title: Entering Lighthouse Cellar
description: You descend through the opened grate into a damp, musty cellar beneath the lighthouse. It smells of brine and decay. Crates and barrels line the walls. A rickety wooden staircase leads upwards.

options.name: Search the Cellar
options.description: Look through the crates and barrels for items or clues.

options.name: Ascend Cellar Stairs
options.description: Head up into the main lighthouse structure.

options.name: Listen for Sounds Above
options.description: Check if anyone is moving in the room above.

title: Listening after Failed Entry
description: After making noise trying to force the grate or falling from the wall, you listen intently. Do you hear any reaction from inside the lighthouse?

options.name: Hear Movement/Shouts Inside
options.description: Someone was alerted!

options.name: Hear Nothing
options.description: Seems your noise went unnoticed, or no one is home/cares.

title: Hidden Lever (Grate)
description: You pull the hidden lever disguised as rock. With a grinding sound, the cellar grate slides open!

options.name: Enter Cellar
options.description: Descend into the opening.

title: Picking Grate Lock
description:
You clean out the small keyhole on the cellar grate and apply your Thieves' Tools. [Dexterity (Thieves' Tools) check DC 14].

Success: Click! The grate lock opens.

Failure: The lock is rusted or tricky, resisting your attempts.

options.name: Enter Cellar (If Success)
options.description: Open the grate and descend.

options.name: Resort to Force (If Failure)
options.description: Try breaking the grate open.

options.name: Give Up on Grate
options.description: Try another entrance.

title: Reaching Lighthouse Window
description: You reach the level of the first barred windows on the lighthouse exterior. The wind buffets you. Peering inside is difficult through the grimy glass.

options.name: Try to Pry Bars
options.description: Test the bars for weakness. [Strength check DC 16?].

options.name: Try to See Inside
options.description: Clean a section of glass and peer in. [Perception check].

options.name: Climb Higher?
options.description: Attempt to reach the next level of windows.

options.name: Climb Back Down
options.description: Decide this isn't working.

title: Removing Loose Bar
description:
You grip the loose bar and pull. [Strength check DC 13].

Success: With a groan of rusted metal, the bar comes free! You now have a narrow opening into the lighthouse.

Failure: The bar is stuck fast despite being loose.

options.name: Squeeze Through Opening (If Success)
options.description: Try to enter the lighthouse through the gap. [Dexterity check?].

options.name: Try Other Bars (If Failure)
options.description: Check if other bars are weak.

options.name: Climb Down
options.description: Give up on this window.

title: Dockmaster's Storage
description: You inquire about the Dockmaster's storage for seized goods. 'Keeps 'em in the locked shed at the end o' the main pier,' a dockhand tells you. 'Guard posted there usually, 'specially since that weird crate came in.'

options.name: Plan Heist on Storage Shed
options.description: Consider how to bypass the guard and lock.

options.name: Try to Bribe/Distract Guard
options.description: Attempt to get access legitimately or through guile.

options.name: Forget the Crate
options.description: Decide it's too much trouble.

title: Planning Dockmaster Heist
description: You decide to try and steal the mysterious crate seized from the shipwreck. It's in the Dockmaster's locked shed at the end of the pier, likely guarded.

options.name: Scout the Shed and Guard
options.description: Observe the location, guard patterns, locks.

options.name: Attempt Night Infiltration
options.description: Plan to break in under cover of darkness.

options.name: Create Diversion for Guard
options.description: Plan a way to lure the guard away.

title: Tail's Identity
description:
You demand the tail identify himself and who sent him. He might: [Deception check]
1: Panic and run.
2: Claim to be a concerned citizen / off-duty guard.
3: Admit he works for Silas / Borin / a Faction / Guard Captain.

options.name: Chase Him (If Runs - 1)
options.description: Pursue the fleeing tail.

options.name: Press Him Further (If Claims Innocence - 2)
options.description: Don't believe him, try intimidation.

options.name: React to Revelation (If Admits Employer - 3)
options.description: Decide how to proceed based on who sent him.

title: Intimidating the Tail
description:
You try to intimidate the tail into leaving or revealing his employer. [Intimidation check DC 14].

Success: He looks frightened. 'Alright, alright! Silas paid me to watch ya! Just watching!' He might flee after confessing.

Failure: He stands his ground or draws a concealed weapon.

options.name: Let Him Go / Flee (If Success)
options.description: You got the info. Decide next steps.

options.name: Fight Him (If Failure/Draws Weapon)
options.description: Confrontation escalates.

options.name: Press for More Details (If Success)
options.description: 'Why does Silas want me watched?'

title: Fighting the Tail

enemies.name: Watcher / Spy
enemies.description: A hired spy, likely prioritizes escape over combat.

description: The confrontation with the tail escalates to violence! He draws a dagger.
limitation: Spy might try to disengage and flee if injured. Victory leads to Node 1178. Defeat leads to Node 1179.

title: Apothecary Loot (Potions/Herbs)
description: You quickly grab the valuable items from the apothecary shelves: [Choose one or roll] 1-2: Two Vials of Healing Potion. 3-4: Pouch of valuable herbs (identify?). 5-6: A vial of Antitoxin.

options.name: Take Healing Potions (2)
options.description: Secure the potions.

collectedItems.name: Healing Potion (x2)
collectedItems.description: A vial of red liquid that restores health.

options.name: Take Valuable Herbs
options.description: Secure the pouch of herbs.

collectedItems.name: Valuable Herbs
collectedItems.description: A pouch of potent herbs (Nightshade? Moonpetal?).

options.name: Take Antitoxin
options.description: Secure the vial of antitoxin.

collectedItems.name: Antitoxin
collectedItems.description: A vial of liquid that neutralizes poisons.

title: Apothecary Strongbox
description: You find a small, sturdy strongbox under the apothecary's counter. It's locked. [Attempt Thieves' Tools DC 15].

options.name: Pick Lock Successfully
options.description: The lock clicks open!

options.name: Fail to Pick Lock
options.description: The lock resists your efforts.

options.name: Try Forcing Box Open (Noisy)
options.description: Attempt to smash it open.

title: Leaving Apothecary Quietly
description: Finding nothing easily valuable or deciding against further risk, you slip back out the window, leaving the apothecary shop undisturbed.

options.name: Return to Market Square Vicinity
options.description: Reassess targets or head elsewhere.

title: Opening Apothecary Till (Quietly)
description: You manage to slide the till drawer open quietly. Inside, you find a small scattering of coins: 2d10 Silver Pieces and 3d6 Copper Pieces.

options.name: Take the Coins
options.description: Pocket the meager earnings.

options.name: Search Rest of Shop
options.description: Look for more valuable items.

options.name: Leave Quietly with Coins
options.description: Exit the shop.

title: Forcing Apothecary Till (Noisy)
description: You force the till drawer open with a loud crack! Inside are some coins (2d10 SP, 3d6 CP). The noise likely alerted anyone sleeping upstairs!

options.name: Grab Coins and Flee
options.description: Take the money and run out immediately.

options.name: Wait to See Who Responds?
options.description: Hide and see if the owner investigates.

title: Jeweler Quick Grab
description: With guards approaching fast, you smash a nearby display case and grab handfuls of glittering items - mostly silver rings and cheap gem pendants. [Gain 'Assorted Cheap Jewelry' item, worth ~50 GP to fence]. You flee into the night.

items.name: Assorted Cheap Jewelry
items.description: A handful of low-value jewelry.

options.name: Escape into Alleys/Docks
options.description: Try to lose the pursuing guards.

title: Jeweler Targeted Grab
description: Ignoring the easier grabs, you quickly scan for the most valuable item - perhaps a single large gem or a heavy gold necklace. [Perception check DC 14]. You snatch it just as guards burst in! You flee into the night.

options.name: Escape with Valuable Gem/Necklace
options.description: You got the prize! [Gain 'Valuable Gem/Necklace', worth ~150 GP?].

collectedItems.name: Valuable Gem/Necklace
collectedItems.description: A single valuable piece of jewelry.

options.name: Fumble Grab, Escape Empty-Handed
options.description: In your haste, you fail to secure the item before fleeing.

title: Checking Jeweler for Traps
description:
You carefully examine the jeweler's shop floor and display cases. [Investigation check DC 15].

Success: You spot nearly invisible pressure plates near the main counter and faint arcane runes on the large display cases (likely alarm wards).

Failure: You don't notice any obvious traps.

options.name: Attempt to Disable Traps (If Success)
options.description: Try to bypass the pressure plates or disarm the wards. [Thieves' Tools check? Arcana check?].

options.name: Proceed Cautiously (Avoid Plates/Cases?)
options.description: Try to move around the detected traps.

options.name: Target Safe/Strongbox Instead
options.description: Avoid the trapped displays, look for the main safe.

options.name: Abort Heist (If Traps Found/Too Risky)
options.description: Decide it's too dangerous.

title: Targeting Jeweler Displays
description: You approach the glass display cases. Opening them quietly likely requires picking small locks or finding a catch. Breaking them will make noise and possibly trigger alarms (if you failed trap check).

options.name: Attempt to Pick Case Locks
options.description: Use Thieves' Tools. [DC 14?].

options.name: Smash Case (Noisy/Risky)
options.description: Break the glass quickly.

options.name: Leave Displays, Look for Safe
options.description: Focus on the main prize.

title: Searching for Jeweler's Safe
description:
You search the jeweler's shop for a safe or strongbox. [Investigation check DC 14].

Success: You find a heavy iron safe hidden behind a tapestry in the back room.

Failure: You don't find an obvious safe, perhaps it's extremely well hidden or doesn't exist.

options.name: Attempt to Crack Safe (If Success)
options.description: Try opening the safe lock. [High DC Thieves' Tools check?].

options.name: Target Display Cases Instead
options.description: Go back to trying the displays.

options.name: Leave Shop Empty-Handed (If Failure)
options.description: Can't find the main loot.

title: Antiquities Quick Search
description: Scanning the cluttered shop quickly, you spot a few silver trinkets on a shelf and perhaps some old coins spill ed from a box. It doesn't look like much immediate wealth.

options.name: Take Silver Trinkets/Coins (~10 GP)
options.description: Grab the easily accessible small valuables.

options.name: Search More Thoroughly (Interesting Artifacts?)
options.description: Take more time looking for unique items.

options.name: Check the Till
options.description: Look for cash.

title: Searching for Antiquities
description: You take time to examine the strange objects in the shop. [Investigation/Arcana check DC 14]. You find: a dusty tome with strange symbols OR an odd metallic puzzle box OR a figurine that faintly hums (similar to the Tumbler?).

options.name: Take Dusty Tome
options.description: Pocket the potentially magical/valuable book.

options.name: Take Puzzle Box
options.description: Pocket the intricate box.

options.name: Take Humming Figurine
options.description: Pocket the potentially related artifact.

options.name: Find Nothing Interesting
options.description: Just old junk.

title: Checking Antiquities Till
description: You check the simple wooden till behind the counter. It contains a meager amount of coin (1d8 SP, 2d10 CP).

options.name: Take the Coins
options.description: Pocket the small change.

options.name: Search for Other Valuables
options.description: Look for artifacts or hidden stashes.

title: Listening for Antiquities Owner
description: You pause inside the antiquities shop and listen carefully for sounds from upstairs. You hear... faint snoring OR floorboards creaking above OR silence.

options.name: Continue Burglary Quietly (If Snoring/Silence)
options.description: The owner seems asleep or absent.

options.name: Freeze/Hide (If Creaking)
options.description: Someone is moving upstairs! Hide or prepare to flee.

options.name: Leave Now (If Creaking/Nervous)
options.description: Abort the heist.

title: Antiquities Storeroom Search
description: You search the dusty storeroom at the back of the antiquities shop. It's mostly filled with packing material, broken pottery, and unsold junk. [Perception check DC 14]. Success: You find a crate containing several unopened bottles of aged wine OR a hidden loose floorboard revealing a small stash of coins (3d6 GP). Failure: Nothing of value.

options.name: Take Wine/Coins (If Success)
options.description: Secure the found valuables.

options.name: Move to Main Shop (If Failure)
options.description: Nothing here. Try the front.

title: Boarding Paid Passage
description: You board the ship for which you paid passage. As a paying passenger, you are shown to a small but adequate cabin. The journey begins soon. [Potential Branch End]

options.name: Settle In for the Voyage
options.description: Relax and see where the journey takes you.

options.name: Explore the Ship (Passenger Areas)
options.description: Mingle with other passengers, look around.

title: Passenger Rumors
