description: Before the ship departs, you chat with other passengers or crew. You learn the ship's destination (e.g., a major southern port city, a remote island colony) and perhaps hear rumors about pirates, storms, or strange sightings at sea.

options.name: Note Destination/Rumors
options.description: File away the information.

options.name: Board the Ship
options.description: Proceed with departure.

title: Joining the Crew
description: You board the ship as working crew. You're directed to the cramped, smelly crew quarters and immediately put to work hauling ropes or scrubbing decks. It's hard labor, but you're leaving Nestlebrook.

options.name: Endure the Work
options.description: Focus on your tasks and the journey. [Potential Branch End?]

options.name: Try to Learn Navigation/Sailing
options.description: Pay attention, try to pick up useful skills.

options.name: Look for Opportunities Amongst Crew
options.description: Gambling? Theft? Information?

title: Learning Ship's Destination
description: You ask a fellow crew member or officer where the ship is heading. You're told the destination (e.g., Port Azure down the coast, the distant Spice Islands, etc.).

options.name: Accept Destination
options.description: Continue working your passage.

options.name: Consider Jumping Ship at Next Stop?
options.description: If the destination isn't ideal.

title: Guard Info on Gangs
description: You ask the guard if the thug descriptions match local gangs. He sighs. 'Sounds like maybe Kraken's Crew or Salty Dogs. Always fighting over turf down the docks. Best stay clear of 'em both.'

options.name: Note Gang Names
options.description: Remember the local troublemakers.

options.name: Thank Guard and Leave
options.description: End interaction.

title: Empty Alley (Guards)
description: You lead the guards back to the alley, but the thugs are long gone. 'Told ya,' one guard mutters. 'They don't stick around.' They seem uninterested in investigating further.

options.name: Leave with Guards
options.description: Return to the main street.

options.name: Search Alley for Clues Yourself
options.description: Look around after the guards leave.

title: Alley Clue Search
description:
Searching the alley after the thugs (and possibly guards) are gone. [Perception check DC 13].

Success: You find a dropped weapon (rusty knife?) OR a gang symbol crudely scratched on the wall (Kraken/Salty Dog?) OR a few spilled coins.

Failure: The alley yields no useful clues.

options.name: Take Weapon/Coins (If Found)
options.description: Pocket the findings.

options.name: Note Gang Symbol (If Found)
options.description: Identify the likely culprits.

options.name: Leave the Alley
options.description: Move on.

title: Alley Ambush (Thugs vs Guards)
description: Incredibly, the thugs are still lurking in the alley when you return with the guards! Seeing the Watch, they either attack desperately or try to flee.

options.name: Help Guards Fight Thugs
options.description: Join the fray.

options.name: Stay Back and Watch
options.description: Let the guards handle it.

options.name: Try to Flee During Chaos
options.description: Use the fight as a diversion to slip away.

title: Guard Directions
description: The guard, accepting your story, gives you simple directions towards the docks, market, or main gate out of town.

options.name: Follow Directions
options.description: Head towards your chosen destination.

options.name: Thank Him, Go Elsewhere
options.description: Ignore directions, pursue own plan.

title: Guard on Tavern Trouble
description: 'Trouble at the Sailor?' The guard sighs. 'Always. Drunks, gamblers, occasional brawl. That mercenary fella looks like trouble waiting to happen too. Just keep yer head down.'

options.name: Ask More About Mercenary
options.description: 'Know anything about him?'

options.name: Thank Guard, Leave
options.description: End conversation.

title: Backpedaling with Guard
description: You quickly try to smooth things over with the suspicious guard. 'Sorry, officer. Just shaken up by the attack.' He eyes you for a moment longer, then nods curtly. 'Alright. Just be careful.'

options.name: Thank Him, Leave
options.description: Continue on your way.

options.name: Ask for Directions
options.description: Try to act normal.

title: Maintaining Defiance (Guard)
description: You maintain your defensive posture with the guard. He frowns, clearly marking you as potential trouble. 'Don't let me catch you causing problems,' he warns, before moving on or continuing to watch you.

options.name: Leave Area Under Scrutiny
options.description: Move away from the guard's attention.

options.name: Ignore Him, Continue Business
options.description: Proceed with your plans, knowing you're watched.

title: Abrupt Departure (Guard)
description: You abruptly end the conversation and walk away from the suspicious guard. This action likely confirms his suspicions and may attract more attention from the Watch later.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook Quickly
options.description: Get out before the guards decide to detain you.

options.name: Find Hiding Place
options.description: Lie low.

title: Getting Bearings (Lost)
description: Scanning your surroundings from the unfamiliar street, you spot the Tidecaller Lighthouse on the cliffs OR the masts of ships at the docks OR the smoke from the market square.

options.name: Head Towards Lighthouse
options.description: Orient yourself by the lighthouse.

options.name: Head Towards Docks
options.description: Make your way to the waterfront.

options.name: Head Towards Market Square
options.description: Go to the town center.

title: Asking Directions (Lost)
description: You stop a passing local and ask for directions. They eye your rough appearance but point you towards the market, docks, or nearest tavern.

options.name: Follow Directions
options.description: Head towards the indicated location.

options.name: Ask About Current Location
options.description: 'What street is this?' Try to learn more.

title: Exploring Unfamiliar Street
description: You explore the unfamiliar street where you emerged after getting lost in the alleys. It seems to be a residential area with small houses OR a poorer district near warehouses OR borders the town graveyard.

options.name: Look for Burglary Targets (Residential)
options.description: Case the houses.

options.name: Investigate Warehouses (Poorer District)
options.description: Check for gang activity or storage.

options.name: Explore Graveyard
options.description: Look for shelter or secrets among the graves.

options.name: Try to Find Main Street
options.description: Get back to a more familiar area.

title: Stable Work Reward
description: You receive your meager payment (bread/cheese or 3 CP) for mucking out the stalls. It wasn't pleasant, but it was honest.

options.name: Eat/Pocket Reward, Leave
options.description: Depart the stable.

options.name: Ask Stablehand for Information
options.description: Try to get rumors now that you've worked.

title: Stablehand Gossip
description: While working or after getting paid, you ask the stablehand for gossip. He might mention: strange lights at the lighthouse, guards asking about strangers, or trouble between local fishermen and a wealthy merchant (Borin?).

options.name: Inquire Further About Lighthouse/Guards/Merchant
options.description: Ask for more details on the topic he mentioned.

options.name: Thank Him, Leave
options.description: End the conversation.

title: Paid for Stable Stay
description: You pay the stablehand the 5 coppers he demanded for your unauthorized stay. He lets you leave.

options.name: Leave the Stable
options.description: Exit.

title: Stablehand Victory
description: You defeat the stablehand. He lies unconscious amidst the hay. The stables are quiet except for the horses.

options.name: Loot Stablehand
options.description: Check his pockets.

options.name: Search the Stables Thoroughly
options.description: Now undisturbed, look for valuables or useful items.

options.name: Flee Before Owner/Guards Arrive
options.description: Get out quickly.

title: Stablehand Defeat
description: The stablehand, surprisingly adept with the pitchfork, manages to subdue you or drive you off. You're likely injured and thrown out of the stables.

options.name: Tend Wounds / Seek Healing
options.description: Deal with injuries.

options.name: Try Different Shelter
options.description: Look for the abandoned shack or other options.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: This town is nothing but trouble.

title: Water Refused
description: Finn weakly refuses the stagnant barrel water. He needs clean water.

options.name: Try the Public Well
options.description: Go get clean water.

options.name: Give Up on Helping
options.description: Leave him be.

title: Finn's Meager Possessions
description: You take the few coppers OR the map fragment found amongst Finn's belongings.

options.name: Examine Map Fragment (If Taken)
options.description: See if the coastal rocks map is useful.

options.name: Leave the Shack
options.description: Depart.

title: Wave Token
description: You examine the small wooden token carved with a wave symbol. It feels smooth, worn by handling. Does it signify anything?

items.name: Wooden Wave Token
items.description: A small token carved with a wave.

options.name: Keep Token (Possible Clue)
options.description: Hold onto it.

options.name: Discard Token
options.description: Likely meaningless.

options.name: Ask Locals About Symbol?
options.description: See if anyone recognizes the wave carving.

title: Clue Acquired (Finn)
description: You pocket the clue left behind by Finn (note fragment or token). It might be useful later.

options.name: Leave the Shack
options.description: Depart.

title: Following Finn's Tracks
description: You follow Finn's faint tracks leading away from the shack towards the docks. The tracks look unsteady, stumbling.

options.name: Find Finn Collapsed Near Docks
options.description: He didn't make it far.

options.name: Tracks Lead to Water's Edge
options.description: Did he fall in? Or get on a boat?

options.name: Lose Tracks Among Dock Crowds
options.description: The trail disappears.

title: Warm Meal
description: You spend your coppers on a hot pie or stew. The warmth spreads through you, improving your mood and energy slightly.

options.name: Look for Work
options.description: Feeling better, seek employment.

options.name: Look for Theft Opportunity
options.description: Feeling better, seek illicit gains.

options.name: Find Shelter
options.description: Look for a place to rest.

title: Stealing Market Food
description:
You try to snatch a pie from the stall. [Sleight of Hand DC 13].

Success: You grab the food and dart away unnoticed!

Failure: The vendor or a bystander shouts 'Thief!'

options.name: Eat Stolen Food (If Success)
options.description: Find a corner and quickly eat.

options.name: Flee Market (If Failure)
options.description: Run from the scene.

title: Sewer Outlet
description: Following the sluggish flow of sewage leads you towards an opening. You emerge through a grate onto a slimy beach near the harbor, outside the main docks, hopefully unseen.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Clean Up
options.description: Wash off the sewer filth in the sea.

options.name: Head Towards Docks
options.description: Approach the main dock area.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook via Coast
options.description: Start walking away from town.

title: Sewer Exit (Street)
description: You find a loose manhole cover or maintenance grate leading upwards. Pushing it aside, you emerge cautiously into a quiet alley or side street back in Nestlebrook.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Get Bearings
options.description: Figure out where you are.

options.name: Find Place to Clean Up
options.description: Locate a well or fountain.

options.name: Proceed Cautiously
options.description: Continue your plans from this new location.

title: Deeper Sewer Exploration
description: You venture deeper into the sewer tunnels. The darkness thickens, the stench worsens. Strange echoes bounce off the walls. You might encounter hazards (collapsing sections, deep water) or denizens (Otyugh? Mutant rats? Smugglers' hideout?). [Roll for encounter?]

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Encounter Sewer Hazard/Denizen
options.description: Deal with the obstacle or creature.

options.name: Find Hidden Passage/Stash
options.description: Discover a secret tunnel or hidden goods.

options.name: Decide to Turn Back
options.description: Too dangerous. Return towards an exit.

title: Storage Room Loot
description: You pocket the found item (coins, rope, etc.) from the storage room.

options.name: Exit Back the Way You Came
options.description: Leave the building.

options.name: Enter Main Room
options.description: Proceed further inside.

title: Eavesdropping (Storage Room)
description: Pressing your ear to the door leading to the main room, you overhear conversation: two shopkeepers discussing slow business OR guards talking about patrols OR hushed voices mentioning 'shipments' and 'the lighthouse'.

options.name: Note Information
options.description: Remember the potentially useful gossip.

options.name: Enter Main Room Cautiously
options.description: Proceed inside.

options.name: Exit Back the Way You Came
options.description: Leave the building.

title: Exiting Back Door Building
description: You slip back out the rear door into the alley, leaving the building behind.

options.name: Continue Journey/Plans
options.description: Proceed with your goals in Nestlebrook.

title: Entering Main Room (Back Door)
description: You cautiously enter the main room of the building from the storage area. It appears to be a tavern common room / shop floor / warehouse space. People might be present.

options.name: Assess the Situation
options.description: Quickly scan the room for occupants or points of interest.

title: Finding Safe Descent (Rooftops)
description: You spot a sturdy drainpipe leading down into a quiet alley OR a series of low, connected roofs allowing an easy climb down.

options.name: Climb Down
options.description: Descend safely to street level.

title: Rooftop Observation
description: From your rooftop vantage point, you observe the streets below. [Perception check DC 14]. You spot: guards questioning people OR cloaked figures meeting in an alley OR merchants closing up shop OR nothing unusual.

options.name: Investigate Guard Activity
options.description: Climb down and get closer to see what the guards are doing.

options.name: Investigate Cloaked Figures
options.description: Descend and try to eavesdrop or follow them.

options.name: Target Closing Shop
options.description: Note a potential burglary target.

options.name: Descend Safely (Nothing Seen)
options.description: Climb down.

title: Risky Rooftop Descent
description:
You attempt a difficult jump to a lower roof or a risky climb down a crumbling wall. [Acrobatics/Athletics check DC 15].

Success: You make it down, perhaps with a hard landing but safe.

Failure: You slip and fall the remaining distance! [Take 1d6+2 bludgeoning damage?].

options.name: Landed Safely (If Success)
options.description: You're back on the ground.

options.name: Deal with Fall Injury (If Failure)
options.description: Assess damage, try to move.

title: Rooftop Respite
description: You rest hidden on the rooftop, catching your breath and letting the adrenaline fade. The sounds of the street below eventually quiet down.

options.name: Descend Safely
options.description: Climb down now that things seem calm.

options.name: Continue Rooftop Travel
options.description: Keep moving across the roofs.

title: Stowaway Arrival
description: After days (or weeks) at sea, hidden or working, the ship finally makes landfall. You can try to slip ashore unnoticed or disembark with the crew.

options.name: Slip Ashore Stealthily
options.description: Try to leave the ship without being seen.

options.name: Disembark Normally (If Working)
options.description: Leave with the crew.

options.name: Face Port Authorities (If Confined)
options.description: Be handed over to the local law.

title: Determining Ship's Destination
description: By listening to crew chatter or finding discarded charts, you manage to determine the ship's likely destination:  the remote Scholar's Isle. Other  places  were  also mentioned by the crew, the bustling metropolis of Silverhaven, the pirate haven of Tortuga's Rest, stood out ot darryn, but one shipmate stoodout knowingly.

options.name: Accept Destination
options.description: Continue the voyage.

options.name: Plan Escape Before Arrival?
options.description: If the destination sounds bad, try to get off sooner?

title: Stowaway Cargo Search
description: Searching the cargo hold while avoiding the crew, you find crates marked with the symbols of a known merchant house from [Destination City] OR crates containing exotic spices OR locked chests potentially holding valuables.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device, humming faintly.

options.name: Note Merchant House (Info)
options.description: Remember the name for potential future dealings.

options.name: Steal Spices?
options.description: Try to take a small amount of valuable spices.

options.name: Attempt to Pick Locked Chest
options.description: Use Thieves' Tools if available. [DC 15?].

options.name: Return to Hiding
options.description: Go back to your concealed spot.

title: Stowaway Discovered (Hostile)
description: Emerging from hiding is met with immediate hostility. The crew members seize you, perhaps roughing you up. 'Stowaway! Lock 'em in the brig!' You are disarmed and thrown into a dark, cramped space below deck.

options.name: Confined Until Landfall
options.description: Wait until the ship reaches port to face authorities.

title: Stowaway Interrogation
description: The crew corners you, demanding answers. 'Who are you? Why are you on this ship? Running from something?' They seem more curious than immediately hostile, but suspicious.

options.name: Lie (Invent Plausible Story)
options.description: 'Seeking passage, couldn't afford fare.' [Deception check].

options.name: Tell Partial Truth (Vague)
options.description: 'Leaving trouble behind in Nestlebrook.'

options.name: Offer to Work
options.description: Reiterate willingness to earn passage.

title: Befriending Crew
description: While working alongside the crew, you try to make friends or gather information. You might learn about the ship's route, the captain's habits, crew grievances, or rumors from other ports.

options.name: Learn Ship's Destination/Route
options.description: Confirm where you are heading.

options.name: Hear Useful Rumors
options.description: Gain information about potential opportunities or dangers elsewhere.

options.name: Fail to Gain Trust
options.description: The crew remains wary or uninterested.

title: Theft Amongst Crew
description: Even while working, you keep an eye out for theft opportunities. Perhaps lifting a few coins from a sleeping sailor's pouch or swiping a tool or minor item.

options.name: Attempt Minor Theft
options.description: Try to steal something small. [Sleight of Hand check].

options.name: Decide Against It
options.description: Too risky, could jeopardize your passage.

title: Sailor Defeated
description: You defeat the sailor trying to eject you from the ship. You need to act fast before others arrive.

options.name: Find Hiding Place Quickly
options.description: Disappear into the hold or another concealed spot.

options.name: Loot Sailor?
options.description: Quickly check his pockets.

options.name: Jump Overboard
options.description: Escape into the water.

title: Subdued by Sailor
description: The tough sailor overpowers you. You are likely knocked out or tied up and dragged before the captain or first mate.

options.name: Face the Captain's Judgment
options.description: Be confined or thrown off at the next opportunity.

title: Barricaded on Ship
description: You manage to find a small cabin or storage closet and barricade the door from the inside using furniture or cargo. You hear crew members shouting and pounding on the door outside.

options.name: Wait Out the Siege?
options.description: Hope they give up or the ship reaches port.

options.name: Look for Another Exit
options.description: Is there a window, vent, or loose panel?

options.name: Prepare for Breach
options.description: Get ready to fight when they break through.

title: Exploring the Ship (Fugitive)
description: Knowing the crew is alerted, you move stealthily through the ship's interior, looking for supplies, information, or a better hiding place, while avoiding patrols.

options.name: Find Captain's Cabin / Charts
options.description: Locate the command center, possibly find maps or logs.

options.name: Find Galley / Stores
options.description: Look for food and water.

options.name: Encounter Crew Patrol!
options.description: Run into sailors searching for you.

options.name: Find Secure Hiding Spot
options.description: Discover a better place to conceal yourself.

title: Safe Under Pier
description: You wait, shivering in the cold water under the pier, until the sounds of pursuit fade away. The coast seems clear.

options.name: Emerge and Clean Up
options.description: Get out of the water and try to dry off.

options.name: Stay Hidden Longer
options.description: Remain concealed just in case.

title: Spotted Under Pier!
description: A voice calls down from above! 'Hey! There's someone hiding under here!' Your cover is blown. Pursuers or guards lean over the edge.

options.name: Swim Away Quickly
options.description: Dive and swim further along the docks or out to sea.

options.name: Surrender
options.description: Give up.

options.name: Try to Climb Up and Fight/Flee
options.description: Scramble onto the pier.

title: Blending In (Ferry)
description: You try to act like a normal passenger on the ferry, finding a seat or leaning on the rail, observing the other travelers and the coastline.

options.name: Listen for Destination Info
options.description: Eavesdrop on conversations.

options.name: Look for Opportunities (Pickpocket?)
options.description: Scan fellow passengers.

options.name: Enjoy the Ride
options.description: Relax until arrival.

title: Ferry Destination
description: You learn the ferry's destination: it's simply crossing the bay to a smaller village opposite Nestlebrook OR heading to the regional capital further down the coast.

options.name: Accept Destination (Village)
options.description: Prepare to disembark at the nearby village.

options.name: Accept Destination (Capital)
options.description: Prepare for arrival in the larger city.

title: Hiding on the Ferry
description: You find a place to hide on the ferry - perhaps among luggage, behind lifeboats, or in a little-used service closet. You avoid scrutiny but miss observing passengers or the journey.

options.name: Remain Hidden Until Arrival
options.description: Wait until the ferry docks.

options.name: Risk Peeking Out Periodically
options.description: Try to gather info without being seen.

title: Rescue from Drowning
description: As your strength fails and darkness encroaches, strong hands haul you from the icy water onto a small boat or back onto the pier. You cough up water, saved from drowning but now at the mercy of your rescuers (Guards? Fishermen? Smugglers?).

options.name: Face Rescuers
options.description: Deal with whoever saved you.

title: Drowned (Ending)
description: Your struggles cease. The cold, dark water of Nestlebrook harbor claims you. Your desperate flight, the strange Tumbler, the whispers of Loc - all fade into oblivion. [Game Over]

options.name: The End
options.description: Your story ends here.

title: Examining the Cell
description:
You thoroughly examine your cell. The stone walls are solid, the bars thick. The straw pallet is thin and dirty. [Perception check DC 15].

Success: You find a loose stone in the wall hiding a small shiv OR notice a weakness in the bar's weld OR find graffiti hinting at escape methods.

Failure: The cell seems secure and bare.

options.name: Use Shiv/Weakness (If Found)
options.description: Attempt to use the found item/weakness to escape.

options.name: Note Graffiti (If Found)
options.description: Try to decipher the hints.

options.name: Wait for Guard (If Nothing Found)
options.description: No obvious escape route.

title: Talking to Prisoners
description: You try talking to prisoners in adjacent cells (if any). They might offer information about the guards, the jail's layout, previous escape attempts, or local rumors in exchange for favors or just conversation.

options.name: Learn Useful Information
options.description: Gain a clue about guards, escape routes, or who might be interested in you.

options.name: Gain Untrustworthy Ally?
options.description: Another prisoner offers to help escape, but can they be trusted?

options.name: Learn Nothing Useful
options.description: The other prisoners are unhelpful or ignorant.

title: Resting in Cell
description: You try to get some rest on the uncomfortable straw pallet. Sleep is fitful, disturbed by the cold, damp, and sounds of the jail.

options.name: Wake Up (Guard Arrival?)
options.description: Time passes. A guard might arrive for interrogation or meals.

title: Confession and Plea
description: You confess to the theft but plead desperation - hunger, poverty. The Guard Captain listens stonily. 'Poverty doesn't excuse crime. You'll face the magistrate.' Your plea seems to have little effect on the sentence, but perhaps avoids harsher treatment.

options.name: Ask About the Tumbler
options.description: 'What about that device you took? What is it?'

options.name: Accept Fate
options.description: Await judgment.

title: Maintaining Innocence (Jail)
description: You maintain your innocence, denying the theft or claiming it was a misunderstanding. The Guard Captain sighs. 'We have witnesses. And this...' (she gestures towards the Tumbler, if confiscated) '... is hardly typical pocket lint. Your denials aren't convincing.'

options.name: Offer Information (Bargain)
options.description: Change tact, offer intel on factions/lighthouse.

options.name: Remain Silent
options.description: Refuse to speak further.

options.name: Demand Magistrate
options.description: Insist on seeing the judge.

title: Bargaining with Information (Jail)
description: You offer the Guard Captain information about the Unbound cult, the Keeper mercenary, or the strange events at the lighthouse in exchange for leniency or release. She seems interested. 'Tell me what you know. If it proves useful...'

options.name: Share Information
options.description: Reveal what you know about the factions and their activities.

options.name: Demand Release First
options.description: Insist on being freed before sharing.

title: Remaining Silent (Jail)
description: You refuse to answer the Guard Captain's questions. She regards you coolly. 'Very well. Silence won't help your case with the magistrate.' She signals for the guards to return you to your cell.

options.name: Returned to Cell
options.description: Back to waiting.

title: Jailhouse Observer
description: Listening carefully, you try to identify who is interested in your arrest. You might overhear guards mentioning 'that scholar Elara sent someone asking' OR 'those robed fellows were lurking nearby' OR 'the armored merc seemed interested'.

options.name: Hope for Elara's Help
options.description: Perhaps the scholar will intervene.

options.name: Fear Unbound Interest
options.description: The cultists might try to break you out... or silence you.

options.name: Worry About Keeper Interest
options.description: The Guardian might want to question you... or eliminate you.

title: Threatening Interest (Jail)
description: Knowing that the Unbound or the Keeper are aware of your imprisonment fills you with dread. They are powerful and ruthless. Your situation seems even more precarious.

options.name: Focus on Escape
options.description: Redouble efforts to find a way out of the cell.

options.name: Try to Warn Guards?
options.description: Tell the guards about the dangerous factions? [Risky, might not be believed].

title: Hopeful Interest (Jail)
description: The possibility that someone like Elara is aware of your plight offers a sliver of hope. Maybe help is on the way?

options.name: Wait Patiently for Intervention
options.description: Hope Elara or an ally acts.

options.name: Try to Send Message?
options.description: Attempt to bribe a guard to carry a message to Elara?

title: Stakeout at Silas's
description: You wait hidden near Silas's shop. After a while, Borin the merchant emerges, looking pleased, clutching a hefty coin purse but no Tumbler. OR Silas throws Borin out, arguing. OR A cloaked figure arrives and enters after Borin leaves.

options.name: Follow Borin (Got Paid)
options.description: See where he goes with the money.

options.name: Enter Shop (Argument/Cloaked Figure)
options.description: Investigate what happened.

options.name: Follow Cloaked Figure
options.description: See who else is involved.

title: Eavesdropping at Silas's
description: Pressing your ear to the door/window [Perception DC 14]: You overhear Silas haggling fiercely with Borin over the Tumbler's price, mentioning 'other interested parties'. OR You hear Borin agreeing to sell it, mentioning delivery to 'Valerius'. OR You hear raised voices, then silence.

options.name: Wait Outside
options.description: See who emerges or what happens next.

options.name: Enter the Shop Now
options.description: Interrupt the deal or investigate.

title: Entering Silas's Shop (Deal Ongoing)
description: You enter the pawn shop. Silas and Borin (or a cloaked figure) turn, surprised by your interruption. The Tumbler might be visible on the counter.

options.name: Demand the Tumbler
options.description: Confront them directly.

options.name: Attempt to Steal Tumbler (If Visible)
options.description: Make a grab for it.

options.name: Pretend to Browse
options.description: Act casual, observe.

title: Following Towards Lighthouse
description: You follow Borin (or the Unbound) along the cliff path towards the lighthouse. The wind picks up, and the tower looms closer. [Stealth check DC 13 to remain undetected].

options.name: Reach Lighthouse Approach Undetected (If Success)
options.description: Arrive near the lighthouse still unseen.

options.name: Spotted on Path! (If Failure)
options.description: They notice you following!

options.name: Ambush Now?
options.description: Attack before reaching the lighthouse.

title: Race to the Lighthouse
description: You find a rough shortcut or simply sprint ahead, arriving at the base of the Tidecaller Lighthouse before Borin / the Unbound. The heavy oak door is closed.

options.name: Prepare Ambush at Entrance
options.description: Hide and wait for them to arrive.

options.name: Try to Enter Lighthouse First
options.description: Attempt to knock, pick lock, or find another way in quickly.

options.name: Wait and Observe Arrival
options.description: See what happens when they reach the door.

title: Ambush Success (Merchant)
description: You easily defeat the merchant Borin and reclaim the Whispering Tumbler.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: A small, complex metal device. Reclaimed.

options.name: Loot the Merchant
options.description: Check his pockets.

options.name: Proceed to Lighthouse?
options.description: Continue towards the tower.

options.name: Return to Nestlebrook
options.description: Head back to town with the Tumbler.

title: Ambush Failure (Merchant)
description: Somehow, the panicked merchant manages to fight you off or escape your ambush, still holding the Tumbler. He flees towards the lighthouse or back to town, shouting.

options.name: Pursue the Merchant
options.description: Give chase again.

options.name: Give Up, Retreat
options.description: Let him go.

title: Standoff Victory
description: You defeat both the merchant and the Unbound agent in the standoff. The Whispering Tumbler lies nearby (or was on one of them).

options.name: Retrieve Tumbler and Loot Bodies
options.description: Take the artifact and check pockets.

options.name: Retrieve Tumbler and Flee
options.description: Grab the prize and get out before guards arrive.

title: Standoff Defeat
description: Outnumbered or outmatched, you are defeated by the merchant and/or the Unbound agent. They take the Tumbler (if you had it back) and likely leave you injured or unconscious.

options.name: Wake Up Later, Robbed
options.description: Regain consciousness, Tumbler gone.

title: Diversion for Merchant
description: You create a sudden diversion (shout, throw something) to distract the Unbound agent. 'Run!' you yell to Borin.

options.name: Merchant Escapes (with Tumbler?)
options.description: Borin takes the chance and flees.

options.name: Unbound Agent Focuses on You
options.description: The cultist ignores the fleeing merchant and attacks you.

title: Sharing Tumbler Info (Silas)
description: You share what you know about the Tumbler being a Key Fragment sought by factions. Silas listens, wide-eyed. 'Gods... worse than I thought. Alright, you shared... that info on Borin's smuggled weapons... use it well, but don't tell 'im I told ya!'

options.name: Conclude Business
options.description: Deal is done.

options.name: Ask for More Help/Info?
options.description: Try to press your advantage.

title: Bluffing Silas (Tumbler Knowledge)
description: You bluff or exaggerate the Tumbler's importance or your knowledge. Silas seems impressed (or more scared). He shares the information about Borin's smuggled weapons.

options.name: Conclude Business
options.description: Deal complete.

title: Paid for Dirt (Borin)
description: Borin pays you 30 GP for the damaging information about Silas.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 30 gold.

options.name: Leave Borin
options.description: Transaction complete.

title: Haggling with Borin
description:
You haggle with Borin over the price for info on Silas. [Persuasion check DC 13].

Success: 'Alright, fifty it is. Worth it to see Silas sweat.'

Failure: 'Thirty is generous. Take it or leave.'

options.name: Accept 50 GP (If Success)
options.description: Take the better payment.

options.name: Accept 30 GP
options.description: Take the original offer.

options.name: Refuse Payment, Ask About Tumbler?
options.description: Try trading info for info instead.

title: Northern Salvage Location
description: You ask Borin where the salvage crate came from. 'Some wreck up north... Whispering Shoals, I think the crew called it? Dangerous waters. Said they barely made it back.'

options.name: Connect to Previous Rumors
options.description: This matches the fisherman's tale.

options.name: Thank Him, Leave
options.description: End conversation.

title: Borin on Cloaked Thugs
description: 'Those thugs?' Borin shudders. 'Dark cloaks, serpent pins. Demanded the 'Key Fragment'. Didn't call themselves Unbound, but... had that look. Offered good coin, better than Silas initially. Made me nervous.'

options.name: Confirm Unbound Involvement
options.description: Fits the description.

options.name: Thank Him, Leave
options.description: End conversation.

title: Pickpocketing Borin
description:
As Borin dismisses you, you attempt to lift his coin purse. [Sleight of Hand check DC 14].

Success: You snag his purse! (Contains 1d20+10 GP?).

Failure: He catches you! 'Thief! Guards!'

options.name: Flee with Loot (If Success)
options.description: Run before he raises a bigger alarm.

options.name: Face Guards/Fight (If Failure)
options.description: Caught red-handed.

title: Tampering History
description: You ask the old sailor if anyone ever tried tampering with the lighthouse light. 'Tried?' he scoffs. 'Aye, years back. Some fool thought he could control the tides. Light went out... storm came up like wrath itself. Smashed his boat to splinters. Lighthouse keeper then... vanished.'

options.name: Note Danger of Tampering
options.description: Seems like a bad idea.

options.name: Ask About Previous Keeper
options.description: 'What happened to the old keeper?'

title: Temple Healing Received
description: You pay the donation, and the acolyte performs healing prayers or administers aid. Your wounds are mended, and any disease seems cured. You feel restored.

options.name: Thank Acolyte, Leave
options.description: Continue your business in Nestlebrook.

options.name: Ask Acolyte for Information?
options.description: Inquire about local dangers or strange happenings.

title: Working for Temple Healing
description: The acolyte agrees to provide healing in exchange for work. You spend half a day sweeping the shrine, polishing relics, and assisting with chores. Afterwards, they tend to your wounds/illness.

options.name: Healing Received
options.description: You are restored.

title: Elara's Remedy Received
description: You pay Elara 10 GP. She provides a potent-smelling poultice or tonic. Applying it, you feel warmth spread through you, easing pain and clearing your head. Your wounds mend, illness fades.

options.name: Thank Elara, Leave
options.description: Depart her cottage.

options.name: Ask Her Questions Now (Healed)
options.description: Inquire about the Tumbler, Factions, etc.

title: Elara's Task (Healing)
description: 'A small task,' Elara says. 'There's a weed, Shadowthistle, that grows only in the old graveyard. Its roots are... problematic. Bring me three healthy roots, and I will provide your remedy.'

options.name: Agree to Task (Go to Graveyard)
options.description: Accept the fetch quest.

options.name: Refuse Task
options.description: Decline the job.

title: Guard Assists Injured
description: Seeing your state, the guard helps you to a nearby bench or offers to escort you to the town healer (if one exists) or the jailhouse infirmary (less appealing).

options.name: Accept Escort to Healer
options.description: Go get medical attention.

options.name: Accept Escort to Jail (Infirmary)
options.description: Probably means being locked up after.

options.name: Decline Help, Try Self-Care
options.description: Insist you're fine.

title: Stranger's Aid
description: You accept the kind stranger's help. They assist you in cleaning your wounds with supplies they have, offer you some food/water, or help you reach a safer place like an inn's steps or Elara's cottage.

options.name: Reach Safer Place
options.description: Arrive at Inn/Elara's/etc.

title: Stranger's Guidance
description: You ask the kind stranger for help getting to a healer or shelter. They nod sympathetically. 'I can help you to Elara's cottage - she knows herbs - or perhaps the Salty Siren inn, if you have coin for a room?'

options.name: Go to Elara's Cottage
options.description: Accept help getting to the scholar.

options.name: Go to Salty Siren Inn
options.description: Accept help getting to the inn.

options.name: Thank Them, Decline Specific Help
options.description: Appreciate the offer but decide to manage alone.

title: Fighting Rats (Injured)

enemies.name: Giant Rat (x2)
enemies.description: Oversized rodents attracted by weakness.

description: While weak in the alley, giant rats scurry out, sensing an easy meal! You must defend yourself despite your injuries. [Start combat potentially with disadvantage or reduced max HP?]
limitation: Darryn is injured. Rats might flee if one is killed. Victory leads to Node 1191. Defeat leads to Node 1192.

title: Facing New Thug (Injured)

enemies.name: Opportunistic Thug
enemies.description: A lowlife looking to rob the weak.

description: Another thug wanders into the alley and spots you injured. 'Well, well,' he sneers, hefting a club. 'Looks like someone left some pickings.' You must fight again while hurt.
limitation: Darryn is injured. Thug might flee if badly wounded. Victory leads to Node 1193. Defeat leads to Node 1194.

title: Waking Up (Dock Collapse)
description: You regain consciousness. You're still on the docks, but someone has moved you slightly or covered you with a rough blanket. It seems some time has passed.

options.name: Look Around for Helper/Witness
options.description: See if anyone is nearby.

options.name: Check Belongings
options.description: See if you were robbed.

options.name: Try to Stand and Move
options.description: Assess injuries and try to leave.

title: Waking Up Robbed (Dock Collapse)
description: You wake up on the cold docks, aching all over. A quick check confirms your worst fears - anything of value you had left is gone. You've hit rock bottom again.

options.name: Seek Help (Beg/Guard)
options.description: Look for charity or report the theft.

options.name: Look for Desperate Measures (Work/Theft)
options.description: Need to survive.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook Utterly Broke (Ending?)
options.description: Give up on this town entirely.

title: Rejected by Sailors
description: The sailors reject your pleas for passage or help, perhaps mocking your injuries or telling you to see a proper healer. No aid is forthcoming here.

options.name: Try to Find Healer
options.description: Look for temple or Elara.

options.name: Try to Find Shelter
options.description: Look for somewhere to rest.

options.name: Leave Town (Injured)
options.description: Stagger away from Nestlebrook.

title: Ship's Surgeon Aid
description: A ship's surgeon takes pity, cleaning your wounds and providing basic bandages. 'Can't take you aboard, but this should help. Get yourself somewhere warm.'

options.name: Thank Surgeon, Seek Shelter
options.description: Find somewhere to recover.

title: Damages Paid
description: You pay the barkeep 30 GP for the damages. He grudgingly accepts it. 'Alright. Now get out. And don't come back anytime soon.'

options.name: Leave the Tavern
options.description: Exit.

title: Haggling Damages
description:
You try to haggle the damage cost down from 30 GP. [Persuasion check DC 14].

Success: 'Fine! Twenty gold, and you clean up this mess!'

Failure: 'Thirty gold, or I call the Watch!'

options.name: Pay 20 GP + Clean Up (If Success)
options.description: Accept the reduced price and consequence.

options.name: Pay 30 GP (If Failure)
options.description: Pay the original amount.

options.name: Refuse to Pay (If Failure)
options.description: Won't pay.

title: Stopping the Barkeep
description: You lunge towards the barkeep to stop him calling the guards. This likely initiates combat with him.

options.name: Fight the Barkeep
options.description: Engage the tavern owner.

title: Renting Room (Salty Siren)
description: The plump innkeeper smiles warmly. 'A room? Certainly, dearie. 5 silver per night.' You pay for a simple, clean room.

options.name: Rest in Room
options.description: Enjoy a peaceful night's sleep.

options.name: Talk to Innkeeper
options.description: Ask her for local news or rumors.

title: Salty Siren Rumors
description: In the quiet common room of the Salty Siren, you overhear or learn from the innkeeper: talk of increased guard patrols due to recent thefts, whispers about Elara the Hedge Witch being visited by strangers, and concerns about the weather turning bad near the Whispering Shoals.

options.name: Be Cautious (Guards)
options.description: Note the increased Watch activity.

options.name: Investigate Elara's Visitors?
options.description: Consider visiting Elara.

options.name: Ask More About Shoals Weather
options.description: Inquire about the bad weather forecast.

title: Salty Siren Theft Opportunity?
description: The Salty Siren seems respectable. Opportunities for theft are slim. Perhaps a traveler left their room key on the counter briefly, or a bag unattended near the fireplace?

options.name: Attempt to Snatch Key
options.description: Try to grab the room key. [Sleight of Hand DC 15].

options.name: Attempt to Lift Bag
options.description: Try to take the unattended bag. [Sleight of Hand DC 14].

options.name: Decide Against It
options.description: Too risky in this quiet place.

title: Observing Leaky Barrel
description: From a dark corner in the Leaky Barrel, you observe the patrons. Mostly hard-luck cases, desperate gamblers, and a few toughs who look like gang members (Kraken's Crew?). It smells of despair and cheap spirits.

options.name: Approach Gang Members?
options.description: Try talking to the toughs.

options.name: Look for Gambling Game
options.description: Inquire about dice or cards.

options.name: Look for Easy Mark
options.description: Scan for someone truly drunk or foolish.

options.name: Leave
options.description: This place feels wrong.

title: Leaky Barrel Gambling
description: You find a rough dice game happening in a back room. Stakes seem low, but tensions are high. Cheating seems likely.

options.name: Join the Game
options.description: Risk your coin.

options.name: Watch for Cheats
options.description: Observe the game closely before playing.

options.name: Attempt to Cheat?
options.description: Try your own luck at deception.

options.name: Back Out
options.description: Decide against playing.

title: Leaky Barrel Mark
description: Scanning the room, the 'easiest' mark seems to be a very drunk old man mumbling to himself, his coin pouch loose. However, robbing him might attract unwanted attention or pity.

options.name: Attempt the Theft
options.description: Try to lift the old man's pouch. [Sleight of Hand DC 11].

options.name: Reconsider, Find Another Way
options.description: Feels wrong or too pathetic.

title: Escape Attempt (Cliff Edge)
description:
Near the cliff edge, you make your move! You try to trip the nearest cultist towards the edge OR make a sudden dash away while they navigate the narrow path. [Dexterity/Athletics check DC 15].

Success: You cause confusion, break free, and scramble away!

Failure: You stumble, they restrain you more securely, possibly injuring you in the process.

options.name: Escape into Wilderness! (If Success)
options.description: You are free but pursued.

options.name: Restrained Again (If Failure)
options.description: Escape failed, possibly worse situation.

title: Targeting Lagging Cultist
description: If your bonds are loose, you wait for one cultist (perhaps the one with the injured leg) to fall slightly behind, then make your move!

options.name: Attack the Lagger
options.description: Try to quickly overpower the isolated cultist. [Combat, 1 vs 1 initially].

options.name: Use Lagger as Hostage?
options.description: Attempt to grab them and threaten the others. [Very Risky].

options.name: Opportunity Missed
options.description: Hesitate too long, the chance passes.

title: Dash for the Woods
description: Seeing dense woods nearby, you make a sudden break for the treeline, hoping the trees and undergrowth will provide cover.

options.name: Attempt Escape into Woods
options.description: Run into the forest. [Stealth/Athletics check vs Pursuit].

title: Arrival at Lighthouse (Captive)
description: Unable to escape, you are dragged by the Unbound cultists to the base of the Tidecaller Lighthouse. The heavy oak door stands before you. They knock in a specific rhythm.

options.name: Door Opens
options.description: The gaunt servant opens the door, ushering the cultists (and you) inside.

options.name: Last Chance Struggle?
options.description: Make one final attempt to break free at the threshold.

title: Lighthouse Beam Lore
description: 'The beam!' a cultist spits. 'Valerius refocused it. Not just a warning light now... it's a conduit! Draws down the lunar power, channels the tide's forgotten magic! Aligns the energies needed to weaken Loc's chains!'

options.name: Ask About Weakening Chains
options.description: 'How does that free him?'

options.name: Look for Escape
options.description: Use their rant as distraction.

title: Feigning Conversion
description:
You try to convince the Unbound you wish to join them, to serve Loc. [High DC Deception check DC 17].

Success: They seem surprised, maybe suspicious, but pause. 'A convert? Perhaps Loc *does* guide you... You might serve in the ritual, not *as* the ritual...'

Failure: They laugh cruelly. 'Think us fools? Your fear stinks. Silence!'

options.name: Potential New Role (If Success)
options.description: They might treat you differently, offering a chance to observe or act.

options.name: Bluff Failed (If Failure)
options.description: Back to being a sacrifice/prisoner.

title: Picking the Moonpetal
description: You carefully reach out and pluck one of the luminous Moonpetal Blossoms. It feels cool and slightly tingly in your hand, pulsing with faint light. You have what Elara wanted.

items.name: Whispering Tumbler
items.description: Identified as a Key Fragment for Loc's prison.

items.name: Moonpetal Blossom
items.description: A faintly glowing flower from Whispering Falls.

options.name: Return to Elara
options.description: Head back to the scholar's cottage.

options.name: Investigate Grotto Further
options.description: Look around more before leaving.

options.name: Check Snares (If Set)
options.description: Check your traps on the way back.

title: Listening to Falls Whispers
description:
You focus, concentrating on the strange whispers echoing from the waterfall. [Wisdom or Arcana check DC 15].

Success: Fragments become clearer: '...the key turns... tide rises... gate weakens...' OR you feel a presence - ancient, watchful, perhaps Fey.

Failure: The whispers remain indistinct, a meaningless chorus.

options.name: Note Phrases (If Success)
options.description: Remember the cryptic words about key/tide/gate.

options.name: Acknowledge Presence (If Success)
options.description: Try speaking to the unseen presence?

options.name: Gather Blossom/Leave (If Failure)
options.description: Can't understand the whispers.

title: Examining the Pool
description: You peer into the clear, moonlit pool at the base of the falls. The bottom is smooth stone, but you notice faint runes carved there, similar to those in the lighthouse. OR You see the reflection of the moon, but it seems distorted, rippling unnaturally.

options.name: Note Runes
options.description: Remember the symbols.

options.name: Touch the Water?
options.description: Reach into the pool.

options.name: Gather Blossom/Leave
options.description: Focus on the quest objective.

title: Sensing Danger (Falls)
description:
You scan the grotto, alert for danger. [Perception check DC 14, possibly modified by Anti-Fey charm].

Success: You spot shimmering outlines near the edges of the grotto - likely hidden Fey creatures watching you.

Failure: The grotto seems peaceful and empty, aside from the whispers.

options.name: Address Fey (If Success)
options.description: Speak to the hidden watchers.

options.name: Gather Blossom Quickly (If Success)
options.description: Grab the flower and leave before they interfere.

options.name: Proceed Normally (If Failure)
options.description: Assume the area is safe.

title: Interacting with Pixies
description: You try calling out or offering a shiny trinket to the Pixies. They giggle and might dart closer, curious, OR remain elusive, vanishing entirely.

options.name: Ask Pixies for Directions?
options.description: See if they understand and will help.

options.name: They Ignore/Vanish
options.description: Cannot communicate.

options.name: They Play Tricks?
options.description: Maybe they try to lead you astray or steal something small.

title: Fighting Giant Spider

enemies.name: Giant Spider
enemies.description: A large arachnid descending from the trees.

description: A Giant Spider lowers itself silently into your camp! It lunges, fangs dripping!
limitation: Spider might try to web Darryn. Victory leads to Node 1217. Defeat leads to Node 1218.

title: Investigating Humming
description: Following the strange, melodic humming, you push through the trees and find a small clearing containing faintly glowing mushrooms OR a hidden shrine with resonating crystals.

options.name: Examine Glowing Mushrooms
options.description: Are they edible? Magical? [Nature/Arcana check].

options.name: Examine Hidden Shrine
options.description: Look at the crystals and any carvings. [Investigation/Arcana check].

options.name: Return to Camp
options.description: Go back to where you were resting.

title: Investigating Tremor
description: Looking for the source of the tremor, you find evidence of recent digging nearby OR a large burrow entrance OR the ground seems unstable, prone to collapse.

options.name: Examine Digging Signs
options.description: Who or what was digging here?

options.name: Investigate Burrow
options.description: Peer inside the large hole. [Risky].

options.name: Avoid Unstable Ground
options.description: Move away from the hazardous area.

title: Uneventful Night/Return to Camp
description: The disturbance passes, or your investigation reveals nothing immediately threatening. You return to your campsite and manage to get some rest until morning.

options.name: Continue Journey at Dawn
options.description: Proceed with your original quest/travel.

title: Checking Snares
description:
On your way back from Whispering Falls, you check the snares you set earlier. [Luck roll or based on previous Survival check].

Success: You caught a rabbit or bird!

Failure: The snares are empty or tripped by something non-edible.

options.name: Take Catch (If Success)
options.description: Collect the food.

options.name: Continue to Elara
options.description: Proceed back to the scholar.

title: Bushwhacking Success
description: Pushing through the dense woods,  you eventually hear the sound of falling water and find your way to the Whispering Falls grotto.

options.name: Approach the Falls
options.description: Enter the grotto.

title: Finding New Path
description: Searching off the main trail, you find another faint animal path OR a dry stream bed leading generally in the direction you need to go.

options.name: Follow New Path/Stream Bed
options.description: Try the alternative route.

title: Lost in the Woods
description: Trying to navigate off-trail, you become disoriented. The sounds of the forest seem confusing, and you're unsure which way leads to the Falls or back towards Nestlebrook. [Requires Wisdom (Survival) check DC 14 to reorient].

options.name: Reorient Successfully
options.description: Get your bearings, continue search.

options.name: Remain Lost, Make Camp
options.description: Wait for daylight or try again.

options.name: Wander Aimlessly (Risk Encounter)
options.description: Keep moving, hoping to stumble onto the path.

title: Observing Mystery Boat
description: You watch the boat with faint lights heading out towards the Whispering Shoals. It's a small, fast fishing vessel, moving quietly without running lights. Smugglers, perhaps? Or something related to the shipwreck?

options.name: Try to Follow (If You Have Boat?)
options.description: Attempt to pursue them.

options.name: Note Boat Description
options.description: Remember its appearance.

options.name: Return Focus to Docks/Town
options.description: Let the boat go.

title: Pocketing Brandy
description: You stash the bottles of smuggled brandy. They could fetch a decent price or provide liquid courage.

items.name: Smuggled Brandy (3 bottles)
items.description: Decent quality brandy, likely stolen.

options.name: Emerge from Under Pier
options.description: Leave the hiding spot.

title: Examining Cloak Pin
description:
You examine the discarded cloak pin found under the pier. [Investigation check DC 14].

Success: It bears a small, subtle symbol: a coiled serpent OR a keyhole.

Failure: It's a plain, common metal pin.

options.name: Recognize Symbol (Unbound/Keeper)
options.description: Identify the faction likely involved.

options.name: Keep Pin (If Plain/Unsure)
options.description: Hold onto it.

options.name: Discard Pin
options.description: Seems useless.

title: Opening Waterproof Pouch
description: You open the waterproof pouch found hidden under the pier. Inside is a small amount of soggy coin (1d6 GP) AND a waterlogged note with faded writing.

options.name: Take Coins
options.description: Pocket the money.

options.name: Try to Read Note
options.description: Attempt to decipher the faded writing. [Investigation check?].

options.name: Discard Pouch/Note
options.description: Leave it.

title: Confirming Unbound Visitors
description: The description of dark-robed figures visiting Valerius at high tide strongly suggests they were Unbound cultists. Valerius seems to be associating with them, willingly or not.

options.name: Head to Lighthouse (Expecting Unbound?)
options.description: Approach the tower prepared for cultists.

options.name: Warn Keeper Marius?
options.description: Inform the Guardian about Valerius's visitors.

title: Valerius's Ambiguous Role
description: Valerius's apparent contempt for 'blind obedience' (like the Keepers) yet association with the Unbound makes his true allegiance unclear. Is he manipulating the cultists for his own ends? Or is he a high-ranking, independent member?

options.name: Proceed with Caution (Assume Deception)
options.description: Be wary when dealing with Valerius.

title: Seeking the Unbound
description: You decide to seek out the Unbound cultists directly. Where do you look?

options.name: Check Warehouse (If Seen Earlier)
options.description: Investigate the warehouse near the docks.

options.name: Check Back Rooms of Taverns
options.description: Look in the Drunken Sailor or Leaky Barrel.

options.name: Head Towards Lighthouse Path
options.description: See if they are meeting near the lighthouse.

options.name: Ask Informants (Finnigan?)
options.description: Try to get their current location.

title: Seeking Work (Leaky Barrel)
description: You ask the surly barkeep at the Leaky Barrel about dangerous work. He sizes you up. 'Maybe. Need someone to deliver a... sensitive package... across town. No questions asked. Or... discourage some Salty Dogs sniffin' around our turf.'

options.name: Take Delivery Job
options.description: Agree to deliver the package. [Could be trap/illegal goods].

options.name: Take Discourage Job (Salty Dogs)
options.description: Agree to confront the rival gang.

options.name: Decline Jobs
options.description: Too shady.

title: Asking Guards for Bounties
description: You ask a guard about posted bounties. He points to a nearby board: 'Wanted: Giant Rats in cellar (5 CP - Drunken Sailor)', 'Wanted: Information on Smuggler 'Squid' (25 GP)', 'Wanted: Proof of Kraken's Crew illegal activities (50 GP Reward)'.

options.name: Take Rat Bounty (Again?)
options.description: Easy copper.

options.name: Investigate Smuggler 'Squid'
options.description: Try to find information on the smuggler for the reward.

options.name: Investigate Kraken's Crew
options.description: Try to gather proof against the gang.

title: Casing Wealthy Homes
description: You scout the more affluent parts of Nestlebrook. You identify a prosperous merchant's house with lax nighttime security OR the harbormaster's residence which seems quiet.

options.name: Target Merchant House
options.description: Plan a burglary.

options.name: Target Harbormaster Residence
options.description: Plan an infiltration (maybe for his keys?).

options.name: Decide Against It
options.description: Too risky.

title: Heisting the Guard Office
description: Attempting to break into the Guard Captain's office (likely within the jailhouse) to retrieve confiscated items (like the Tumbler) is extremely risky. It will be locked and likely guarded even at night.

options.name: Attempt Infiltration
options.description: Try to sneak in and pick locks. [Very High DC Stealth/Thieves' Tools].

options.name: Create Diversion Elsewhere
options.description: Try to draw guards away from the office.

options.name: Abort Plan
options.description: Suicidal.

title: Briefing Brynn
description: You quickly explain to Brynn about Valerius the scholar, the Unbound cultists possibly meeting him, the strange lighthouse energies, and the potential presence of a Keeper (Marius). She nods grimly. 'Cultists, scholars, ancient evils... sounds like a Tuesday. Let's go.'

options.name: Proceed to Lighthouse (Stealth Approach)
options.description: Suggest sneaking up.

options.name: Proceed to Lighthouse (Direct Approach)
options.description: Suggest knocking.

title: Lighthouse Stealth (w/ Brynn)
description: You and Brynn attempt a stealthy approach to the lighthouse, using cover and moving quietly.

options.name: Reach Base Undetected
options.description: Successfully approach unseen. Decide entry point (Door/Grate/Climb?).

options.name: Spotted!
options.description: Someone (Servant? Lookout?) sees you approaching!

title: Lighthouse Direct (w/ Brynn)
description: With Brynn watching your back, you walk up to the main lighthouse door and knock.

options.name: Servant Answers
options.description: The gaunt servant opens the door.

options.name: No Answer / Hostile Response
options.description: The door remains shut, or someone yells threats from inside.

title: Demanding Answers (w/ Brynn)
description: Backed by Brynn, you demand answers from Keeper Marius. He glances at Brynn, then back at you, unfazed. 'Threats won't loosen my tongue, half-elf. State your purpose clearly, or leave.'

options.name: Offer Alliance Again
options.description: 'We can help against the Unbound.'

options.name: Brynn Attacks
options.description: Signal Brynn to fight.

options.name: Back Down
options.description: He's not intimidated. Retreat.

title: Alliance Offer (w/ Brynn)
description: You offer Marius an alliance against the Unbound, gesturing to Brynn as proof of capability. He considers. 'Mercenaries... unreliable. But the Unbound are active. Meet me at the lighthouse path at moonrise. We observe.'

options.name: Agree to Meet
options.description: Accept the rendezvous.

options.name: Decline
options.description: Don't trust him.

title: Brynn vs Keeper
description: Brynn draws her weapon and attacks Keeper Marius at your signal! Marius reacts instantly, axe flashing.

options.name: Join the Fight
options.description: Aid Brynn against the Guardian.

options.name: Let Brynn Handle It?
options.description: Stay back and watch the fight.

title: Planning Silas Heist (w/ Brynn)
description: You and Brynn plan the pawn shop heist. You'll handle entry and finding the Tumbler (or other valuables). Brynn will act as lookout and deal with any guards or Silas himself if he interferes.

options.name: Execute Heist Plan
options.description: Proceed with the burglary.

title: Planning Reliquary Heist (w/ Brynn)
description: You and Brynn plan to intercept the Reliquary. Brynn suggests creating a major diversion while you try to snatch the box during the confusion, or alternatively, a direct ambush where she engages the guards while you grab the target.

options.name: Plan Diversion & Snatch
options.description: Brynn causes chaos, you grab.

options.name: Plan Direct Ambush
options.description: Brynn fights, you grab.

title: Refusing Heist Pay
description: You refuse Brynn's demand for extra pay for the heist. 'Fine,' she shrugs, 'original deal stands. Bodyguarding. No breaking and entering.' The heist is off unless you do it solo.

options.name: Proceed with Original Plan (No Heist)
options.description: Focus on Lighthouse or Factions with Brynn as bodyguard.

options.name: Attempt Heist Solo?
options.description: Try robbing Silas or intercepting Reliquary alone.

options.name: Dismiss Brynn?
options.description: Decide you don't need her if she won't help with heist.

title: Corrupt Captain's Aid
description: The Guard Captain accepts your hefty bribe. 'Alright,' they mutter, pocketing the coin. 'I can make certain patrols... look the other way. Maybe misplace some evidence. Don't make me regret this.' You have a temporary, dangerous ally in the Watch.

options.name: Ask for Specific Favor (Release Items?)
options.description: Request the return of confiscated goods (Tumbler?).

options.name: Ask for Info on Factions/Lighthouse
options.description: See what the Watch knows.

options.name: Use Freedom to Leave Town
options.description: Take the opportunity to escape Nestlebrook.

title: Turning the Ship Around
description: You ask the ship's captain to return to Nestlebrook. He laughs. 'Turn back? For what? We're on schedule. Don't be ridiculous.' Your request is denied.

options.name: Plan to Return Later
options.description: Disembark at next port.

options.name: Accept It, Continue South
options.description: Focus on the journey.

title: Planning Return Journey
description: Deciding you must return to Nestlebrook, you plan to disembark at the ship's next port of call and find passage back north. This detour will cost time and coin.

options.name: Arrive at Next Port
options.description: The ship docks at [New Location].

title: Elara on Loc's Return
description: 'If Loc returns fully?' Elara looks grave. 'Imagine reality as tapestry. Loc's return isn't just burning it - it's pulling all the threads at once. Time, space, life, death... meanings blur, laws break. Perhaps creation anew, perhaps just... unmaking. Neither sounds pleasant.'

options.name: Thank Her, Board Ship
options.description: Heed the warning, but leave anyway.

options.name: Reconsider Leaving?
options.description: Maybe you *should* stay and prevent this?

title: Elara on Your Connection
description: 'Why you?' Elara studies you. 'Perhaps latent sensitivity? Elven blood often carries echoes of the old world. Or maybe... simple chance. The Fragments sometimes seem drawn to those who *can* make a difference, for good or ill. The choice, ultimately, is yours.'

options.name: Accept Ambiguity, Board Ship
options.description: Leave with her words in mind.

options.name: Reconsider Leaving?
options.description: Feel a sense of responsibility?

title: Silas Reveals Buyer/Inquirer
description: Pressured one last time, Silas whispers, 'It was Valerius's agent bought it! Pale fellow, blank eyes. And yes, the Unbound *and* the Keeper were asking too! Now go!'

options.name: Board Ship with Info
options.description: Leave town knowing Valerius has the Tumbler.

options.name: Reconsider Leaving?
options.description: Go after Valerius?

title: Silas Stays Silent
description: Silas refuses to reveal anything further about the Tumbler, its buyer, or interested parties. 'Done talking about it! Good riddance!'

options.name: Board Ship
options.description: Leave without the final answers.

title: Finnigan's Final Rumor
description: You pay Finnigan for one last rumor. He pockets the coin. 'Heard Valerius ain't human... shapeshifter maybe? OR That Keeper, Marius? Rumor is he failed a duty once, tryin' to make amends. Use that how ya will.'

options.name: Board Ship with Rumor
options.description: Leave town with this intriguing, possibly useless, tidbit.

options.name: Reconsider Leaving?
options.description: This changes things?

title: No More Rumors
description: Ratty Finnigan claims the rumor mill has run dry regarding the lighthouse situation.

options.name: Board Ship
options.description: Leave town.

title: Buying Supplies (Post-Gear)
description: With your remaining 10-15 GP after buying gear, you purchase basic supplies like rations and rope.

options.name: Proceed with Plans (Fully Supplied)
options.description: Ready for adventure.

title: Adding Shortsword (Studded)
description: You spend 10 GP of your remaining 15 GP on a Shortsword to complement your Studded Leather armor. You have 5 GP left.

items.name: Studded Leather
items.description: Leather armor reinforced with studs.

items.name: Shortsword
items.description: A well-balanced shortsword.

options.name: Proceed with Plans
options.description: Continue investigations.

title: Adding Shortsword (Chain)
description: You spend your last 10 GP on a Shortsword, completing your Chain Shirt + Shield + Sword combat setup.

items.name: Chain Shirt
items.description: A shirt of interlocking metal rings.

items.name: Shield
items.description: A standard wooden shield.

items.name: Shortsword
items.description: A well-balanced shortsword.

options.name: Proceed with Plans (Combat Ready)
options.description: Seek combat or dangerous tasks.

title: Guardian Identified
description: You learn the Guardian mercenary is named Marius and is associated with the Keepers of the Lock (or perhaps the Argent Hand order).

options.name: Approach Marius with Info
options.description: Talk to him, possibly mentioning you know who he is.

options.name: Share Info with Elara/Unbound?
options.description: Tell others about the Keeper's identity.

options.name: Keep Info to Yourself
options.description: File it away.

title: Guardian's Quarry
description: Rumors confirm Keeper Marius has been asking pointed questions about recently arrived half-elves and strange artifacts, strongly suggesting he is aware of you and/or the Tumbler.

options.name: Increase Caution / Avoid Him
options.description: He's definitely looking for you.

options.name: Approach Him Directly
options.description: Confront him.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: Get out before he finds you.

title: Guardian Remains Enigma
description: Despite inquiries, the Guardian mercenary remains largely a mystery - just a watchful, dangerous presence.

options.name: Continue Observing Him
options.description: Keep watching.

options.name: Avoid Him
options.description: Steer clear.

options.name: Focus on Other Leads
options.description: Investigate Lighthouse/Unbound.

title: Tumbler at the Lighthouse
description: You now know (or strongly suspect) the Whispering Tumbler was sold or sent to Master Valerius at the Tidecaller Lighthouse. It's likely playing a role in his research or plans.

options.name: Go to the Lighthouse
options.description: Investigate or retrieve the Tumbler.

options.name: Warn Elara/Marius
options.description: Inform the scholar or Keeper that Valerius has a Key Fragment.

options.name: Forget the Tumbler
options.description: Let Valerius keep it, not your problem anymore.

title: Valerius's Agent
description: Silas describes the agent who bought the Tumbler: 'Pale fellow, tall, moved... odd. Blank eyes. Wore simple grey robes. Didn't say much, just paid in good coin and left towards the cliffs.' Matches the description of Valerius's servant.

options.name: Confirm Servant Involvement
options.description: Valerius's servant is actively acquiring items.

options.name: Head to Lighthouse
options.description: Investigate.

title: Lowball Resentment
description: Realizing Silas likely made a hefty profit selling the Tumbler after buying it cheap from you leaves a bitter taste. It fuels your resolve to perhaps revisit Silas later...

options.name: Focus on Current Leads
options.description: Deal with Silas later (or not).

options.name: Plan Revenge/Reclamation?
options.description: Consider stealing back from Silas.

title: Leveraging Silas's Fear
description: Silas's palpable fear of both factions is a clear weakness. You could potentially use this to extort him further, gain more information, or manipulate him into helping you.

options.name: Press for More Information
options.description: Use his fear to make him talk.

options.name: Demand More Coin
options.description: Extort him.

options.name: Try to Force Alliance
options.description: Make him help you against a faction.

title: Suspecting Silas
description: Silas's denials about dealing directly with the factions feel false. He's likely more involved than he lets on, perhaps acting as an intermediary or information broker for one or both sides.

options.name: Try to Catch Him in Lie
options.description: Ask specific questions based on other info.

options.name: Assume He's Untrustworthy
options.description: Be wary of any information he provides.

title: Protection Deal Made
description: You've struck a deal with Silas - protection (or silence) in exchange for coin or information. This puts you in a precarious position, potentially obligated to defend the fence or entangled in his problems.

options.name: Fulfill Your End (Wait for Trouble?)
options.description: Stay nearby, wait to see if Unbound/Keeper show up.

options.name: Take Payment/Info and Leave?
options.description: Consider betraying the deal.

title: Silas's Cellar
description: You descend into Silas's cellar. It's damp, cluttered with forgotten junk, stored inventory, and perhaps traps or hidden compartments.

options.name: Search for Tumbler/Valuables
options.description: Look for the artifact or other loot. [Investigation check].

options.name: Look for Stairs Up to Shop
options.description: Find the way into the main store.

options.name: Check for Traps
options.description: Examine the cellar carefully. [Perception check].

title: Silas's Back Room
description: Squeezing through the bent window bars, you enter what appears to be Silas's back room or office. There's a desk, shelves with ledgers, and possibly a strongbox.

options.name: Search Desk/Ledgers
options.description: Look for clues, coin, or the Tumbler.

options.name: Look for Strongbox
options.description: Search for a hidden safe.

options.name: Enter Main Shop Area
options.description: Move to the front of the store.

title: Searching Silas's Counter/Desk
description: You search the counter area or desk. [Investigation check DC 14]. Success: You find a hidden drawer with coin (3d10 GP?), a ledger detailing questionable transactions, OR the Tumbler itself tucked away. Failure: Only mundane items.

options.name: Take Coin/Tumbler (If Found)
options.description: Secure the loot.

options.name: Read Ledger (If Found)
options.description: Quickly scan for useful information.

options.name: Search Elsewhere (If Nothing Found)
options.description: Check shelves or back room.

title: Searching Silas's Shelves
description:
You scan the cluttered shelves of the pawn shop. Amidst the junk and minor valuables, do you spot the Tumbler? [Perception check DC 15].

Success: You spot the intricate metallic device tucked behind some pottery!

Failure: It's not obviously visible among the clutter.

options.name: Take Tumbler (If Found)
options.description: Retrieve the artifact.

options.name: Check Counter/Back Room (If Not Found)
options.description: Look elsewhere.

options.name: Take Other Valuables?
options.description: Grab some other easily pawnable goods instead.

title: Checking Silas's Back Room
description: You cautiously enter Silas's back room or head towards the stairs to his living quarters.

options.name: Search Back Room
options.description: Look for valuables or the Tumbler here.

options.name: Go Upstairs (Risky)
options.description: Risk encountering Silas in his living quarters.

options.name: Return to Main Shop
options.description: Go back to searching the front.

title: Planning Harbormaster Heist
description: You plan to infiltrate the harbormaster's office or residence to steal his keys and access the lockbox containing seized goods (possibly the mysterious crate from the wreck).

options.name: Infiltrate Office at Night
options.description: Attempt to break into the harbormaster's office.

options.name: Pickpocket Keys from Harbormaster
options.description: Try to lift the keys directly from his person during the day.

options.name: Infiltrate Residence at Night
options.description: Break into his home to find the keys.

title: Planning Wood Shipment Heist
description: You plan to intercept or steal Master Borin's expected shipment of rare woods. Finnigan said it arrives tonight and the guards are paid poorly. You could try bribing the guards, ambushing the cart, or sneaking into the storage area.

options.name: Attempt to Bribe Guards
options.description: Approach the guards watching the shipment.

options.name: Ambush Delivery Cart
options.description: Attack the cart en route.

options.name: Sneak into Storage Area
options.description: Try to steal the wood after delivery.

title: Smuggler's Rendezvous
description: At midnight, you go to the old pier mentioned by Finnigan. A shadowy figure ('Squid') emerges from a small, hidden boat. 'Finnigan sent ya? Tide's Turn, eh? Alright. Ten gold, get in.'

options.name: Pay 10 GP, Get In
options.description: Agree to the price and board the smuggler's boat.

options.name: Try to Haggle/Offer Less
options.description: 'Finnigan said it was covered!' or offer less coin.

options.name: Refuse Payment/Distrust Smuggler
options.description: Back out of the deal.

title: Distrusting the Escape Plan
description: The smuggler rendezvous seems too convenient or risky. You decide against meeting 'Squid'.

options.name: Find Another Way Out
options.description: Look for passage on regular ships or leave overland.

options.name: Confront Finnigan?
options.description: Go back and question the informant.

title: Tavern Brawl Loot (Cheat)
description: Amidst the wreckage, you quickly loot the unconscious gambler and bouncer/barkeep. You find a total of 3d6 GP and maybe the bouncer's club.

options.name: Flee with Loot
options.description: Take the spoils and run before guards arrive.

title: Finding the Reliquary
description: You locate the Reliquary in a secure part of the ship (captain's cabin?). It's a heavy lead-lined box, about two feet square, covered in arcane wards that hum faintly. It's locked with a complex mechanism.

options.name: Attempt to Pick Lock
options.description: Use Thieves' Tools. [High DC? Magical trap?].

options.name: Attempt to Take the Whole Box
options.description: Try to carry the heavy, awkward box off the ship stealthily.

options.name: Leave It, Abort Heist
options.description: Too difficult or dangerous.

title: Reliquary Guards Alerted!
description: Spotted trying to steal the Reliquary! Guards on the 'Sea Serpent' raise the alarm and converge on your position!

options.name: Fight the Guards
options.description: Engage the ship's guards.

options.name: Attempt to Flee the Ship
options.description: Try to escape back onto the docks or into the water.

title: Diversion: Fire!
description: You manage to start a fire amongst some crates or nets on the docks. Flames lick upwards, smoke billows, shouts of 'Fire!' erupt. Some guards from the 'Sea Serpent' look towards the commotion.

options.name: Use Diversion to Board Ship/Grab Box
options.description: While guards are distracted, make your move. [Stealth/Sleight of Hand?].

options.name: Fire Spreads Too Fast/Draws Wrong Attention
options.description: The fire gets out of control or attracts too many guards/civilians.

title: Diversion: Brawl!
description: You manage to provoke a fight between sailors or rival gangs on the docks near the 'Sea Serpent'. The brawl escalates, drawing the attention of some ship guards.

options.name: Use Diversion to Board Ship/Grab Box
options.description: While guards are distracted, make your move. [Stealth/Sleight of Hand?].

options.name: Get Caught in Brawl?
options.description: Risk getting pulled into the fight yourself.

title: Diversion: False Alarm!
description: You shout 'Man Overboard!' or some other emergency. Panic spreads briefly, and some guards on the 'Sea Serpent' peer over the railing or move towards the supposed incident.

options.name: Use Diversion to Board Ship/Grab Box
