options.description: While guards are distracted, make your move. [Stealth/Sleight of Hand?].

options.name: Alarm Quickly Dismissed
options.description: The guards realize it's a false alarm too quickly.

title: Ambushing Reliquary Guards

enemies.name: Ship Guard (x4)
enemies.description: Alert guards protecting valuable cargo.

description: You launch your ambush as the four guards transfer the heavy Reliquary box!
limitation: Guards fight defensively around the box. Victory leads to Node 1282. Defeat leads to Node 1283.

title: Reliquary Snatch Attempt
description:
During the chaos of the ambush (or after defeating guards), you make a grab for the heavy Reliquary box. It's unwieldy. [Strength check DC 14 to lift and run effectively].

Success: You manage to heft the box and make a break for it!

Failure: You stumble with the weight, dropping it or slowing down enough for remaining guards/pursuers to catch you.

options.name: Escape with the Reliquary! (If Success)
options.description: You have the mysterious box!

collectedItems.name: Reliquary Box
collectedItems.description: A heavy, lead-lined box covered in wards.

options.name: Caught/Cornered (If Failure)
options.description: Cannot escape with the box.

title: Reliquary Ambush Defeat
description: The four ship guards overwhelm you during your ambush attempt. You are subdued, likely facing imprisonment or worse for attacking guarded cargo.

options.name: Wake Up Imprisoned
options.description: Likely in the ship's brig or local jail.

title: Peeking into Warehouse
description: You peek through the slightly open side door of the warehouse. Inside, it's dimly lit. You see several cloaked figures gathered, examining maps on a crate OR practicing with knives OR seemingly waiting.

options.name: Enter Stealthily
options.description: Try to slip inside unnoticed.

options.name: Listen More Closely
options.description: Try to overhear their conversation.

options.name: Leave, Report Findings?
options.description: Decide not to enter, maybe report to Keeper/Elara?

title: Entering Unbound Warehouse
description:
You slip inside the warehouse. [Stealth check DC 14]. It smells of dust and brine. The Unbound cultists are gathered further inside. 

Success: You remain undetected for now.

Failure: A floorboard creaks! One of them turns. 'Who's there?'

options.name: Observe from Shadows (If Success)
options.description: Find cover and watch them.

options.name: Confrontation! (If Failure)
options.description: Prepare to fight or talk your way out.

options.name: Retreat Quietly (If Success)
options.description: Back out before being spotted.

title: Listening at Warehouse Door
description: You listen at the warehouse door. [Perception check DC 13]. You hear low chanting OR discussion of 'the Master's plan' at the lighthouse OR arguments about leadership (Kaelen?).

options.name: Note Information
options.description: Remember the overheard details.

options.name: Enter Warehouse
options.description: Decide to go inside.

options.name: Leave
options.description: Decide against entering.

title: Finding Unbound in Tavern
description: You cautiously enter the main room of the Drunken Sailor from the back. You spot the Unbound agents back at a corner table, speaking intensely.

options.name: Approach Them
options.description: Go talk to them.

options.name: Try to Eavesdrop Again
options.description: Find a spot to listen.

options.name: Alert the Keeper (Marius)?
options.description: If he's still here, signal him.

title: Exploring Tavern Back Rooms
description: Searching the tavern's kitchen/cellar area yields little - sacks of potatoes, barrels of ale, maybe some leftover food you could steal?

options.name: Steal Food?
options.description: Grab some scraps.

options.name: Go to Main Room
options.description: See if Unbound are there.

options.name: Leave Tavern (Back Exit)
options.description: Exit without going through main room.

title: Eavesdropping (Tavern Back)
description: From the kitchen or hallway, you try to overhear the Unbound in the main room. [Perception check DC 15 due to distance/noise]. Success: Catch fragments about 'high tide', 'the alignment', 'Keeper interference'. Failure: Too much ambient noise.

options.name: Note Information (If Success)
options.description: Gain clues about their plans.

options.name: Enter Main Room
options.description: Go confront or observe them closer.

options.name: Leave Tavern
options.description: Exit.

title: Trail Trap Triggered!
description: You hear a shout of surprise and pain from the trail entrance! Your trap snared someone. Peeking out, you see a robed Unbound cultist tangled in your snare / fallen into your pit.

options.name: Capture/Interrogate Prisoner
options.description: Approach the trapped cultist.

options.name: Attack While Trapped
options.description: Finish them off quickly.

options.name: Observe If Others Come
options.description: Wait to see if companions arrive.

options.name: Leave Them Trapped
options.description: Abandon the prisoner and continue.

title: Keeping the Shards
description: The obsidian shards feel significant, possibly magical or tied to the Unbound. You decide to keep them.

items.name: Obsidian Shards (x3)
items.description: Polished obsidian shards, possibly runic or magical.

options.name: Continue Following Trail
options.description: Proceed towards the cave/pass.

options.name: Show Shards to Elara Later?
options.description: Plan to ask the scholar about them.

title: Discarding the Shards
description: Whether mundane or potentially dangerous, you decide the obsidian shards aren't worth carrying and discard them.

options.name: Continue Following Trail
options.description: Proceed towards the cave/pass.

title: Observing Unbound Cavern
description: From the shadows of the cavern/warehouse, you observe the Unbound: chanting around an altar where strange energies coalesce OR forging weapons marked with serpent symbols OR guarding caged prisoners who look terrified.

options.name: Focus on Altar/Ritual
options.description: Try to understand the ritual's purpose. [Arcana check?]

options.name: Focus on Forged Weapons
options.description: Assess their quality and number.

options.name: Focus on Prisoners
options.description: Try to identify them or look for escape opportunities.

options.name: Attempt to Sabotage
options.description: Try to disrupt their activity.

options.name: Retreat Quietly
options.description: Leave before being discovered.

title: Disrupting Unbound Activity
description: You decide to disrupt the Unbound activities. You could try causing a rockfall, extinguishing their braziers, directly attacking, or freeing prisoners.

options.name: Cause Rockfall/Collapse
options.description: Try to create chaos. [Risky, might harm prisoners].

options.name: Extinguish Lights
options.description: Create darkness and confusion. [Requires method - water, magic?].

options.name: Launch Attack
options.description: Engage the cultists directly.

options.name: Attempt to Free Prisoners
options.description: Sneak towards the cages. [Requires lockpicking/breaking].

title: Scanning Unbound Cavern
description: Scanning the cavern while hidden, you look for a specific target. You spot: the apparent leader (Kaelen?) directing the ritual OR a chest potentially holding artifacts OR the Key Fragment (Tumbler) itself placed on the altar.

options.name: Target the Leader
options.description: Focus on eliminating or capturing Kaelen.

options.name: Target the Chest
options.description: Try to steal the chest.

options.name: Target the Tumbler
options.description: Make a move to retrieve the Key Fragment.

options.name: Continue Observing
options.description: Gather more intel before acting.

title: Fighting Cave Guard

enemies.name: Unbound Guard

weapons.name: Curved Dagger
weapons.description: A simple but sharp curved knife.

enemies.description: A cultist guard alerted to your presence.

description: The Unbound guard at the cave entrance attacks, trying to stop you while shouting alarms!
limitation: Fight quickly before reinforcements arrive. Victory leads to Node 1301. Defeat leads to Node 1302.

title: Bluffing Cave Guard
description:
You try to talk your way past the alerted cave guard. 'I'm expected,' or 'Just delivering a message!' [Deception check DC 14].

Success: The guard hesitates, confused. 'Expected? Who...?' Provides a brief opening.

Failure: 'Lies! No one enters unbidden!' He attacks or continues shouting.

options.name: Attack During Hesitation (If Success)
options.description: Use his confusion to strike first.

options.name: Try to Push Past (If Success)
options.description: Attempt to run deeper into the cave.

options.name: Fight (If Failure)
options.description: Bluff failed.

options.name: Flee (If Failure)
options.description: Retreat out of the cave.

title: Ambushing Cave Sentries

enemies.name: Unbound Sentry (x1 or x2)

weapons.name: Curved Dagger
weapons.description: A simple but sharp curved knife.

enemies.description: Cultists emerging to investigate the diversion.

description: You spring your ambush as one or two Unbound cultists emerge from the cave!
limitation: Fight quickly before others are alerted. Victory leads to Node 1304. Defeat leads to Node 1302.

title: Journey East (Oakhaven)
description: You follow the prospectors' vague directions east, embarking on a multi-day journey through the mountains towards the settlement of Oakhaven. This path takes you away from the immediate conflicts of Nestlebrook. [Potential Branch End - New Area]

options.name: Arrive in Oakhaven
options.description: Begin exploring the new settlement.

options.name: Encounter Trouble on the Road
options.description: Face hazards or encounters during the journey.

title: Buying Prospector Secrets
description:
You offer the prospectors coin (e.g., 10 GP) for information about their find or the cave. One looks tempted, the other suspicious. [Persuasion check DC 14].

Success: 'Alright... found this dust near the old ruins up east. Cave... yeah, down that way,' (gestures) '... Unbound cultists use it. Heard screams. Stay away.'

Failure: 'Not talkin'. Move along.'

options.name: Head Towards Ruins (If Success)
options.description: Investigate the ruins where dust was found.

options.name: Head Towards Cave (If Success)
options.description: Investigate the Unbound cave.

options.name: Leave Them Be (If Failure)
options.description: Move on.

title: Prospector Trade Outcome
description: You successfully trade with the prospectors, exchanging goods (e.g., rope for food, weapon for gold dust sample?).

options.name: Continue Journey
options.description: Move on with your new items/less encumbrance.

title: Finding the Prospectors' Cave
description: Following the prospectors' likely path or scanning the area, you locate the cave entrance they feared. It's partially hidden by brush, emitting a faint, unpleasant odor.

options.name: Enter the Cave
options.description: Proceed inside.

title: Shadowing Prospectors
description: You discreetly follow the prospectors as they pack up their camp. They nervously head back down the mountain towards the coast, avoiding the direction of the cave and ruins.

options.name: Continue Following Them
options.description: See if they lead you back to Nestlebrook or somewhere else.

options.name: Break Off, Head to Cave/Ruins
options.description: Investigate the places they fear.

title: Keeping Gold Dust
description: You decide to keep the pouch of gold dust. Finding someone to refine it and give you a fair price might be difficult.

items.name: Pouch of Gold Dust
items.description: A small leather pouch containing gold dust mixed with gravel.

options.name: Continue Mountain Journey
options.description: Proceed, looking for settlements.

options.name: Head Back to Coast/Town
options.description: Return to find a buyer.

title: Panning for Gold
description: You find a stream and spend time carefully panning the contents of the pouch. You manage to separate most of the gold dust (~20 GP worth). Failure: You lose some dust in the process (~10 GP worth).

options.name: Collect Refined Dust
options.description: Secure the separated gold dust.

title: Hiding from Prospectors
description:
You dive behind cover as the prospectors pursue you. [Stealth check DC 13 vs their Perception].

Success: They run past your hiding spot, continuing their search elsewhere.

Failure: They spot you hiding!

options.name: Emerge When Clear (If Success)
options.description: Wait, then continue journey.

options.name: Fight (If Failure)
options.description: Found! Confrontation.

title: Outrunning Prospectors
description:
You push your endurance, scrambling over rocks and through brush. [Athletics check DC 13].

Success: You manage to outdistance the less nimble prospectors.

Failure: They corner you, familiar with the terrain.

options.name: Escape (If Success)
options.description: You got away. Find place to rest.

options.name: Fight (If Failure)
options.description: Cornered.

title: Prospector Victory
description: You defeat the two prospectors. They lie injured or unconscious.

options.name: Loot Bodies and Campsite
options.description: Take their belongings and search their camp.

options.name: Leave Them Be
options.description: Continue your journey.

title: Prospector Defeat
description: The tough prospectors overpower you with their tools. They likely retrieve their stolen pouch (if you took it) and leave you bruised and beaten in the mountains, possibly taking your gear too.

options.name: Wake Up Injured and Robbed
options.description: Assess situation.

title: Looting Prospectors
description: Searching the defeated prospectors and their camp yields: the pouch of Gold Dust (~25 GP value), basic camping supplies (rations, rope), and one of their pickaxes.

items.name: Pouch of Gold Dust
items.description: A small leather pouch containing gold dust mixed with gravel.

items.name: Rations (1d4 days)
items.description: Prospector's rations.

items.name: Hempen Rope (50ft)
items.description: Standard rope.

items.name: Pickaxe
items.description: A heavy mining tool.

options.name: Continue Journey
options.description: Choose path (Watchtower/Ruins).

title: Celestial Clues
description: The strange star patterns or the pulsating light near the coast feel significant. It seems likely Valerius's work at the lighthouse involves celestial alignments, possibly tied to the Tumbler or Loc.

options.name: Head Towards Lighthouse (Confirm Theory)
options.description: The pulsating star points the way.

options.name: Head Towards Ruins (Star Pattern Link?)
options.description: Maybe the patterns relate to the ruins.

options.name: Rest Until Morning
options.description: Process the discovery.

title: Watchtower Shelter Request
description: You claim to be lost. The guard eyes you suspiciously. 'Shelter? Hmm. Captain might allow it, for a night. Depends if you look like trouble. Wait there.' He disappears briefly.

options.name: Granted Shelter
options.description: They let you inside the watchtower courtyard for the night.

options.name: Refused Shelter
options.description: 'Captain says no. Move along.'

title: Watchtower Inquiry (Ruins/Dangers)
description: You ask the guard about the nearby ruins or dangers. 'Ruins? Aye, cursed place. Best avoided. Full o' ghosts... or worse. As for dangers, mostly mountain cats, sometimes prospectors squabbling. Keep alert.'

options.name: Ask More About 'Worse'
options.description: 'Worse than ghosts?'

options.name: Thank Guard, Decide Path
options.description: Decide whether to brave ruins or go elsewhere.

title: Watchtower Work Offer
description: You offer your services to the watchtower guards. The guard considers. 'Maybe. Need someone scout the pass towards Oakhaven. Or... track down some missing prospectors. Pay ain't great, but it's honest.'

options.name: Accept Scouting Job
options.description: Agree to scout the pass.

options.name: Accept Tracking Job
options.description: Agree to look for the prospectors.

options.name: Decline Work
options.description: Not interested.

title: Leaving Watchtower Vicinity
description: You decide to leave the watchtower area, either turned away or choosing not to interact further.

options.name: Head Towards Ruins
options.description: Take the other path.

options.name: Head Back Down Mountain
options.description: Return towards Nestlebrook/coast.

options.name: Continue Past Watchtower (If Bypassing)
options.description: Keep heading west into mountains.

title: Bypassing the Watchtower
description: You successfully move past the watchtower, avoiding interaction with the guards. The mountain path continues westward, deeper into potentially uncharted territory.

options.name: Continue Westward Journey
options.description: Explore further into the mountains.

options.name: Look for Shelter
options.description: Find a place to camp.

title: Watchtower Intel/Weakness
description: Sneaking near the watchtower base undetected, you might overhear guards complaining about low supplies OR spot a poorly secured supply gate OR hear mention of tensions with the 'madman' at the coastal lighthouse.

options.name: Note Low Supplies (Potential Target?)
options.description: The watchtower might be vulnerable or have stealable goods.

options.name: Note Supply Gate (Entry Point?)
options.description: Consider infiltrating via the supply gate.

options.name: Note Lighthouse Tension (Ally Potential?)
options.description: Maybe the guards dislike Valerius?

options.name: Retreat Quietly
options.description: Leave with the information.

title: Watchtower Alarm!
description: Spotted! An alarm horn blares from the watchtower. Guards shout and point in your direction. Arrows might start flying soon!

options.name: Flee Immediately!
options.description: Run for cover or away from the tower.

options.name: Attempt to Surrender?
options.description: Try to give up peacefully.

options.name: Fight Approaching Guards?
options.description: Engage the responding guards.

title: Searching Ruins
description: Searching the crumbling ruins [Investigation check DC 14]: Success: You find a hidden alcove with ancient coins (Value?) OR a weathered journal hinting at the ruins' purpose (temple? observatory?) OR a loose stone concealing a small Potion of Resistance (type?). Failure: Only rubble and dust.

options.name: Take Coins/Potion (If Found)
options.description: Pocket the discovery.

options.name: Read Journal (If Found)
options.description: Decipher the weathered text.

options.name: Continue Exploring Ruins
options.description: Keep searching.

options.name: Leave Ruins
options.description: Depart.

title: Shelter in Ruins
description: You find a relatively intact chamber within the ruins, sheltered from the wind. It would make a decent place to rest, though the atmosphere is eerie.

options.name: Make Camp Here
options.description: Settle down for the night.

options.name: Explore Further Before Resting
options.description: Keep searching the ruins.

title: Following Tracks in Ruins
description: Following the recent tracks leads you deeper into the ruins, towards the central tower OR down crumbling stairs into an underground section.

options.name: Proceed to Tower
options.description: Head towards the main tower.

options.name: Descend into Underground
options.description: Go down the stairs.

title: Ruins Architecture/Lore
description: Examining the ruins' style [History/Arcana check DC 14]: Success: You recognize symbols associated with celestial observation OR patterns hinting at elemental magic OR carvings depicting strange, non-humanoid beings. Failure: The style is unfamiliar.

options.name: Note Findings
options.description: Remember the architectural clues.

options.name: Continue Exploring
options.description: Keep searching.

title: Entering via Unbound Mark
description: You enter the ruins through the entrance marked with Unbound symbols. The passage leads directly towards the central structure, likely their main area of operation.

options.name: Proceed Cautiously
options.description: Move towards the central structure, expecting cultists.

options.name: Look for Ambush Spots
options.description: Find a place to observe or attack.

title: Analyzing Ruin Tracks
description: Studying the tracks near the ruins [Survival check DC 13]: You deduce at least 3-4 individuals passed through recently, wearing robes (based on drag marks) and carrying heavy gear. They seem organized.

options.name: Assume Unbound Cultists
options.description: The evidence points to them.

options.name: Follow Tracks into Ruins
options.description: See where they went.

title: Smugglers and the Shoals
description: 'Smugglers?' The sailor laughs grimly. 'Maybe the desperate ones. Heard tell of hidden coves *beyond* the Teeth, but ya gotta know the channel, and the tide... Get it wrong, yer feedin' the fishes.'

options.name: Inquire About Hidden Coves
options.description: Ask for details or map references.

options.name: Dismiss Smuggler Route
options.description: Too dangerous.

title: Crate Symbols
description: You ask about the symbols carved by the 'changed' sailor or seen on the Dockmaster's crate. 'Weird stuff,' another patron mutters. 'Looked like... coiling snakes? Or maybe eyes? Dockmaster keeps the crate locked up tight now.'

options.name: Suspect Unbound Connection?
options.description: Coiling snakes sound like their motif.

options.name: Consider Dockmaster Heist
options.description: Plan to steal the crate.

options.name: Dismiss Vague Description
options.description: Could be anything.

title: Connecting Whispers
description: The tales of sailors hearing whispers near the wreck and returning 'changed' reminds you strongly of the similar stories surrounding the Tidecaller Lighthouse. Is there a connection between the wreck and Valerius's activities?

options.name: Investigate Lighthouse
options.description: Seems increasingly central to the mystery.

options.name: Investigate Shipwreck/Crate
options.description: The source of the change might be at the wreck or in the crate.

title: Acquiring a Boat (Seabrook)
description: You need a boat to reach the Serpent's Teeth rocks. You could try to 'borrow' an unattended fishing boat at night, hire a desperate fisherman for a dangerous trip (costly), or perhaps find Patch the halfling fence (if met) deals in boats.

options.name: Attempt Boat Theft
options.description: Try to steal a small boat. [Stealth/Dex check].

options.name: Hire Fisherman
options.description: Negotiate a price for the risky voyage. [Charisma/Coin].

options.name: Ask Patch the Fence
options.description: See if the halfling can procure a boat.

title: Recruiting Salvage Crew
description: You try to recruit sailors at The Barnacle's Bite for a salvage trip to the Serpent's Teeth, offering a share of any treasure found. Most scoff at the danger, but one or two desperate or foolhardy sailors might agree.

options.name: Assemble Makeshift Crew
options.description: Gather 1-2 unreliable crewmates.

options.name: Fail to Recruit Anyone
options.description: No one is willing to risk it.

options.name: Attempt Solo Trip?
options.description: Decide to go alone if you can get a boat.

title: Approaching Salty Dogs
description: You approach the group of rough-looking Salty Dog gang members lounging near their ship. Their leader, a woman with a scarred face, eyes you up and down. 'What do you want, stranger?'

options.name: Offer Info on Kraken's Crew
options.description: Tell them where the rival gang is hanging out.

options.name: Offer Services (Muscle/Thief?)
options.description: See if they need help.

options.name: Ask About Work (General)
options.description: Inquire about dock work.

options.name: Back Away
options.description: Change your mind.

title: Observing Salty Dogs
description: Watching the Salty Dogs from a distance, you see them shaking down merchants, loading suspicious crates onto their ship, and arguing amongst themselves. They seem violent and disorganized.

options.name: Approach Them
options.description: Decide to talk to them.

options.name: Report Activities to Guards?
options.description: Consider informing the Watch (if Seabrook has any).

options.name: Look for Opportunity to Steal from Them?
options.description: Try to rob the gang? [Very Risky].

options.name: Leave Them Be
options.description: Avoid the gang.

title: Approaching Kraken's Crew
description: You find members of the Kraken's Crew (perhaps the ones from the tavern) lurking in an alley. 'You again?' one sneers. 'Come back for more trouble?'

options.name: Offer Info on Salty Dogs / Grognak
options.description: Try to trade information.

options.name: Offer Services?
options.description: See if they need help.

options.name: Intimidate Them?
options.description: Try to scare them off.

options.name: Fight Them
options.description: Engage the gang members.

options.name: Back Away
options.description: Avoid confrontation.

title: Staking Out Fish Market
description: You wait hidden in the smelly alleys near the fish market. After some time, you spot Kraken's Crew members extorting vendors OR meeting with a shady merchant OR heading towards the Barnacle's Bite.

options.name: Follow Them
options.description: Shadow the gang members.

options.name: Intervene (Extortion)?
options.description: Try to stop the shakedown.

options.name: Gather Proof for Bounty
options.description: Try to get evidence of their illegal activities.

options.name: Give Up Stakeout
options.description: Decide to do something else.

title: Intimidating Mick
description:
You try to intimidate One-Eyed Mick into paying his debt. [Intimidation check DC 13].

Success: Mick scowls but grudgingly tosses a pouch with 10 silver at your feet. 'Fine! Tell Grognak we're square.'

Failure: Mick draws his knife. 'Think yer tough? Let's see!'

options.name: Collect Silver (If Success)
options.description: Take the money.

options.name: Fight Mick (If Failure)
options.description: Engage the sailor.

options.name: Back Down (If Failure)
options.description: Avoid the fight.

title: Persuading Mick
description:
You try reasoning with Mick. [Persuasion check DC 13].

Success: He grumbles but eventually sighs and hands over the 10 silver. 'Fine, fine. Easier than dealin' with Grognak.'

Failure: 'Save yer breath. Ain't payin'.' He turns his back.

options.name: Collect Silver (If Success)
options.description: Take the payment.

options.name: Resort to Intimidation/Threats (If Failure)
options.description: Try a tougher approach.

options.name: Report Failure to Grognak (If Failure)
options.description: Tell the barkeep.

title: Side Deal with Mick
description: You propose a side deal: Mick gives you less (e.g., 5 silver), and you tell Grognak he paid in full. Mick considers, then grins slyly. 'Heh. Like yer style. Alright, 5 silver it is. But if Grognak finds out, yer on yer own.'

options.name: Accept 5 Silver, Lie to Grognak
options.description: Take the smaller payment and plan your lie.

options.name: Refuse Deal, Demand Full Amount
options.description: Insist on the original 10 silver.

title: Leveraging Mick's Cargo
description: You mention Mick's 'lost' cargo. His good eye widens. 'How'd you...? Fine! Fine!' He quickly shoves 10 silver into your hand. 'Tell Grognak we're square! And keep yer mouth shut about the cargo!'

options.name: Collect Silver
options.description: Take the payment.

options.name: Press for More? (Extortion)
options.description: Try to get more money for your silence.

title: Bluffing After Interruption
description:
You try to bluff your way out after being caught near the drunk sailor. [Deception check DC 12].

Success: They seem to accept your excuse (stumbled, thought he dropped something) and leave you alone.

Failure: They don't believe you. 'Thief! Get 'im!'

options.name: Retreat Quickly (If Success)
options.description: Leave the situation.

options.name: Fight/Flee (If Failure)
options.description: Deal with the confrontation.

title: Confrontation (Drunk Sailor)
description: Your attempt to steal from the drunk sailor backfires. He wakes up angry, or other patrons step in to defend him or punish you.

options.name: Fight Sailor/Patrons
options.description: Engage in a tavern brawl.

options.name: Flee the Tavern
options.description: Run for it.

title: Counting Till Haul
description: Safely away from the Barnacle's Bite, you count the coins stolen from Grognak's till: 2d6 Gold Pieces.

options.name: Leave Seabrook Immediately
options.description: Get out before Grognak sends someone after you.

options.name: Find Shelter
options.description: Lie low.

title: Grognak Defeated!
description: Against the odds, you defeat the formidable orc barkeep, Grognak! He lies unconscious behind the bar. The few remaining patrons stare in terrified silence. You basically own the tavern now... for about five minutes until someone fetches the Watch or his kin.

options.name: Loot the Till and Grognak
options.description: Grab all available cash and valuables.

options.name: Flee Immediately
options.description: Get out before repercussions arrive.

options.name: Declare Yourself New Boss? (Insane)
options.description: Try to take over the tavern.

title: Grognak's Revenge
description: Grognak the orc easily overpowers you, likely knocking you senseless with a single blow. You wake up dumped unceremoniously in a fish gut barrel outside, bruised, robbed, and smelling horrific. [Game Over? Or Severe Setback]

options.name: Crawl Away, Seek Help/Shelter
options.description: Try to survive this humiliation.

options.name: Give Up (Ending)
options.description: This is too much. Your story ends here.

title: Discouragement Job Success
description: You report back to Grognak that the Kraken's Crew members have left. He grunts approvingly. 'Good work. Here.' He tosses you 15 Silver Pieces.

options.name: Take Payment
options.description: Accept the reward.

options.name: Ask for More Work?
options.description: See if he has other tasks.

title: Fish Gut Sabotage
description: You 'accidentally' spill a bucket of foul fish guts near the Kraken's Crew members. They react with disgust and anger. 'Oi! Watch it, scum!' One shoves you.

options.name: Apologize, Hope They Leave
options.description: 'Sorry! Clumsy!' See if the stench drives them off.

options.name: Escalate (Fight)
options.description: Shove back, start a brawl.

title: Pickpocketing Kraken Crew
description:
You attempt to pick the pocket of one of the loitering Kraken's Crew members. [Sleight of Hand DC 14].

Success: You lift a few coins (1d6 SP?) or maybe a small knife.

Failure: They catch your hand! 'Thieving rat! Trying to rob the Crew?!'

options.name: Subtle Success, Withdraw
options.description: Pocket loot, report job failure/try intimidation.

options.name: Caught! Fight!
options.description: They attack you.

title: Spreading Rumors (Kraken Crew)
description:
You discreetly tell a nearby dockhand that you overheard the Salty Dogs planning to jump the Kraken's Crew members here. [Deception check DC 13].

Success: Word spreads quickly. The Kraken's Crew look nervous and decide to leave the area.

Failure: No one believes you, or the Crew members overhear and confront you.

options.name: Report Success to Grognak (If Success)
options.description: Claim your reward.

options.name: Confronted by Crew (If Failure)
options.description: Deal with the angry gang members.

title: Kraken Crew Victory
description: You defeat the three Kraken's Crew members. They lie beaten on the docks. You should probably leave before their friends or the Watch show up.

options.name: Loot Bodies Quickly
options.description: Check their pockets.

options.name: Report Success to Grognak
options.description: Go claim your reward.

options.name: Flee the Scene
options.description: Disappear before more trouble arrives.

title: Kraken Crew Defeat
description: Outnumbered, you are beaten down by the Kraken's Crew thugs. They likely rob you of anything valuable and leave you injured on the docks.

options.name: Wake Up Robbed and Injured
options.description: Try to recover.

title: Retrieving the Locket
description: Reaching into the freezing sludge, you grasp the tarnished silver locket.

items.name: Tarnished Silver Locket
items.description: A silver locket, recovered from sludge.

options.name: Examine the Locket
options.description: Clean it off, check for markings or contents.

options.name: Finish Cleaning Tank
options.description: Complete the job.

title: Tank Job Complete
description: After hours of nauseating work, the kraken tank is finally clean (or clean enough). You report back to Grognak.

options.name: Claim Payment
options.description: Grognak inspects, then tosses you 20 Silver Pieces.

title: Examining the Locket
description: You clean the sludge off the silver locket. It's tarnished and dented. It clicks open reveal ing... miniature portraits of a human man and a half-elven child OR empty, velvet-lined hollows OR a tiny, coiled serpent symbol etched inside.

items.name: Silver Locket (Contents?)
items.description: A tarnished silver locket. Contents revealed.

options.name: Recognize Portraits? (Self/Father?)
options.description: The faces seem disturbingly familiar...

options.name: Note Serpent Symbol (Unbound?)
options.description: Connects the locket to the cult.

options.name: Keep Locket (Empty/Unknown)
options.description: Hold onto the intriguing find.

options.name: Finish Cleaning Tank
options.description: Return to the job.

title: Meeting Patch the Fence
description: You find Patch, a nervous halfling operating from a leaky rowboat tied under a pier. He constantly glances around. 'Whatcha got? Or whatcha need? Make it quick!'

options.name: Sell Stolen Goods (Silk/Brandy?)
options.description: Offer him the items from the crate.

options.name: Ask to Buy Boat
options.description: Inquire about acquiring a boat for salvage trip.

options.name: Ask for Information (Gangs/Wreck?)
options.description: See if he knows local secrets.

options.name: Leave
options.description: Decide not to deal with him.

title: Heading North (from Seabrook)
description: You leave Seabrook, heading north along the coast, back towards the region around Nestlebrook. The journey is familiar but perhaps feels different now.

options.name: Return to Nestlebrook
options.description: Re-enter the troubled town.

options.name: Explore Coastal Path Further
options.description: Look for different opportunities along the way.

title: Heading South (from Seabrook)
description: You leave Seabrook, continuing south along the coast. The terrain might become rockier, settlements perhaps scarcer. You pass the Serpent's Teeth rocks offshore.

options.name: Investigate Serpent's Teeth / Wreck?
options.description: If you have a boat or way to reach them.

options.name: Continue South to Next Port/Region
options.description: Press on into unknown territory. [Potential Branch End - New Area].

options.name: Turn Inland
options.description: Leave the coast behind.

title: Heading Inland (from Seabrook)
description: You leave the coast near Seabrook and head inland, perhaps towards the mountains or deeper forests. The terrain changes, offering different challenges and opportunities.

options.name: Enter Wilderness
options.description: Focus on survival in the wilds.

options.name: Seek Mountain Path
options.description: Look for routes towards the mountain range.

title: Confined Below Deck
description: You are locked in the ship's brig or a dark storage closet. It's uncomfortable, and you have no idea how long the voyage will last or what awaits you at the destination.

options.name: Wait for Landfall
options.description: Endure the confinement.

options.name: Attempt Escape?
options.description: Look for weaknesses in the door or walls. [Difficult].

options.name: Try Bribing Guard (If One Comes)
options.description: Attempt to buy freedom.

title: Seabrook General Store
description: The general store is poorly stocked, run by a tired-looking woman. She sells basic supplies (rope, rations, cheap tools) but has little news and seems wary of strangers.

options.name: Buy Basic Supplies (If Coin)
options.description: Purchase necessities.

options.name: Ask About Local Trouble (Gangs/Wreck)
options.description: See if she knows anything.

options.name: Attempt Theft?
options.description: Try to steal something while she's distracted.

options.name: Leave Store
options.description: Nothing useful here.

title: Investigating Seabrook Warehouses
description: You check out the closed warehouses. One has crude Salty Dog markings, another a Kraken symbol. They seem quiet during the day, but likely guarded or occupied at night.

options.name: Attempt Daytime Break-in? (Very Risky)
options.description: Try entering one now.

options.name: Stake Out for Night Activity
options.description: Plan to return after dark.

options.name: Leave Them Be
options.description: Avoid gang turf.

title: Scouting Coastal Village
description: Observing the small coastal village from a distance: It looks like a simple fishing community, perhaps a dozen dwellings, a single pier, nets drying. Seems peaceful, if poor.

options.name: Enter the Village
options.description: Approach the settlement.

options.name: Bypass the Village
options.description: Continue along the coast.

title: Sea Cave Shelter
description: You find shelter in a sea cave. It's damp and echoes with the waves, but protects you from the wind. You notice the high tide mark is worryingly close... Is it safe to stay the night?

options.name: Risk Staying the Night
options.description: Hope the tide doesn't rise too high.

options.name: Find Higher Ground in Cave
options.description: Look for ledges or deeper sections above the tide line.

options.name: Abandon Cave, Seek Other Shelter
options.description: Too risky. Look for dunes or boat.

title: Dune Shelter
description: You find a hollow amongst the coastal dunes. It offers decent concealment but minimal protection from wind or rain. You settle down for an exposed night's rest.

options.name: Rest Fitfully
options.description: Wake in the morning, likely cold and sandy.

title: Boat Hull Shelter
description: Sheltering beneath the hull of an overturned fishing boat offers good protection from the elements. It smells of old fish and tar. Seems like a relatively safe place to rest.

options.name: Rest Well
options.description: Get a decent night's sleep.

title: Deep Wilderness Survival (Ongoing)
description: Days turn into weeks. You hone your survival skills, finding food and shelter in the deep wilderness. You are utterly alone, the world of towns and factions feeling like a distant dream. [This is a potential thematic ending - Darryn finds peace, or isolation, in the wild].

options.name: Embrace the Wild (Ending)
options.description: Your story continues, alone, in the wilderness.

options.name: Yearn for Civilization
options.description: Decide to attempt the long journey back.

title: Deep Wilderness Encounter
description: While surviving in the deep wilderness, you encounter a weathered hermit living off the land OR stumble into the lair of a dangerous beast (Owlbear? Wyvern?).

options.name: Interact with Hermit
options.description: Approach the hermit cautiously.

options.name: Deal with Beast
options.description: Fight or flee the dangerous creature.

title: Hidden Grove / Standing Stones
description: Your search leads you to a hidden grove where ancient standing stones hum with faint arcane energy. The air feels strangely calm and old here. Perhaps a place of power or forgotten rituals.

options.name: Examine Stones/Energy
options.description: Try to understand the magic. [Arcana check].

options.name: Rest Here
options.description: Make camp in the potentially sacred/magical site.

options.name: Leave Grove
options.description: Decide not to disturb the place.

title: Forgotten Wilderness Ruin
description: You stumble upon a completely overgrown ruin deep in the wilderness - perhaps a crumbling tower, a sunken temple entrance, or collapsed dwellings of an unknown people.

options.name: Explore the Ruin
options.description: Search for treasure, clues, or danger.

options.name: Make Camp Near Ruin
options.description: Use it as a landmark or potential shelter.

options.name: Avoid Ruin
options.description: Leave the forgotten place undisturbed.

title: Disturbing Ancient Spirit
description: Your search for magic awakens something old and protective - perhaps an ancient Treant, a guardian spirit, or territorial fey creatures. They demand you leave or face their wrath.

options.name: Attempt Diplomacy/Appeasement
options.description: Try to talk your way out, offer respect or gifts.

options.name: Fight the Guardian(s)
options.description: Engage the ancient entity.

options.name: Flee
options.description: Retreat quickly.

title: Successful Hunt Harvest
description: You successfully butcher the animal, gaining 1d4+1 days of Rations and a Wolf Pelt or Boar Hide (potentially sellable or usable).

options.name: Continue Journey (Well Supplied)
options.description: Move on with your bounty.

title: Poor Hunt Harvest
description: Your butchering attempt yields only 1 day's worth of Rations and ruins the hide.

options.name: Continue Journey
options.description: Move on.

title: Wilderness Recovery
description: You find a safe place to rest and recover from your injuries or exhaustion in the wilderness. After some time, you feel well enough to travel again.

options.name: Continue Journey
options.description: Resume exploration or head back.

title: Following into Ruin Structure
description: You follow the Unbound into the central tower or underground section of the ruins. It's dark, crumbling, and you hear their voices echoing ahead.

options.name: Proceed Stealthily
options.description: Try to get closer without being detected.

options.name: Create Diversion Behind You
options.description: Make noise back the way you came to distract them.

options.name: Announce Presence / Attack
options.description: Reveal yourself.

title: Approaching Ruin Center (Stealth)
description: Moving quietly from the outer ruins towards the central structure, you spot the Unbound performing a ritual OR arguing near a strange artifact.

options.name: Observe Ritual/Argument
options.description: Get closer to see details.

options.name: Attempt to Steal Artifact?
options.description: Try to grab the object while they're distracted.

options.name: Attack
options.description: Launch an assault.

title: Listening in Ruins
description: Listening carefully within the ruins, you hear the Unbound chanting words of power OR arguing about 'the alignment' OR sounds of digging/excavation.

options.name: Move Towards Sound
options.description: Investigate the source.

options.name: Try to Understand Chanting
options.description: [Arcana check?]

options.name: Retreat from Ruins
options.description: Decide not to investigate further.

title: Observing Ruin Activity
description: Watching from hiding, you see the Unbound performing actions: placing strange stones around a central point OR consulting ancient maps OR one figure appears to be giving orders (Kaelen?).

options.name: Continue Observing
options.description: Gather more intel.

options.name: Attempt to Interfere
options.description: Try to disrupt their preparations.

options.name: Target the Leader?
options.description: Focus on the one giving orders.

title: Ruin Lights
description: Strange lights flare up within the central structure of the ruins - perhaps magical energy from a ritual, or simply torches being lit as they prepare for something.

options.name: Investigate Cautiously
options.description: Approach the structure where the lights are.

options.name: Wait and Observe
options.description: See what happens next.

title: Ruin Inactivity
description: You watch the ruins, but nothing significant seems to be happening. Perhaps the Unbound are waiting, or have already finished their business here.

options.name: Enter and Explore
options.description: Investigate the quiet ruins.

options.name: Leave Ruins
options.description: Move on.

title: Looting Wilderness Cultists
description: Searching the defeated Unbound agents yields: their curved daggers, 2d6 GP, and [Roll 1d4] 1: Nothing else. 2: A crude map showing the mountain ruins. 3: A note mentioning 'Kaelen awaits at the cave'. 4: A Potion of Poison Resistance.

options.name: Take Loot
options.description: Collect the items.

title: Deciphering Cultist Map/Note
description: You examine the map or note found on the cultists. The map clearly marks the nearby ruins OR the cave entrance. The note confirms Kaelen is the leader and is waiting at the designated location.

options.name: Head to Marked Location
options.description: Follow the map/note to the Ruins or Cave.

options.name: Prepare Ambush at Location
options.description: Try to get there first and set a trap.

title: Proceeding to Unbound Site
description: Knowing the cultists' likely destination (ruins or cave), you head towards it, possibly better armed and informed after defeating the agents.

options.name: Approach Ruins
options.description: Go to the mountain ruins.

options.name: Approach Cave
options.description: Go to the cave entrance.

title: Wilderness Path Discovery
description: The hidden path leads you to a cliff overlook offering a wide view of the surrounding wilderness OR terminates at another hidden cave entrance.

options.name: Scout from Overlook
options.description: Use the vantage point to survey the area. [Perception check].

options.name: Investigate Cave Entrance
options.description: Explore the new cave.

options.name: Return to Camp/Continue Journey
options.description: Go back or press on.

title: Trail of Trouble
description: Following the tracks leads you to another, older campsite where you see signs of a struggle - disturbed earth, broken arrows, perhaps dried bloodstains.

options.name: Investigate Struggle Scene
options.description: Search for clues about who fought here and why. [Investigation check].

options.name: Follow Tracks Leading Away
options.description: See where the survivors (or victors) went.

options.name: Leave Area
options.description: Avoid the signs of past violence.

title: Feigning Innocence (Post-Theft)
description: You put on your most innocent expression, perhaps even offering to help the furious halfling search for the 'thief'. He eyes you suspiciously but is too busy yelling for guards to focus on you immediately.

options.name: Maintain the Act
options.description: Keep up the pretense, hope guards don't suspect you.

options.name: Slip Away During Search
options.description: Use the continued commotion to escape.

title: Diverting Suspicion (Post-Theft)
description:
As the halfling shouts about his stolen purse, you subtly point towards another shady-looking patron or perhaps the cloaked figure (if seen). 'Maybe *they* took it?' [Deception check DC 14].

Success: The halfling's attention (and possibly the guards') is diverted towards your scapegoat.

Failure: Your attempt is obvious or unconvincing. Suspicion falls back on you.

options.name: Escape During Diversion (If Success)
options.description: Slip out while they focus elsewhere.

options.name: Face Suspicion (If Failure)
options.description: The halfling or guards confront you.

title: Elara on Jade Frog
description: You show the Jade Frog figurine to Elara. She examines it. 'Interesting. Minor sympathetic magic, yes. A ward against ill fortune, perhaps strongest near natural water sources. Nicely carved. Worth a fair bit to the right person, magic aside.'

items.name: Jade Frog Figurine
items.description: Jade frog, identified as minor luck ward.

options.name: Keep the Charm
options.description: Hold onto the lucky frog.

options.name: Ask Elara to Buy It?
options.description: See if she is interested.

options.name: Plan to Sell to Silas/Collector
options.description: Seek out a buyer.

title: Sold Frog to Silas
description: You sell the Jade Frog figurine to Silas for 20 GP.

options.name: Continue Business in Nestlebrook
options.description: Use the coin.

title: Haggling Frog Price (Silas)
description:
You haggle with Silas over the frog figurine. [Persuasion check DC 13].

Success: 'Alright, 30 GP. Final offer.'

Failure: 'Twenty is fair for jade.'

options.name: Accept 30 GP (If Success)
options.description: Sell the frog.

options.name: Accept 20 GP (If Failure)
options.description: Sell the frog.

options.name: Keep Figurine
options.description: Decline offer.

title: Silas on Frog Magic
description: You ask Silas if the Jade Frog is magical. He squints at it. 'Magic? Doubt it. Just a nice carving. Good luck charm, maybe? People pay for superstition. Twenty Gold.' He doesn't seem to detect or care about minor magic.

options.name: Sell it for 20 GP
options.description: Take his offer.

options.name: Keep It (Believing It's Magical)
options.description: Hold onto it.

title: Keeping the Frog
description: You decide to keep the Jade Frog figurine, either because you believe it's magical, the price was too low, or you've grown attached.

items.name: Jade Frog Figurine
items.description: A well-carved jade frog.

options.name: Continue with Plans
options.description: Proceed with your goals.

title: Selling Frog (Curios & Relics)
description: You show the Jade Frog to the elderly owner of 'Curios & Relics'. His eyes light up slightly. 'Ah, lovely piece. Pre-Imperial style, perhaps? Very fine work. I could offer you... 35 Gold Pieces for it?'

items.name: Jade Frog Figurine
items.description: A well-carved jade frog.

options.name: Accept 35 GP
options.description: Sell the figurine.

options.name: Haggle for More
options.description: 'Seems rare. How about 50?' [Persuasion check].

options.name: Keep Figurine
options.description: Decline offer.

title: Finding Abandoned Cellar
description: Searching desperately after the guard fight, you find an old house with a broken cellar door slightly ajar. You slip inside, pulling it shut. It's dark, damp, and seems unused.

options.name: Hide and Rest
options.description: Wait for the search to die down.

options.name: Search Cellar?
options.description: Look for useful items or other exits.

title: Seeking Elara's Help (Post-Bribery)
description: You cautiously make your way to Elara's cottage after bribing the guard. You explain your situation  the theft, the Tumbler (if applicable), the arrest, the bribe.

options.name: Ask for Sanctuary/Hiding Place
options.description: Request her help staying hidden.

options.name: Ask for Advice
options.description: Inquire what she thinks you should do now.

options.name: Ask About the Tumbler (If Relevant)
options.description: Seek her knowledge about the artifact.

title: Seeking Silas's Help (Post-Bribery)
description: You risk visiting Silas after bribing your way free. You explain you're in trouble with the Watch. 'Guards?!' Silas looks terrified. 'Get out! Don't bring them here!' He refuses to help, fearing association.

options.name: Leave Quickly
options.description: He won't help.

options.name: Threaten/Extort Him?
options.description: Try to force his help.

title: Co-op Success
description: Success! You lifted the halfling's heavy purse while your cloaked partner created a diversion. You subtly signal them.

options.name: Meet Partner to Split Loot
options.description: Arrange a rendezvous outside or in an alley to divide the spoils (75 GP + Jade Frog total).

options.name: Betray Partner, Keep All
options.description: Slip away with the entire purse.

title: Betraying Partner (Co-op Theft)
description: You decide to betray your temporary partner, slipping away with the entire purse (or letting them take the fall while you keep quiet). You gain the full loot (75 GP + Jade Frog) but likely make a dangerous enemy.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 75 gold.

items.name: Jade Frog Figurine
items.description: A smooth, well-carved jade frog.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook Immediately
options.description: Get out before your partner seeks revenge.

title: Partner Success (Co-op)
description: Your diversion worked! The cloaked figure subtly signals they got the purse. Time to retreat and meet them.

options.name: Meet Partner to Split Loot
options.description: Rendezvous outside to divide the spoils.

title: Partner Caught (Co-op)
description: Your diversion wasn't enough! The halfling catches your cloaked partner attempting the theft! 'Thief!' he yells.

options.name: Help Your Partner Escape/Fight
options.description: Intervene, cause more chaos or fight.

options.name: Abandon Your Partner
options.description: Slip away while the attention is on them.

title: Partner Betrayal (Co-op)
description: Your partner either succeeded and fled without sharing, or you abandoned them when they got caught. Either way, the alliance is broken, you gain nothing, and may have made an enemy.

options.name: Leave the Tavern Angrily
options.description: Cut your losses.

options.name: Look for Partner (Revenge/Demand Share?)
options.description: Try to find them.

title: Rival Attempts Theft
description:
The cloaked rival makes their move on the halfling! [Rival makes hidden Sleight of Hand check].

Outcome 1: Success! The rival lifts the purse and slips away unnoticed.
Outcome 2: Failure! The halfling catches them!

options.name: Rival Succeeds, Opportunity Gone
options.description: They got away with it.

options.name: Rival Fails, Halfling Yells!
options.description: The rival is caught.

options.name: Try to Steal from Rival After They Steal?
options.description: Attempt to pickpocket the successful rival thief?

title: Racing the Rival
description:
You both move towards the halfling almost simultaneously! It's a contest of speed and stealth. [Contested Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check vs Rival].

Success: You get there first and lift the purse!

Failure: The rival beats you to it, OR you both fumble and alert the halfling!

options.name: Success! Check Loot.
options.description: You got the purse!

options.name: Rival Succeeds
options.description: They got the purse.

options.name: Alerted Halfling!
options.description: You both failed, halfling yells 'Thieves!'

title: Interfering with Rival
description:
As the rival thief makes their move, you subtly 'accidentally' bump them or cause a minor distraction nearby. [Your Sleight of Hand/Deception vs Rival's Perception?].

Success: You cause them to fumble! The halfling notices *them*!

Failure: Your interference is ineffective or obvious, alerting the rival or the halfling.

options.name: Rival Caught! (If Success)
options.description: Use the commotion to slip away or attempt theft yourself.

options.name: Interference Fails (If Failure)
options.description: Deal with consequences (rival anger, alerted halfling).

title: Halfling vs Rival Confrontation
description: The halfling confronts the cloaked figure, accusing them. Voices rise, fists might clench. Other patrons watch.

options.name: Fight Breaks Out!
options.description: Watch the brawl.

options.name: Rival Talks Way Out / Leaves
options.description: The confrontation diffuses.

options.name: Use Distraction to Leave
options.description: Slip out during the argument.

title: Intervening (Halfling vs Rival)
description: You decide to step into the confrontation between the halfling and the cloaked figure. Whose side do you take?

options.name: Side with Halfling
options.description: Back up his accusation against the rival.

options.name: Side with Rival (Unlikely?)
options.description: Defend the cloaked figure against the halfling.

options.name: Try to Mediate/De-escalate
options.description: Attempt to calm things down.

title: Halfling Bluff (Post-Warning)
description:
You try to bluff the suspicious halfling. [Deception check DC 13].

Success: He seems to accept your claim of just being helpful, though remains wary.

Failure: 'Don't take me for a fool!' He seems ready to call guards or start trouble.

options.name: Leave Tavern (If Success)
options.description: Exit before he changes his mind.

options.name: Face Consequences (If Failure)
options.description: Prepare for fight or guards.

title: Intimidating the Halfling
description:
You try to intimidate the halfling. He may be small, but he looks surprisingly fierce (and rich enough to have friends). [Intimidation check DC 14].

Success: He backs down slightly, muttering under his breath.

Failure: He calls your bluff. 'Guards! This one's threatening me!'

options.name: Leave Tavern (If Success)
options.description: Exit while you have the upper hand.

options.name: Face Guards (If Failure)
options.description: Dealing with the Watch again.

title: Betraying Partner (Co-op Theft)
description: You decide to betray your temporary partner, slipping away with the entire purse (or letting them take the fall while you keep quiet). You gain the full loot (75 GP + Jade Frog) but likely make a dangerous enemy.

items.name: Gold Pieces
items.description: A pouch containing 75 gold.

items.name: Jade Frog Figurine
items.description: A smooth, well-carved jade frog.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook Immediately
options.description: Get out before your partner seeks revenge.

options.name: Lie Low in Town
options.description: Hide out, hope they don't find you.

title: Co-op Rendezvous
description: You meet your cloaked partner in a nearby alley. They hand over half the loot: roughly 37 GP and they keep the Jade Frog (or vice versa). 'Pleasure doing business,' they hiss, before disappearing.

options.name: Accept Your Share
options.description: Take the gold. Fair deal.

title: Helping Caught Partner
description: Your partner (or rival) is caught by the halfling! You intervene, perhaps tripping the halfling or causing another diversion to allow escape.

options.name: Partner/Rival Escapes, You Both Flee
options.description: Your intervention allows them to break free. You both run.

options.name: Intervention Fails, Both Caught?
options.description: You draw attention, now the halfling/guards focus on both of you.

title: Seeking Partner (Revenge/Share)
description: Angered by the betrayal (or abandonment), you try to track down your former partner.

options.name: Find Them (Confrontation)
options.description: You locate them in an alley. Demand your share or fight?

options.name: Cannot Find Them
options.description: They vanished completely.

title: Rival Theft Outcome
description: The rival thief successfully lifts the purse and vanishes OR fumbles the attempt and is caught by the halfling.

options.name: Opportunity Gone (Rival Success)
options.description: They got away clean.

options.name: Rival Caught
options.description: The halfling yells for guards.

title: Theft Race Outcome
description: The contested theft attempt results in: You getting the purse first OR the rival getting it OR both failing and alerting the halfling.

options.name: You Got It!
options.description: Check loot.

options.name: Rival Got It
options.description: They succeeded.

options.name: Both Failed, Halfling Alerted
options.description: Run!

title: Jeweler Loot Secured
description: You managed to acquire valuable jewelry from the shop (either cheap assortment or single valuable piece) and escape into the night before the guards arrived.

options.name: Find Fence to Sell Loot
options.description: Seek out Silas or another buyer.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook with Loot
options.description: Get out of town with your score.

options.name: Lie Low
options.description: Find a hiding place.

title: Watching Halfling vs Rival Fight
description: A brief, clumsy fight breaks out between the halfling and the cloaked figure. It ends quickly, perhaps with the rival fleeing or being subdued by the halfling or arriving guards.

options.name: Rival Flees
options.description: The figure escapes.

options.name: Rival Subdued
options.description: The halfling/guards capture the rival.

options.name: Slip Away During Fight
options.description: Use the chance to leave.

title: Siding with Halfling
description: You step in to support the halfling against the cloaked figure. Seeing they are outnumbered, the figure snarls and retreats into the shadows.

options.name: Halfling is Grateful?
options.description: See if he offers thanks or reward.

options.name: Halfling Remains Suspicious of You
options.description: He still eyes you warily.

title: Halfling Believes Bluff
description: The halfling seems to accept your innocent explanation, though he remains watchful. The immediate confrontation is averted.

options.name: Leave Tavern
options.description: Exit.

title: Cracking the Jeweler's Safe
description:
The heavy iron safe proves difficult, but your tools find the tumblers. [Very High DC Thieves' Tools check DC 19].

Success: Click! The heavy door swings open revealing velvet pouches containing numerous gems and gold pieces! (Value: 200+ GP).

Failure: The lock mechanism jams or resists your best efforts. You cannot open it.

options.name: Take the Treasure! (If Success)
options.description: Grab the valuable contents.

options.name: Leave Empty-Handed (If Failure)
options.description: The main prize eludes you.

title: Leaving Jeweler's Shop
description: You slip back out of the jeweler's shop, either with immense riches from the safe or empty-handed.

options.name: Escape Nestlebrook with Wealth (If Successful)
options.description: Leave town immediately.

options.name: Return to Streets (If Failed)
options.description: Look for other opportunities.

title: Antiquities Small Haul
description: You pocket the few silver trinkets and scattered coins found in the antiquities shop. A very minor score.

options.name: Search More Thoroughly
options.description: Look for more valuable artifacts.

options.name: Leave the Shop
options.description: Exit with your meager loot.

title: Antiquities Artifact Acquired
description: You take the interesting artifact (Tome, Puzzle Box, or Humming Figurine) from the antiquities shop.

options.name: Examine Artifact Later
options.description: Study your find once you are safely away.

options.name: Leave the Shop
options.description: Exit with the artifact.

title: Leaving Antiquities Shop
description: You slip back out of the 'Curios & Relics' shop, possibly with minor loot or an intriguing artifact.

options.name: Return to Streets
options.description: Decide next move.

title: Antiquities Owner Alerted!
description: Hiding in the shop, you hear footsteps descending the stairs! The elderly owner, perhaps woken by noise, is coming down.

options.name: Remain Hidden
options.description: Stay concealed, hope they don't spot you. [Stealth check].

options.name: Attempt to Flee Past Owner
options.description: Make a dash for the door/window.

options.name: Confront Owner?
options.description: Reveal yourself. [Might lead to fight/capture].

title: Antiquities Storeroom Loot
description: You take the aged wine OR the stash of coins found in the storeroom.

options.name: Move to Main Shop
options.description: Continue the burglary.

options.name: Leave Shop with Loot
options.description: Exit via back window/door.

title: Exploring Ship (Passenger)
description: As a paying passenger, you explore the main decks. You might chat with other travelers, observe the crew working, or simply enjoy the sea view.

options.name: Gather Rumors from Passengers
options.description: Engage others in conversation.

options.name: Look for Gambling?
options.description: See if any games are happening.

options.name: Return to Cabin
options.description: Rest.

title: Voyage Information
description: You've learned the ship's destination and perhaps some rumors about the journey or the destination port.

options.name: Board Ship / Settle In
options.description: Continue with the voyage.

title: Learning Ship Skills
description: While working, you pay close attention, learning the basics of tying knots, reading winds, or maybe even celestial navigation from patient (or impatient) sailors.

options.name: Gain Minor Skill/Knowledge?
options.description: [Potentially grants advantage on future sea-related checks?]

title: Planning to Jump Ship
description: The ship's destination doesn't appeal to you. You start planning to leave at the next port of call, perhaps needing to acquire funds or supplies first.

options.name: Await Next Port
options.description: Continue working until the ship docks elsewhere.

options.name: Look for Theft Opportunities Onboard
options.description: Try to get funds before jumping ship.

title: Convincing Silas (Ambush)
description: You manage to convince the terrified Silas to help ambush the Guardian. [Requires successful High DC Persuasion]. He agrees reluctantly, likely providing his trapped cellar or information for the ambush.

options.name: Set the Trap
options.description: Prepare the ambush using Silas's help.

title: Suggesting Non-Lethal Trap (Guardian)
description: You suggest merely trapping or delaying Marius, not killing him. Silas seems slightly less terrified. 'Trap him? Maybe... a net? Or lock him in the cellar? Still dangerous!'

options.name: Plan Net/Cellar Trap
options.description: Work out the details with Silas.

options.name: Silas Still Refuses
options.description: Even trapping him is too risky for Silas.

title: Preparing for Rendezvous
description: You use the time before moonrise to check your gear, rest briefly, perhaps buy last-minute supplies if needed.

options.name: Head to Meeting Point
options.description: Go meet Marius near the lighthouse path.

title: Scouting Rendezvous Point
description: You arrive early at the path leading to the lighthouse. It's windswept and deserted. You find good vantage points to observe the path and the lighthouse itself. No sign of Marius or Unbound yet.

options.name: Wait for Marius
options.description: Settle in and wait.

options.name: Prepare Ambush (Betrayal?)
options.description: Set up to attack Marius when he arrives?

title: Betraying the Guardian
description: Having agreed to meet Marius, you instead seek out the Unbound (if you know where they are) to warn them about the Keeper's plan.

options.name: Find Unbound, Give Warning
options.description: Alert the cultists.

options.name: Cannot Find Unbound in Time
options.description: Unable to locate them before moonrise.

title: Guardian on Intervention
description: 'Necessary intervention,' Marius clarifies, 'means preventing the activation of the Gate, stopping the ritual if it directly endangers the Fragment or the binding, or defending against direct attack. We do not seek confrontation, but we will finish it.'

options.name: Agree to Meet
options.description: Accept the terms.

options.name: Decline Mission
options.description: Still seems too risky or vague.

title: Valerius as Third Party
description: The idea that Valerius might be a rogue element, seeking Loc's power for himself against both Unbound and Keepers, adds another layer of complexity and danger to the lighthouse situation.

options.name: Proceed with Caution (Assume Triple Threat)
options.description: Be wary of Valerius, Unbound, and Keepers.

title: Valerius's Defenses?
description: You ask Silas how Valerius protects himself. 'Don't know!' Silas squeaks. 'Magic, probably! That creepy servant! Maybe traps? People who go up there don't gossip much!'

options.name: Assume Magical Defenses
options.description: Prepare for arcane traps/wards at lighthouse.

title: Silas Defeated
description: You defeat Silas the fence. He lies groaning on the floor of his cluttered shop. You can now search freely.

options.name: Search for Tumbler/Valuables
options.description: Look thoroughly through the shop.

options.name: Leave Before Guards Arrive
options.description: Get out quickly.

title: Defeated by Silas
description: The desperate pawnbroker manages to get the upper hand, perhaps using a hidden weapon or trap. He knocks you out or drives you from his shop, injured.

options.name: Wake Up Outside Shop (Injured)
options.description: Regain consciousness in the alley.

title: Fleeing Silas's Shop (Looted)
description: You successfully pickpocket Silas or grab an item and flee his shop before he fully realizes or can react.

options.name: Examine Loot
options.description: Check what you managed to steal.

options.name: Leave Nestlebrook
options.description: Get out of town.

title: Observing Unbound Escape
description: While the Guardian is distracted by your diversion, you see the Unbound agents slip out the back exit of the tavern. Your risky maneuver worked.

options.name: Deal with Diversion Fallout
options.description: Face the Guardian or barkeep regarding your actions.

options.name: Slip Away Yourself
options.description: Use the remaining confusion to leave.

title: Diversion Backfires
description: Your diversion draws unwanted attention directly to you. The Guardian (Marius) or the Barkeep approaches you, demanding an explanation for the commotion.

options.name: Bluff/Lie
options.description: Make up an excuse for the disturbance. [Deception check].

options.name: Fight/Flee
options.description: Resort to violence or try to run.

title: Guardian Distracted
description: You successfully engage Keeper Marius in conversation or argument, keeping his attention focused on you long enough for the Unbound agents to slip away.

options.name: End Conversation, Withdraw
options.description: Disengage from Marius now that the goal is achieved.

options.name: Continue Talking (Gather Info?)
options.description: Try to learn more from him.

title: Guardian Undistracted
description: Keeper Marius ignores your attempts to distract him or sees through the ploy. He might notice the Unbound agents leaving anyway.

options.name: Guardian Confronts Unbound?
options.description: Does he move to intercept them?

options.name: Guardian Confronts You?
options.description: He focuses his anger on your interference.

options.name: Situation Diffuses
options.description: Nothing happens immediately.

title: Guardian Defeated!
description: In a stunning turn, you manage to defeat Keeper Marius! He lies beaten, his formidable axe clattering nearby. Defeating a Keeper is a significant act, likely with unforeseen consequences.

options.name: Loot Marius (Axe? Sigil? Orders?)
options.description: Take his belongings.

options.name: Leave Him (Alive/Dead?)
options.description: Decide his fate.

options.name: Flee Nestlebrook Immediately
options.description: Get out before other Keepers arrive.

title: Defeated by the Guardian
description: Keeper Marius defeats you decisively. His strike might be non-lethal, intended to subdue, or potentially fatal depending on the circumstances. You are at his mercy.

options.name: Imprisoned by Keeper
options.description: He takes you captive.

options.name: Left for Dead/Warning
options.description: He leaves you beaten, possibly taking the Tumbler.

options.name: Executed? (Ending)
options.description: As a threat to the Keepers' duty, he eliminates you. [Game Over]

title: Seeking Opposite Faction
description: Having fled one faction (Unbound or Keeper), you consider seeking out the other for protection, alliance, or information.

options.name: Seek Unbound (After Fleeing Keeper)
options.description: Find the cultists.

options.name: Seek Keeper (After Fleeing Unbound)
options.description: Find Marius.

options.name: Avoid Both Factions
options.description: Stay hidden or leave town.

title: Imprisoned by Keeper
description: You wake up bound, perhaps in a secure location Marius commandeered (a sturdy inn room, a guard cell he 'borrowed'). He stands over you. 'You interfered. Now you will tell me everything you know about the Fragment and the Unbound.'

options.name: Cooperate (Tell Him Everything)
options.description: Share your knowledge.

options.name: Refuse to Cooperate
options.description: Stay silent or defiant.

options.name: Attempt Escape
options.description: Look for immediate way out.

title: Spared by Keeper
description: Marius defeats you but chooses not to kill or capture you, perhaps seeing you as insignificant or wanting you to deliver a message. He might take the Tumbler if you had it. You are left beaten and warned.

options.name: Recover and Leave Nestlebrook (Ending?)
options.description: Heed the warning and get out.

options.name: Recover and Seek Revenge/Tumbler?
options.description: Plan to go after Marius again.

options.name: Recover and Seek Unbound?
options.description: Perhaps the enemies of your enemy...?

title: Planning Silas Heist (w/ Unbound)
description: You and the Unbound cultists plan to retrieve the Tumbler from Silas. They favor a direct assault, overpowering the fence. You might suggest a stealthier approach.

options.name: Agree to Direct Assault
options.description: Prepare for combat at the pawn shop.

options.name: Suggest Stealth/Infiltration
options.description: Try to convince them to let you break in.

options.name: Betray Unbound to Silas/Keeper?
options.description: Warn the target about the impending attack.

title: Planning Keeper Attack (w/ Unbound)
description: You agree to help the Unbound attack Keeper Marius to retrieve the Tumbler (if he has it). They plan a swift, brutal ambush, likely in an alley or outside the tavern.

options.name: Participate in Ambush
options.description: Join the attack.

options.name: Act as Bait/Distraction
options.description: Lure Marius into the trap.

options.name: Warn Marius (Betray Unbound)?
options.description: Alert the Keeper to the plan.

title: Planning Lighthouse Infiltration (w/ Unbound)
description: You and the Unbound plan to enter the Tidecaller Lighthouse to confront Valerius and retrieve the Tumbler (if believed to be there). They suggest forcing the main door or using a secret entrance if known.

options.name: Force Main Door
options.description: Join the assault on the entrance.

options.name: Use Secret Entrance (Grate?)
options.description: Guide them to the cellar grate.

options.name: Warn Valerius/Servant?
options.description: Betray the Unbound.

title: Joining the Unbound
description: You cast your lot with the Unbound, accepting their chaotic promises over tangible rewards. They welcome you as a new acolyte, perhaps marking you with their serpent symbol. Your path is now intertwined with theirs, heading towards the ritual at the lighthouse. [Significant Alignment Shift; Potential Ending Path]

options.name: Proceed to Lighthouse with Cult
options.description: Join their journey to the ritual.

title: Demanding Tangible Reward (Unbound)
description: You demand concrete payment from the Unbound. They seem amused. 'Coin? Power is the only true currency. If the Fragment is retrieved, perhaps you'll be granted a boon... or perhaps you'll simply be useful.' They offer nothing definite.

options.name: Accept Vague Promise
options.description: Agree to help anyway.

options.name: Refuse to Help
options.description: Not worth the risk without clear payment.

title: Attempting to Plant Evidence (Guardian)
description:
You attempt to plant false evidence (stolen goods, Unbound symbol) on Marius or in his belongings. This requires incredible stealth and timing. [Very High DC Stealth/Sleight of Hand check DC 18].

Success: Evidence planted! Now you need to alert the guards.

Failure: Marius catches you, or the evidence is discovered immediately!

options.name: Alert the Guards (If Success)
options.description: Report your 'discovery'.

options.name: Caught by Marius! (If Failure)
options.description: Face the Keeper's wrath.

title: Spreading False Rumors (Guardian)
description: You try to spread rumors about Keeper Marius being corrupt, collaborating with smugglers, or being secretly Unbound. [Series of Deception checks? Depends on who you tell]. Success might turn guards/townsfolk against him. Failure might lead back to Marius.

options.name: Rumors Spread Successfully
options.description: The Watch becomes suspicious of Marius.

options.name: Rumors Fail / Backfire
options.description: No one believes you, or Marius learns of your slander.

title: Recruiting Allies (Guardian Ambush)
description: You try to recruit help to ambush Keeper Marius. Who do you approach?

options.name: Approach Unbound
options.description: Offer alliance against common enemy.

options.name: Approach Silas (Unlikely)
options.description: Try to convince the terrified fence.

options.name: Hire Mercenaries (Brynn?)
options.description: Offer gold for help.

options.name: Proceed Solo
options.description: Decide to attempt it alone.

title: Setting Physical Trap (Guardian)
description: You attempt to set a physical trap for Marius (deadfall, pitfall, net). [Dexterity check using available resources, DC 15]. Success: Trap is ready. Failure: Trap is obvious or fails.

options.name: Lure Marius into Trap (If Success)
options.description: Try to lead him to the location.

options.name: Abort Plan (If Failure)
options.description: Trap failed.

title: Solo Ambush (Guardian)
description: You find a shadowed alley or corner and wait to ambush Keeper Marius alone. This is incredibly dangerous.

options.name: Launch Attack When He Appears
options.description: Initiate combat, maybe with surprise.

options.name: Lose Nerve, Abort
options.description: Decide against it at the last second.

title: Elara on Keeper Weaknesses
description: You ask Elara about Keeper weaknesses. 'Their strength is their weakness,' she muses. 'Their rigid adherence to duty and order. They can be... predictable. Bound by oaths. Perhaps vulnerable to paradox or chaos? Physically, they are but mortals, albeit highly trained.'

options.name: Consider Psychological Approach?
options.description: Try to exploit his duty or introduce chaos?

options.name: Focus on Physical Confrontation
options.description: Plan ambush/fight.

options.name: Thank Her, Pursue Other Leads
options.description: Seek different leverage.

title: Silas on Keeper Dirt
description: You press Silas for dirt on Marius. 'Dirt? On a Keeper?' Silas sweats. 'They're fanatics! Clean as whistles, usually! Heard this one... Marius... served at some temple that fell to ruin... maybe ask 'im about the 'Ashen Spire'?' He looks terrified for having said even that.

options.name: Use 'Ashen Spire' as Leverage
options.description: Mention the name to Marius, see if it affects him.

options.name: Investigate 'Ashen Spire'?
options.description: Try to learn more about this location.

options.name: Dismiss It, Seek Other Leverage
options.description: Maybe meaningless.

title: Arguing with Guard (Begging)
description: You argue with the guard who told you to stop begging. He's unimpressed. 'Look, I don't make the rules. Cause trouble, and you'll end up in the cells. Now move along!'

options.name: Comply
options.description: Move along.

options.name: Refuse / Escalate?
options.description: Risk arrest.

title: Evading Guard (Begging)
description: While the guard is lecturing you, you take the opportunity to slip away into the crowd or duck down an alley.

options.name: Escape Successfully
options.description: Avoided arrest.

options.name: Guard Notices, Gives Chase?
options.description: He sees you run!

title: Touching Lighthouse Symbols
description: You reach out and touch one of the faintly glowing symbols on the lighthouse wall. You feel a sharp jolt of cold energy OR a flood of confusing images (stars, waves, locks) OR the symbol flares brightly, possibly alerting someone.

options.name: Withdraw Hand (Cold Jolt/Images)
options.description: React to the sensation.
